original: puraskṛtaṃ puṇyavatāṃ parāṃ gatiṃ kṣitīśvaraṃ lokapatim prajāpatim /
analyzed: puraskṛtam puṇyavatām parām gatim kṣitīśvaram loka patim prajāpatim
translated: The one who is honored by the virtuous, the supreme goal, the lord of the earth, the lord of the people, the lord of creatures,

original: paraṃ parāṇām api kāraṇaṃ hariṃ namāmi lokatrayakarmasākṣiṇam // / //
analyzed: param parāṇām api kāraṇam harim namāmi lokatraya karma sākṣiṇam
translated: I bow to Hari, who is the supreme cause of even the supreme ones, and is the witness of the actions of the three worlds.

original: bhoge tv anantasya payodadhau suraḥ purā hi śete bhagavān anādikṛt /
analyzed: bhoge tu anantasya payodadhau suraḥ purā hi śete bhagavān anādi kṛt
translated: In the enjoyment of the infinite ocean of milk, the unborn lord used to sleep in ancient times,

original: kṣīrodavīcīkaṇikāmbunokṣitaṃ taṃ śrīnivāsaṃ praṇato 'smi keśavam // / //
analyzed: kṣīroda vīcī kaṇikā ambunā ukṣitam tam śrīnivāsam praṇataḥ smi keśavam
translated: I bow to Shri Nivas Keshava, who is sprinkled with the drops of the waves of the Milk Ocean.

original: yo nārasiṃhaṃ vapur āsthito mahān suro murārir madhukaiṭabhāntakṛt /
analyzed: yaḥ nārasiṃham vapuḥ āsthitaḥ mahān suraḥ murāriḥ madhu kaiṭabha anta kṛt
translated: The great god who assumed the form of Narasimha, the enemy of demons, the destroyer of Madhu and Kaitabha,

original: samastalokārtiharaṃ hiraṇyakaṃ namāmi viṣṇuṃ satataṃ namāmi tam // / //
analyzed: samasta loka ārti haram hiraṇyakam namāmi viṣṇum satatam namāmi tam
translated: The remover of all worldly afflictions, the golden one, I constantly bow to that Vishnu, I bow to him.

original: anantam avyaktam atīndriyaṃ vibhuṃ sve sve hi rūpe svayam eva saṃsthitam /
analyzed: anantam avyaktam atīndriyam vibhum sve sve hi rūpe svayam eva saṃsthitam
translated: The infinite, unmanifest, all-pervading one, existing in its own form,

original: yogeśvarair eva sadā namaskṛtaṃ namāmi bhaktyā satataṃ janārdanam // / //
analyzed: yoga īśvaraiḥ eva sadā namaskṛtam namāmi bhaktyā satatam janārdanam
translated: I constantly bow with devotion to Janardana, always worshipped by the lords of yoga.

original: ānandam ekaṃ virajaṃ vidātmakaṃ vṛndālayaṃ yogibhir eva pūjitam /
analyzed: ānandam ekam virajam vid ātmakam vṛnda ālayam yogibhiḥ eva pūjitam
translated: The sole bliss, free from impurities, the self-manifest, the abode of the Vrndavana, worshipped by the yogis,

original: aṇor aṇīyāṃsam avṛddhim akṣayaṃ namāmi bhaktapriyam īśvaraṃ harim // / //
analyzed: aṇoḥ aṇīyāṃsam a vṛddhim akṣayam namāmi bhakta priyam īśvaram harim
translated: I bow to Hari, the smallest of the small, the undecaying, the imperishable, the lord, the beloved of the devotees.

original: śrīvyāsa uvāca /🔽iti stotrāvasāne taṃ vāg uvācāśarīriṇī /
analyzed: śrī vyāsaḥ uvāca  iti stotra avasāne tam vāc uvāca aśarīriṇī
translated: Shree Vyasa said:

original: mārkaṇḍeyaṃ mahābhāgaṃ tīrthe 'nu tapasi sthitam // / //
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyam mahābhāgam tīrthe nu tapasi sthitam
translated: At the end of this hymn, an unembodied voice spoke to the greatly fortunate Markandeya, who was engaged in austerities in the tirtha.

original: kimarthaṃ kliśyate brahmaṃs tvayā yo naiva dṛśyate /
analyzed: kimartham kliśyate brahman tvayā yaḥ nā eva dṛśyate
translated: Why are you suffering, O Brahmin, for one who is not seen?

original: mādhavaḥ sarvatīrtheṣu yāvan na snānam ācareḥ // / //
analyzed: mādhavaḥ sarva tīrtheṣu yāvat na snānam ācareḥ
translated: Until you bathe in all the tirthas, Madhava will not be seen.

original: ityuktaḥ sarvatīrtheṣu snātvovāca mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sarva tīrtheṣu snātvā uvāca mahāmatiḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the great sage bathed in all the tirthas and said:

original: kṛtvā kṛtvā sarvatīrthe snānaṃ caiva kṛtaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: kṛtvā kṛtvā sarva tīrthe snānam ca eva kṛtam bhavet
translated: By doing this, one would have taken a bath in all the holy places.

original: tad vada tvaṃ mama prītyā yo 'si so 'si namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: tat vada tvam mama prītyā yaḥ si saḥ si namaḥ stu te
translated: Please tell me that, you who are, salutations to you.

original: vāg uvāca /
analyzed: vāc uvāca
translated: Speech said:

original: stotreṇānena viprendra stuhi nārāyaṇaṃ prabhum /
analyzed: stotreṇa anena vipra indra stuhi nārāyaṇam prabhum
translated: O Indra among Brahmins, praise Lord Narayana with this hymn.

original: nānyathā sarvatīrthānāṃ phalaṃ prāpsyasi suvrata // / //
analyzed: nā anyathā sarva tīrthānām phalam prāpsyasi suvrata
translated: O one of good vows, you will not attain the fruits of all the holy places otherwise.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: tad evākhyāhi bhagavan stotraṃ tīrthaphalapradam /
analyzed: tat eva ākhyāhi bhagavan stotram tīrtha phala pradam
translated: O Lord, please tell me that hymn which grants the fruits of the holy places,

original: yena japtena sakalaṃ tīrthasnānaphalaṃ labhet // / //
analyzed: yena japtena sakalam tīrtha snāna phalam labhet
translated: By reciting which one would obtain the fruits of bathing in all the holy places.

original: vāg uvāca /
analyzed: vāc uvāca
translated: Speech said:

original: jaya jaya devadeva jaya mādhava keśava /
analyzed: jaya jaya devadeva jaya mādhava keśava
translated: Victory, victory to the Lord of gods, victory to Madhava, Keshava.

original: jaya padmapalāśākṣa jaya govinda gopate // / //
analyzed: jaya padma palāśa akṣa jaya govinda gopate
translated: Victory to the one with eyes like lotus petals, victory to Govinda, the lord of cows.

original: jaya jaya padmanābha jaya vaikuṇṭha vāmana /
analyzed: jaya jaya padmanābha jaya vaikuṇṭha vāmana
translated: Victory, victory to the one with a navel like a lotus, victory to Vaikuntha, Vamana.

original: jaya padma hṛṣīkeśa jaya dāmodarācyuta // / //
analyzed: jaya padma hṛṣīkeśa jaya dāmodara acyuta
translated: Victory to the lotus-naveled Hrishikesha, victory to Damodara, Achyuta.

original: jaya padmeśvarānanta jaya lokaguro jaya /
analyzed: jaya padmeśvara ananta jaya loka guro jaya
translated: Victory, victory to the lord of the lotus, Ananta, victory to the preceptor of the world, victory.

original: jaya śaṅkhagadāpāṇe jaya bhūdharasūkara // / //
analyzed: jaya śaṅkha gadā pāṇe jaya bhūdhara sūkara
translated: Victory to the one holding a conch and a mace, victory to the earth-supporting boar.

original: jaya yajñeśa vārāha jaya bhūdhara bhūmipa /
analyzed: jaya yajñeśa vārāha jaya bhūdhara bhūmipa
translated: Victory to the lord of sacrifice, the boar, victory to the earth-supporting lord of the earth.

original: jaya yogeśa yogajña jaya yogapravarttaka // / //
analyzed: jaya yogeśa yoga jña jaya yoga pravarttaka
translated: Victory to the Lord of Yoga, knower of Yoga, victory to the promoter of Yoga.

original: jaya yogapravarttaka jaya dharmapravarttaka /
analyzed: jaya yoga pravarttaka jaya dharma pravarttaka
translated: Victory to the promoter of Yoga, victory to the promoter of Dharma.

original: kṛtapriya jaya jaya yajñeśa yajñāṅga jaya // / //
analyzed: kṛtapriya jaya jaya yajñeśa yajñāṅga jaya
translated: Victory, victory to the beloved of Krishna, victory to the Lord of sacrifice, victory to the limb of sacrifice.

original: jaya vandita saddvija jaya nāradasiddhida /
analyzed: jaya vandita sat dvija jaya nārada siddhi da
translated: Victory to the one worshipped by good Brahmins, victory to the giver of success to Narada.

original: jaya puṇyavatāṃ geha jaya vaidikabhājana // / //
analyzed: jaya puṇyavatām geha jaya vaidika bhājana
translated: Victory to the home of the virtuous, victory to the vessel of the Vedas.

original: jaya jaya caturbhuja jayadeva jaya daityabhayāvaha /
analyzed: jaya jaya caturbhuja jayadeva jaya daitya bhaya āvaha
translated: Victory, victory to the four-armed one, victory to the god, victory to the one who brings fear to the demons.

original: jaya sarvajña sarvātman jaya śaṃkara śāśvata // / //
analyzed: jaya sarvajña sarva ātman jaya śaṃkara śāśvata
translated: Victory to the omniscient one, to the soul of all, victory to Shankara, the eternal one.

original: jaya viṣṇo mahādeva jaya nityam adhokṣaja /
analyzed: jaya viṣṇo mahādeva jaya nityam adhokṣaja
translated: Victory to Vishnu, the great god, victory to the eternally unmanifest one.

original: prasādaṃ kuru deveśa darśayādya svakāṃ tanum // / //
analyzed: prasādam kuru deveśa darśaya adya svakām tanum
translated: Be gracious, O Lord of gods, and show me your own form today.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: ity evaṃ kīrtite tena mārkaṇḍeyena dhīmatā /
analyzed: iti evam kīrtite tena mārkaṇḍeyena dhīmatā
translated: Thus praised by the wise Markandeya,

original: prādur babhūva bhagavān pītavāsā janārdanaḥ // / //
analyzed: prādur babhūva bhagavān pīta vāsāḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: the Blessed Lord Janardana, clad in yellow garments, appeared.

original: śaṅkhacakragadāpāṇiḥ sarvābharaṇabhūṣitaḥ /
analyzed: śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇiḥ sarva ābharaṇa bhūṣitaḥ
translated: He had a conch, a discus, and a mace in his hands, and was adorned with all ornaments.

original: tejasā dyotayan sarvā diśo viṣṇuḥ sanātanaḥ // / //
analyzed: tejasā dyotayan sarvāḥ diśaḥ viṣṇuḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: With his splendor, Vishnu, the eternal one, illuminated all the directions.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā sahasā bhūmau ciraprārthitadarśanam /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā sahasā bhūmau cira prārthita darśanam
translated: Seeing him suddenly on the ground, whom he had long desired to see,

original: prayātaḥ śirasā vaśyo bhaktyā sa bhṛgunandanaḥ // / //
analyzed: prayātaḥ śirasā vaśyaḥ bhaktyā sa bhṛgu nandanaḥ
translated: The descendant of Bhrigu, who was to be conquered by the head, went with devotion.

original: nipatyotpatya ca punaḥ punaḥ sāṅgaṃ mahāmanāḥ /
analyzed: nipatya utpatya ca punar punar sa aṅgam mahā manāḥ
translated: The great-minded one, having fallen down and risen up again and again, with his limbs,

original: prabaddhasaṃpuṭakaro govindaṃ purataḥ stuvan // / //
analyzed: prabaddha saṃpuṭa karaḥ govindam puratas stuvan
translated: With folded hands in front, praising Govinda,

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: ḥnamo 'stu te devadeva mahācitta mahākāya mahāprājña mahādeva mahākīrte brahmendracandrarudrārcitapādayugala śrīpadmahasta saṃmarditadaityadeha
analyzed: ḥnamaḥ stu te devadeva mahā citta mahā kāya mahā prājña mahādeva mahā kīrte brahma indra candra rudra arcita pāda yugala śrī padma hasta saṃmardita daitya deha
translated: Salutations to you, O God of gods, O great mind, O great body, O greatly wise, O great god, O of great fame, O whose feet are worshipped by Brahma, Indra, Chandra and Rudra, O lotus-handed one, O whose body is crushed by the demons,

original: ḥanantabhogaśayanārpitasarvāṅga sanakasanandanasanatkumārādyair yogibhir nāsāgranyastalocanair anavaratam abhicintitamokṣatattva /
analyzed: ananta bhoga śayana arpita sarva aṅga sanaka sanandana sanatkumāra ādyaiḥ yogibhiḥ nāsā agra nyasta locanaiḥ anavaratam abhicintita mokṣa tattva
translated: O whose entire body is placed on the bed of infinite coils, O one whose true nature of liberation is constantly contemplated by the yogis such as Sanaka, Sanandana, Sanatkumara and others, with their eyes fixed on the tip of the nose,

original: ḥgandharvavidyādharayakṣakiṃnarakiṃpuruṣair aharaho gīyamānadivyayaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥgandharva vidyādhara yakṣa kiṃnara kiṃpuruṣaiḥ aharahar gīyamāna divya yaśaḥ
translated: O one whose divine fame is sung day after day by the Gandharvas, Vidyadharas, Yakshas, Kinnaras and Kimpurushas,

original: ḥnṛsiṃha nārāyaṇa padmanābha govinda govardhanaguhānivāsa yogīśvara deveśvara jaleśvara maheśvara // / //
analyzed: ḥnṛsiṃha nārāyaṇa padmanābha govinda govardhana guhā nivāsa yogi īśvara deva īśvara jaleśvara maheśvara
translated: O Narasimha, O Narayana, O Padma-naabha, O Govinda, O Govardhana, O Guha-nivasa, O Lord of yogis, O Lord of gods, O Lord of waters, O Great Lord,

original: ḥyogadhara mahāmāyādhara vidyādhara yaśodhara kīrtidhara triguṇanivāsa tritattvadhara tretāgnidhara // / //🔽ḥtrivedabhāk triniketa trisuparṇa tridaṇḍadhara // / //
translated: 2. Yoga-dharā (One who holds Yoga), 3. Mahā-māyā-dharā (One who holds the great illusion), 4. Vidyā-dharā (One who holds knowledge), 5. Yaśodharā (One who holds fame), 6. Kīrti-dharā (One who holds renown), 7. Tri-guṇa-nivāsa (Dweller in the three qualities), 8. Tri-tattva-dharā (One who holds the three principles), 9. Treta-agni-dharā (One who holds the three sacrificial fires),

original: ḥsnigdhameghābhārcitadyutivirājita pītāmbaradhara kirīṭakaṭakakeyūrahāramaṇiratnāṃśudīptividyotitasarvadiśa // / //
translated: 10. Tri-veda-bhāk (Possessor of the three Vedas), 11. Tri-niketa (Having three abodes), 12. Tri-suparṇa (Having three Suparṇas), 13. Tri-daṇḍa-dharā (One who holds three staffs),🔽14. Adorned with the radiance of a friendly cloud, wearing yellow garments, all directions illuminated by the brilliance of crowns, bracelets, armlets, necklaces, gems and jewels,

original: ḥkanakamaṇikuṇḍalamaṇḍitagaṇḍasthala madhusūdana viśvamūrte // / //
analyzed: ḥ kanaka maṇi kuṇḍala maṇḍita gaṇḍa sthala madhusūdana viśvamūrte
translated: 15. Cheeks adorned with golden jewel earrings, O Madhusūdana, O universal form,

original: ḥlokanātha yajñeśvara yajñapriya tejomaya bhaktipriya vāsudeva duritāpahārārādhya puruṣottama namo 'stu te // / //
translated: 16. Lord of the worlds, lord of sacrifices, fond of sacrifices, full of splendor, fond of devotion, Vāsudeva, remover of miseries, worthy of worship, Supreme Being, salutations to you.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyāsa said:

original: ity udīritam ākarṇya bhagavāṃs tu janārdanaḥ /
analyzed: iti udīritam ākarṇya bhagavān tu janārdanaḥ
translated: Having heard this uttered, Lord Janārdana,

original: devadevaḥ prasannātmā mārkaṇḍeyam uvāca ha // / //
analyzed: devadevaḥ prasanna ātmā mārkaṇḍeyam uvāca ha
translated: the god of gods, with a delighted mind, spoke to Mārkaṇḍeya,

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /🔽tuṣṭo 'smi bhavato vatsa tapasā mahatā punaḥ /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca  tuṣṭaḥ smi bhavataḥ vatsa tapasā mahatā punar
translated: The Blessed Lord said:🔽I am pleased with you, my child, again with great austerity,

original: stotrair api mahābuddhe naṣṭapāpo 'si sāṃpratam // / //
analyzed: stotraiḥ api mahābuddhe naṣṭa pāpaḥ si sāṃpratam
translated: and with hymns, O greatly wise one, your sins are now destroyed.

original: varaṃ varaya viprendra varado 'haṃ tavāgrataḥ /
analyzed: varam varaya vipra indra vara daḥ ham tava agratas
translated: Choose a boon, O chief of Brahmanas, I am the bestower of boons before you.

original: nātaptatapasā brahman draṣṭuṃ sādhyo 'ham añjasā // / //
analyzed: na a tapta tapasā brahman draṣṭum sādhyaḥ ham añjasā
translated: O Brahmana, I am not to be seen directly by one who has not undergone severe austerities.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: kṛtakṛtyo 'smi deveśa sāṃprataṃ tava darśanāt /
analyzed: kṛtakṛtyaḥ smi deveśa sāṃpratam tava darśanāt
translated: I am satisfied, O Lord of gods, by seeing you now.

original: tvadbhaktim acalām ekāṃ mama dehi jagatpate // / //
analyzed: tvad bhaktim acalām ekām mama dehi jagatpate
translated: Give me unwavering devotion to you alone, O Lord of the universe.

original: yadi prasanno bhagavan mama mādhava śrīpate /
analyzed: yadi prasannaḥ bhagavat mama mādhava śrīpate
translated: If you are pleased, O Lord, O Madhava, O Lord of Shri,

original: cirāyuṣyaṃ hṛṣīkeśa yena tvāṃ ciram arcaye // / //
analyzed: cira āyuṣyam hṛṣīkeśa yena tvām ciram arcaye
translated: Grant me long life, O Hrishikesha, so that I may worship you for a long time.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: mṛtyus te nirjitaḥ pūrve cirāyus tvaṃ ca labdhavān /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ te nirjitaḥ pūrve cira āyuḥ tvam ca labdhavān
translated: Death has been conquered by you in the past, and you have attained long life.

original: bhaktir astv acalā te me vaiṣṇavī muktidāyinī // / //
analyzed: bhaktiḥ astu acalā te me vaiṣṇavī mukti dāyinī
translated: Let there be unwavering devotion to me in you, devotion to Vishnu that grants liberation.

original: idaṃ tīrthaṃ mahābhāga tvannāmnā khyātim eṣyati /
analyzed: idam tīrtham mahābhāga tvad nāmnā khyātim eṣyati
translated: This holy place, O blessed one, will become famous by your name.

original: punas tvaṃ drakṣyase māṃ vai kṣīrābdhau yogaśāyinam // / //
analyzed: punar tvam drakṣyase mām vai kṣīrābdhau yoga śāyinam
translated: You will again see me in the milk ocean, lying in yoga.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: ity uktvā puṇḍarīkākṣas tatraivāntar adhīyata /🔽mārkaṇḍeyo 'pi dharmātmā cintayan madhusūdanam // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā puṇḍarīkākṣaḥ tatra eva antar adhīyata  mārkaṇḍeyaḥ pi dharma ātmā cintayan madhusūdanam
translated: Having said this, the lotus-eyed one disappeared right there.🔽Markandeya, the righteous one, thinking of Madhusudana,

original: arcayan devadeveśaṃ japan śuddhaṃ namann api /
analyzed: arcayan devadeveśam japan śuddham naman api
translated: worshipping the Lord of the Lord of gods, chanting the pure (mantra), bowing down,

original: vedaśāstrāṇi puṇyāni purāṇāny akhilāni ca // / //
analyzed: veda śāstrāṇi puṇyāni purāṇāni akhilāni ca
translated: The sacred Vedas, scriptures, and all the Puranas,

original: munīnāṃ bhāvayām āsa gāthāś caiva tapodhanaḥ /
analyzed: munīnām bhāvayām āsa gāthāḥ ca eva tapodhanaḥ
translated: The sage, the store of austerities, contemplated the songs of the sages.

original: itihāsāni puṇyāni pitṛtattvaṃ ca sattamaḥ // / //
analyzed: itihāsāni puṇyāni pitṛ tattvam ca sattamaḥ
translated: The most virtuous one contemplated the sacred histories and the truth about the ancestors.

original: tataḥ kadācit puruṣottamoktaṃ vacaḥ smaran śāstravidāṃ variṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kadācid puruṣottama uktam vacaḥ smaran śāstra vidām variṣṭhaḥ
translated: Then, remembering the words spoken by Purushottama, the best among those who know the scriptures,

original: bhraman samudraṃ sa jagāma draṣṭuṃ hariṃ sureśaṃ munir ugratejāḥ // / //
analyzed: bhraman samudram sa jagāma draṣṭum harim sureśam muniḥ ugra tejāḥ
translated: The sage of fierce energy wandered and went to the ocean to see Hari, the lord of the gods.

original: śrameṇa yuktaś cirakālasaṃbhramād bhṛgoḥ sa pautro haribhaktim udvahan /
analyzed: śrameṇa yuktaḥ cira kāla saṃbhramāt bhṛgoḥ sa pautraḥ hari bhaktim udvahan
translated: And the grandson of Bhrigu, bearing Hari's devotion, was overcome with fatigue from wandering for a long time.

original: kṣīrābdhim āsādya hariṃ sureśaṃ nāgendrabhoge kṛtanidram aikṣata // / //
analyzed: kṣīrābdhim āsādya harim sureśam nāga indra bhoge kṛta nidram aikṣata
translated: Having reached the milk ocean, he saw Hari, the lord of the gods, lying on the hood of the great serpent.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe mārkaṇḍeyacaritre daśamo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe mārkaṇḍeyacaritre daśamaḥ
translated: Thus ends the tenth chapter in the life of Markandeya in the Narasimha Purana.

original: vyāsa uvāca /🔽praṇipatya jagannāthaṃ carācaraguruṃ harim /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca  praṇipatya jagannātham carācara gurum harim
translated: Vyasa said:🔽Having bowed to Hari, the lord of the universe, the preceptor of the moving and unmoving,

original: mārkaṇḍeyo 'bhituṣṭāva bhogaparyaṅkaśāyinam // / //
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ bhituṣṭāva bhoga paryaṅka śāyinam
translated: Markandeya praised the one lying on the serpent couch.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: prasīda bhagavan viṣṇo prasīda puruṣottama /
analyzed: prasīda bhagavan viṣṇo prasīda puruṣottama
translated: Be gracious, O Lord Vishnu, be gracious, O Supreme Being,

original: prasīda devadeveśa prasīda garuḍadhvaja // / //
analyzed: prasīda devadeveśa prasīda garuḍadhvaja
translated: Be pleased, O Lord of the gods of gods, be pleased, O Garuḍa-bannered one.

original: prasīda viṣṇo lakṣmīśa prasīda dharaṇīdhara /
analyzed: prasīda viṣṇo lakṣmīśa prasīda dharaṇīdhara
translated: Be pleased, O Viṣṇu, O Lord of Lakṣmī, be pleased, O supporter of the earth.

original: prasīda lokanāthādya prasīda parameśvara // / //
analyzed: prasīda lokanātha adya prasīda parameśvara
translated: Be pleased, O Lord of the worlds and foremost, be pleased, O Supreme Lord.

original: prasīda sarvadeveśa prasīda kamalekṣaṇa /
analyzed: prasīda sarva deva īśa prasīda kamala īkṣaṇa
translated: Be pleased, O Lord of all gods, be pleased, O lotus-eyed one.

original: prasīda mandaradhara prasīda madhusūdana // / //
analyzed: prasīda mandara dhara prasīda madhusūdana
translated: Be pleased, O supporter of Mandara, be pleased, O slayer of Madhu.

original: prasīda subhagākānta prasīda bhuvanādhipa /
analyzed: prasīda subhagā kānta prasīda bhuvanādhipa
translated: Be pleased, O lover of the fortunate one, be pleased, O Lord of the worlds.

original: prasīdādya mahādeva prasīda mama keśava // / //
analyzed: prasīda adya mahādeva prasīda mama keśava
translated: Be pleased, O great god, be pleased, O Keśava, my Lord.

original: jaya kṛṣṇa jayācintya jaya viṣṇo jayāvyaya /
analyzed: jaya kṛṣṇa jaya acintya jaya viṣṇo jaya avyaya
translated: Victory to Kṛṣṇa, victory to the inconceivable one, victory to Viṣṇu, victory to the imperishable one.

original: jaya viśva jayāvyakta jaya viṣṇo namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: jaya viśva jaya avyakta jaya viṣṇo namaḥ stu te
translated: Victory to the universe, victory to the unmanifest one, victory to Viṣṇu, salutations to you.

original: jaya deva jayājeya jaya satya jayākṣara /
analyzed: jaya deva jaya ajeya jaya satya jaya akṣara
translated: Victory to the god, victory to the unconquerable one, victory to the truth, victory to the imperishable one.

original: jaya kāla jayeśāna jaya sarva namo 'stu te // / //🔽jaya yajñapate nātha jaya viśvapate vibho /
analyzed: jaya kāla jaya īśāna jaya sarva namaḥ stu te  jaya yajñapate nātha jaya viśvapate vibho
translated: Victory to time, victory to Īśāna, victory to all, salutations to you.🔽Victory to the Lord of sacrifice, O Lord, victory to the Lord of the universe, O powerful one.

original: jaya bhūtapate nātha jaya sarvapate vibho // / //
analyzed: jaya bhūtapate nātha jaya sarva pate vibho
translated: Victory to the Lord of beings, O Lord, victory to the Lord of all, O powerful one.

original: jaya viśvapate nātha jaya dakṣa namo 'stu te /
analyzed: jaya viśvapate nātha jaya dakṣa namaḥ stu te
translated: Victory to the Lord of the universe, O Lord, victory to Dakṣa, salutations to you.

original: jaya pāpaharānanta jaya janmajarāpaha // / //
analyzed: jaya pāpa hara ananta jaya janma jarā apaha
translated: Victory to the remover of sins, O infinite one, victory to the remover of birth and old age.

original: jaya bhadrātibhadreśa jaya bhadra namo 'stu te /
analyzed: jaya bhadra atibhadra īśa jaya bhadra namaḥ stu te
translated: Victory to the lord of Bhadra and Atibhadra, victory to Bhadra, salutations to you.

original: jaya kāmada kākutstha jaya mānada mādhava // / //
analyzed: jaya kāma da kākutstha jaya māna da mādhava
translated: Victory to the fulfiller of desires, to the descendant of Kakutstha, victory to the granter of honor, to Madhava.

original: jaya śaṃkara deveśa jaya śrīśa namo 'stu te /🔽jaya kuṅkumaraktābha jaya paṅkajalocana // / //
analyzed: jaya śaṃkara deveśa jaya śrīśa namaḥ stu te  jaya kuṅkuma rakta ābha jaya paṅkaja locana
translated: Victory to Shankara, lord of the gods, victory to the lord of Shri, salutations to you.🔽Victory to one who is red like saffron, victory to one with lotus eyes.

original: jaya candanaliptāṅga jaya rāma namo 'stu te /
analyzed: jaya candana lipta aṅga jaya rāma namaḥ stu te
translated: Victory to one whose body is smeared with sandalwood paste, victory to Rama, salutations to you.

original: jaya deva jagannātha jaya devakinandana // / //
analyzed: jaya deva jagannātha jaya devakinandana
translated: Victory to the god, lord of the world, victory to the delighter of Devaki.

original: jaya sarvaguro jñeya jaya śaṃbho namo 'stu te /
analyzed: jaya sarva guro jñeya jaya śaṃbho namaḥ stu te
translated: Victory to the omniscient guru, victory to Shiva, salutations to you.

original: jaya sundara padmābha jaya sundarivallabha /
analyzed: jaya sundara padma ābha jaya sundari vallabha
translated: Victory to the handsome one, to one who is like a lotus, victory to the beloved of Sundari.

original: jaya sundarasarvāṅga jaya vandya namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: jaya sundara sarva aṅga jaya vandya namaḥ stu te
translated: Victory to one whose entire body is beautiful, victory to the venerable one, salutations to you.

original: jaya sarvada sarveśa jaya śarmada śāśvata /
analyzed: jaya sarva da sarva īśa jaya śarma da śāśvata
translated: Victory to the all-pervading one, to the lord of all, victory to the bestower of peace, to the eternal one.

original: jaya kāmada bhaktānāṃ prabhaviṣṇo namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: jaya kāma da bhaktānām prabhaviṣṇo namaḥ stu te
translated: Victory to the fulfiller of desires of devotees, to the powerful one, salutations to you.

original: namaḥ kamalanābhāya namaḥ kamalamāline /
analyzed: namaḥ kamalanābhāya namaḥ kamala māline
translated: Salutations to the one with a lotus navel, salutations to the one wearing a garland of lotuses.

original: lokanātha namas te 'stu vīrabhadra namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: lokanātha namaḥ te stu vīrabhadra namaḥ stu te
translated: Lord of the world, salutations to you, victory to Virabhadra, salutations to you.

original: namas trailokyanāthāya caturmūrte jagatpate /
analyzed: namaḥ trailokya nāthāya catur mūrte jagatpate
translated: Salutations to the lord of the three worlds, to the one with four forms, to the lord of the universe.

original: namo devādhidevāya namo nārāyaṇāya te // / //
analyzed: namaḥ deva adhidevāya namaḥ nārāyaṇāya te
translated: Salutations to the supreme god of the gods, salutations to you, Narayana.

original: namas te vāsudevāya namas te pītavāsase /
analyzed: namaḥ te vāsudevāya namaḥ te pītavāsase
translated: Salutations to you, O Vasudeva! Salutations to you, O wearer of yellow garments!

original: namas te narasiṃhāya namas te śārṅgadhāriṇe // / //
analyzed: namaḥ te narasiṃhāya namaḥ te śārṅga dhāriṇe
translated: Salutations to you, O Narasimha! Salutations to you, O wielder of the Sharnga bow!

original: namaḥ kṛṣṇāya rāmāya namaś cakrāyudhāya ca /
analyzed: namaḥ kṛṣṇāya rāmāya namaḥ cakrāyudhāya ca
translated: Salutations to Krishna, to Rama, and to the one whose weapon is the discus.

original: namaḥ śivāya devāya namas te bhuvaneśvara // / //
analyzed: namaḥ śivāya devāya namaḥ te bhuvaneśvara
translated: Salutations to Shiva, to the god, salutations to you, O lord of the universe!

original: namo vedāntavedyāya namo 'nantāya viṣṇave /
analyzed: namaḥ vedānta vedyāya namaḥ nantāya viṣṇave
translated: Salutations to the one who is to be known through the Vedanta, salutations to the infinite Vishnu.

original: namas te sakalādhyakṣa namas te śrīdharāacyuta // / //
analyzed: namaḥ te sakala adhyakṣa namaḥ te śrīdhara aacyuta
translated: Salutations to you, the overseer of all, salutations to you, O Shrihari, O Achyuta!

original: lokādhyakṣa jagatpūjya paramātman namo 'stu te /
analyzed: loka adhyakṣa jagat pūjya paramātman namaḥ stu te
translated: O lord of the worlds, worshiped by the world, O supreme soul, salutations to you.

original: tvaṃ mātā sarvalokānāṃ tvam eva jagataḥ pitā // / //
analyzed: tvam mātā sarva lokānām tvam eva jagataḥ pitā
translated: You are the mother of all worlds, you are the father of the universe!

original: tvam ārtānāṃ suhṛn mitraṃ priyas tvaṃ prapitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: tvam ārtānām suhṛd mitram priyaḥ tvam prapitāmahaḥ
translated: You are the friend and well-wisher of the afflicted, you are the beloved great-grandfather.

original: tvaṃ gurus tvaṃ gatiḥ sākṣī tvaṃ patis tvaṃ parāyaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: tvam guruḥ tvam gatiḥ sākṣī tvam patiḥ tvam parāyaṇaḥ
translated: You are the guru, the refuge, the witness, the lord, and the ultimate resort.

original: tvaṃ dhruvas tvaṃ vaṣaṭkartā tvaṃ havis tvaṃ hutāśanaḥ /
analyzed: tvam dhruvaḥ tvam vaṣaṭkartā tvam haviḥ tvam hutāśanaḥ
translated: You are the stable one, the one who utters vashat, you are the offering, you are the sacrificial fire.

original: tvaṃ śivas tvaṃ vasur dhātā tvaṃ brahmā tvaṃ sureśvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: tvam śivaḥ tvam vasuḥ dhātā tvam brahmā tvam sura īśvaraḥ
translated: You are Shiva, you are the wealth-bestowing god, you are Brahma, you are the lord of the gods.

original: tvaṃ yamas tvaṃ ravir vāyus tvaṃ jalaṃ tvaṃ dhaneśvaraḥ /
analyzed: tvam yamaḥ tvam raviḥ vāyuḥ tvam jalam tvam dhaneśvaraḥ
translated: You are Yama, you are the sun, you are the wind, you are the water, you are Kubera, the lord of wealth.

original: tvaṃ manus tvam ahorātraṃ tvaṃ niśā tvaṃ niśākaraḥ /
analyzed: tvam manuḥ tvam ahorātram tvam niśā tvam niśākaraḥ
translated: You are Manu, you are day and night, you are the night, you are the moon.

original: tvaṃ dhṛtis tvaṃ śriyaḥ kāntis tvaṃ kṣamā tvaṃ dharādharaḥ // / //
analyzed: tvam dhṛtiḥ tvam śriyaḥ kāntiḥ tvam kṣamā tvam dharādharaḥ
translated: You are patience, you are the beauty of Shri, you are forgiveness, you are the supporter of the earth.

original: tvaṃ kartā jagatām īśas tvaṃ hantā madhusūdana /
analyzed: tvam kartā jagatām īśaḥ tvam hantā madhusūdana
translated: You are the creator of the worlds, O Lord, you are the destroyer, O slayer of Madhu.

original: tvam eva goptā sarvasya jagatas tvaṃ carācara // / //
analyzed: tvam eva goptā sarvasya jagataḥ tvam carācara
translated: You alone are the protector of all, of the moving and unmoving world.

original: karaṇaṃ kāraṇaṃ kartā tvam eva parameśvaraḥ /🔽śaṅkhacakragadāpāṇe bho samuddhara mādhava // / //
analyzed: karaṇam kāraṇam kartā tvam eva parameśvaraḥ  śaṅkha cakra gadā pāṇe bho samuddhara mādhava
translated: You are the instrument, the cause, and the doer, you alone are the Supreme Lord.🔽O wielder of the conch, discus, and club, O Madhava, please deliver me.

original: priya padmapalāśākṣa śeṣaparyaṅkaśāyinam /
analyzed: priya padma palāśa akṣa śeṣa paryaṅka śāyinam
translated: O beloved one with eyes like lotus petals, O one who lies on the couch of the serpent Shesha,

original: tvām eva bhaktyā satataṃ namāmi puruṣottamam // / //
analyzed: tvām eva bhaktyā satatam namāmi puruṣottamam
translated: I constantly bow to you with devotion, to you, the supreme being.

original: śrīvatsāṅka jagadbījaṃ śyāmalaṃ kamalekṣaṇam /
analyzed: śrīvatsa aṅka jagat bījam śyāmalam kamala īkṣaṇam
translated: O one marked with the Shrivatsa mark, the seed of the universe, the dark one with lotus eyes,

original: namāmi te vapur deva kalikalmaṣanāśanam // / //
analyzed: namāmi te vapuḥ deva kali kalmaṣa nāśanam
translated: I bow to your form, O God, which destroys the sins of the Kali age.

original: lakṣmīdharam udārāṅgaṃ divyamālāvibhūṣitam /
analyzed: lakṣmī dharam udāra aṅgam divya mālā vibhūṣitam
translated: The supporter of Lakshmi, with a noble body, adorned with divine garlands,

original: cārupṛṣṭhaṃ mahābāhuṃ cārubhūṣaṇabhūṣitam // / //
analyzed: cāru pṛṣṭham mahā bāhum cāru bhūṣaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: With a beautiful back, long arms, and adorned with beautiful ornaments.

original: padmanābhaṃ viśālākṣaṃ padmapattranibhekṣaṇam /
translated: With the navel like a lotus, large eyes, eyes like lotus petals,

original: dīrghatuṅgamahāghrāṇaṃ nīlajīmūtasaṃnibham // / //
analyzed: dīrgha tuṅga mahā ghrāṇam nīla jīmūta saṃnibham
translated: With a long, high, and large nose, resembling a dark cloud.

original: dīrghabāhuṃ suguptāṅgaṃ ratnahārojjvalorasam /🔽subhrūlalāṭamukuṭaṃ snigdhadantaṃ sulocanam // / //
analyzed: dīrgha bāhum su gupta aṅgam ratna hāra ujjvala urasam  su bhrū lalāṭa mukuṭam snigdha dantam su locanam
translated: Long-armed, well-protected limbs, chest shining with jeweled necklaces,🔽Beautiful eyebrows, forehead, crown, glossy teeth, beautiful eyes,

original: cārubāhuṃ sutāmrauṣṭhaṃ ratnojjvalitakuṇḍalam /
analyzed: cāru bāhum su tāmra oṣṭham ratna ujjvalita kuṇḍalam
translated: Charming arms, beautiful copper lips, earrings shining with jewels,

original: vṛttakaṇṭhaṃ supīnāṃsaṃ sarasaṃ śrīdharaṃ harim // / //🔽sukumāram ajaṃ nityaṃ nīlakuñcitamūrdhajam /
analyzed: vṛtta kaṇṭham su pīna aṃsam sarasam śrīdharam harim  su kumāram ajam nityam nīla kuñcita mūrdhajam
translated: Round neck, well-developed shoulders, the sweet-natured Shri Hari,🔽The tender, unborn one, with eternally dark curly hair,

original: unnatāṃsaṃ mahoraskaṃ karṇāntāyatalocanam // / //
analyzed: unnata aṃsam mahā uraskam karṇa anta āyata locanam
translated: Shoulders raised, broad chest, eyes extending to the ears,

original: hemāravindavadanam indirāyanam īśvaram /
analyzed: hema aravinda vadanam indirāyanam īśvaram
translated: Face like a golden lotus, the lord of Lakshmi, the lord,

original: sarvalokavidhātāraṃ sarvapāpaharaṃ harim // / //
translated: The creator of all worlds, the remover of all sins, Hari,

original: sarvalakṣaṇasaṃpannaṃ sarvasattvamanoramam /
analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa saṃpannam sarva sattva manoramam
translated: Endowed with all good qualities, delightful to all beings,

original: viṣṇum acyutam īśānam anantaṃ puruṣottamam // / //
analyzed: viṣṇum acyutam īśānam anantam puruṣottamam
translated: Vishnu, the immutable, the lord, the infinite, the best of men,

original: nato 'smi manasā nityaṃ nārāyaṇam anāmayam /
analyzed: nataḥ smi manasā nityam nārāyaṇam anāmayam
translated: I always bow my mind to the flawless Narayana,

original: varadaṃ kāmadaṃ kāntam anantaṃ sūnṛtaṃ śivam // / //
analyzed: vara dam kāma dam kāntam anantam sūnṛtam śivam
translated: The giver of boons, the fulfiller of desires, the beloved, the infinite, the truthful, the auspicious,

original: namāmi śirasā viṣṇo sadā tvāṃ bhaktavatsala /
analyzed: namāmi śirasā viṣṇo sadā tvām bhakta vatsala
translated: I bow my head to you, O Vishnu, always affectionate towards devotees,

original: asminn ekārṇave ghore vāyuskambhitacañcale // / //
analyzed: asmin ekārṇave ghore vāyu skambhita cañcale
translated: In this terrible, solitary ocean, trembling with the wind,

original: anantabhogaśayane sahasraphaṇaśobhite /
analyzed: ananta bhoga śayane sahasra phaṇa śobhite
translated: On a bed of infinite coils, adorned with a thousand hoods,

original: vicitraśayane ramye sevite mandavāyunā // / //
analyzed: vicitra śayane ramye sevite manda vāyunā
translated: On a beautiful and colorful bed, served by a gentle breeze.

original: bhujapañcarasaṃsakta kamalālayasevitam /
analyzed: kamala ālaya sevitam
translated: Served by the abode of lotuses, attached to the five limbs of the arms.

original: iha tvāṃ manasā sarvam idānīṃ dṛṣṭavān aham // / //
analyzed: iha tvām manasā sarvam idānīm dṛṣṭavān aham
translated: Here, I have now seen you in my mind with everything.

original: idānīṃ tu suduḥkhārto māyayā tava mohitaḥ /
analyzed: idānīm tu su duḥkha ārtaḥ māyayā tava mohitaḥ
translated: But now, afflicted by great sorrow, deluded by your illusion,

original: ekodake nirālambe naṣṭasthāvarajaṅgame // / //
analyzed: eka udake nirālambe naṣṭa sthāvara jaṅgame
translated: In a single water, without support, with the destruction of the immobile and the moving.

original: śūnye tamasi duṣpāre duḥkhapaṅke nirāmaye /
analyzed: śūnye tamasi duṣpāre duḥkha paṅke nirāmaye
translated: In an empty darkness, difficult to cross, in a painful mud without remedy,

original: śītātapajarāroga śokatṛṣṇādibhiḥ sadā // / //
analyzed: śīta ātapa jarā roga śoka tṛṣṇā ādibhiḥ sadā
translated: Constantly afflicted by cold, heat, old age, disease, grief, thirst, and so on,

original: pīḍito 'smi bhṛśaṃ tāta suciraṃ kālam acyuta /
analyzed: pīḍitaḥ smi bhṛśam tāta su ciram kālam acyuta
translated: I am greatly afflicted, O father, for a long time, O imperishable one.

original: śokamohagrahagrasto vicaran bhavasāgare // / //
analyzed: śoka moha graha grastaḥ vicaran bhava sāgare
translated: Wandering in the ocean of existence, seized by the planets of sorrow and delusion,

original: ihādya vidhinā prāptas tava pādābjasaṃnidhau /
analyzed: iha adya vidhinā prāptaḥ tava pāda abja saṃnidhau
translated: Today, I have come here by fate to the vicinity of your lotus feet.

original: ekārṇave mahāghore dustare duḥkhapīḍitaḥ // / //
analyzed: ekārṇave mahā ghore dustare duḥkha pīḍitaḥ
translated: In a great and terrible single ocean, difficult to cross, afflicted by pain,

original: cirabhramapariśrāntas tvām adya śaraṇaṃ gataḥ /🔽prasīda sumahāmāya viṣṇo rājīvalocana // / //
analyzed: cira bhrama pariśrāntaḥ tvām adya śaraṇam gataḥ  prasīda su mahāmāya viṣṇo rājīva locana
translated: Exhausted by wandering for a long time, I have now come to you for refuge.🔽Be gracious, O great illusion, O Vishnu, O lotus-eyed one,

original: viśvayone viśālākṣa viśvātman viśvasaṃbhava /
analyzed: viśvayone viśāla akṣa viśvātman viśva saṃbhava
translated: O origin of the universe, O large-eyed one, O soul of the universe, O origin of the universe,

original: ananyaśaraṇaṃ prāptam ato 'tra kulanandana // / //
analyzed: an anya śaraṇam prāptam kula nandana
translated: Since I have come here without any other refuge, O delighter of the family,

original: trāhi māṃ kṛpayā kṛṣṇa śaraṇāgatam āturam /
analyzed: trāhi mām kṛpayā kṛṣṇa śaraṇa āgatam āturam
translated: Please save me with compassion, O Krishna, I am a distressed one who has come to you for refuge.

original: namas te puṇḍarīkākṣa purāṇapuruṣottama // / //
analyzed: namaḥ te puṇḍarīkākṣa purāṇa puruṣottama
translated: Salutations to you, O lotus-eyed one, O best of ancient beings...

original: añjanābha hṛṣīkeśa māyāmaya namo 'stu te /
analyzed: añjana ābha hṛṣīkeśa māyā maya namaḥ stu te
translated: O one with a body like dark ointment, O Hrishikesha, O one full of illusion, salutations to you.

original: mām uddhara mahābāho magne saṃsārasāgare // / //🔽gahvare dustare duḥkha kliṣṭe kleśamahāgrahaiḥ /
analyzed: mām uddhara mahā bāho magne saṃsāra sāgare  gahvare dustare duḥkha kliṣṭe kleśa mahā grahaiḥ
translated: O mighty-armed one, please lift me up from this ocean of worldly existence...🔽In this deep, difficult to cross, painful, afflicted by the great afflictions of the mind,

original: anāthaṃ kṛpaṇaṃ dīnaṃ patitaṃ bhavasāgare /
analyzed: anātham kṛpaṇam dīnam patitam bhava sāgare
translated: Helpless, miserable, poor, fallen in the ocean of worldly existence,

original: māṃ samuddhara govinda varadeśa namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: mām samuddhara govinda vara deśa namaḥ stu te
translated: Please lift me up, O Govinda, O best of places, salutations to you...

original: namas trailokyanāthāya haraye bhūdharāya ca /
analyzed: namaḥ trailokya nāthāya haraye bhūdharāya ca
translated: Salutations to the lord of the three worlds, to Hari, to the bearer of the earth,

original: devadeva namas te 'stu śrīvallabha namo 'stu te // / //
analyzed: devadeva namaḥ te stu śrīvallabha namaḥ stu te
translated: To the god of gods, salutations to you, O beloved of Shri, salutations to you...

original: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa kṛpālus tvam agatīnāṃ gatir bhavān /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa kṛpāluḥ tvam agatīnām gatiḥ bhavān
translated: Krishna, Krishna, you are compassionate, you are the refuge of those without one,

original: saṃsārārṇavamagnānāṃ prasīda madhusūdana // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra arṇava magnānām prasīda madhusūdana
translated: Please be gracious, O slayer of Madhu, to those who are sunk in the ocean of worldly existence...

original: tvām ekam ādyaṃ puruṣaṃ purāṇaṃ jagatpatiṃ kāraṇam acyutaṃ prabhum /
analyzed: tvām ekam ādyam puruṣam purāṇam jagatpatim kāraṇam acyutam prabhum
translated: You alone are the primordial, ancient being, the lord of the universe, the immutable cause, the lord,

original: janārdanaṃ janmajarārtināśanaṃ sureśvaraṃ sundaram indirāpatim // / //
analyzed: janārdanam janma jarā ārti nāśanam sureśvaram sundaram indirāpatim
translated: Janardana, the destroyer of the sufferings of birth and old age, the lord of gods, the handsome one, the husband of Lakshmi...

original: bṛhadbhujaṃ śyāmalakomalaṃ śubhaṃ varānanaṃ vārijapattranetram /
analyzed: bṛhat bhujam śyāmala komalam śubham vara ānanam vārija pattra netram
translated: I bow to the eternal Lord Hari, who has mighty arms, a dark and tender form, an auspicious face, eyes like lotus petals,

original: taraṃgabhaṅgāyatakuntalaṃ hariṃ sukāntam īśaṃ praṇato 'smi śāśvatam // / //
analyzed: taraṃga bhaṅga āyata kuntalam harim su kāntam īśam praṇataḥ smi śāśvatam
translated: and curly hair long like the waves of the ocean, who is very handsome and the Lord.

original: sā jihvā yā hariṃ stauti tac cittaṃ yat tvadarpitam /
analyzed: sā jihvā yā harim stauti tat cittam yat tvad arpitam
translated: That tongue which praises Hari, that mind which is devoted to you,

original: tāv eva kevalau ślāghyau yau tvatpūjākarau karau // / //
analyzed: tau eva kevalau ślāghyau yau tvad pūjā karau karau
translated: only those two are praiseworthy, those two hands which perform your worship.

original: janmāntarasahasreṣu yan mayā pātakaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: janma antara sahasreṣu yat mayā pātakam kṛtam
translated: Whatever sin I have committed in thousands of births,

original: tan me hara tvaṃ govinda vāsudeveti kīrtanāt // / //
analyzed: tat me hara tvam govinda vāsudeva iti kīrtanāt
translated: remove that from me, O Govinda, by the recitation of Vasudeva.

original: vyāsa uvāca /🔽iti stutas tato viṣṇur mārkaṇḍeyena dhīmatā /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca  iti stutaḥ tatas viṣṇuḥ mārkaṇḍeyena dhīmatā
translated: Vyasa said:🔽Thus praised by the wise Markandeya,

original: saṃtuṣṭaḥ prāha viśvātmā taṃ muniṃ garuḍadhvajaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃtuṣṭaḥ prāha viśvātmā tam munim garuḍadhvajaḥ
translated: Vishnu, the soul of the universe, the one with Garuda on his banner, being pleased, said to the sage:

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: prīto 'smi tapasā vipra stutyā ca bhṛgunandana /
analyzed: prītaḥ smi tapasā vipra stutyā ca bhṛgu nandana
translated: I am pleased with your austerities and praise, O brahmin, descendant of Bhrigu.

original: varaṃ vṛṇīṣva bhadraṃ te prārthitaṃ dadmi te varam // / //
analyzed: varam vṛṇīṣva bhadram te prārthitam dadmi te varam
translated: May you fare well. Choose a boon. I will grant you the boon you desire.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: tvatpādapadme deveśa bhaktiṃ me dehi sarvadā /
analyzed: tvad pāda padme deveśa bhaktim me dehi sarvadā
translated: O Lord of gods, always grant me devotion to your lotus feet.

original: yadi tuṣṭo mamādya tvam anyad ekaṃ vṛṇomy aham // / //
analyzed: yadi tuṣṭaḥ mama adya tvam anyat ekam vṛṇomi aham
translated: If you are pleased with me today, I ask for one more thing.

original: stotreṇānena deveśa yas tvāṃ stoṣyati nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: stotreṇa anena deveśa yaḥ tvām stoṣyati nityaśas
translated: O Lord of gods, grant him who will always praise you with this hymn,

original: svarlokavasatiṃ tasya dehi deva jagatpate // / //
analyzed: svar loka vasatim tasya dehi deva jagatpate
translated: residence in the world of heaven, O god, O lord of the universe.

original: dīrghāyuṣṭvaṃ tu yad dattaṃ tvayā me tapyataḥ purā /
analyzed: dīrgha āyuḥ tvam tu yat dattam tvayā me tapyataḥ purā
translated: The long life that you granted me in the past while I was performing austerities,

original: tat sarvaṃ saphalaṃ jātam idānīṃ tava darśanāt // / //
analyzed: tat sarvam saphalam jātam idānīm tava darśanāt
translated: all that has now become fruitful by seeing you.

original: vastum icchāmi deveśa tava pādābjam arcayan /
analyzed: vastum icchāmi deveśa tava pāda abjam arcayan
translated: I wish to stay here itself, O Lord of gods, worshipping your lotus feet,

original: atraiva bhagavan nityaṃ janmamṛtyuvivarjitaḥ // / //
analyzed: atrā eva bhagavat nityam janma mṛtyu vivarjitaḥ
translated: free from birth and death here itself, O Lord.

original: śrībhagavān uvāca /
analyzed: śrī bhagavān uvāca
translated: The Blessed Lord said:

original: mayy astu te bhṛguśreṣṭha bhaktir avyabhicāriṇī /
analyzed: mayi astu te bhṛgu śreṣṭha bhaktiḥ avyabhicāriṇī
translated: Let there be unwavering devotion to me in you, O best of Bhrigus.

original: bhaktyā muktir bhavaty eva tava kālena sattama // / //
analyzed: bhaktyā muktiḥ bhavati eva tava kālena sattama
translated: By devotion, liberation will surely come to you in due course, O best one.

original: yas tv idaṃ paṭhate stotraṃ sāyaṃ prātas taveritam /
analyzed: yaḥ tu idam paṭhate stotram sāyam prātar tava īritam
translated: He who recites this hymn composed by you in the morning and evening,

original: mayi bhaktiṃ dṛḍhāṃ kṛtvā mama loke sa modate // / //
analyzed: mayi bhaktim dṛḍhām kṛtvā mama loke sa modate
translated: having firmly fixed devotion to me, rejoices in my world.

original: yatra yatra bhṛguśreṣṭha sthitas tvaṃ māṃ smariṣyasi /
analyzed: yatra yatra bhṛgu śreṣṭha sthitaḥ tvam mām smariṣyasi
translated: Wherever you may be, O best of Bhrigus, remembering me,

original: tatra tatra sameṣyāmi dānto bhaktavaśo 'smi bhoḥ // / //
analyzed: tatra tatra sameṣyāmi dāntaḥ bhakta vaśaḥ smi bhoḥ
translated: there I will come, being self-controlled, I am subject to my devotees.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: ity uktvā taṃ muniśreṣṭhaṃ mārkaṇḍeyaṃ sa mādhavaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā tam muni śreṣṭham mārkaṇḍeyam sa mādhavaḥ
translated: Having said this to that best of sages Markandeya, that Madhava,

original: virarāma sa sarvatra paśyan viṣṇuṃ yatas tataḥ // / //
analyzed: virarāma sa sarvatra paśyan viṣṇum yatas tatas
translated: and ceased everywhere, seeing Vishnu from all sides.

original: iti te kathitaṃ vipra caritaṃ tasya dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: iti te kathitam vipra caritam tasya dhīmataḥ
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, I have told you the story of that wise one,

original: mārkaṇḍeyasya ca munes tenaivoktaṃ purā mama // / //
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyasya ca muneḥ tena evā uktam purā mama
translated: of the sage Markandeya, as told to me by him in the past.

original: ye viṣṇubhaktyā caritaṃ purāṇaṃ bhṛgos tu pautrasya paṭhanti nityam /
analyzed: ye viṣṇu bhaktyā caritam purāṇam bhṛgoḥ tu pautrasya paṭhanti nityam
translated: Those who always recite the ancient story of Vishnu's devotion, of Bhrigu's grandson,

original: te muktapāpā narasiṃhaloke vasanti bhaktair abhipūjyamānāḥ // / //
analyzed: te mukta pāpāḥ narasiṃha loke vasanti bhaktaiḥ abhipūjyamānāḥ
translated: they, being free from sins, dwell in Narasimha's world, being worshipped by devotees.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe mārkaṇḍeyacaritaṃ nāma ekādaśo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe mārkaṇḍeyacaritam nāma ekādaśaḥ dhyāya
translated: Thus ends the eleventh chapter in the Narasimha Purana, named the story of Markandeya.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Sūta said:

original: śrutvemām amṛtāṃ puṇyāṃ sarvapāpapraṇāśinīm /
analyzed: śrutvā imām amṛtām puṇyām sarva pāpa praṇāśinīm
translated: Having heard this nectar-like, meritorious, and sin-destroying story,

original: avitṛptaḥ sa dharmātmā śuko vyāsam abhāṣata // / //
analyzed: a vitṛptaḥ sa dharma ātmā śukaḥ vyāsam abhāṣata
translated: that righteous-souled Śuka, being unsatisfied, spoke to Vyāsa:

original: śrīśuka uvāca /
analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Śrī Śuka said:

original: aho 'tīva tapaścaryā mārkaṇḍeyasya dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: aho tīva tapaḥ caryā mārkaṇḍeyasya dhīmataḥ
translated: Oh! The austerities of the wise Markandeya are indeed great,

original: yena dṛṣṭo hariḥ sākṣād yena mṛtyuḥ parājitaḥ // / //
analyzed: yena dṛṣṭaḥ hariḥ sākṣāt yena mṛtyuḥ parājitaḥ
translated: by whom Hari was directly seen and by whom death was defeated.

original: na tṛptir asti me tāta śrutvemāṃ vaiṣṇavīṃ kathām /
analyzed: na tṛptiḥ asti me tāta śrutvā imām vaiṣṇavīm kathām
translated: O father, I am not satisfied having heard this Vaishnava story,

original: puṇyāṃ pāpaharāṃ tāta tasmād anyat tu me vada // / //
analyzed: puṇyām pāpa harām tāta tasmāt anyat tu me vada
translated: which is meritorious and sin-destroying. Therefore, tell me something else, O father.

original: narāṇāṃ dṛḍhacittānām akāryaṃ neha kurvatām /
analyzed: narāṇām dṛḍha cittānām akāryam na iha kurvatām
translated: For men of firm minds who do not perform forbidden acts in this world,

original: yat puṇyam ṛṣibhiḥ proktaṃ tan me vada mahāmate // / //
analyzed: yat puṇyam ṛṣibhiḥ proktam tat me vada mahāmate
translated: Tell me, O greatly wise one, what merit the sages have declared.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: narāṇāṃ dṛḍhacittānām iha loke paratra ca /
analyzed: narāṇām dṛḍha cittānām iha loke paratra ca
translated: For men of firm minds in this world and the next,

original: puṇyaṃ yat syān muniśreṣṭha tan me nigadataḥ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: puṇyam yat syāt muni śreṣṭha tat me nigadataḥ śṛṇu
translated: Listen as I tell you, O best of sages, what merit there may be.

original: atraivodāharantīmām itihāsaṃ purātanam /
analyzed: atra eva udāharanti imām itihāsam purātanam
translated: In this very context, they relate this ancient history,

original: yamyā ca saha saṃvādaṃ yamasya ca mahātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: yamyā ca saha saṃvādam yamasya ca mahātmanaḥ
translated: The conversation between Yama and the great-souled Yama.

original: vivasvān aditeḥ putras tasya putrau suvarcasau /
analyzed: vivasvān aditeḥ putraḥ tasya putrau su varcasau
translated: Vivasvat, the son of Aditi, had two sons of great splendor,

original: jajñāte sa yamaś caiva yamī cāpi yavīyasī // / //
analyzed: jajñāte sa yamaḥ ca eva yamī ca api yavīyasī
translated: Yama was born first, and Yamuna, his younger sister.

original: tau tatra saṃvivardhete pitur bhavana uttame /
analyzed: tau tatra saṃvivardhete pituḥ bhavane uttame
translated: They grew up there in their father's excellent abode,

original: krīḍamānau svabhāvena svacchandagamanāv ubhau // / //
analyzed: krīḍamānau svabhāvena svacchanda gamanau ubhau
translated: Playing naturally, both of them going wherever they pleased.

original: yamī yamaṃ samāsādya svasā bhrātaram abravīt // / //
analyzed: yamī yamam samāsādya svasā bhrātaram abravīt
translated: Yamuna, the sister, approaching her brother Yama, said:

original: na bhrātā bhaginīṃ yogyāṃ kāmayantīṃ ca kāmayet /
analyzed: na bhrātā bhaginīm yogyām kāmayantīm ca kāmayet
translated: A brother should not desire a sister who is in love, nor should he desire one who is not in love.

original: bhrātṛbhūtena kiṃ tasya svasur yo na patir bhavet // / //
analyzed: bhrātṛ bhūtena kim tasya svasuḥ yaḥ na patiḥ bhavet
translated: What is the use of being a brother to one's sister if one does not become her husband?

original: abhūta iva sa jñeyo na tu bhūtaḥ kathaṃcana /
analyzed: abhūtaḥ iva sa jñeyaḥ na tu bhūtaḥ kathaṃcana
translated: He should be known as if he were not a brother, but in no way a brother.

original: anāthāṃ nātham icchantīṃ svasāraṃ yo na nāthati // / //
analyzed: anāthām nātham icchantīm svasāram yaḥ na nāthati
translated: He who does not protect his helpless sister who desires a protector,

original: kāṅkṣantīṃ bhrātaraṃ nāthaṃ bhartāraṃ yas tu necchati /
analyzed: kāṅkṣantīm bhrātaram nātham bhartāram yaḥ tu na icchati
translated: And she who desires a brother as her protector but does not get one,

original: bhrāteti nocyate loke sa pumān munisattamaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhrātā iti nā ucyate loke sa pumān muni sattamaḥ
translated: That man, O best of sages, is not called a brother in the world.

original: syād vānyatanayā tasya bharyā bhavati kiṃ tayā /
analyzed: syāt vā anya tanayā tasya bharyā bhavati kim tayā
translated: Or would his other daughter be his wife? What is the use of her?

original: īkṣatas tu svasā bhrātuḥ kāmena paridahyate // / //
analyzed: īkṣataḥ tu svasā bhrātuḥ kāmena paridahyate
translated: But while looking, his sister is burned by desire.

original: yat kāryam aham icchāmi tvam eveccha tad eva hi /
analyzed: yat kāryam aham icchāmi tvam evā iccha tat eva hi
translated: Whatever I desire to be done, you alone desire that very thing.

original: anyathāhaṃ mariṣyāmi tvām icchantī vicetanā // / //
analyzed: anyathā aham mariṣyāmi tvām icchantī vicetanā
translated: Otherwise, desiring you, I will die, deprived of consciousness.

original: kāmaduḥkham asahyaṃ nu bhrātaḥ kiṃ tvaṃ na cecchasi /🔽kāmāgninā bhṛśaṃ taptā pralīyāmy aṅga mā ciram // / //
analyzed: kāma duḥkham asahyam nu bhrātar kim tvam na ca icchasi  kāma agninā bhṛśam taptā pralīyāmi aṅga mā ciram
translated: O brother, do you not desire the unbearable suffering of desire?🔽Tormented by the fire of desire, I am melting away, so do not delay.

original: kāmārtāyāḥ striyāḥ kānta vaśago bhava mā ciram /
analyzed: kāma ārtāyāḥ striyāḥ kānta vaśagaḥ bhava mā ciram
translated: O lover, be quickly under the control of a woman afflicted by desire.

original: svena kāyena me kāyaṃ saṃyojayitum arhasi // / //
analyzed: svena kāyena me kāyam saṃyojayitum arhasi
translated: You should unite my body with your own body.

original: yama uvāca /
analyzed: yamaḥ uvāca
translated: Yama said:

original: kim idaṃ lokavidviṣṭaṃ dharmaṃ bhagini bhāṣase /
analyzed: kim idam loka vidviṣṭam dharmam bhagini bhāṣase
translated: O sister, why do you speak this dharma that is hated by the world?

original: akāryam iha kaḥ kuryāt pumān bhadre sucetanaḥ // / //
analyzed: akāryam iha kaḥ kuryāt pumān bhadre su cetanaḥ
translated: O good lady, what man of good sense would do this improper act here?

original: na te saṃyojayiṣyāmi kāyaṃ kāyena bhāmini /
analyzed: na te saṃyojayiṣyāmi kāyam kāyena bhāmini
translated: I will not unite your body with my body, O beautiful lady.

original: na bhrātā madanārtāyāḥ svasuḥ kāmaṃ prayacchati // / //
analyzed: na bhrātā madana ārtāyāḥ svasuḥ kāmam prayacchati
translated: A brother does not give his sister what she desires when she is afflicted by passion.

original: mahāpātakam ity āhuḥ svasāraṃ yo 'dhigacchati /
analyzed: mahāpātakam iti āhuḥ svasāram yaḥ dhigacchati
translated: They say that one who approaches his own sister commits a mortal sin.

original: paśūnām eṣa dharmaḥ syāt tiryagyonivatāṃ śubhe // / //
analyzed: paśūnām eṣa dharmaḥ syāt tiryagyonivatām śubhe
translated: This would be the dharma of animals, O auspicious one, for those born in the animal realm.

original: yamy uvāca /
analyzed: yamī uvāca
translated: Yama said:

original: ekasthāne yathā pūrvaṃ saṃyogo nau na duṣyati /
analyzed: eka sthāne yathā pūrvam saṃyogaḥ nau na duṣyati
translated: Just as our union in one place before was not sinful,

original: mātṛgarbhe tathaivāyaṃ saṃyogo nau na duṣyati // / //
analyzed: mātṛ garbhe tathā eva ayam saṃyogaḥ nau na duṣyati
translated: so this union of ours in the mother's womb is not sinful.

original: kiṃ bhrātar apy anāthāṃ tvaṃ mā necchasi śobhanam /
analyzed: kim bhrātar api anāthām tvam mā nā icchasi śobhanam
translated: Why do you not desire, O brother, this auspicious thing for your helpless sister?

original: svasāraṃ nirṛtī rakṣaḥ saṃgacchati ca nityaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: svasāram nirṛtiḥ rakṣaḥ saṃgacchati ca nityaśas
translated: The demon of misfortune always approaches and unites with your sister.

original: yama uvāca /
analyzed: yamaḥ uvāca
translated: Yama said:

original: svayaṃbhuvāpi nindyeta lokavṛttaṃ jugupsitam /
analyzed: svayaṃbhuvā api nindyeta loka vṛttam jugupsitam
translated: Even the self-existent one would condemn the conduct of the world, which is despicable.

original: pradhānapuruṣācīrṇaṃ loko 'yam anuvartate // / //
analyzed: pradhānapuruṣa ācīrṇam lokaḥ yam anuvartate
translated: This world follows what is practiced by the principal and the people.

original: tasmād aninditaṃ dharmaṃ pradhānapuruṣaś caret /
analyzed: tasmāt aninditam dharmam pradhāna puruṣaḥ caret
translated: Therefore, the principal and the people should practice the uncensured dharma.

original: ninditaṃ varjayed yatnād etad dharmasya lakṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: ninditam varjayet yatnāt etat dharmasya lakṣaṇam
translated: One should carefully avoid the censured, this is the characteristic of dharma.

original: yad yad ācarati śreṣṭhas tat tad evetaro janaḥ /
analyzed: yat yat ācarati śreṣṭhaḥ tat tat eva itaraḥ janaḥ
translated: Whatever the best person does, that alone is done by other people.

original: sa yat pramāṇaṃ kurute lokas tad anuvartate // / //
analyzed: sa yat pramāṇam kurute lokaḥ tat anuvartate
translated: Whatever standard he sets, the world follows.

original: atipāpam ahaṃ manye subhage vacanaṃ tava /
analyzed: ati pāpam aham manye subhage vacanam tava
translated: O fortunate one, I consider your words to be extremely sinful.

original: viruddhaṃ sarvadharmeṣu lokeṣu ca viśeṣataḥ // / //
analyzed: viruddham sarva dharmeṣu lokeṣu ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: They are contradictory to all religions and especially to worldly norms.

original: matto 'nyo yo bhaved yo vai viśiṣṭo rūpaśīlataḥ /🔽tena sārdhaṃ pramodasva na te bhartā bhavāmy aham // / //
analyzed: mattaḥ nyaḥ yaḥ bhavet yaḥ vai viśiṣṭaḥ rūpa śīlataḥ  tena sārdham pramodasva na te bhartā bhavāmi aham
translated: If there is anyone else who is superior to me in beauty and character,🔽then rejoice with him. I will not be your husband.

original: nāhaṃ spṛśāmi tanvā te tanuṃ bhadre dṛḍhavrataḥ /
analyzed: na aham spṛśāmi tanvā te tanum bhadre dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: O good lady, I do not touch your body with my body, being firm in my vows.

original: munayaḥ pāpam āhus taṃ yaḥ svasāraṃ nigṛhṇati // / //
analyzed: munayaḥ pāpam āhuḥ tam yaḥ svasāram nigṛhṇati
translated: The sages declare that sin to be great, which one commits against one's own sister.

original: yamy uvāca /
analyzed: yamī uvāca
translated: Yama said:

original: durlabhaṃ caiva paśyāmi loke rūpam ihedṛśam /
analyzed: durlabham ca eva paśyāmi loke rūpam iha īdṛśam
translated: I consider such beauty to be rare in this world.

original: yatra rūpaṃ vayaś caiva pṛthivyāṃ kva pratiṣṭhitam // / //
analyzed: yatra rūpam vayaḥ ca eva pṛthivyām kva pratiṣṭhitam
translated: Where can such beauty and youth be found on earth?

original: na vijānāmi te cittaṃ kuta etat pratiṣṭhitam /
analyzed: na vijānāmi te cittam kutas etat pratiṣṭhitam
translated: I do not know your mind, from where does this come?

original: ātmarūpaguṇopetāṃ na kāmayasi mohitām // / //
analyzed: ātma rūpa guṇa upetām na kāmayasi mohitām
translated: You are endowed with beauty and good qualities, yet you do not desire me, being deluded.

original: lateva pādape lagnā kāmaṃ tvaccharaṇaṃ gatā /
analyzed: latā iva pādape lagnā kāmam tvad śaraṇam gatā
translated: Like a creeper clinging to a tree, I have come to you for protection.

original: bāhubhyāṃ saṃpariṣvajya nivasāmi śucismitā // / //
analyzed: bāhubhyām saṃpariṣvajya nivasāmi śuci smitā
translated: Embracing you with my arms, I will stay, O you of pure smiles.

original: yama uvāca /
analyzed: yamaḥ uvāca
translated: Yama said:

original: anyaṃ śrayasva suśroṇi devaṃ devy asitekṣaṇe /
analyzed: anyam śrayasva su śroṇi devam devi asita īkṣaṇe
translated: O lady of beautiful hips, O goddess of dark eyes, seek refuge in another god.

original: yas tu te kāmamohena cetasā vibhramaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu te kāma mohena cetasā vibhramam gataḥ
translated: He in whose mind you have become confused due to the delusion of desire,

original: tasya devasya devī tvaṃ bhavethā varavarṇini // / //
analyzed: tasya devasya devī tvam bhavethāḥ varavarṇini
translated: O goddess, you should become the wife of that god, O you of excellent complexion.

original: īpsitāṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ varyāṃ śaṃsanti mānavāḥ /
analyzed: īpsitām sarva bhūtānām varyām śaṃsanti mānavāḥ
translated: Men praise the desirable and excellent one among all beings.

original: subhadrāṃ cārusarvāṅgīṃ saṃskṛtāṃ paricakṣate // / //
analyzed: su bhadrām cāru sarva aṅgīm saṃskṛtām paricakṣate
translated: They call the well-formed and beautiful one in all limbs Subhadra (auspicious).

original: tatkṛte 'pi suvidvāṃso na kariṣyanti dūṣaṇam /
analyzed: tad kṛte pi su vidvāṃsaḥ na kariṣyanti dūṣaṇam
translated: Even for his sake, the well-learned ones will not commit a fault.

original: paritāpaṃ mahāprājñe na kariṣye dṛḍhavrataḥ // / //
analyzed: paritāpam mahā prājñe na kariṣye dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: O greatly wise one, I will not cause you grief, being firm in my vows.

original: cittaṃ me nirmalaṃ bhadre viṣṇau rudre ca saṃsthitam /
analyzed: cittam me nirmalam bhadre viṣṇau rudre ca saṃsthitam
translated: O good lady, my mind is pure, established in Vishnu and Rudra.

original: ataḥ pāpaṃ nu necchāmi dharmacitto dṛḍhavrataḥ // / //
analyzed: atas pāpam nu na icchāmi dharma cittaḥ dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: Therefore, I do not desire sin, being of a virtuous mind and firm in my vows.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: asakṛt procyamāno 'pi tayā caivaṃ dṛḍhavrataḥ /
analyzed: asakṛt tayā ca evam dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: Though repeatedly told thus, Yama, being firm in his vows,

original: kṛtavān na yamaḥ kāryaṃ tena devatvam āptavān // / //
analyzed: kṛtavān na yamaḥ kāryam tena deva tvam āptavān
translated: did not do what she said, and therefore attained godhood.

original: narāṇāṃ dṛḍhacittānām evaṃ pāpam akurvatām /
analyzed: narāṇām dṛḍha cittānām evam pāpam a kurvatām
translated: For men who are firm in their resolve and do not commit such sins,

original: anantaṃ phalam ity āhus teṣāṃ svargaphalaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: anantam phalam iti āhuḥ teṣām svarga phalam bhavet
translated: they say the fruit is endless, and they will attain heaven.

original: etat tu yamyupākhyānaṃ pūrvavṛttaṃ sanātanam /
analyzed: etat tu yamī upākhyānam pūrva vṛttam sanātanam
translated: This is the ancient story of Yama's past,

original: sarvapāpaharaṃ puṇyaṃ śrotavyam anasūyayā // / //
analyzed: sarva pāpa haram puṇyam śrotavyam anasūyayā
translated: And should be listened to without malice.

original: yaś caitat paṭhate nityaṃ havyakavyeṣu brāhmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca etat paṭhate nityam havya kavyeṣu brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: The Brahmin who recites this daily at oblations to gods and ancestors,

original: saṃtṛptāḥ pitaras tasya na viśanti yamālayam // / //🔽yaś caitat paṭhate nityaṃ pitṝṇām anṛṇo bhavet /
analyzed: saṃtṛptāḥ pitaraḥ tasya na viśanti yama ālayam  yaḥ ca etat paṭhate nityam pitṝṇām anṛṇaḥ bhavet
translated: His ancestors are satisfied and do not enter Yama's abode.🔽And he who recites this will be free from debt to his ancestors,

original: vaivasvatībhyas tīvrābhyo yātanābhyaḥ pramucyate // / //
analyzed: vaivasvatībhyaḥ tīvrābhyaḥ yātanābhyaḥ pramucyate
translated: And will be freed from the severe torments of Yama.

original: putraitad ākhyānam anuttamaṃ mayā tavoditaṃ vedapadārthaniścitam /
analyzed: putra etat ākhyānam anuttamam mayā tava uditam veda padārtha niścitam
translated: O son, this excellent story has been narrated to you by me, ascertained by the words of the Vedas,

original: purātanaṃ pāpaharaṃ sadā nṛṇāṃ kim anyad adyaiva vadāmi śaṃsa me // / //
analyzed: purātanam pāpa haram sadā nṛṇām kim anyat adyā eva vadāmi śaṃsa me
translated: Ancient, always removing the sins of men. What else shall I tell you now? Tell me.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe yamīyamasaṃvādo nāma dvādaśo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe yamīyamasaṃvādaḥ nāma dvādaśaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twelfth chapter in the Narasimha Purana, named the dialogue between Yama and Yamuna.

original: śrīśuka uvāca /
analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Shuka said:

original: vicitreyaṃ kathā tāta vaidikī me tvayeritā /
analyzed: vicitrā iyam kathā tāta vaidikī me tvayā īritā
translated: O father, this wonderful Vedic story has been told to me by you.

original: anyāḥ puṇyāś ca me brūhi kathāḥ pāpapraṇāśinīḥ // / //
analyzed: anyāḥ puṇyāḥ ca me brūhi kathāḥ pāpa praṇāśinīḥ
translated: Tell me other holy stories that destroy sins.

original: ahaṃ te kathayiṣyāmi purāvṛttam anuttamam /
analyzed: aham te kathayiṣyāmi purāvṛttam anuttamam
translated: I shall tell you the excellent ancient story,

original: pativratāyāḥ saṃvādaṃ kasyacid brahmacāriṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: pativratāyāḥ saṃvādam kasyacid brahmacāriṇaḥ
translated: The dialogue between a chaste woman and a certain celibate.

original: kaśyapo nītimān nāma brāhmaṇo vedapāragaḥ /
analyzed: kaśyapaḥ nītimān nāma brāhmaṇaḥ vedapāragaḥ
translated: There was a wise Brāhmaṇa named Kaśyapa, a master of the Vedas,

original: sarvaśāstrārthatattvajño vyākhyāne pariniṣṭhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva śāstra artha tattva jñaḥ vyākhyāne pariniṣṭhitaḥ
translated: knower of the truth of all scriptures, perfected in exposition,

original: svadharmakāryanirataḥ paradharmaparāṅmukhaḥ /
analyzed: svadharma kārya nirataḥ para dharma parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: devoted to his own duties, averse to the duties of others,

original: ṛtukālābhigāmī ca agnihotraparāyaṇaḥ // / //🔽sāyaṃprātar mahābhāga hutvāgniṃ tarpayan dvijān /
analyzed: ṛtu kāla abhigāmī ca agnihotra parāyaṇaḥ  sāyaṃprātar mahābhāga hutvā agnim tarpayan dvijān
translated: approaching his wife during her season, devoted to the Agnihotra,🔽O illustrious one, offering oblations to the fire in the evening and morning, satisfying the Brāhmaṇas,

original: atithīn āgatān gehaṃ narasiṃhaṃ ca pujayat // / //
analyzed: atithīn āgatān geham narasiṃham ca pujayat
translated: honoring guests who come to his house and the Lord Nṛsiṃha,

original: tasya patnī mahābhāgā sāvitrī nāma nāmataḥ /
analyzed: tasya patnī mahābhāgā sāvitrī nāma nāmataḥ
translated: his greatly fortunate wife was named Sāvitrī,

original: pativratā mahābhāgā patyuḥ priyahite ratā // / //
analyzed: pativratā mahābhāgā patyuḥ priya hite ratā
translated: a chaste woman of great fortune, devoted to the welfare of her husband,

original: bhartuḥ śuśrūṣaṇenaiva dīrghakālam aninditā /
analyzed: bhartuḥ śuśrūṣaṇena eva dīrgha kālam aninditā
translated: for a long time, she was faultless, solely engaged in serving her husband,

original: parokṣajñānam āpannā kalyāṇī guṇasaṃmatā // / //
analyzed: parokṣa jñānam āpannā kalyāṇī guṇa saṃmatā
translated: she attained esoteric knowledge, the virtuous one was esteemed for her virtues,

original: tayā saha sa dharmātmā madhyadeśe mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: tayā saha sa dharma ātmā madhyadeśe mahāmatiḥ
translated: together with her, that righteous one of great intellect,

original: nandigrāme vasan dhīmān svānuṣṭhānaparāyaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: nandigrāme vasan dhīmān sva anuṣṭhāna parāyaṇaḥ
translated: dwelling in Nandigrāma in Madhyadeśa, the wise one, devoted to his own practices,

original: atha kauśaliko vipro yajñaśarmā mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: atha kauśalikaḥ vipraḥ yajñaśarmā mahāmatiḥ
translated: then the great sage Yajñaśarman, a Brāhmaṇa from Kauśala,

original: tasya bhāryābhavat sādhvī rohiṇī nāma nāmataḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya bhāryā bhavat sādhvī rohiṇī nāma nāmataḥ
translated: his wife was the virtuous Rohiṇī by name,

original: sarvalakṣaṇasaṃpannā patiśuśrūṣaṇe ratā /
analyzed: sarva lakṣaṇa saṃpannā pati śuśrūṣaṇe ratā
translated: endowed with all good qualities, devoted to serving her husband,

original: sā prasūtā sutaṃ tv ekaṃ tasmād bhartur aninditā // / //
analyzed: sā prasūtā sutam tu ekam tasmāt bhartuḥ aninditā
translated: She gave birth to a son from her husband, who was irreproachable.

original: sa yāyāvaravṛttis tu putre jāte vicakṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: sa yāyāvara vṛttiḥ tu putre jāte vicakṣaṇaḥ
translated: That wise one, following the conduct of the Yāyāvaras, after the son was born,

original: jātakarma tadā cakre snātvā putrasya mantrataḥ // / //
analyzed: jātakarma tadā cakre snātvā putrasya mantrataḥ
translated: performed the birth rites for the son, having bathed and recited the mantras.

original: dvādaśe 'hani tasyaiva devaśarmeti buddhimān /
analyzed: dvādaśe hani tasya eva devaśarmā iti buddhimān
translated: On the twelfth day itself, the wise Devasharman,

original: puṇyāhaṃ vācayitvā tu nāma cakre yathāvidhi // / //
analyzed: puṇyāham vācayitvā tu nāma cakre yathāvidhi
translated: having recited the auspicious verses, gave the name according to the prescribed rites.

original: upaniṣkramaṇaṃ caiva caturthe māsi yatnataḥ /
analyzed: upaniṣkramaṇam ca eva caturthe māsi yatnataḥ
translated: And the ceremony of taking the child out of the lying-in room was performed in the fourth month with care,

original: tathānnaprāśanaṃ ṣaṣṭhe māsi cakre yathāvidhi // / //
analyzed: tathā annaprāśanam ṣaṣṭhe māsi cakre yathāvidhi
translated: and the rice-feeding ceremony was performed in the sixth month according to the prescribed rites.

original: saṃvatsare tataḥ pūrṇe cūḍākarma ca dharmavit /
analyzed: saṃvatsare tatas pūrṇe cūḍākarma ca dharma vid
translated: Then, in the completed first year, the knower of dharma performed the tonsure ceremony,

original: kṛtvā garbhāṣṭame varṣe vratabandhaṃ cakāra saḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛtvā garbha aṣṭame varṣe vrata bandham cakāra saḥ
translated: and in the eighth year from conception, he performed the thread ceremony for him.

original: sopanīto yathānyāyaṃ pitrā vedam adhītavān /
analyzed: sa upanītaḥ yathānyāyam pitrā vedam adhītavān
translated: Having been initiated in the proper way, he studied the Veda from his father.

original: svīkṛte tv ekavede tu pitā svarlokam āsthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: svīkṛte tu eka vede tu pitā svar lokam āsthitaḥ
translated: When one Veda was mastered, the father went to the heavenly world.

original: mātrā sahāsa duḥkhī sa pitary uparate sutaḥ /
analyzed: mātrā saha āsa duḥkhī sa pitari uparate sutaḥ
translated: The son, grieving with his mother after the father's demise,

original: dhairyam āsthāya medhāvī sādhubhiḥ preritaḥ punaḥ // / //
analyzed: dhairyam āsthāya medhāvī sādhubhiḥ preritaḥ punar
translated: regaining courage, urged on by the virtuous,

original: pretakāryāṇi kṛtvā tu devaśarmā gataḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: pretakāryāṇi kṛtvā tu devaśarmā gataḥ sutaḥ
translated: performed the funeral rites and went to his son Devasharman.

original: gaṅgādiṣu sutīrtheṣu snānaṃ kṛtvā yathāvidhi // / //
analyzed: gaṅgā ādiṣu su tīrtheṣu snānam kṛtvā yathāvidhi
translated: Having bathed in the excellent holy places like Ganga, according to the prescribed rites,

original: tam eva prāptavān grāmaṃ yatrāste sā pativratā /🔽saṃprāpya viśrutaḥ so 'tha brahmacārī mahāmate // / //
analyzed: tam eva prāptavān grāmam yatra āste sā pativratā  saṃprāpya viśrutaḥ saḥ tha brahmacārī mahāmate
translated: he reached that very village where the chaste woman was staying.🔽Having reached, he became famous as a celibate, of great intellect,

original: bhikṣāṭanaṃ tu kṛtvāsau japan vedam atandritaḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣāṭanam tu kṛtvā asau japan vedam atandritaḥ
translated: wandering for alms, he was reciting the Veda without laziness.

original: kurvann evāgnikāryaṃ tu nandigrāme ca tasthivān // / //
analyzed: kurvan evā agni kāryam tu nandigrāme ca tasthivān
translated: Performing the fire ritual, he stayed in Nandigrama.

original: mṛte bhartari tanmātā putre pravrajite tu sā /
analyzed: mṛte bhartari tad mātā putre pravrajite tu sā
translated: When her husband died and her son left home,

original: duḥkhād duḥkham anuprāptā niyataṃ rakṣakaṃ vinā // / //
analyzed: duḥkhāt duḥkham anuprāptāḥ niyatam rakṣakam vinā
translated: she went from sorrow to sorrow, certainly without a protector.

original: atha snātvā tu nadyāṃ vai brahmacārī svakarpaṭam /
analyzed: atha snātvā tu nadyām vai brahmacārī sva karpaṭam
translated: Then, having bathed in the river, the celibate,

original: kṣitau prasārya śoṣārthaṃ japann āsīta vāgyataḥ // / //
analyzed: kṣitau prasārya śoṣa artham japan āsīta vāgyataḥ
translated: spreading out his own garment on the ground to dry, sat reciting, restrained in speech.

original: kāko balākā tad vastraṃ parigṛhyāśu jagmatuḥ /
analyzed: kākaḥ balākā tat vastram parigṛhya āśu jagmatuḥ
translated: A crow and a crane quickly took hold of that garment and left.

original: tau dṛṣṭvā devaśarmā tato dvijaḥ // / //🔽viṣṭhām utsṛjya vastre tu jagmatus tasya bhartsanāt /🔽roṣeṇa khe yāntau pakṣiṇau tu saḥ // / //
analyzed: tau dṛṣṭvā bhartsayāmasa devaśarmā tatas dvijaḥ  viṣṭhām utsṛjya vastre tu jagmatuḥ tasya bhartsanāt  roṣeṇa vīkṣayāmasa khe yāntau pakṣiṇau tu saḥ
translated: Seeing them, the brahmin Devasharman,🔽having released feces on the garment, went away out of contempt for them.🔽The angry birds flying in the sky, he

original: tadroṣavahninā dagdhau bhūmyāṃ nipatitau khagau /
analyzed: tad roṣa vahninā dagdhau bhūmyām nipatitau khagau
translated: was burned by the fire of their anger and the birds fell to the ground.

original: sa dṛṣṭvā tau kṣitiṃ yātau pakṣiṇau vismayaṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: sa dṛṣṭvā tau kṣitim yātau pakṣiṇau vismayam gataḥ
translated: Seeing those two birds fallen on the ground, he was amazed.

original: tapasā na mayā kaścit sadṛśo 'sti mahītale /
analyzed: tapasā na mayā kaścid sadṛśaḥ sti mahī tale
translated: Thinking, By my austerities, there is no one equal to me on the earth,

original: iti matvā gato bhikṣām aṭituṃ grāmam añjasā // / //
analyzed: iti matvā gataḥ bhikṣām aṭitum grāmam añjasā
translated: he went straight to the village to beg for alms.

original: aṭan brāhmaṇageheṣu brahmacārī tapaḥsmayī /
analyzed: aṭan brāhmaṇa geheṣu brahmacārī tapaḥsmayī
translated: Wandering in the houses of Brahmins, that celibate, remembering austerities,

original: praviṣṭas tad gṛhaṃ vatsa gṛhe yatra pativratā // / //
analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ tat gṛham vatsa gṛhe yatra pativratā
translated: O child, entered that house where the chaste wife was, in the house.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā yācyamānāpi tena bhikṣāṃ pativratā /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā yācyamānā api tena bhikṣām pativratā
translated: Seeing him begging for alms, even though begged by him, the chaste wife,

original: vāgyatā pūrvaṃ vijñāya bhartuḥ kṛtvānuśāsanam // / //🔽tatpādau bhūya uṣṇena vārinā /
analyzed: vāgyatā pūrvam vijñāya bhartuḥ kṛtvā anuśāsanam  kṣālayāmasa tad pādau bhūyas uṣṇena vārinā
translated: having first understood the command of her husband, remained silent.

original: āśvāsya svapatiṃ sā tu bhikṣāṃ dātuṃ pracakrame // / //
analyzed: āśvāsya sva patim sā tu bhikṣām dātum pracakrame
translated: Having again comforted her husband with hot water, she began to give alms.

original: tataḥ krodhena raktākṣo brahmacārī pativratām /🔽dagdhukāmas tapovīryāt punaḥ punar udaikṣata /
analyzed: tatas krodhena rakta akṣaḥ brahmacārī pativratām  dagdhu kāmaḥ tapaḥ vīryāt punar punar udaikṣata
translated: Then the celibate, with eyes red with anger,🔽desiring to burn the chaste wife by the power of his austerities, looked at her again and again.

original: sāvitrī tu nirīkṣyaivaṃ hasantī sā tam abravīt // / //
analyzed: sāvitrī tu nirīkṣya evam hasantī sā tam abravīt
translated: But Savitri, seeing him like this, laughed and said to him:

original: na kāko na balākāhaṃ tvatkrodhena tu yau mṛtau /
analyzed: na kākaḥ na balākā aham tvad krodhena tu yau mṛtau
translated: I am neither a crow nor a crane who died by your anger.

original: nadītīre 'dya kopātman bhikṣāṃ matto yadīcchasi // / //
analyzed: nadī tīre dya kopa ātman bhikṣām mattaḥ yadi icchasi
translated: If you desire alms from me, O angry one, on the bank of the river today.

original: tayaivam uktaḥ sāvitryā bhikṣām ādāya so 'grataḥ /
analyzed: tayā evam uktaḥ sāvitryā bhikṣām ādāya saḥ gratas
translated: Thus addressed by Savitri, he took the alms and went ahead,

original: cintayan manasā tasyāḥ śaktiṃ dūrārthavedinīm // / //🔽etyāśrame maṭhe sthāpya bhikṣāpātraṃ prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: cintayan manasā tasyāḥ śaktim dūra artha vedinīm  eti āśrame maṭhe sthāpya bhikṣā pātram prayatnataḥ
translated: thinking in his mind about her power to know distant things.🔽Having come to the hermitage, he carefully placed the alms bowl in the hut,

original: pativratāyāṃ bhuktāyāṃ gṛhasthe nirgate patau // / //
analyzed: pativratāyām bhuktāyām gṛhasthe nirgate patau
translated: and after the chaste wife had eaten, when the householder had gone out,

original: punar āgamya tadgehaṃ tām uvāca pativratām // / //
analyzed: punar āgamya tad geham tām uvāca pativratām
translated: he returned to the house and spoke to that chaste wife.

original: brahmacāry uvāca /
analyzed: brahmacārī uvāca
translated: The celibate said:

original: prabrūhy etan mahābhāge pṛcchato me yathārthataḥ // / //
analyzed: prabrūhi etat mahābhāge pṛcchataḥ me yathārthataḥ
translated: Tell me this, O blessed one, as I ask you truthfully.

original: viprakṛṣṭārthavijñānaṃ katham āśu tavābhavat /🔽ityuktā tena sā sādhvī sāvitrī tu pativratā // / //
analyzed: viprakṛṣṭa artha vijñānam katham āśu tava abhavat  iti uktā tena sā sādhvī sāvitrī tu pativratā
translated: How did you come to know of a matter so far removed?🔽Thus addressed by him, that virtuous and chaste Savitri,

original: taṃ brahmacāriṇaṃ prāha pṛcchantaṃ gṛham etya vai /
analyzed: tam brahmacāriṇam prāha pṛcchantam gṛham etya vai
translated: spoke to that celibate who had come to the house and asked her,

original: śṛṇuṣvāvahito brahman yan māṃ tvaṃ paripṛcchasi // / //
analyzed: śṛṇuṣva avahitaḥ brahman yat mām tvam paripṛcchasi
translated: Listen attentively, O Brahmin, to what you ask me.

original: tat te 'haṃ saṃpravakṣyāmi svadharmaparibṛṃhitam /
analyzed: tat te ham saṃpravakṣyāmi svadharma paribṛṃhitam
translated: I will tell you that, which is supported by our own dharma.

original: strīṇāṃ tu patiśuśrūṣā dharma eṣa paristhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: strīṇām tu pati śuśrūṣā dharmaḥ eṣa paristhitaḥ
translated: For women, service to their husband is the established dharma.

original: tam evāhaṃ sadā kuryāṃ nānyam asmi mahāmate /
analyzed: tam eva aham sadā kuryām na anyam asmi mahāmate
translated: I should always do that, and nothing else, O greatly wise one.

original: divārātram asaṃdigdhaṃ śraddhayā paritoṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: divārātram asaṃdigdham śraddhayā paritoṣaṇam
translated: Day and night, without doubt, I have faithfully satisfied him.

original: kurvantyā mama saṃbhūtaṃ viprakṛṣṭārthadarśanam /
analyzed: kurvantyāḥ mama saṃbhūtam viprakṛṣṭa artha darśanam
translated: By doing so, I have attained the ability to see distant things.

original: anyac ca te pravakṣyāmi nibodha tvaṃ yadīcchasi // / //
analyzed: anyat ca te pravakṣyāmi nibodha tvam yadi icchasi
translated: And I will tell you something else, understand if you wish.

original: pitā yāyāvaraḥ śuddhas tasmād vedam adhītya vai /
analyzed: pitā yāyāvaraḥ śuddhaḥ tasmāt vedam adhītya vai
translated: My father was a pure Yāyāvara. Having studied the Vedas from him,

original: mṛte pitari kṛtvā tu pretakāryam ihāgataḥ // / //
analyzed: mṛte pitari kṛtvā tu pretakāryam iha āgataḥ
translated: after my father's death, I performed the funeral rites and came here.

original: utsṛjya mātaraṃ draṣṭuṃ vṛddhāṃ dīnāṃ tapasvinīm /
analyzed: utsṛjya mātaram draṣṭum vṛddhām dīnām tapasvinīm
translated: Abandoning my aged, helpless, and miserable mother,

original: anāthāṃ vidhavām atra nityaṃ svodaraposakaḥ // / //
analyzed: anāthām vidhavām atra nityam sva udara posakaḥ
translated: who is a widow without a protector here, always nourishing her own belly.
