original: yayā garbhe dhṛtaḥ pūrvaṃ pālito lālitas tathā /
analyzed: yayā garbhe dhṛtaḥ pūrvam pālitaḥ lālitaḥ tathā
translated: By whom you were first held in the womb and nurtured and fondled,

original: tāṃ tyaktvā vipine dharmaṃ caran vipra na lajjase // / //
analyzed: tām tyaktvā vipine dharmam caran vipra na lajjase
translated: abandoning her in the forest, O Brahmin, you are not ashamed to practice dharma.

original: yayā tava kṛtaṃ brahman bālye malanikṛntanam /
analyzed: yayā tava kṛtam brahman bālye mala nikṛntanam
translated: By whom, O Brahmin, the removal of impurities was done in your childhood,

original: duḥkhitāṃ tāṃ gṛhe tyaktvā kiṃ bhaved vipine 'ṭataḥ // / //🔽mātṛduḥkhena te vaktraṃ pūtigandham idaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: duḥkhitām tām gṛhe tyaktvā kim bhavet vipine  mātṛ duḥkhena te vaktram pūti gandham idam bhavet
translated: what would happen by abandoning that suffering one in the house and wandering in the forest?🔽Your face would become foul-smelling due to the suffering of your mother.

original: pitraiva saṃskṛto yasmāt tasmāc chaktir abhūd iyam // / //
analyzed: pitrā eva saṃskṛtaḥ yasmāt tasmāt śaktiḥ abhūt iyam
translated: Since you were consecrated by your father alone, this power has arisen.

original: pakṣī dagdhaḥ sudurbuddhe pāpātman sāṃprataṃ vṛthā /
analyzed: pakṣī dagdhaḥ su durbuddhe pāpa ātman sāṃpratam vṛthā
translated: O foolish one, the bird has been burnt. O sinful one, now it is in vain.

original: vṛthā snānaṃ vṛthā tīrthaṃ vṛthā japtaṃ vṛthā hutam // / //
analyzed: vṛthā snānam vṛthā tīrtham vṛthā japtam vṛthā hutam
translated: The bath is in vain, the pilgrimage is in vain, the japa is in vain, the oblation is in vain...

original: sa jīvati vṛthā brahman yasya mātā suduḥkhitā /
analyzed: sa jīvati vṛthā brahman yasya mātā su duḥkhitā
translated: O Brahmin, he lives in vain whose mother is greatly afflicted.

original: yo rakṣet satataṃ bhaktyā mātaraṃ mātṛvatsalaḥ // / //
analyzed: yaḥ rakṣet satatam bhaktyā mātaram mātṛ vatsalaḥ
translated: He who always protects his mother with devotion, like a mother's darling...

original: tasyehānuṣṭhitaṃ sarvaṃ phalaṃ cāmutra ceha hi /
analyzed: tasya iha anuṣṭhitam sarvam phalam ca amutra ca iha hi
translated: For him, all that is performed here bears fruit both in this world and the next.

original: mātuś ca vacanaṃ brahman pālitaṃ yair narottamaiḥ // / //
analyzed: mātuḥ ca vacanam brahman pālitam yaiḥ nara uttamaiḥ
translated: O Brahmin, those best of men who have upheld the words of their mother...

original: te mānyās te namaskāryā iha loke paratra ca /
analyzed: te mānyāḥ te namaskāryāḥ iha loke paratra ca
translated: They are to be honored, they are to be bowed to in this world and the next.

original: atas tvaṃ tatra gatvādya yatra mātā vyavasthitā // / //
analyzed: atas tvam tatra gatvā adya yatra mātā vyavasthitā
translated: Therefore, you go there today, where your mother is situated...

original: tāṃ tvaṃ rakṣaya jīvantīṃ tadrakṣā te paraṃ tapaḥ /
analyzed: tām tvam rakṣaya jīvantīm tat rakṣā te param tapaḥ
translated: You protect her while she is alive, that protection is your supreme austerity.

original: krodhaṃ parityajainaṃ tvaṃ dṛṣṭādṛṣṭavighātakam // / //
analyzed: krodham parityaja enam tvam dṛṣṭa adṛṣṭa vighātakam
translated: Abandon this anger, which is an obstacle to what is seen and unseen...

original: tayoḥ kuru vadhe śuddhiṃ pakṣiṇor ātmaśuddhaye /
analyzed: tayoḥ kuru vadhe śuddhim pakṣiṇoḥ ātma śuddhaye
translated: For the sake of your own purification, bring about the purification of the two birds in the killing.

original: yāthātathyena kathitam etat sarvaṃ mayā tava // / //
analyzed: yāthātathyena kathitam etat sarvam mayā tava
translated: All this has been told to you exactly as it is...

original: brahmacārin kuruṣva tvaṃ yadīcchasi satāṃ gatim /
analyzed: brahmacārin kuruṣva tvam yadi icchasi satām gatim
translated: O celibate, do what you wish for, if you desire the state of the virtuous.

original: ity uktvā virarāmātha dvijaputraṃ pativratā // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā virarāma atha dvija putram pativratā
translated: Having said this, the faithful wife stopped, addressing the son of the twice-born.

original: so 'pi tām āha bhūyo 'pi sāvitrīṃ tu kṣamāpayan /
analyzed: saḥ pi tām āha bhūyas pi sāvitrīm tu kṣamāpayan
translated: He too, again and again, asked Savitri for forgiveness,

original: ajñānāt kṛtapāpasya kṣamasva varavarṇini // / //
analyzed: ajñānāt kṛta pāpasya kṣamasva varavarṇini
translated: saying, O you of the best complexion, forgive me for the sin I have committed out of ignorance.

original: mayā tavāhitaṃ yac ca kṛtaṃ krodhanirīkṣaṇam /
analyzed: mayā tava ahitam yat ca kṛtam krodha nirīkṣaṇam
translated: Whatever harm I have done to you out of anger and harsh looks,

original: tat kṣamasva mahābhāge hitam uktaṃ pativrate // / //🔽tatra gatvā mayā yāni karmāṇi tu śubhavrate /
analyzed: tat kṣamasva mahābhāge hitam uktam pativrate  tatra gatvā mayā yāni karmāṇi tu śubha vrate
translated: forgive that, O greatly fortunate one, O faithful wife, who have spoken for my benefit.

original: kāryāṇi tāni me brūhi yathā me sugatir bhavet // / //
analyzed: kāryāṇi tāni me brūhi yathā me su gatiḥ bhavet
translated: Having gone there, O you of good vows, tell me the rites that should be performed by me, so that I may attain a good state.

original: tenaivaṃ uktā sāpy āha taṃ pṛcchantaṃ pativratā /
analyzed: tena evam uktā sā api āha tam pṛcchantam pativratā
translated: Thus addressed by him, the faithful wife, asked by him, said to him,

original: yāni kāryāṇi vakṣyāmi tvayā karmāṇi me śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: yāni kāryāṇi vakṣyāmi tvayā karmāṇi me śṛṇu
translated: Listen to the rites that should be performed by you, which I will tell you.

original: poṣyā mātā tvayā tatra niścayaṃ bhaikṣavṛttinā /
analyzed: poṣyā mātā tvayā tatra niścayam bhaikṣa vṛttinā
translated: There, by you, who will live on alms, your mother should be supported.

original: atra vā tatra vā brahman prāyaścittaṃ ca pakṣiṇoḥ // / //
analyzed: atra vā tatra vā brahman prāyaścittam ca pakṣiṇoḥ
translated: Here or there, O Brahmana, the expiation for the two birds should be performed.

original: yajñaśarmasutā kanyā bhāryā tava bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yajñaśarma sutā kanyā bhāryā tava bhaviṣyati
translated: The daughter of Yajnashatra will be your wife.

original: tāṃ gṛhṇīṣva ca dharmeṇa gate tvayi sa dāsyati // / //
analyzed: tām gṛhṇīṣva ca dharmeṇa gate tvayi sa dāsyati
translated: Take her in accordance with the law. When you have gone, he will give her to you.

original: putras te bhavitā tasyām ekaḥ saṃtativardhanaḥ /
analyzed: putraḥ te bhavitā tasyām ekaḥ saṃtati vardhanaḥ
translated: On her, you will have one son, who will increase the line.

original: yāyāvaradhanād vṛttiḥ pitṛvat te bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: yāyāvara dhanāt vṛttiḥ pitṛ vat te bhaviṣyati
translated: Your livelihood will be like that of your father, from the wealth of the Yāyāvaras.

original: punar mṛtāyāṃ bhāryāyāṃ bhavitā tvaṃ tridaṇḍakaḥ /
analyzed: punar mṛtāyām bhāryāyām bhavitā tvam tridaṇḍakaḥ
translated: And when your wife dies again, you will become a Tridaṇḍaka.

original: sa yatyāśramadharmeṇa yathoktyānuṣṭhitena ca /
analyzed: sa yati āśrama dharmeṇa yathā uktyā anuṣṭhitena ca
translated: By practicing the duties of a hermit's stage of life as prescribed,

original: narasiṃhaprasādena vaiṣṇavaṃ padam āpsyasi // / //
analyzed: narasiṃha prasādena vaiṣṇavam padam āpsyasi
translated: and by the grace of Narasiṃha, you will attain the position of Viṣṇu.

original: bhāvyam etat tu kathitaṃ mayā tava hi pṛcchataḥ /
analyzed: bhāvyam etat tu kathitam mayā tava hi pṛcchataḥ
translated: This is what I have told you, which is to be done, as you asked.

original: manyase nānṛtaṃ tv etat kuru sarvaṃ hi me vacaḥ // / //
analyzed: manyase na anṛtam tu etat kuru sarvam hi me vacaḥ
translated: You should not consider this false. Do everything according to my words.

original: brāhmaṇa uvāca /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ uvāca
translated: The Brāhmaṇa said:

original: gacchāmi mātṛrakṣārtham adyaivāhaṃ pativrate /
analyzed: gacchāmi mātṛ rakṣā artham adya eva aham pativrate
translated: O chaste lady, I am going today itself to protect my mother.

original: kariṣye tvadvacaḥ sarvaṃ tatra gatvā śubhekṣaṇe // / //
analyzed: kariṣye tvad vacaḥ sarvam tatra gatvā śubha īkṣaṇe
translated: Having gone there, O auspicious-eyed one, I will do everything according to your words.

original: ity uktvā gatavān brahman devaśarmā tatas tvaran /
analyzed: iti uktvā gatavān brahman devaśarmā tatas tvaran
translated: Having said this, O Brāhmaṇa, Devasharman then quickly left,

original: saṃrakṣya mātaraṃ yatnāt krodhamohavivarjitaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃrakṣya mātaram yatnāt krodha moha vivarjitaḥ
translated: carefully protecting his mother, free from anger and delusion.

original: kṛtvā vivāham utpādya putraṃ vaṃśakaraṃ śubham /
analyzed: kṛtvā vivāham utpādya putram vaṃśa karam śubham
translated: Having performed the marriage and begetting a son who would carry on the lineage,

original: mṛtabhāryaś ca saṃnyasya samaloṣṭāśmakāñcanaḥ /
analyzed: mṛta bhāryaḥ ca saṃnyasya sama loṣṭa aśma kāñcanaḥ
translated: and his wife having died, he renounced, regarding a clod, a stone, and gold as the same,

original: narasiṃhaprasādena parāṃ siddhim avāptavān // / //
analyzed: narasiṃha prasādena parām siddhim avāptavān
translated: and by the grace of Narasiṃha, attained the highest perfection.

original: pativratāśaktir iyaṃ taveritā dharmaś ca mātuḥ parirakṣaṇaṃ param /
analyzed: pativratā śaktiḥ iyam tava īritā dharmaḥ ca mātuḥ parirakṣaṇam param
translated: This is the power of a devoted wife, which you have invoked. And the highest duty is the protection of the mother.

original: saṃsāravṛkṣaṃ ca nihatya bandhanaṃ chitvā ca viṣṇoḥ padam eti mānavaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra vṛkṣam ca nihatya bandhanam chitvā ca viṣṇoḥ padam eti mānavaḥ
translated: And having cut down the tree of worldly existence and severed the bonds, a man goes to the abode of Vishnu.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe brahmacārisaṃvādo nāma trayodaśo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe brahmacārisaṃvādaḥ nāma trayodaśaḥ dhyāya
translated: Thus ends the thirteenth chapter in the Narasimha Purana, named the Dialogue between the Brahmacharin and the Guru.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: śṛṇu vatsa mahābuddhe śiṣyāś caitāṃ parāṃ kathām /
analyzed: śṛṇu vatsa mahābuddhe śiṣyāḥ ca etām parām kathām
translated: Listen, dear one of great intellect, and let these disciples listen to this supreme story,

original: mayocyamānāṃ śṛṇvantu sarvapāpapraṇāśinīm // / //
analyzed: mayā ucyamānām śṛṇvantu sarva pāpa praṇāśinīm
translated: which I am telling, which destroys all sins.

original: purā dvijavaraḥ kaścid vedaśāstraviśāradaḥ /
analyzed: purā dvijavaraḥ kaścid veda śāstra viśāradaḥ
translated: In ancient times, a certain excellent brahmin, skilled in the Vedas and scriptures,

original: mṛtabhāryo gatas tīrthaṃ cakre snānaṃ yathāvidhi // / //
analyzed: mṛta bhāryaḥ gataḥ tīrtham cakre snānam yathāvidhi
translated: whose wife had died, went to a holy place and bathed according to the prescribed rites.

original: tapaḥ sutaptaṃ vijane niḥspṛho dārakarmaṇi /
analyzed: tapaḥ su taptam vijane niḥspṛhaḥ dārakarmaṇi
translated: Having performed severe austerities in a secluded place, free from desires for worldly affairs,

original: bhikṣāhāraḥ pravasito japasnānaparāyaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhikṣā āhāraḥ pravasitaḥ japa snāna parāyaṇaḥ
translated: subsisting on alms, wandering, devoted to japa and ablutions.

original: snātvā sa gaṅgāṃ yamunāṃ sarasvatīṃ puṇyāṃ vitastām atha gomatīṃ ca /
analyzed: snātvā sa gaṅgām yamunām sarasvatīm puṇyām vitastām atha gomatīm ca
translated: Having bathed in the Ganga, Yamuna, Sarasvati, the sacred Vitasta and Gomati,

original: gayāṃ samāsādya pitṛn pitāmahān saṃtarpayan san gatavān mahendram // / //
analyzed: gayām samāsādya pitṛn pitāmahān saṃtarpayan san gatavān mahendram
translated: and having reached Gaya and offered libations to the ancestors and grandfathers, he went to Mahendra.

original: tatrāpi kuṇḍeṣu girau mahāmatiḥ snātvā nu dṛṣṭvā bhṛgunandanottamam /
analyzed: tatra api kuṇḍeṣu girau mahāmatiḥ snātvā nu dṛṣṭvā bhṛgunandana uttamam
translated: There too, in the cauldrons on the mountain, the greatly wise one bathed and saw the best of the descendants of Bhrigu.

original: kṛtvā pitṛbhyas tu tathaiva tṛptiṃ vrajan vanaṃ pāpaharaṃ praviṣṭaḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛtvā pitṛbhyaḥ tu tathā eva tṛptim vrajan vanam pāpa haram praviṣṭaḥ
translated: Having thus offered satisfaction to the ancestors, he went to the forest that removes sins and entered it.

original: dhārāṃ patantīṃ mahatīṃ śiloccayāt saṃdhārya bhaktyā tv anu nārasiṃhe /
analyzed: dhārām patantīm mahatīm śiloccayāt saṃdhārya bhaktyā tu anu nārasiṃhe
translated: Holding the great stream falling from the mountain, he devoutly followed Narasimha.

original: śirasy aśeṣāghavināśinīṃ tadā viśuddhadehaḥ sa babhūva vipraḥ // / //
analyzed: śirasi aśeṣa agha vināśinīm tadā viśuddha dehaḥ sa babhūva vipraḥ
translated: Then the brahmin, with his body purified, held on his head the stream that destroys all sins.

original: vindhyācale saktam anantam acyutaṃ bhaktair munīndrair api pūjitaṃ sadā /
analyzed: vindhya acale saktam anantam acyutam bhaktaiḥ muni indraiḥ api pūjitam sadā
translated: On Vindhya mountain, the infinite and immutable one, always worshipped by the best of sages and devotees,

original: ārādhya puṣpair girisaṃbhavair śubhais tatraiva siddhiṃ tv abhikāṅkṣya saṃsthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: ārādhya puṣpaiḥ giri saṃbhavaiḥ śubhaiḥ tatra eva siddhim tu abhikāṅkṣya saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Having worshipped with beautiful flowers from the mountain, he remained there desiring to attain perfection.

original: sa nārasiṃho bahukālapūjayā tuṣṭaḥ sunidrāgatam āha bhaktam /
analyzed: sa nārasiṃhaḥ bahu kāla pūjayā tuṣṭaḥ sunidrā gatam āha bhaktam
translated: That Narasimha, being pleased by the worship for a long time, spoke to the devotee who had fallen asleep.

original: anāśramitvaṃ gṛhabhaṅgakāraṇaṃ hy ato gṛhāṇāśramam uttamaṃ dvija // / //
analyzed: anāśrami tvam gṛha bhaṅga kāraṇam hi atas gṛhāṇa āśramam uttamam dvija
translated: The state of being without an ashrama is the cause of the destruction of the household, therefore, O brahmin, accept the best ashrama.

original: anāśramīti dvija vedapāragān api tv ahaṃ nānugṛhṇāmi cātra /
analyzed: anāśramī iti dvija vedapāragān api tu aham na anugṛhṇāmi ca atra
translated: O brahmin, I do not favor even those who have mastered the Vedas if they are without an ashrama.

original: tathāpi niṣṭhāṃ tava vīkṣya sattama tvayi prasannena mayety udīritam // / //
analyzed: tathā api niṣṭhām tava vīkṣya sattama tvayi prasannena mayā iti udīritam
translated: Still, O best of men, seeing your steadfastness, I have spoken thus, being pleased with you.

original: tenaivam uktaḥ parameśvareṇa dvijo 'pi buddhyā pravicintya vākyam /
analyzed: tena evam uktaḥ parameśvareṇa dvijaḥ buddhyā pravicintya vākyam
translated: Thus addressed by the Supreme Lord, the brahmin also, having pondered the words with his intellect,

original: harer alaṅghyaṃ narasiṃhamūrter bhādhaṃ ca kṛtvā sa yatir babhūva // / //
analyzed: hareḥ a laṅghyam narasiṃha mūrteḥ bhādham ca kṛtvā sa yatiḥ babhūva
translated: and having considered the curse of Hari, the Narasimha form, that ascetic became...

original: tridaṇḍavṛkṣākṣapavitrapāṇir āplutya toye tv aghahāriṇi sthitaḥ /
analyzed: tridaṇḍa vṛkṣa akṣa pavitra pāṇiḥ āplutya toye tu agha hāriṇi sthitaḥ
translated: With a staff, a tree, and a sacred thread in his hand, having plunged into the water that removes sins, he stood there,

original: japan sadā mantram apāstadoṣaṃ sāvitryam īśaṃ hṛdaye smaran harim // / //
analyzed: japan sadā mantram apāsta doṣam sāvitryam īśam hṛdaye smaran harim
translated: Reciting the mantra that is always free from faults, remembering the lord Hari in his heart with the Savitri mantra.

original: yathākathaṃcit pratilabhya śākaṃ bhaikṣyābhituṣṭo vanavāsavāsī /
analyzed: yathā kathaṃcid pratilabhya śākam bhaikṣya abhituṣṭaḥ vana vāsa vāsī
translated: Somehow obtaining vegetables, content with alms, dwelling in the forest,

original: abhyarcya viṣṇuṃ narasiṃhamūrtiṃ dhyātvā ca nityaṃ hṛdi śuddham ādyam // / //
analyzed: abhyarcya viṣṇum narasiṃha mūrtim dhyātvā ca nityam hṛdi śuddham ādyam
translated: Having worshipped Vishnu in the form of Narasimha, always meditating on the pure, primordial one in the heart.

original: viviktadeśe vipule kuśāsane niveśya sarvaṃ hṛdaye 'sya sarvam /
analyzed: vivikta deśe vipule kuśa āsane niveśya sarvam hṛdaye sya sarvam
translated: In a secluded place, having seated himself on a large kusha seat, having placed everything in his heart,

original: bāhyaṃ samastaṃ guṇam indriyāṇāṃ vilīya bhedaṃ bhagavaty anante // / //
analyzed: bāhyam samastam guṇam indriyāṇām vilīya bhedam bhagavati anante
translated: The entire external collection of qualities of the senses, dissolving in the infinite Lord.

original: vijñeyam ānandam ajaṃ viśālaṃ satyātmakaṃ kṣemapadaṃ vareṇyam /
analyzed: vijñeyam ānandam ajam viśālam satya ātmakam kṣema padam vareṇyam
translated: The knowable, blissful, unborn, vast, of the nature of truth, the abode of peace, the most excellent,

original: saṃcintya tasmin pravihāya dehaṃ babhūva muktaḥ paramātmarūpī // / //
analyzed: saṃcintya tasmin pravihāya deham babhūva muktaḥ paramātma rūpī
translated: Having thought of this, he abandoned his body in that (fire) and became liberated, assuming the form of the Supreme Self.

original: imāṃ kathāṃ muktiparāṃ yathoktāṃ paṭhanti ye nārasiṃhaṃ smarantaḥ /
analyzed: imām kathām mukti parām yathā uktām paṭhanti ye nārasiṃham smarantaḥ
translated: Those who recite this story, which is about liberation, as told, remembering Narasimha,

original: prayāgatīrthaplavane tu yat phalaṃ tat prāpya te yānti hareḥ padaṃ mahat // / //
analyzed: prayāga tīrtha plavane tu yat phalam tat prāpya te yānti hareḥ padam mahat
translated: attain the same fruit as from bathing at the holy place of Prayaga, and go to the great abode of Hari.

original: ity etad uktaṃ tava putra pṛcchataḥ purātanaṃ puṇyatamaṃ pavitrakam /
analyzed: iti etat uktam tava putra pṛcchataḥ purātanam puṇyatamam pavitrakam
translated: Thus, O son, I have told you the ancient, most meritorious and purifying (account),

original: saṃsāravṛkṣasya vināśanaṃ paraṃ punaḥ kam icchasy abhivāñchitaṃ vada // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra vṛkṣasya vināśanam param punar kam icchasi abhivāñchitam vada
translated: which is the supreme destroyer of the tree of worldly existence. Tell me again, what else you desire to hear.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe caturdaśo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe caturdaśaḥ dhyāya
translated: Thus ends the fourteenth chapter in the Narasimha Purana.

original: śrīśuka uvāca /
analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Shuka said:

original: śrotum icchāmy ahaṃ tāta sāṃprataṃ munibhiḥ saha /
analyzed: śrotum icchāmi aham tāta sāṃpratam munibhiḥ saha
translated: O father, I wish to hear now, along with the sages,

original: saṃsāravṛkṣaṃ sakalaṃ yenedaṃ parivartate // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra vṛkṣam sakalam yena idam parivartate
translated: the entire tree of worldly existence by which this (world) revolves.

original: vaktum arhasi me tāta tvayaitat sūcitaṃ purā /
analyzed: vaktum arhasi me tāta tvayā etat sūcitam purā
translated: O father, you should tell me that, which you indicated earlier.

original: nānyo vetti mahābhāga saṃsāroccāralakṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: na anyaḥ vetti mahābhāga saṃsāra uccāra lakṣaṇam
translated: No one else knows the characteristics of the rise and fall of worldly existence, O greatly fortunate one.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

original: sa putreṇaivam uktas tu śiṣyāṇāṃ madhyagena ca /
analyzed: sa putreṇa evam uktaḥ tu śiṣyāṇām madhya gena ca
translated: He, thus addressed by his son, who was in the midst of his disciples,

original: kṛṣṇadvaipāyanaḥ prāha saṃsāratarulakṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: kṛṣṇadvaipāyanaḥ prāha saṃsāra taru lakṣaṇam
translated: Krishna Dvaipayana has spoken of the characteristics of the tree of worldly existence.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: śṛṇvantu śiṣyāḥ sakalā vatsa tvaṃ śṛṇu bhāvitaḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇvantu śiṣyāḥ sakalāḥ vatsa tvam śṛṇu bhāvitaḥ
translated: Let all the disciples listen, O dear one, you listen with devotion.

original: saṃsāravṛkṣaṃ vakṣyāmi yena cedaṃ samāvṛtam // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra vṛkṣam vakṣyāmi yena ca idam samāvṛtam
translated: I shall speak of the tree of worldly existence, by which this (world) is enveloped.

original: avyaktamūlaprabhavas tasmād agre tathotthitaḥ /
analyzed: avyakta mūla prabhavaḥ tasmāt agre tathā utthitaḥ
translated: It has the unmanifest as its root and origin, and from it, the primordial (principle) has arisen.

original: buddhiskandhamayaś caiva indriyāṅkarakoṭaraḥ // / //
analyzed: buddhi skandha mayaḥ ca eva indriya aṅkara koṭaraḥ
translated: It has the intellect as its trunk, and the senses as its sprouts and hollows.

original: mahābhūtaviśākhaś ca viśeṣaiḥ pattraśākhavān /
analyzed: mahābhūta viśākhaḥ ca viśeṣaiḥ pattra śākhavān
translated: It has the great elements as its branches, and the specific (elements) as its leaves and twigs.

original: dharmādharmasupuṣpaś ca sukhaduḥkhaphalodayaḥ // / //
analyzed: dharma adharma su puṣpaḥ ca sukha duḥkha phala udayaḥ
translated: It has righteousness and unrighteousness as its beautiful flowers, and the arising of happiness and sorrow as its fruits.

original: ājīvyaḥ sarvabhūtānāṃ brahmavṛkṣaḥ sanātanaḥ /
analyzed: ājīvyaḥ sarva bhūtānām brahmavṛkṣaḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: It is the eternal tree of Brahman, which sustains all beings.

original: etad brahma paraṃ caiva brahma vṛkṣasya tasya tat // / //
analyzed: etat brahma param ca eva brahma vṛkṣasya tasya tat
translated: This is the supreme Brahman, and that is the Brahman of that tree.

original: ity evaṃ kathitaṃ vatsa saṃsāravṛkṣalakṣaṇam /
analyzed: iti evam kathitam vatsa saṃsāra vṛkṣa lakṣaṇam
translated: Thus, O dear one, the characteristics of the tree of worldly existence have been told.

original: vṛkṣaṃ enaṃ samārūḍhā moham āyānti dehinaḥ // / //
analyzed: vṛkṣam enam samārūḍhāḥ moham āyānti dehinaḥ
translated: Embracing this tree, embodied beings come under delusion.

original: saṃsarantīha satataṃ sukhaduḥkhasamanvitāḥ /🔽prāyeṇa prākṛtā martyā brahmajñānaparāṅmukhāḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃsaranti iha satatam sukha duḥkha samanvitāḥ  prāyeṇa prākṛtāḥ martyāḥ brahma jñāna parāṅmukhāḥ
translated: Wandering here always, they are endowed with happiness and sorrow.🔽For the most part, ordinary mortals are averse to the knowledge of Brahman.

original: chittvainaṃ kṛtino yānti no yānti brahmajñāninaḥ /
analyzed: chittvā enam kṛtinaḥ yānti no yānti brahma jñāninaḥ
translated: Having cut it down, the accomplished ones go, not the knowers of Brahman.

original: karmakriye mahāprājña nainaṃ chindanti duṣkṛtāḥ // / //
analyzed: karma kriye mahā prājña na enam chindanti duṣkṛtāḥ
translated: O greatly wise one, the evil deeds do not cut him.

original: enaṃ chittvā ca bhittvā ca jñānena paramāsinā /
analyzed: enam chittvā ca bhittvā ca jñānena parama asinā
translated: Having cut and pierced him with the supreme sword of knowledge,

original: tato 'maratvaṃ te yānti yasmān nāvartate punaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas mara tvam te yānti yasmāt na āvartate punar
translated: Then they attain immortality from which they do not return again.

original: dehadāramayaiḥ pāśair dṛḍhaṃ baddho 'pi mucyate /
analyzed: deha dāra mayaiḥ pāśaiḥ dṛḍham mucyate
translated: Even though bound tightly with the fetters of body and wife, he is liberated.

original: jñānam eva paraṃ puṃsāṃ śreyasām abhivāñchitam /
analyzed: jñānam eva param puṃsām śreyasām abhivāñchitam
translated: Knowledge alone is supreme for men, desired for their welfare.

original: toṣaṇaṃ narasiṃhasya jñānahīnaḥ paśuḥ pumān // / //
analyzed: toṣaṇam narasiṃhasya jñāna hīnaḥ paśuḥ pumān
translated: A man devoid of knowledge is like an animal, unable to please Narasimha.

original: āhāranidrābhayamaithunāni samānam etat paśubhir narāṇām /
analyzed: āhāra nidrā bhaya maithunāni samānam etat paśubhiḥ narāṇām
translated: Food, sleep, fear and sex - these are common to animals and men.

original: jñānaṃ narāṇām adhikaṃ hi loke jñānena hīnāḥ paśubhiḥ samānāḥ // / //
analyzed: jñānam narāṇām adhikam hi loke jñānena hīnāḥ paśubhiḥ samānāḥ
translated: But knowledge is superior for men in this world; those devoid of knowledge are equal to animals.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe pañcadaśo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe pañcadaśaḥ dhyāya
translated: Thus ends the fifteenth chapter in the Narasimha Purana.

original: śrīśuka uvāca /
analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Shuka said:

original: saṃsāravṛkṣam āruhya dvaṃdvapāśaśatair dṛḍhaiḥ /
analyzed: saṃsāra vṛkṣam āruhya dvaṃdva pāśa śataiḥ dṛḍhaiḥ
translated: Having climbed the tree of worldly existence, firmly bound by hundreds of pairs of opposites,

original: badhyamānaḥ sutaiśvaryaiḥ patito yonisāgare // / //
analyzed: badhyamānaḥ suta aiśvaryaiḥ patitaḥ yoni sāgare
translated: Bound by sons, wealth and other such things, he falls into the ocean of births.

original: yaḥ kāmakrodhalobhais tu viṣayaiḥ paripīḍitaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ kāma krodha lobhaiḥ tu viṣayaiḥ paripīḍitaḥ
translated: He who is afflicted by desire, anger, greed and objects of sense,

original: baddhaḥ svakarmabhir gauṇaiḥ putradāraiṣaṇādibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: baddhaḥ sva karmabhiḥ gauṇaiḥ putra dāra eṣaṇā ādibhiḥ
translated: Bound by his own secondary actions such as seeking sons and wife,

original: sa kena nistaraty āśu dustaraṃ bhavasāgaram /
analyzed: sa kena nistarati āśu dustaram bhava sāgaram
translated: By what means does one quickly cross the difficult ocean of worldly existence?

original: pṛcchām ākhyāhi me tāta tasya muktiṃ kathaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: pṛcchām ākhyāhi me tāta tasya muktim katham bhavet
translated: O father, please tell me the answer to this question. How can he be liberated?

original: śrīvyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: śrī vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Shree Vyasa said:

original: śṛṇu vatsa mahāprājña yaj jñātvā muktim āpnuyāt /
analyzed: śṛṇu vatsa mahā prājña yat jñātvā muktim āpnuyāt
translated: Listen, O child of great wisdom, by knowing which one can attain liberation.

original: tac ca vakṣyāmi te divyaṃ nāradena śrutaṃ purā // / //
analyzed: tat ca vakṣyāmi te divyam nāradena śrutam purā
translated: I shall tell you that divine knowledge, which was heard by Narada in the past.

original: narake raurave ghore dharmajñānavivarjitāḥ /
analyzed: narake raurave ghore dharma jñāna vivarjitāḥ
translated: Those devoid of knowledge of Dharma, in the terrible Raurava hell,

original: svakarmabhir mahāduḥkhaṃ prāptā yatra yamālaye // / //
analyzed: sva karmabhiḥ mahā duḥkham prāptāḥ yatra yama ālaye
translated: where they have attained great suffering due to their own actions in Yama's abode.

original: mahāpāpakṛtaṃ ghoraṃ saṃprāptāḥ pāpakṛjjanāḥ /
analyzed: mahā pāpa kṛtam ghoram saṃprāptāḥ pāpa kṛt janāḥ
translated: The people who have committed great sins have attained terrible consequences.

original: ālokya nāradaḥ śīghraṃ gatvā yatra trilocanaḥ // / //🔽gaṅgādharaṃ mahādevaṃ śaṃkaraṃ śūlapāṇinam /
analyzed: ālokya nāradaḥ śīghram gatvā yatra trilocanaḥ  gaṅgā dharam mahādevam śaṃkaram śūlapāṇinam
translated: Having seen this, Narada quickly went to where the Three-Eyed One (Shiva) was.

original: praṇamya vidhivad devaṃ nāradaḥ paripṛcchati // / //
analyzed: praṇamya vidhivat devam nāradaḥ paripṛcchati
translated: Narada bowed to Mahadeva, the bearer of Ganga, Shankara, the wielder of the trident, in the proper way and asked:

original: nārada uvāca /
analyzed: nāradaḥ uvāca
translated: Narada said:

original: yaḥ saṃsāre mahādvaṃdvaiḥ kāmabhogaiḥ śubhāśubhaiḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ saṃsāre mahā dvaṃdvaiḥ kāma bhogaiḥ śubha aśubhaiḥ
translated: One who is bound in worldly existence by the great dualities, by the pleasures of desire, by the good and bad,

original: śabdādiviṣayair baddhaḥ pīḍyamānaḥ ṣaḍūrmibhiḥ // / //
analyzed: śabda ādi viṣayaiḥ baddhaḥ pīḍyamānaḥ ṣaṣ ūrmibhiḥ
translated: by the six waves (of thought) such as sound and other objects,

original: kathaṃ nu mucyate kṣipraṃ mṛtyusaṃsārasāgarāt /
analyzed: katham nu mucyate kṣipram mṛtyu saṃsāra sāgarāt
translated: how can one be quickly liberated from the ocean of death and worldly existence?

original: bhagavan brūhi me tattvaṃ śrotum icchāmi śaṃkara // / //
analyzed: bhagavan brūhi me tattvam śrotum icchāmi śaṃkara
translated: O Lord, please tell me the truth, I wish to hear it, O Śaṅkara.

original: tasya tad vacanaṃ śrutvā nāradasya trilocanaḥ /
analyzed: tasya tat vacanam śrutvā nāradasya trilocanaḥ
translated: Having heard those words of Nārada, the Three-eyed One,

original: uvāca tam ṛṣiṃ śaṃbhuḥ prasannavadano haraḥ // / //
analyzed: uvāca tam ṛṣim śaṃbhuḥ prasanna vadanaḥ haraḥ
translated: Śambhu, Hara, with a pleased face, spoke to the sage.

original: maheśvara uvāca /
analyzed: maheśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Maheśvara said:

original: jñānāmṛtaṃ ca guhyaṃ ca rahasyam ṛṣisattama /
analyzed: jñāna amṛtam ca guhyam ca rahasyam ṛṣi sattama
translated: The nectar of knowledge, the secret, the mystery, O best of sages,

original: vakṣyāmi śṛṇu duḥkhaghnaṃ sarvabandhabhayāpaham // / //
analyzed: vakṣyāmi śṛṇu duḥkha ghnam sarva bandha bhaya apaham
translated: I will tell you, listen to it, which destroys sorrow and removes the fear of all bondage.

original: tṛṇādi caturāsyāntaṃ bhūtagrāmaṃ caturvidham /
analyzed: tṛṇa ādi catur āsya antam bhūta grāmam caturvidham
translated: The group of beings, fourfold, from grass up to the four-faced one,

original: carācaraṃ jagat sarvaṃ prasuptaṃ yasya māyayā // / //
analyzed: carācaram jagat sarvam prasuptam yasya māyayā
translated: The entire world of moving and unmoving, is asleep by whose Maya.

original: tasya viṣṇoḥ prasādena yadi kaścit prabudhyate /
analyzed: tasya viṣṇoḥ prasādena yadi kaścid prabudhyate
translated: If anyone awakens by the grace of that Viṣṇu,

original: sa nistarati saṃsāraṃ devānām api dustaram // / //
analyzed: sa nistarati saṃsāram devānām api dustaram
translated: He crosses the world, difficult to cross even for the gods.

original: bhogaiśvaryamadonmattas tattvajñānaparāṅmukhaḥ /
analyzed: bhoga aiśvarya mada unmattaḥ tattva jñāna parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: Intoxicated with the pride of enjoyment and lordship, averse to the knowledge of reality,

original: saṃsārasumahāpaṅke jīrṇā gaur iva majjati // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra su mahā paṅke jīrṇā gauḥ iva majjati
translated: He sinks in the great mire of worldly existence like an old cow.

original: yas tv ātmānaṃ nibadhnāti karmabhiḥ kośakāravat /
analyzed: yaḥ tu ātmānam nibadhnāti karmabhiḥ kośakāra vat
translated: But he who binds his own self with actions like a spider,

original: tasya muktiṃ na paśyāmi janmakoṭiśatair api // / //
analyzed: tasya muktim na paśyāmi janma koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: I do not see his liberation even in hundreds of millions of births.

original: tasmān nārada sarveśaṃ devānāṃ devam avyayam /
analyzed: tasmāt nārada sarva īśam devānām devam avyayam
translated: Therefore, O Narada, the imperishable Lord of all gods, the God,

original: ārādhayet sadā saṃyag dhyāyed viṣṇuṃ samāhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: ārādhayet sadā saṃyak dhyāyet viṣṇum samāhitaḥ
translated: Therefore, O Narada, one should always properly worship and meditate with a concentrated mind on Vishnu, the lord of all, the undecaying god of the gods.

original: yas taṃ viśvam anādyantam ādyaṃ svātmani saṃsthitam /
analyzed: yaḥ tam viśvam an ādi antam ādyam sva ātmani saṃsthitam
translated: He who meditates on that all-pervading, beginningless and endless, primordial Vishnu residing in his own Self,🔽the omniscient, pure Vishnu, is always liberated.

original: sarvajñam amalaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //🔽nirvikalpaṃ nirākāśaṃ niṣprapañcaṃ nirāmayam /
analyzed: sarvajñam amalam viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate  nirvikalpam nirākāśam niṣprapañcam nirāmayam
translated: Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.

original: vāsudevam ajaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //🔽nirañjanaṃ paraṃ śāntam acyutaṃ bhūtabhāvanam /
analyzed: vāsudevam ajam viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate  nirañjanam param śāntam acyutam bhūtabhāvanam
translated: Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.

original: devagarbhaṃ vibhuṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //🔽sarvapāpavinirmuktam aprameyam alakṣaṇam /
analyzed: deva garbham vibhum viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate  sarva pāpa vinirmuktam aprameyam alakṣaṇam
translated: Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.

original: nirvāṇam anaghaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //🔽amṛtaṃ paramānandaṃ sarvapāpavivarjitam /
analyzed: nirvāṇam anagham viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate  amṛtam parama ānandam sarva pāpa vivarjitam
translated: Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.

original: brahmaṇyaṃ śaṃkaraṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā saṃkīrtya mucyate // / //🔽yogeśvaraṃ purāṇākhyam aśarīraṃ guhāśayam /
analyzed: brahmaṇyam śaṃkaram viṣṇum sadā saṃkīrtya mucyate  yogeśvaram purāṇa ākhyam aśarīram guhā āśayam
translated: Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.🔽Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.🔽Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.🔽Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.🔽Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.🔽Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.

original: amātram avyayaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: amātram avyayam viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: Meditating always on the unborn Vishnu, Vāsudeva, who is free from alternatives, free from space, free from conceptual elaborations, and free from disease, one is liberated.

original: śubhāśubhavinirmuktam ūrmiṣaṭkaparaṃ vibhum /
analyzed: śubha aśubha vinirmuktam ūrmi ṣaṭka param vibhum
translated: The all-pervading Lord, free from good and bad, beyond the six waves (of manifestation),

original: acintyam amalaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: acintyam amalam viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: Meditating always on Vishnu, the inconceivable, the pure, one is liberated.

original: sarvadvaṃdvavinirmuktaṃ sarvaduḥkhavivarjitam /
analyzed: sarva dvaṃdva vinirmuktam sarva duḥkha vivarjitam
translated: Free from all dualities, devoid of all sorrows,

original: apratarkyam ajaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: apratarkyam ajam viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: Meditating always on Vishnu, the unborn, the inconceivable, one is liberated.

original: anāmagotram advaitaṃ caturthaṃ paramaṃ padam /
analyzed: a nāma gotram a dvaitam caturtham paramam padam
translated: The fourth supreme state, nameless, without lineage, non-dual,

original: taṃ sarvahṛdgataṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: tam sarva hṛd gatam viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: Meditating always on Vishnu, who resides in the heart of all, one is liberated.

original: arūpaṃ satyasaṃkalpaṃ śuddham ākāśavat param /
analyzed: arūpam satya saṃkalpam śuddham ākāśa vat param
translated: Formless, with true resolve, pure like the supreme sky,

original: ekāgramanasā viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: ekāgra manasā viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: Meditating always on Vishnu with a one-pointed mind, one is liberated.

original: sarvātmakaṃ svabhāvastham ātmacaitanyarūpakam /
translated: The universal soul, abiding in its own nature, having the form of the consciousness of the self,

original: śubhram ekākṣaraṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: śubhram ekākṣaram viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: Meditating always on Vishnu, the pure, the one-syllabled, one is liberated.

original: anirvācyam avijñeyam akṣarādim asaṃbhavam /
analyzed: anirvācyam avijñeyam akṣara ādim asaṃbhavam
translated: Indescribable, unknowable, beginningless, impossible,

original: ekaṃ nūtnaṃ sadā viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: ekam nūtnam sadā viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: Meditating always on Vishnu, the one, the new, one is liberated.

original: viśvādyaṃ viśvagoptāraṃ viśvādaṃ sarvakāmadam /
analyzed: viśva adyam viśva goptāram viśva ādam sarva kāma dam
translated: The origin of the universe, the protector of the universe, the devourer of the universe, the bestower of all desires,

original: sthānatrayātigaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: sthāna traya atigam viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: Meditating always on Vishnu, who transcends the three states, one is liberated.

original: sarvaduḥkhakṣayakaraṃ sarvaśāntikaraṃ harim /
analyzed: sarva duḥkha kṣaya karam sarva śānti karam harim
translated: Hari, the destroyer of all sorrows, the bestower of all peace,

original: sarvapāpaharaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: sarva pāpa haram viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: meditating always on Vishnu, the remover of all sins, one becomes liberated.

original: brahmādidevagandharvair munibhiḥ siddhacāraṇaiḥ /
analyzed: brahma ādi deva gandharvaiḥ munibhiḥ siddha cāraṇaiḥ
translated: Vishnu, who is served by Brahma and other gods, Gandharvas, sages, Siddhas and Charanas,

original: yogibhiḥ sevitaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: yogibhiḥ sevitam viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: meditating always on Vishnu, one becomes liberated.

original: viṣṇau pratiṣṭhitaṃ viśvaṃ viṣṇur viśve pratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇau pratiṣṭhitam viśvam viṣṇuḥ viśve pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: The universe is established in Vishnu, Vishnu is established in the universe,

original: viśveśvaram ajaṃ viṣṇuṃ kīrtayann eva mucyate // / //
analyzed: viśveśvaram ajam viṣṇum kīrtayan eva mucyate
translated: glorifying Vishnu, the unborn lord of the universe, one becomes liberated.

original: saṃsārabandhanān muktim icchan kāmam aśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: saṃsāra bandhanāt muktim icchan kāmam aśeṣatas
translated: Desiring liberation from the bondage of worldly existence and the complete destruction of desires,

original: bhaktyaiva varadaṃ viṣṇuṃ sadā dhyāyan vimucyate // / //
analyzed: bhaktyā eva vara dam viṣṇum sadā dhyāyan vimucyate
translated: meditating always on Vishnu, the bestower of boons through devotion alone, one becomes liberated.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: nāradena purā pṛṣṭa evaṃ sa vṛṣabhadhvajaḥ /
analyzed: nāradena purā pṛṣṭaḥ evam sa vṛṣabhadhvajaḥ
translated: Thus asked by Narada in the past, the bull-bannered one (Shiva),

original: yad uvāca tadā tasmai tan mayā kathitaṃ tava // / //🔽tam eva satataṃ dhyāhi nirbījaṃ brahma kevalam /
analyzed: yat uvāca tadā tasmai tat mayā kathitam tava  tam eva satatam dhyāhi nirbījam brahma kevalam
translated: what he said to him then, that I have told you.🔽Meditate on him alone, the seedless, pure Brahman,

original: avāpsyasi dhruvaṃ tāta śāśvataṃ padam avyayam // / //
analyzed: avāpsyasi dhruvam tāta śāśvatam padam avyayam
translated: you will certainly attain, O son, the eternal, immutable state.

original: śrutvā suraṛṣiviṣṇoḥ prādhānyam idam īśvarāt /
analyzed: śrutvā sura ṛṣi viṣṇoḥ prādhānyam idam īśvarāt
translated: Having heard this preeminence of Vishnu, the god of gods, from the Lord,

original: sa viṣṇuṃ saṃyag ārādhya parāṃ siddhim avāptavān // / //
analyzed: sa viṣṇum saṃyak ārādhya parām siddhim avāptavān
translated: He, having properly propitiated Vishnu, attained the highest perfection.

original: yaś cainaṃ paṭhate caiva nṛsiṃhakṛtamānasaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ ca enam paṭhate ca eva nṛsiṃha kṛta mānasaḥ
translated: And he who recites this, with his mind fixed on Narasimha,

original: śatajanmakṛtaṃ pāpam api tasya praṇaśyati // / //
analyzed: śata janma kṛtam pāpam api tasya praṇaśyati
translated: Even his sins committed in a hundred births perish.

original: viṣṇoḥ stavam idaṃ puṇyaṃ mahādevena kīrtitam /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ stavam idam puṇyam mahādevena kīrtitam
translated: This meritorious hymn of Vishnu, recited by Mahadeva,

original: prātaḥ snātvā paṭhen nityam amṛtatvaṃ sa gacchati // / //
analyzed: prātar snātvā paṭhet nityam amṛta tvam sa gacchati
translated: One should recite it daily after bathing in the morning, he attains immortality.

original: dhyāyanti ye nityam anantam acyutaṃ hṛtpadmamadhyeṣv atha kīrtayanti ye /
analyzed: dhyāyanti ye nityam anantam acyutam hṛd padma madhyeṣu atha kīrtayanti ye
translated: Those who always meditate on the infinite and immutable one in the middle of the lotus of the heart, and those who chant his glories,

original: upāsakānāṃ prabhum īśvaraṃ paraṃ te yānti siddhiṃ paramāṃ tu vaiṣṇavīm // / //
analyzed: upāsakānām prabhum īśvaram param te yānti siddhim paramām tu vaiṣṇavīm
translated: Those devotees who worship the supreme Lord and God, they attain the highest perfection of Vishnu.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe viṣṇoḥ stavarājanirūpaṇe ṣoḍaśo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe viṣṇoḥ stavarāja nirūpaṇe ṣoḍaśaḥ dhyāya
translated: Thus ends the sixteenth chapter in the Narasimha Purana, describing the best hymn of Vishnu.

original: śrīśuka uvāca /
analyzed: śrī śukaḥ uvāca
translated: Shuka said:

original: kiṃ japan mucyate tāta satataṃ viṣṇutatparaḥ /
analyzed: kim japan mucyate tāta satatam viṣṇu tatparaḥ
translated: O father, what should one constantly recite, being devoted to Vishnu, to be liberated?

original: saṃsāraduḥkhāt sarveṣāṃ hitāya vada me pitaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃsāra duḥkhāt sarveṣām hitāya vada me pitar
translated: For the welfare of all, tell me, O father, how to be free from the sufferings of worldly existence.

original: vyāsa uvāca /
analyzed: vyāsaḥ uvāca
translated: Vyasa said:

original: aṣṭākṣaraṃ pravakṣyāmi mantrāṇāṃ mantram uttamam /
analyzed: aṣṭa akṣaram pravakṣyāmi mantrāṇām mantram uttamam
translated: I shall tell you the eight-syllabled mantra, the best of all mantras,

original: yaṃ japan mucyate martyo janmasaṃsārabandhanāt // / //
analyzed: yam japan mucyate martyaḥ janma saṃsāra bandhanāt
translated: By reciting which a mortal is freed from the bondage of birth and worldly existence.

original: hṛtpuṇḍarīkamadhyasthaṃ śaṅkhacakragadādharam /
analyzed: hṛd puṇḍarīka madhya stham śaṅkha cakra gadā dharam
translated: Residing in the center of the lotus of the heart, holding a conch, discus, and mace,

original: ekāgramanasā dhyātvā viṣṇuṃ kuryāj japaṃ dvijaḥ // / //
analyzed: ekāgra manasā dhyātvā viṣṇum kuryāt japam dvijaḥ
translated: The twice-born should perform the japa of Vishnu, meditating on him with a one-pointed mind.

original: ekānte nirjanasthāne viṣṇvagre vā jalāntike /
analyzed: ekānte nirjana sthāne viṣṇu agre vā jala antike
translated: In a solitary place devoid of people, in front of Vishnu or near water,

original: japed aṣṭākṣaraṃ mantraṃ citte viṣṇuṃ nidhāya vai // / //
analyzed: japet aṣṭa akṣaram mantram citte viṣṇum nidhāya vai
translated: One should recite the eight-syllabled mantra, keeping Vishnu in mind.

original: aṣṭākṣarasya mantrasya ṛṣir nārāyaṇaḥ svayam /
analyzed: aṣṭa akṣarasya mantrasya ṛṣiḥ nārāyaṇaḥ svayam
translated: The sage of the eight-syllabled mantra is Narayana himself,

original: chandaś ca daivī gāyatrī paramātmā ca devatā // / //🔽śuklavarṇaṃ ca oṃkāraṃ nakāraṃ raktam ucyate /
analyzed: chandaḥ ca daivī gāyatrī paramātmā ca devatā  śukla varṇam ca oṃkāram nakāram raktam ucyate
translated: The meter is divine Gāyatrī, and the supreme Self is the deity.🔽The syllable Om is of white color, and the syllable na is said to be red,

original: mokāraṃ varṇataḥ kṛṣṇaṃ nākāraṃ raktam ucyate // / //
analyzed: mokāram varṇataḥ kṛṣṇam na ākāram raktam ucyate
translated: The syllable mo is of black color, and the syllable na is said to be red.

original: rākāraṃ kuṅkumābhaṃ tu yakāraṃ pītam ucyate /
analyzed: rākāram kuṅkuma ābham tu yakāram pītam ucyate
translated: The syllable rā is of the color of saffron, and the syllable ya is said to be yellow,

original: ṇākāram añjanābhaṃ tu yakāraṃ bahuvarṇakam // / //
analyzed: ṇākāram añjana ābham tu yakāram bahu varṇakam
translated: The syllable ṇa is of the color of collyrium, and the syllable ya has many colors.

original: oṃ namo nārāyaṇāyeti mantraḥ sarvārthasādhakaḥ /
analyzed: om namaḥ nārāyaṇāya iti mantraḥ sarva artha sādhakaḥ
translated: The mantra Om namo nārāyaṇāya accomplishes all purposes,

original: bhaktānāṃ japatāṃ tāta svargamokṣaphalapradaḥ /
analyzed: bhaktānām japatām tāta svarga mokṣa phala pradaḥ
translated: And bestows the fruits of heaven and liberation to devotees who recite it, O son.

original: vedānāṃ praṇayenaiṣa siddho mantraḥ sanātanaḥ // / //
analyzed: vedānām praṇayena eṣa siddhaḥ mantraḥ sanātanaḥ
translated: This eternal mantra is accomplished by the recitation of the Vedas.

original: sarvapāpaharaḥ śrīmān sarvamantreṣu cottamaḥ /
analyzed: sarva pāpa haraḥ śrīmān sarva mantreṣu ca uttamaḥ
translated: It removes all sins, is glorious, and supreme among all mantras.

original: enam aṣṭākṣaraṃ mantraṃ japan nārāyaṇaṃ smaret // / //
analyzed: enam aṣṭa akṣaram mantram japan nārāyaṇam smaret
translated: Reciting this eight-syllable mantra, one should remember Narayana.

original: saṃdhyāvasāne satataṃ sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate /
analyzed: saṃdhyā avasāne satatam sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: At the end of the evening prayers, one is always freed from all sins.

original: eṣa eva paro mantra eṣa eva paraṃ tapaḥ // / //
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva paraḥ mantraḥ eṣaḥ eva param tapaḥ
translated: This alone is the supreme mantra, this alone is the supreme austerity.

original: eṣa eva paro mokṣa eṣa svarga udāhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ eva paraḥ mokṣaḥ eṣa svargaḥ udāhṛtaḥ
translated: This alone is the supreme liberation, this is declared to be heaven.

original: sarvavedarahasyebhyaḥ sāra eṣa samuddhṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva veda rahasyebhyaḥ sāraḥ eṣa samuddhṛtaḥ
translated: The essence of all the secrets of the Vedas is extracted from this.

original: viṣṇunā vaiṣṇavānāṃ hi hitāya manujāṃ purā /
analyzed: viṣṇunā vaiṣṇavānām hi hitāya manujām purā
translated: For the welfare of humans, Vishnu himself revealed this to the devotees in ancient times.

original: evaṃ jñātvā tato vipro hy aṣṭākṣaram imaṃ smaret // / //
analyzed: evam jñātvā tatas vipraḥ hi aṣṭa akṣaram imam smaret
translated: Knowing this, the Brahmin should then remember this eight-syllable mantra.

original: snātvā śuciḥ śucau deśe japet pāpaviśuddhaye /
analyzed: snātvā śuciḥ śucau deśe japet pāpa viśuddhaye
translated: Having bathed, pure in a pure place, one should recite it for the purification of sins.

original: jape dāne ca home ca gamane dhyānaparvasu // / //
analyzed: jape dāne ca home ca gamane dhyāna parvasu
translated: In japa, charity, homa, travel, meditation, and on auspicious days,

original: japen nārāyaṇaṃ mantraṃ karmapūrve pare tathā /
analyzed: japet nārāyaṇam mantram karma pūrve pare tathā
translated: One should recite the Narayana mantra before and after the ritual.

original: japet sahasraṃ niyutaṃ śucir bhūtvā samāhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: japet sahasram niyutam śuciḥ bhūtvā samāhitaḥ
translated: One should recite it a thousand or ten thousand times, being pure and concentrated.

original: māsi māsi tu dvādaśyāṃ viṣṇubhakto dvijottamaḥ /
analyzed: māsi māsi tu dvādaśyām viṣṇu bhaktaḥ dvijottamaḥ
translated: Every month, on the twelfth day, an excellent Brahmin devotee of Vishnu,

original: snātvā śucir japed yas tu namo nārāyaṇaṃ śatam // / //
analyzed: snātvā śuciḥ japet yaḥ tu namaḥ nārāyaṇam śatam
translated: having bathed and being pure, should recite Salutations to Narayana a hundred times.

original: sa gacchet paramaṃ devaṃ nārāyaṇam anāmayam /
analyzed: sa gacchet paramam devam nārāyaṇam anāmayam
translated: He would go to the highest god, the faultless Narayana.

original: gandhapuṣpādibhir viṣṇum anenārādhya yo japet // / //
analyzed: gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ viṣṇum anena ārādhya yaḥ japet
translated: One who worships Vishnu with this mantra using fragrances, flowers, etc.,

original: mahāpātakayukto 'pi mucyate nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: mahāpātaka yuktaḥ upi mucyate na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: even if he is guilty of a great sin, is liberated. There is no doubt about this.

original: hṛdi kṛtvā hariṃ devaṃ mantram enaṃ tu yo japet // / //
analyzed: hṛdi kṛtvā harim devam mantram enam tu yaḥ japet
translated: One who meditates on Lord Hari in the heart and recites this mantra,

original: sarvapāpaviśuddhātmā sa gacchet paramāṃ gatim /
analyzed: sarva pāpa viśuddha ātmā sa gacchet paramām gatim
translated: with his soul purified of all sins, he goes to the highest state.

original: prathamena tu lakṣeṇa ātmaśuddhir bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: prathamena tu lakṣeṇa ātma śuddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: By the first lakh, there will be purification of the self.

original: dvitīyena tu lakṣeṇa manusiddhim avāpnuyāt /
analyzed: dvitīyena tu lakṣeṇa manu siddhim avāpnuyāt
translated: By the second lakh, one would attain perfection in the mantra.

original: tṛtīyena tu lakṣeṇa svargalokam avāpnuyāt // / //
analyzed: tṛtīyena tu lakṣeṇa svarga lokam avāpnuyāt
translated: By the third lakh, one would attain the world of heaven.

original: caturthena tu lakṣeṇa hareḥ sāmipyam āpnuyāt /
analyzed: caturthena tu lakṣeṇa hareḥ sāmipyam āpnuyāt
translated: By the fourth lakh, one would attain equality with Hari.

original: pañcamena tu lakṣeṇa nirmalaṃ jñānam āpnuyāt // / //
analyzed: pañcamena tu lakṣeṇa nirmalam jñānam āpnuyāt
translated: By the fifth lakh, one would attain pure knowledge.

original: tathā ṣaṣṭhena lakṣeṇa bhaved viṣṇau sthirā matiḥ /
analyzed: tathā ṣaṣṭhena lakṣeṇa bhavet viṣṇau sthirā matiḥ
translated: Similarly, by the sixth lakh, one's mind would be firmly fixed on Vishnu.

original: saptamena tu lakṣeṇa svarūpaṃ pratipadyate // / //
analyzed: saptamena tu lakṣeṇa sva rūpam pratipadyate
translated: By the seventh lakh, one attains one's own form.

original: aṣṭamena tu lakṣeṇa nirvāṇam adhigacchati /
analyzed: aṣṭamena tu lakṣeṇa nirvāṇam adhigacchati
translated: By the eighth lakh, one attains liberation.

original: svasvadharmasamāyuktaṃ japaṃ kuryād dvijottamaḥ // / //
analyzed: sva svadharma samāyuktam japam kuryāt dvijottamaḥ
translated: The best of Brahmins should perform the Japa along with his own duties.

original: etat siddhikaraṃ mantram aṣṭākṣaram atandritaḥ /
analyzed: etat siddhi karam mantram aṣṭa akṣaram atandritaḥ
translated: This mantra, which brings about success, is the eight-syllabled one, which should be recited without laziness.

original: duḥsvapnāsurapaiśācā uragā brahmarākṣasāḥ // / //
analyzed: duḥsvapna asura paiśācāḥ uragāḥ brahmarākṣasāḥ
translated: Evil dreams, demons, goblins, serpents, Brahmarakshasas,

original: jāpinaṃ nopasarpanti caurakṣudrādhayas tathā /
analyzed: jāpinam na upasarpanti caura kṣudra ādhayaḥ tathā
translated: thieves, small ailments, and so on, do not approach the reciter.

original: ekāgramanasāvyāgro viṣṇubhakto dṛḍhavrataḥ // / //
analyzed: ekāgra manasā avyāgraḥ viṣṇu bhaktaḥ dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: With a one-pointed mind, free from distraction, a devotee of Vishnu, firm in vows,

original: japen nārāyaṇaṃ mantram etan mṛtyubhayāpaham /
analyzed: japet nārāyaṇam mantram etat mṛtyu bhaya apaham
translated: one should recite the Narayana mantra, which removes the fear of death.

original: mantrāṇāṃ paramo mantro devatānāṃ ca daivatam // / //
analyzed: mantrāṇām paramaḥ mantraḥ devatānām ca daivatam
translated: The supreme mantra among mantras, the deity among deities,

original: guhyānāṃ paramaṃ guhyam oṃkārādyakṣarāṣṭakam /
analyzed: guhyānām paramam guhyam oṃkāra ādi akṣara aṣṭakam
translated: the supreme secret among secrets, the eight syllables beginning with Om,

original: āyuṣyaṃ dhanaputrāṃś ca paśūn vidyāṃ mahad yaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: āyuṣyam dhana putrān ca paśūn vidyām mahat yaśaḥ
translated: longevity, wealth, children, animals, knowledge, great fame,

original: dharmārthakāmamokṣāṃś ca labhate ca japan naraḥ /
analyzed: dharma artha kāma mokṣān ca labhate ca japan naraḥ
translated: and a man who recites this obtains dharma, artha, kama, and moksha.

original: etat satyaṃ ca dharmyaṃ ca vedaśrutinidarśanāt // / //
analyzed: etat satyam ca dharmyam ca veda śruti nidarśanāt
translated: This is true and righteous, as shown by the Vedic scriptures,

original: etat siddhikaraṃ nṝṇāṃ mantrarūpaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: etat siddhi karam nṝṇām mantra rūpam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: this form of mantra, which brings about success for men, is undoubtedly so.

original: ṛṣayaḥ pitaro devāḥ siddhās tv asurarākṣasāḥ // / //
analyzed: ṛṣayaḥ pitaraḥ devāḥ siddhāḥ tu asura rākṣasāḥ
translated: The sages, ancestors, gods, siddhas, asuras, rakshasas,

original: etad eva paraṃ japtvā parāṃ siddhim ito gatāḥ /
analyzed: etat eva param japtvā parām siddhim itas gatāḥ
translated: having recited this very supreme mantra, have gone to the highest success from here.

original: jñātvā yas tv ātmanaḥ kālaṃ śāstrāntaravidhānataḥ /
analyzed: jñātvā yaḥ tu ātmanaḥ kālam śāstra antara vidhānataḥ
translated: Knowing one's own time according to the prescriptions of other scriptures,

original: antakāle japann eti tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam // / //
analyzed: antakāle japan eti tat viṣṇoḥ paramam padam
translated: At the time of death, by repeating it, one attains that supreme abode of Vishnu.

original: nārāyaṇāya nama ity ayam eva satyaṃ saṃsāraghoraviṣasaṃharaṇāya mantraḥ /
analyzed: nārāyaṇāya namaḥ iti ayam eva satyam saṃsāra ghora viṣa saṃharaṇāya mantraḥ
translated: This very mantra, Salutations to Narayana, is indeed the truth for the removal of the poison of the terrible worldly existence.

original: śṛṇvantu bhavyamatayo muditās tvarāgā uccais tarām upadiśāmy aham ūrdhvabāhuḥ // / //
analyzed: śṛṇvantu bhavya matayaḥ muditāḥ tva rāgāḥ uccais tarām upadiśāmi aham ūrdhva bāhuḥ
translated: May those with auspicious minds listen with joy, I raise my arms high and teach this loudly.

original: bhūtvordhvabāhur adyāhaṃ satyapūrvaṃ bravīmy aham /
analyzed: bhūtvā ūrdhva bāhuḥ adya aham satya pūrvam bravīmi aham
translated: Having raised my arms high, I speak this truth first.

original: he putra śiṣyāḥ śṛṇuta na mantro 'ṣṭākṣarāt paraḥ // / //
analyzed: he putra śiṣyāḥ śṛṇuta na ṣṭa akṣarāt paraḥ
translated: O sons, disciples, listen, there is no mantra greater than the eight-syllabled one.

original: satyaṃ satyaṃ punaḥ satyam utkṣipya bhujam ucyate /
analyzed: satyam satyam punar satyam utkṣipya bhujam ucyate
translated: Truth, truth, again and again truth is spoken, raising the arm.

original: vedāc chāstraṃ paraṃ nāsti na devaḥ keśavāt paraḥ // / //
analyzed: vedāt śāstram param nā asti na devaḥ keśavāt paraḥ
translated: There is no scripture higher than the Vedas, no god higher than Keshava.

original: ālocya sarvaśāstrāṇi vicārya ca punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: ālocya sarva śāstrāṇi vicārya ca punar punar
translated: Having examined all the scriptures and pondered again and again,

original: idam ekaṃ suniṣpannaṃ dhyeyo nārāyaṇaḥ sadā // / //
analyzed: idam ekam su niṣpannam dhyeyaḥ nārāyaṇaḥ sadā
translated: this one thing is well-established: Narayana should always be meditated upon.

original: ity etat sakalaṃ proktaṃ śiṣyāṇāṃ tava puṇyadam /
analyzed: iti etat sakalam proktam śiṣyāṇām tava puṇya dam
translated: Thus this entire thing has been told to you, my disciples, which is meritorious.

original: kathāś ca vividhāḥ proktā mayā bhaja janārdanam // / //
analyzed: kathāḥ ca vividhāḥ proktāḥ mayā bhaja janārdanam
translated: And various stories have been told by me. Worship Janardana.

original: aṣṭākṣaram imaṃ mantraṃ sarvaduḥkhavināśanam /
analyzed: aṣṭa akṣaram imam mantram sarva duḥkha vināśanam
translated: This eight-syllabled mantra, which destroys all sufferings,

original: japa putra mahābuddhe yadi siddhim abhīpsasi // / //
analyzed: japa putra mahābuddhe yadi siddhim abhīpsasi
translated: O son, if you desire perfection, then perform the japa.

original: idaṃ stavaṃ vyāsamukhāt tu nissṛtaṃ saṃdhyātraye ye puruṣāḥ paṭhanti /
analyzed: idam stavam vyāsa mukhāt tu nissṛtam saṃdhyā traye ye puruṣāḥ paṭhanti
translated: Those men who recite this hymn emanating from the mouth of Vyasa, during the three junctions of the day,

original: te dhautapāṇḍurapaṭā iva rājahaṃsāḥ saṃsārasāgaram apetabhayās taranti // / //
analyzed: te dhauta pāṇḍura paṭāḥ iva rājahaṃsāḥ saṃsāra sāgaram apeta bhayāḥ taranti
translated: They, like white swans with washed white feathers, cross the ocean of worldly existence, free from fear.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe aṣṭākṣaramantramāhātmyaṃ nāma saptadaśo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe aṣṭākṣaramantramāhātmyam nāma saptadaśaḥ dhyāya
translated: Thus ends the seventeenth chapter in the Narasimha Purana, on the greatness of the eight-syllabled mantra.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

original: iti śrutvā kathāḥ puṇyāḥ sarvapāpapraṇāśinīḥ /
analyzed: iti śrutvā kathāḥ puṇyāḥ sarva pāpa praṇāśinīḥ
translated: Having heard these auspicious stories, which destroy all sins,

original: nānāvidhā muniśreṣṭhāḥ kṛṣṇadvaipāyanāt punaḥ // / //
analyzed: nānāvidhāḥ muni śreṣṭhāḥ kṛṣṇadvaipāyanāt punar
translated: The best of sages, again from Krishna Dvaipayana,

original: śukaḥ pūrvaṃ mahābhāgo bharadvājo mahāmate /
analyzed: śukaḥ pūrvam mahābhāgaḥ bharadvājaḥ mahāmate
translated: Shuka, the greatly fortunate one, and Bharadvaja, the greatly wise one,

original: siddhair anyaiś ca sahito nārāyaṇaparo 'bhavat // / //
analyzed: siddhaiḥ anyaiḥ ca sahitaḥ nārāyaṇa paraḥ bhavat
translated: Along with other sages, became devoted to Narayana.

original: evaṃ te kathitā vipra mārkaṇḍeyādikāḥ kathāḥ /
analyzed: evam te kathitāḥ vipra mārkaṇḍeya ādikāḥ kathāḥ
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, I have told you the stories of Markandeya and others,

original: mayā vicitrāḥ pāpaghnyaḥ kiṃ bhūyaḥ śrotum icchasi // / //
analyzed: mayā vicitrāḥ pāpa ghnyaḥ kim bhūyas śrotum icchasi
translated: Which are wonderful and destroy sins. What more do you wish to hear?

original: bharadvāja uvāca /
analyzed: bharadvājaḥ uvāca
translated: Bharadvaja said:

original: vasvādīnāṃ tathā proktā mama sṛṣṭis tvayā purā /
analyzed: vasu ādīnām tathā proktā mama sṛṣṭiḥ tvayā purā
translated: You have earlier told me the creation of the Vasus and others,

original: aśvinor marutāṃ caiva noktotpattis tu tāṃ vada // / //
analyzed: aśvinoḥ marutām ca eva nā ukta utpattiḥ tu tām vada
translated: The origin of the Ashvins and Maruts has not been mentioned. Please tell us that.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

original: marutāṃ vistareṇoktā vaiṣṇavākhye mahāmate /
analyzed: marutām vistareṇa uktāḥ vaiṣṇava ākhye mahāmate
translated: O greatly wise one, the origin of the Maruts has been described in detail in the Purana called Vaishnava,

original: purāṇe śaktiputreṇa purotpatiś ca vāyunā // / //
analyzed: purāṇe śakti putreṇa purā utpatiḥ ca vāyunā
translated: by Shakra's son, and the origin of the Ashvins by Vayu.

original: aśvinor devayoś caiva sṛṣṭir uktā suvistarāt /
analyzed: aśvinoḥ devayoḥ ca eva sṛṣṭiḥ uktā su vistarāt
translated: The creation of the two divine Ashvins has been described in great detail.

original: saṃkṣepāt tava vakṣyāmi sṛṣṭim etāṃ śṛṇuṣva me // / //
analyzed: saṃkṣepāt tava vakṣyāmi sṛṣṭim etām śṛṇuṣva me
translated: I will tell you that creation in brief. Listen to me.

original: ḥdakṣakanyāditiḥ /
analyzed: ḥ dakṣa kanyā aditiḥ
translated: Aditi, the daughter of Daksha.

original: ḥaditer ādityaḥ putraḥ /
analyzed: ḥaditeḥ ādityaḥ putraḥ
translated: Aditi's son was Aditya.

original: ḥtasmai tvaṣṭā duhitaraṃ saṃjñāṃ nāma kanyāṃ dattavān // / //
analyzed: tasmai tvaṣṭā duhitaram saṃjñām nāma kanyām dattavān
translated: Tvastra gave his daughter named Samjna to him.

original: ḥso 'pi tvāṣṭrīṃ rūpavatīṃ manojñāṃ prāpya tayā saha reme /
analyzed: ḥsaḥ pi tvāṣṭrīm rūpavatīm manojñām prāpya tayā saha reme
translated: He too, having obtained Tvastr's beautiful and charming daughter, enjoyed with her.

original: ḥsā katipayāt kālāt svabhartur ādityasya tāpam asahantī pitur gṛhaṃ jagāma // / //
analyzed: ḥsā katipayāt kālāt sva bhartuḥ ādityasya tāpam a sahantī pituḥ gṛham jagāma
translated: After some time, unable to bear the heat of her husband Aditya, she went to her father's house.

original: ḥtām avalokya sutāṃ pitovāca kiṃ putri tava bhartā savitā snehāt tvāṃ rakṣaty uta paruṣa iti // / //
analyzed: avalokya sutām pitā uvāca kim putri tava bhartā savitā snehāt tvām rakṣati uta paruṣaḥ iti
translated: Seeing his daughter, the father said, Daughter, does your husband Savita protect you out of affection or harshly?

original: ḥevaṃ pitur vacanaṃ śrutvā saṃjñā taṃ pratyuvāca /
analyzed: evam pituḥ vacanam śrutvā saṃjñā tam pratyuvāca
translated: Hearing these words of her father, Samjna replied to him.

original: ḥdagdhāhaṃ bhartuḥ pracaṇḍatāpād iti // / //
analyzed: ḥdagdhā aham bhartuḥ pracaṇḍa tāpāt iti
translated: I am scorched by the intense heat of my husband.

original: ḥevaṃ śrutvā tām āha pitā gaccha putri bhartur gṛham iti // / //
analyzed: evam śrutvā tām āha pitā gaccha putri bhartuḥ gṛham iti
translated: Having heard this, the father said to her, Go, daughter, to your husband's house.

original: ḥyuvatīstrīṇāṃ bhartuḥ śuśrūṣaṇam eva dharmaḥ śreyān /
analyzed: ḥyuvatī strīṇām bhartuḥ śuśrūṣaṇam eva dharmaḥ śreyān
translated: For young women, serving the husband is the best dharma.

original: ḥaham api katipayadivasād āgatyādityasyoṣṇatāṃ jāmātur uddhariṣyāmi // / //
analyzed: ḥaham api katipaya divasāt āgatya ādityasya uṣṇa tām jāmātuḥ uddhariṣyāmi
translated: I too, after a few days, will come and relieve my son-in-law of the heat of the sun.

original: ḥityuktā sā ca punar bhartur gṛhaṃ prāpya katipayadivasān manuṃ yamīṃ yamaṃ cāpatyatrayam ādityāt prāsūta /
analyzed: ḥiti uktā sā ca punar bhartuḥ gṛham prāpya katipaya divasān manum yamīm yamam ca apatya trayam ādityāt prāsūta
translated: Having been told this, she again reached her husband's house and gave birth to three children, Manu, Yami, and Yama, from the sun.

original: ḥpunas taduṣṇatām asahantī chāyāṃ bhartur apabhogāya svaprajñābalenotpādya tatra saṃsthāpya gatvottarakurūn adhiṣṭhāyāśvī bhūtvā vicacāra //
analyzed: ḥpunar tad uṣṇa tām a sahantī chāyām bhartuḥ apabhogāya sva prajñā balena utpādya tatra saṃsthāpya gatvā uttarakurūn adhiṣṭhāya aśvī bhūtvā vicacāra
translated: Again, unable to bear that heat, she created a shadow from her husband's enjoyment by the power of her own wisdom, established it there, went to the northern Kurus, and lived as a mare.

original: ḥādityo 'pi saṃjñeyam iti matvā tasyāṃ jāyāṃ punar apatyatrayam // / //
analyzed: saṃjñā iyam iti matvā tasyām jāyām punar apatya trayam utpādayāmasa
translated: The sun, thinking This is my wife, again had three children in her.

original: ḥmanuṃ śanaiścaraṃ tapatīṃ ca /
analyzed: ḥmanum śanaiścaram tapatīm ca
translated: Manu, Shanaishchara, and Tapati.

original: ḥsveṣv apatyeṣu pakṣapātena vartatīṃ chāyāṃ dṛṣṭvā yamaḥ svapitaram āha neyam asmanmāteti // / //
analyzed: ḥsveṣu apatyeṣu pakṣapātena vartatīm chāyām dṛṣṭvā yamaḥ sva pitaram āha na iyam asmad mātā iti
translated: Seeing her acting with partiality towards her own children, Yama said to his father, This is not our mother.

original: ḥpitāpi tac chrutvā bhāryāṃ prāha /
analyzed: ḥ pitā api tat śrutvā bhāryām prāha
translated: Having heard that, the father said to his wife,

original: ḥsarveṣv apatyeṣu samam eva vartatām iti // / //
analyzed: ḥ sarveṣu apatyeṣu samam eva vartatām iti
translated: and treat all your children equally.

original: ḥpunar api sveṣv apatyeṣu snehāt pravartatīṃ chāyāṃ dṛṣṭvā yamo yamī ca tāṃ bahuvidham apīttham uvāca /
analyzed: ḥpunar api sveṣu apatyeṣu snehāt pravartatīm chāyām dṛṣṭvā yamaḥ yamī ca tām bahuvidham api ittham uvāca
translated: Again, seeing Chāyā acting affectionately towards her own children, Yama and Yamī, he spoke to her in various ways:

original: ḥādityasaṃnidhānāt tūṣṇīṃ babhūvataḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥāditya saṃnidhānāt tūṣṇīm babhūvataḥ
translated: but due to the presence of the sun, they remained silent.

original: ḥtataś chāyā tayoḥ śāpaṃ dattavatī /
analyzed: ḥtatas chāyā tayoḥ śāpam dattavatī
translated: Then Chāyā pronounced a curse on them:

original: ḥyama tvaṃ pretarājo bhava yami tvaṃ yamunā nāma nadī bhavet // / //
analyzed: tvam preta rājaḥ bhava yami tvam yamunā nāma nadī bhavet
translated: Yama, you become the king of the dead, and Yamī, you become a river named Yamunā.

original: ḥtataḥ krodhād ādityo 'pi chāyāputrayoḥ śāpaṃ dattavān he putra śanaiścara tvaṃ graho bhava krūradṛṣṭir mandagāmī ca pāpagrahas tvaṃ ca //
analyzed: ḥtatas krodhāt ādityaḥ pi chāyā putrayoḥ śāpam dattavān he putra śanaiścara tvam grahaḥ bhava krūra dṛṣṭiḥ manda gāmī ca pāpa grahaḥ tvam ca
translated: Then, out of anger, Āditya also pronounced a curse on Chāyā's two children: O son, you become the planet Śani, cruel-eyed, slow-moving, and an evil planet, and you, O daughter, become a river named Tapati.

original: ḥputri tapatī nāma nadī bhaveti athādityo dhyānam āsthāya saṃjñā kva sthiteti // / //
analyzed: ḥ putri tapatī nāma nadī bhava iti atha ādityaḥ dhyānam āsthāya saṃjñā kva sthitā iti vicārayāmasa
translated: Then Āditya, meditating, thought, Where is Saṃjñā?

original: ḥsa dṛṣṭavān uttarakuruṣu dhyānacakṣuṣāśvībhūya vicarantī /
analyzed: ḥsa dṛṣṭavān uttarakuruṣu dhyānacakṣuṣā aśvībhūya vicarantī
translated: He saw her with the eye of meditation in the Uttarakuru region, transformed into a mare and wandering.

original: ḥsvayaṃ cāśvarūpeṇa tatra gatvā tayā saha saṃparkaṃ kṛtavān // / //
analyzed: ca aśvarūpeṇa tatra gatvā tayā saha saṃparkam kṛtavān
translated: He himself went there in the form of a horse and had intercourse with her.

original: ḥtasyām evādityād aśvināv utpannau tayor atiśayavapuṣoḥ sākṣāt prajāpatir āgatya devatvaṃ yajñabhāgatvaṃ mukhyaṃ ca devānāṃ bhiṣajatvaṃ dattvā
analyzed: ḥtasyām eva ādityāt aśvinau utpannau tayoḥ atiśaya vapuṣoḥ sākṣāt prajāpatiḥ āgatya deva tvam yajñabhāga tvam mukhyam ca devānām bhiṣaja tvam dattvā
translated: In her, the Ashvins were born from the sun. To them, whose bodies were superior, Prajapati himself came and gave them godhood, a share in the sacrifice, and the foremost position among the gods as physicians.

original: jagāma /
analyzed: jagāma
translated: He then departed.

original: ḥādityaś cāśvarūpaṃ vihāya svabhāryāṃ saṃjñāṃ tvāṣṭrīṃ svarūpadhāriṇīṃ nītvā svarūpam āsthāya divaṃ jagāma // / //
analyzed: ādityaḥ ca aśva rūpam vihāya sva bhāryām saṃjñām tvāṣṭrīm sva rūpa dhāriṇīm nītvā sva rūpam āsthāya divam jagāma
translated: The sun, having abandoned his horse form, took his wife Sanjna, the daughter of Tvastra, in her own form, assumed his own form, and went to heaven.

original: ḥviśvakarmā cāgatya ādityaṃ nāmabhiḥ stutvā tadatiśayoṣṇatāṃśatām // / //
analyzed: ḥviśvakarmā ca āgatya ādityam nāmabhiḥ stutvā tad atiśaya uṣṇa tā aṃśa tām apaśātayāmasa
translated: Vishvakarma also came and praised the sun with names, and his superior heat and rays.

original: evaṃ vaḥ kathitā viprā aśvinautpattir uttamā /
analyzed: evam vaḥ kathitā viprāḥ
translated: Thus, O Brahmins, the excellent birth of the Ashvins has been told to you.

original: puṇyā pavitrā pāpaghnī bharadvāja mahāmate // / //
analyzed: puṇyā pavitrā pāpa ghnī bharadvāja mahāmate
translated: O Bharadvaja of great intellect, it is auspicious, purifying, and destroys sins.

original: ādityaputrau bhiṣajau surāṇāṃ divyena rūpeṇa virājamānau /
analyzed: āditya putrau bhiṣajau surāṇām divyena rūpeṇa virājamānau
translated: The sons of the sun, the physicians of the gods, shining with their divine form,

original: śrutvā tayor janma naraḥ pṛthivyāṃ bhavet surūpo divi modate ca // / //
analyzed: śrutvā tayoḥ janma naraḥ pṛthivyām bhavet surūpaḥ divi modate ca
translated: Having heard their birth on earth, a man becomes handsome and delights in heaven.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe aśvinor utpattir nāma aṣṭādaśo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe aśvinoḥ utpattiḥ nāma aṣṭādaśaḥ dhyāya
translated: Thus ends the eighteenth chapter named The Birth of the Ashvins in the Narasimha Purana.

original: bharadvāja uvāca /
analyzed: bharadvājaḥ uvāca
translated: Bharadvaja said:

original: yaiḥ stuto nāmabhis tena savitā viśvakarmaṇā /
analyzed: yaiḥ stutaḥ nāmabhiḥ tena savitā viśva karmaṇā
translated: By which names was Savita praised by Vishvakarma,

original: tāny ahaṃ śrotum icchāmi vada sūta vivasvataḥ // / //
analyzed: tāni aham śrotum icchāmi vada sūta vivasvataḥ
translated: I wish to hear those names of the Sun. Tell me, O Suta.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

original: tāni me śṛṇu nāmāni yaiḥ stuto viśvakarmaṇā /
analyzed: tāni me śṛṇu nāmāni yaiḥ stutaḥ viśvakarmaṇā
translated: Listen to those names by which the Sun was praised by Vishvakarma.

original: savitā tāni vakṣyāmi sarvapapaharāṇi te // / //
analyzed: savitā tāni vakṣyāmi te
translated: I will tell you those names of the Sun, which remove all sins.

original: ādityaḥ savitā sūryaḥ khagaḥ pūṣā gabhastimān /
analyzed: ādityaḥ savitā sūryaḥ khagaḥ pūṣā gabhastimān
translated: Aditya, Savita, Surya, Khagavān, Pūshā, Gabhastimān,

original: timironmathanaḥ śaṃbhus tvaṣṭā mārtaṇḍa āśugaḥ // / //
analyzed: timira unmathanaḥ śaṃbhuḥ tvaṣṭā mārtaṇḍaḥ āśu gaḥ
translated: Timiraunmathana, Shambhu, Tvaṣṭṛ, Mārtaṇḍa, Āśuvān,

original: hiraṇyagarbhaḥ kapilas tapano bhāskaro raviḥ /
analyzed: hiraṇyagarbhaḥ kapilaḥ tapanaḥ bhāskaraḥ raviḥ
translated: Hiraṇyagarbha, Kapila, Tapana, Bhāskara, Ravi,

original: agnigarbho 'diteḥ putraḥ śaṃbhus timiranāśanaḥ // / //
analyzed: agni garbhaḥ diteḥ putraḥ śaṃbhuḥ timira nāśanaḥ
translated: Agnigarbha, son of Aditi, Shambhu, destroyer of darkness,

original: aṃśumān aṃśumālī ca tamoghnas tejasāṃ nidhiḥ /
analyzed: aṃśumān aṃśumālī ca tamoghnaḥ tejasām nidhiḥ
translated: Aṃśumān, Aṃśumālī, Tamogha, Nidhi of Tejas,

original: ātapī maṇḍalī mṛtyuḥ kapilaḥ sarvatāpanaḥ // / //
analyzed: ātapī maṇḍalī mṛtyuḥ kapilaḥ sarva tāpanaḥ
translated: Ātapī, Maṇḍalī, Mṛtyu, Kapila, Sarvatāpana,

original: harir viśvo mahātejāḥ sarvaratnaprabhākaraḥ /
translated: Hari, Viśva, Mahātejas, Sarvaratna-prabhākara,

original: aṃśumālī timirahā ṛgyajussāmabhāvitaḥ // / //
translated: Aṃśumālī, Tamisrahā, Bhāvita by Ṛg, Yajus, and Sāman,

original: prāṇāviṣkaraṇo mitraḥ supradīpo manojavaḥ /
translated: Prāṇāviṣkaraṇa, Mitra, Supradīpa, Manojava,

original: yajñeśo gopatiḥ śrīmān bhūtajñaḥ kleśanāśanaḥ // / //
translated: Yajñeśa, Gopati, Śrīmān, Bhūtajña, Kleśanāśana,

original: amitrahā śivo haṃso nāyakaḥ priyadarśanaḥ /
translated: Amitraha, Śiva, Haṃsa, Nāyaka, Priyadarśana,

original: śuddho virocanaḥ keśī sahasrāṃśuḥ pratardanaḥ // / //
analyzed: śuddhaḥ virocanaḥ keśī sahasrāṃśuḥ pratardanaḥ
translated: Shuddha, Virochana, Keshi, Sahasra-ansh, Pratardana,

original: dharmaraśmiḥ pataṅgaś ca viśālo viśvasaṃstutaḥ /
analyzed: dharmaraśmiḥ pataṅgaḥ ca viśālaḥ viśva saṃstutaḥ
translated: Dharmarashi, Patanga, Vishala, Vishva-samsruta,

original: durvijñeyagatiḥ śūras tejorāśir mahāyaśāḥ // / //
analyzed: durvijñeya gatiḥ śūraḥ tejaḥ rāśiḥ mahā yaśāḥ
translated: Durvijnya-gati, Shura, Tejorashi, Mahayasha,

original: bhrājiṣṇur jyotiṣām īśo vijiṣṇur viśvabhāvanaḥ /
analyzed: bhrājiṣṇuḥ jyotiṣām īśaḥ vijiṣṇuḥ viśva bhāvanaḥ
translated: Bhrashishnu, Jyotishisha, Vijishnu, Vishva-bhavana,

original: prabhaviṣṇuḥ prakāśātmā jñānarāśiḥ prabhākaraḥ // / //
translated: Prabhishnu, Prakashashatma, Jnanarashi, Prabhakar,

original: ādityo viśvadṛg yajña kartā netā yaśaskaraḥ /
analyzed: ādityaḥ viśva dṛś yajña kartā netā yaśaskaraḥ
translated: Aditya, Vishva-drik, Yajnakarta, Neta, Yashaskara,

original: vimalo vīryavān īśo yogajño yogabhāvanaḥ // / //
translated: Vimal, Virya-van, Isha, Yogajna, Yogabhavana,

original: amṛtātmā śivo nityo vareṇyo varadaḥ prabhuḥ /
analyzed: amṛta ātmā śivaḥ nityaḥ vareṇyaḥ vara daḥ prabhuḥ
translated: Amritatma, Shiva, Nitya, Varenya, Varada, Prabhu,

original: dhanadaḥ prāṇadaḥ śreṣṭhaḥ kāmadaḥ kāmarūpadhṛk // / //
analyzed: dhana daḥ prāṇa daḥ śreṣṭhaḥ kāma daḥ kāma rūpa dhṛk
translated: Dhanada, Pranada, Shrestha, Kamada, Kama-rupa-dhrk,

original: taraṇiḥ śāśvataḥ śāstā śāstrajñas tapanaḥ śayaḥ /
analyzed: taraṇiḥ śāśvataḥ śāstā śāstra jñaḥ tapanaḥ śayaḥ
translated: Tarani, Shashvata, Shasta, Shastrajna, Tapana, Shaya,

original: vedagarbho vibhur vīraḥ śāntaḥ sāvitrivallabhaḥ // / //
translated: Vedagarbha, Vibhu, Vira, Shanta, Savitri-vallabha,

original: dhyeyo viśveśvaro bhartā lokanātho maheśvaraḥ /
analyzed: dhyeyaḥ viśveśvaraḥ bhartā lokanāthaḥ maheśvaraḥ
translated: Dhyeya, Vishveshwara, Bharta, Lokanatha, Maheshvara,

original: mahendro varuṇo dhātā viṣṇur agnir divākaraḥ // / //
analyzed: mahā indraḥ varuṇaḥ dhātā viṣṇuḥ agniḥ divākaraḥ
translated: Mahendra, Varuna, Dhata, Vishnu, Agni, Divakara,

original: etais tu nāmabhiḥ sūryaḥ stutas tena mahātmanā /
analyzed: etaiḥ tu nāmabhiḥ sūryaḥ stutaḥ tena mahātmanā
translated: The Sun was praised by that great soul with these names,

original: uvāca viśvakarmāṇaṃ prasanno bhagavān raviḥ // / //
analyzed: uvāca viśvakarmāṇam prasannaḥ bhagavān raviḥ
translated: The pleased Lord Sun said to Vishvakarma:

original: bhramim āropya mām atra maṇḍalaṃ mama śātaya /
analyzed: bhramim āropya mām atra maṇḍalam mama śātaya
translated: Having placed me here in a circle, destroy my heat.

original: tvadbuddhisthaṃ mayā jñātam evam auṣṇyaṃ śamaṃ vrajet // / //
analyzed: tvad buddhi stham mayā jñātam evam auṣṇyam śamam vrajet
translated: I have understood what is in your mind. Thus, my heat will be pacified.

original: ityukto viśvakarmā ca tathā sa kṛtavān dvija /🔽śāntoṣṇaḥ savitā tasya duhitur viśvakarmaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ viśvakarmā ca tathā sa kṛtavān dvija  śānta uṣṇaḥ savitā tasya duhituḥ viśvakarmaṇaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Vishvakarma did as he was told, O Brahmin.🔽Savita's heat was pacified, and he became the son of Vishvakarma and his daughter

original: saṃjñāyāś cābhavad vipra bhānus tvaṣṭāram abravīt /
analyzed: saṃjñāyāḥ ca abhavat vipra bhānuḥ tvaṣṭāram abravīt
translated: Sanjna. Bhanu, the Sun, spoke to Tvashtar:

original: tvayā yasmāt stuto 'haṃ vai nāmnām aṣṭaśatena ca // / //
analyzed: tvayā yasmāt stutaḥ ham vai nāmnām aṣṭaśatena ca
translated: Since you praised me with eight hundred names,

original: varaṃ vṛṇīṣva tasmāt tvaṃ varado 'haṃ tavānagha /
analyzed: varam vṛṇīṣva tasmāt tvam vara daḥ ham tava anagha
translated: choose a boon from me, O sinless one, for I am the giver of boons.

original: ityukto bhānunā so 'tha viśvakarmābravīd idam // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ bhānunā saḥ tha viśvakarmā abravīt idam
translated: Thus addressed by Bhanu, Vishvakarma said this:

original: varado yadi me deva varam etaṃ prayaccha me /
analyzed: vara daḥ yadi me deva varam etam prayaccha me
translated: If you are the giver of boons, O God, grant me this boon.

original: etais tu nāmabhis yas tvāṃ naraḥ stoṣyati nityaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: etaiḥ tu nāmabhiḥ yaḥ tvām naraḥ stoṣyati nityaśas
translated: The man who always praises you with these names,

original: tasya pāpakṣayaṃ deva kuru bhaktasya bhāskara // / //
analyzed: tasya pāpa kṣayam deva kuru bhaktasya bhāskara
translated: O God Bhaskara, let his sins be destroyed, O Bhaskara.

original: tenaivam ukto dinakṛt tatheti tvaṣṭāram uktvā virarāma bhāskaraḥ /
analyzed: tena evam uktaḥ dinakṛt tathā iti tvaṣṭāram uktvā virarāma bhāskaraḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the Sun said So be it to Tvashtar, and the Sun ceased.

original: saṃjñāṃ viśaṅkāṃ ravimaṇḍalasthitāṃ kṛtvā jagāmātha raviṃ prasādya // / //
analyzed: saṃjñām viśaṅkām ravi maṇḍala sthitām kṛtvā jagāma atha ravim prasādya
translated: Having made an agreement with the Sun, he went to the Sun and propitiated him.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe ekonaviṃśo 'dhyāya // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe ekonaviṃśaḥ dhyāya
translated: Thus ends the nineteenth chapter in the Narasimha Purana.

original: sāṃprataṃ mārutotpattiṃ vakṣyāmi dvijasattama /🔽purā devāsure yuddhe devair indrādibhir diteḥ // / //
analyzed: sāṃpratam māruta utpattim vakṣyāmi dvijasattama  purā devāsure yuddhe devaiḥ indra ādibhiḥ diteḥ
translated: Now, O best of Brahmins, I shall describe the origin of the wind.

original: ḥputrāḥ parābhūtā ditiś ca vinaṣṭaputrā mahendradarpaharaṃ putram icchantī kaśyapam ṛṣiṃ svapatim // / //
analyzed: parābhūtāḥ ditiḥ ca vinaṣṭa putrā mahā indra darpa haram putram icchantī kaśyapam ṛṣim sva patim ārādhayāmasa
translated: In ancient times, in the battle between the gods and demons, the sons of Diti were defeated and Diti, having lost her sons, desiring a son to remove the pride of Indra, approached her husband, the sage Kashyapa.

original: ḥsa ca tapasā saṃtuṣṭo garbhādhānaṃ cakāra tasyām /
analyzed: ḥsa ca tapasā saṃtuṣṭaḥ garbhādhānam cakāra tasyām
translated: He, being pleased with her austerities, performed the garbhādhāna (a Vedic sacrament performed for the fetus in the womb) for her.

original: ḥpunas tām evam uktavān // / //
analyzed: ḥpunar tām evam uktavān
translated: He again spoke to her thus:

original: ḥyadi tvaṃ śuciḥ satī śaracchatam imaṃ garbhaṃ dhārayiṣyasi tataś ca mahendradarpahantā putro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ḥyadi tvam śuciḥ satī śarad śatam imam garbham dhārayiṣyasi tatas ca mahā indra darpa hantā putraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: If you, being pure, will carry this fetus for a hundred autumns, then a son will be born who will remove the pride of Indra.

original: ḥity evam uktā sā ca taṃ garbhaṃ // / //
analyzed: ḥiti evam uktā sā ca tam garbham dhārayāmasa
translated: Thus addressed, she carried that fetus for a hundred autumns.

original: ḥindro 'pi taj jñātvā vṛddhabrāhmaṇarūpeṇāgatya ditipārśvaṃ sthitavān /
analyzed: indraḥ pi tat jñātvā vṛddha brāhmaṇa rūpeṇa āgatya diti pārśvam sthitavān
translated: Indra, having come to know this, assumed the form of an old Brahmin and approached Diti and stood by her side.

original: ḥkiṃcid ūnapūrṇe varṣaśate pādaśaucam akṛtvā ditiḥ śayanam āruhya nidrāṃ gatā // / //
