analyzed: ḥpurukuśyāt dṛṣadaḥ dṛṣadāt abhiśaṃbhuḥ  ḥabhiśaṃbhoḥ dāruṇaḥ dāruṇāt sagaraḥ
translated: From Purukutsa came Dṛṣada, from Dṛṣada Abhiśambhu.🔽From Abhiśambhu came Dāruṇa, from Dāruṇa Sagara.

original: ḥsagarād dharyaśvo haryaśvād dhārīto hārītād rohitāśvaḥ /
analyzed: ḥsagarāt haryaśvaḥ haryaśvāt dhārītaḥ hārītāt rohitāśvaḥ
translated: From Sagara came Haryyāśva, from Haryyāśva Hārīta, from Hārīta Rohiṇāśva.

original: ḥrohitāśvād aṃśumān // / //
analyzed: ḥrohitāśvāt aṃśumān
translated: From Rohiṇāśva came Aṃśumān.

original: ḥaṃśumato bhagīrathaḥ /
analyzed: ḥaṃśumataḥ bhagīrathaḥ
translated: From Aṃśumān came Bhagīratha.

original: ḥyena mahatā tapasā purā divo gaṅgā aśeṣakalmaṣanāśinī caturvidhapuruṣārthadāyinī bhuvam ānītā /
analyzed: ḥyena mahatā tapasā purā divaḥ gaṅgā aśeṣa kalmaṣa nāśinī caturvidha puruṣa artha dāyinī bhuvam ānītā
translated: By whom in ancient times, with great austerity, the Ganges, which destroys all sins and grants the four goals of human life, was brought down to earth.

original: ḥasthiśarkarābhūtāḥ kapilamaharṣinirdagdhāś ca guravaḥ sagarākhyā gaṅgātoyasaṃspṛṣṭā divam āropitāḥ /
analyzed: ḥasthiśarkarā bhūtāḥ kapila mahā ṛṣi nirdagdhāḥ ca guravaḥ sagara ākhyāḥ gaṅgā toya saṃspṛṣṭāḥ divam āropitāḥ
translated: The ancestors named Sagara, who had become a heap of bones burned by the great sage Kapila, were raised to heaven by the touch of the Ganges water.

original: ḥbhagīrathāt saudāsaḥ saudāsāt satrasavaḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥbhagīrathāt saudāsaḥ saudāsāt satrasavaḥ
translated: From Bhagīratha came Saudāsa, from Saudāsa Satrasaha.

original: ḥsatrasavād anaraṇyo 'naraṇyād dīrghabāhuḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥsatrasavāt anaraṇyaḥ naraṇyāt dīrgha bāhuḥ
translated: From Satrasaha came Anaraṇya, from Anaraṇya Dīrghabāhu.

original: ḥdīrghabāhor ajo 'jād daśarathaḥ /
analyzed: ḥ dīrghabāhoḥ ajaḥ jāt daśarathaḥ
translated: From Dīrghabāhu came Aja, from Aja Daśaratha.

original: ḥtasya gṛhe rāvaṇavināśārthaṃ sākṣān nārāyaṇo 'vatīrṇo rāmaḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥtasya gṛhe rāvaṇa vināśa artham sākṣāt nārāyaṇaḥ vatīrṇaḥ rāmaḥ
translated: In his house, Rāma, who is actually Nārāyaṇa, descended for the purpose of destroying Rāvaṇa.

original: ḥsa tu pitṛvacanād bhrātṛbhāryāsahito daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ prāpya tapaś cacāra /
analyzed: ḥsa tu pitṛ vacanāt bhrātṛ bhāryā sahitaḥ daṇḍaka araṇyam prāpya tapaḥ cacāra
translated: He, at the words of his father, having reached the Dandaka forest with his brother's wife, practiced austerities.

original: ḥvane rāvaṇāpahṛtabhāryo bhrātrā saha duḥkhito 'nekakoṭivānaranāyakasugrīvasahāyo
analyzed: rāvaṇa apahṛta bhāryaḥ bhrātrā saha duḥkhitaḥ neka koṭi vānara nāyaka sugrīva sahāyaḥ
translated: Deprived of his wife by Ravana in the forest, sorrowful with his brother, with Sugriva, the leader of many crores of monkeys as his ally,

original: mahodadhau setuṃ nibadhya tair gatvā laṅkāṃ rāvaṇaṃ devakaṇṭakaṃ sabāndhavaṃ hatvā
analyzed: mahā udadhau setum nibadhya taiḥ gatvā laṅkām rāvaṇam deva kaṇṭakam sa bāndhavam hatvā
translated: having built a bridge over the great ocean, having gone with them to Lanka, having killed Ravana, the thorn of the gods, along with his relatives,

original: sītām ādāya punar ayodhyāṃ prāpya bharatābhiṣikto vibhīṣaṇāya laṅkārājyaṃ vimānaṃ
analyzed: sītām ādāya punar ayodhyām prāpya bharata abhiṣiktaḥ vibhīṣaṇāya laṅkā rājyam vimānam
translated: having taken Sita, having reached Ayodhya again, consecrated by Bharata, having given the kingdom of Lanka and an airplane

original: vā dattvā taṃ /
analyzed: vā dattvā tam preṣayāmasa
translated: to Vibhishana,

original: ḥsa tu parameśvaro vimānastho vibhīṣaṇena nīyamāno laṅkāyām api rākṣasapuryāṃ vastum anicchan puṇyāraṇyaṃ tatra sthāpitavān // / //
analyzed: ḥsa tu parameśvaraḥ vimāna sthaḥ vibhīṣaṇena nīyamānaḥ laṅkāyām api rākṣasa puryām vastum an icchan puṇya araṇyam tatra sthāpitavān
translated: he, the Supreme Lord, being carried by Vibhishana in the airplane, not desiring to stay even in the demon city of Lanka, established a sacred forest there.

original: ḥtan nirīkṣya tatraiva mahāhibhogaśayane bhagavān śete /
analyzed: nirīkṣya tatra eva mahā ahi bhoga śayane bhagavān śete
translated: Having seen that, the Lord lies down there on a bed of the coils of a great serpent.

original: ḥso 'pi vibhīṣaṇas tatas tadvimānaṃ netum asamarthaḥ tadvacanāt svāṃ purīṃ jagāma // / //
analyzed: vibhīṣaṇaḥ tatas tat vimānam netum asamarthaḥ tad vacanāt svām purīm jagāma
translated: Vibhishana, being unable to take that airplane further, went to his own city at his words.

original: ḥnārāyaṇasaṃnidhānān mahad vaiṣṇavaṃ kṣetram abhavad adyāpi dṛśyate /
analyzed: mahat vaiṣṇavam kṣetram abhavat adya api dṛśyate
translated: Due to Narayana's presence, it became a great Vaishnava holy place, which is still seen today.

original: ḥrāmāl lavo lavāt padmaḥ padmād ṛtuparṇa ṛṭuparṇād astrapāṇiḥ /
analyzed: ḥrāmāt lavaḥ lavāt padmaḥ padmāt ṛtuparṇaḥ ṛṭuparṇāt astrapāṇiḥ
translated: From Rama, Lava; from Lava, Padma; from Padma, Rituparna; from Rituparna, Astrapani.

original: ḥastrapāṇeḥ śuddhodanaḥ śuddhodanād buddhaḥ /
analyzed: ḥastrapāṇeḥ śuddhodanaḥ śuddhodanāt buddhaḥ
translated: From Astrapani, Shuddhodana; from Shuddhodana, Buddha.

original: ḥbuddhād vaṃśo nivartate // / //
analyzed: ḥ buddhāt vaṃśaḥ nivartate
translated: From Buddha, the lineage ceases.

original: ete mahīpā ravivaṃśajās tava prādhānyatas te kathitā mahābalāḥ /
analyzed: ete mahīpāḥ ravi vaṃśa jāḥ tava prādhānyataḥ te kathitāḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: These kings born in the solar dynasty, the most powerful, have been described to you.

original: purātanair yair vasudhā prapālitā yajñakriyābhiś ca divaukasair nṛpaiḥ // / //
analyzed: purātanaiḥ yaiḥ vasudhā prapālitā yajña kriyābhiḥ ca divaukasaiḥ nṛpaiḥ
translated: By whom the earth was ruled in ancient times, and by whom the gods were worshipped through sacrifices, O king.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe sūryavaṃśānucaritaṃ nāma ṣaḍviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe sūryavaṃśānucaritam nāma ṣaḍviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-sixth chapter named The Succession of the Solar Dynasty in the Narasimha Purana.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Sūta said:

original: ḥatha somavaṃśodbhavānāṃ bhūbhujāṃ saṃkṣepeṇa caritam ucyate // / //
analyzed: atha soma vaṃśa udbhavānām bhūbhujām saṃkṣepeṇa caritam ucyate
translated: Now, the brief history of the kings born in the lunar dynasty is being told.

original: ḥādau tāvat samastaṃ trailokyaṃ kukṣau kṛtvā ekārṇave mahāmbhasi nāgabhogaśayane // / //
analyzed: ḥādau tāvat samastam trailokyam kukṣau kṛtvā ekārṇave mahā ambhasi nāga bhoga śayane
translated: First of all, having placed the entire three worlds in his belly, he lay on the hood of the serpent in the great ocean of water.

original: ḥṛṅmayo yajurmayaḥ sāmamayo 'tharvamayo bhagavān nārāyaṇo yoganidrāṃ samārebhe /
analyzed: ṛk mayaḥ yajuḥ mayaḥ sāma mayaḥ tharva mayaḥ bhagavān nārāyaṇaḥ yoganidrām samārebhe
translated: The illustrious Narayana, consisting of the Rig Veda, Yajur Veda, Sama Veda, and Atharva Veda, began the sleep of yoga.

original: ḥtasya suptasya nābhau mahāpadmam ajāyata /
analyzed: ḥtasya suptasya nābhau mahāpadmam ajāyata
translated: While he was sleeping, a great lotus arose from his navel.

original: ḥtasmin padme caturmukho brahmābhavat // / //
analyzed: ḥtasmin padme catur mukhaḥ brahmā abhavat
translated: On that lotus, the four-faced Brahma came into being.

original: ḥtasya brahmaṇo mānasaḥ putro 'trir abhavat /
analyzed: ḥtasya brahmaṇaḥ mānasaḥ putraḥ u tris abhavat
translated: The mental son of that Brahman was Atri.

original: ḥatrer anasūyāyāṃ somaḥ /
analyzed: ḥatreḥ anasūyāyām somaḥ
translated: Soma was born to Atri and Anasūyā.

original: ḥsa tu prajāpater dakṣasya trayastriṃśat kanyā rohiṇyādyā bhāryārthaṃ gṛhītvā priyāyāṃ jyeṣṭhāyāṃ viśeṣāt prasannamanāḥ rohiṇyāṃ budhaṃ putram 🔽
analyzed: ḥsa tu prajāpateḥ dakṣasya trayastriṃśat kanyāḥ rohiṇī ādyāḥ bhāryā artham gṛhītvā priyāyām jyeṣṭhāyām viśeṣāt prasanna manāḥ rohiṇyām budham putram  utpādayāmasa
translated: He, having taken thirty-three daughters of Dakṣa, the lord of creatures, beginning with Rohiṇī, as his wives, was especially pleased with his beloved eldest wife Rohiṇī, and begot the son Budha in her.

original: ḥbudho 'pi sarvaśāstrajñaḥ pratiṣṭhāne pure 'vasat /
analyzed: ḥbudhaḥ pi sarva śāstra jñaḥ pratiṣṭhāne pure vasat
translated: Budha, also, knowing all the scriptures, dwelt in the city of Pratiṣṭhāna.

original: ḥilāyāṃ purūravasaṃ putram /
analyzed: ḥilāyām purūravasam putram utpādayāmasa
translated: He begot the son Purūravas in Ilā.

original: ḥtasyātiśayarūpānvitasya svargabhogān vihāya urvaśī bahukālaṃ bhāryā babhūva // / //
analyzed: ḥtasya atiśaya rūpa anvitasya svarga bhogān vihāya urvaśī bahu kālam bhāryā babhūva
translated: Of him, endowed with surpassing beauty, Urvaśī, forsaking the enjoyments of heaven, became a wife for a very long time.

original: ḥpurūravasaḥ urvaśyām āyuḥ putro jajñe /
analyzed: ḥ purūravasaḥ urvaśyām āyuḥ putraḥ jajñe
translated: Purūravas begot the son Āyu in Urvaśī.

original: ḥsa tu rājyaṃ dharmataḥ kṛtvā divam āruroha // / //
analyzed: ḥsa tu rājyam dharmataḥ kṛtvā divam āruroha
translated: He, having righteously ruled the kingdom, ascended to heaven.

original: ḥāyo rūpavatyāṃ nahuṣaḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: rūpavatyām nahuṣaḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: Āyu begot the son Nahuṣa in Rūpavatī.

original: ḥyenendratvaṃ prāptam /
analyzed: ḥyena indra tvam prāptam
translated: By whom the status of Indra was attained.

original: ḥnahuṣasyāpi pitṛmatyāṃ yayātiḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥnahuṣasya api pitṛmatyām yayātiḥ
translated: Nahuṣa also begot Yayāti in Paitāmahi.

original: ḥyasya vaṃśajā vṛṣṇayaḥ /🔽ḥyayāteḥ śarmiṣṭhāyāṃ pūrur abhavat // / //
analyzed: ḥyasya vaṃśa jāḥ vṛṣṇayaḥ  ḥyayāteḥ śarmiṣṭhāyām pūruḥ abhavat
translated: From whom the Vṛṣṇis were born.🔽Yayāti begot Puru in Śarmiṣṭhā.

original: ḥpūror vaṃśadāyāṃ saṃyātiḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: ḥpūroḥ vaṃśa dāyām saṃyātiḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: Puru begot the son Saṃyāti in Vamśadā.

original: ḥyasya pṛthivyāṃ saṃpannāḥ sarve kāmāḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥyasya pṛthivyām saṃpannāḥ sarve kāmāḥ
translated: He whose desires were fulfilled on the earth.

original: ḥsaṃyāter bhānudattāyāṃ sārvabhaumaḥ /
analyzed: ḥsaṃyāteḥ bhānu dattāyām sārvabhaumaḥ
translated: The universal monarch was born to Samyāti from Bhānu-dattā.

original: ḥsa tu sarvāṃ pṛthivīṃ dharmeṇa paripālayan narasiṃhaṃ bhagavantam ārādhya yāgadānaiḥ siddhim āpa // / //
analyzed: ḥsa tu sarvām pṛthivīm dharmeṇa paripālayan narasiṃham bhagavantam ārādhya yāga dānaiḥ siddhim āpa
translated: He, ruling the entire earth righteously, propitiated Lord Nṛsiṃha and attained perfection through sacrifices and gifts.

original: ḥtasya sārvabhaumasya vaidehyāṃ bhojaḥ /
analyzed: ḥtasya sārvabhaumasya vaidehyām bhojaḥ
translated: The universal monarch had a son named Bhojā from Vaidehī.

original: ḥyasya vaṃśe purā devāsurasaṃgrāme viṣṇucakrahataḥ kālanemiḥ kaṃso bhūtvā vṛṣṇivaṃśajena vāsudevena ghātito nidhanaṃ gataḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥyasya vaṃśe purā devāsura saṃgrāme viṣṇu cakra hataḥ kālanemiḥ kaṃsaḥ bhūtvā vṛṣṇi vaṃśa jena vāsudevena ghātitaḥ nidhanam gataḥ
translated: In whose family, in the battle between gods and demons in ancient times, Kālanemi, killed by Viṣṇu's discus, became Kaṃsa and was slain by Vāsudeva born in the Yadu dynasty.

original: ḥtasya bhojasya kaliṅgāyāṃ duṣyantaḥ /
analyzed: ḥtasya bhojasya kaliṅgāyām duṣyantaḥ
translated: Bhojā had a son named Duṣyanta from Kaliṅgā.

original: ḥsa tu narasiṃhaṃ bhagavantam ārādhya tatprasādān niṣkaṇṭakaṃ rājyaṃ dharmeṇa kṛtvā divaṃ prāptavān /
analyzed: ḥsa tu narasiṃham bhagavantam ārādhya tad prasādāt niṣkaṇṭakam rājyam dharmeṇa kṛtvā divam prāptavān
translated: He, propitiating Lord Nṛsiṃha, and by his grace ruling the kingdom free from thorns righteously, attained heaven.

original: ḥduṣyantasya śakuntalāyāṃ bharataḥ sa tu dharmeṇa rājyaṃ kurvan kratubhir bhūridakṣiṇaiḥ🔽sarvadevatāmayaṃ bhagavantam ārādhya nivṛttādhikāro brahmadhyānaparo vaiṣṇave pare
analyzed: ḥduṣyantasya śakuntalāyām bharataḥ sa tu dharmeṇa rājyam kurvan kratubhiḥ bhūri dakṣiṇaiḥ  sarva devatā mayam bhagavantam ārādhya nivṛtta adhikāraḥ brahma dhyāna paraḥ vaiṣṇave pare
translated: Duṣyanta's son Bharata, ruling the kingdom righteously with many sacrificial gifts,🔽propitiated the Lord, the essence of all gods, and after his duties were over, devoted to Brahman meditation,

original: jyotiṣi layam avāpa // / //
analyzed: jyotiṣi layam avāpa
translated: attained absorption in the supreme light of Viṣṇu.

original: ḥbharatasya ānandāyām ajamīḍhaḥ /
analyzed: ḥbharatasya ānandāyām ajamīḍhaḥ
translated: Ajamedha was born to Bharata in Ananadā.

original: ḥsa ca paramavaiṣṇavo narasiṃham ārādhya jātaputro dharmeṇa kṛtarājyo viṣṇupuram āruroha // / //
analyzed: ḥsa ca parama vaiṣṇavaḥ narasiṃham ārādhya jāta putraḥ dharmeṇa kṛta rājyaḥ viṣṇu puram āruroha
translated: He, a great devotee of Viṣṇu, having propitiated Narasiṃha and obtained a son, ruled the kingdom righteously and ascended to Viṣṇu's abode.

original: ḥajamīḍhasya sudevyāṃ vṛṣṇiḥ putro 'bhavat /
analyzed: ḥajamīḍhasya sudevyām vṛṣṇiḥ putraḥ bhavat
translated: Vṛṣṇi was born to Ajamedha from Sudevā.

original: ḥso 'pi bahuvarṣaṃ dharmeṇa rājyaṃ kurvan duṣṭanigrahaṃ śiṣṭaparipālanaṃ saptadvīpāṃ vaśe cakre /
analyzed: ḥsaḥ pi bahu varṣam dharmeṇa rājyam kurvan duṣṭa nigraham śiṣṭa paripālanam saptadvīpām vaśe cakre
translated: He too, ruling the earth righteously for many years, controlling the wicked and protecting the virtuous, brought the seven islands under his sway.

original: ḥvṛṣṇer ugrasenāyāṃ pratyañcaḥ putro babhūva // / //
analyzed: vṛṣṇeḥ ugrasenāyām pratyañcaḥ putraḥ babhūva
translated: Pratyaka was born to Vṛṣṇi from Ugrasena.

original: ḥso 'pi dharmeṇa medinīṃ pālayan pratisaṃvatsaraṃ jyotiṣṭomaṃ cakāra /
analyzed: ḥsaḥ pi dharmeṇa medinīm pālayan pratisaṃvatsaram jyotiṣṭomam cakāra
translated: He too, ruling the earth righteously, performed the Jyotiṣṭoma sacrifice every year.

original: ḥnirvāṇam api labdhavān /
analyzed: ḥnirvāṇam api labdhavān
translated: He attained liberation.

original: ḥpratyañcasya bahurūpāyāṃ śāṃtanuḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥ pratyañcasya bahu rūpāyām śāṃtanuḥ
translated: Śāntanu was born to Pratyaka from Bahurūpā.

original: ḥtasya devadattasyandanārohaṇam aśakyaṃ babhūva purataḥ śakyaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: ḥtasya devadatta syandana ārohaṇam aśakyam babhūva puratas śakyam ca
translated: It was impossible for him to ascend the chariot before Devadatta, but possible afterwards.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe somavaṃśavarṇanaṃ nāma saptaviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe somavaṃśavarṇanam nāma saptaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-seventh chapter named the description of the Lunar dynasty in the Śrī Narasiṃha Purāṇa.

original: bharadvāja uvāca /
analyzed: bharadvājaḥ uvāca
translated: Bharadvaja said:

original: syandanārohaṇe pūrvam aśaktiḥ śāṃtanoḥ katham /
analyzed: syandana ārohaṇe pūrvam aśaktiḥ śāṃtanoḥ katham
translated: How was Śantanu previously unable to ascend the chariot?

original: paścāc chaktiḥ kathaṃ cāsīt tasya vai tad vadasva naḥ // / //
analyzed: paścāt śaktiḥ katham ca āsīt tasya vai tat vadasva naḥ
translated: What was his strength later? Tell us that.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Sūta said:

original: bharadvāja śṛṇuṣvaitat purāvṛttaṃ vadāmi te /
analyzed: bharadvāja śṛṇuṣva etat purāvṛttam vadāmi te
translated: O Bharadvaja, listen to this ancient account that I shall tell you.

original: sarvapāpaharaṃ tad dhi caritaṃ śāṃtanor nṛṇām // / //
analyzed: sarva pāpa haram tat hi caritam śāṃtanoḥ nṛṇām
translated: That conduct of Śāntanu removes all the sins of men.

original: babhūva śāṃtanur bhakto narasiṃhatanau purā /
analyzed: babhūva śāṃtanuḥ bhaktaḥ narasiṃha tanau purā
translated: Formerly, Śāntanu was devoted to the form of Narasiṃha.

original: nāradoktavidhānena mādhavam // / //🔽narasiṃhasya devasya nirmālyaṃ tena laṅghitam /
analyzed: nārada ukta vidhānena pūjayāmasa mādhavam  narasiṃhasya devasya nirmālyam tena laṅghitam
translated: According to the method told by Nārada, he worshipped Mādhava.

original: rājñā śāṃtanunā vipra tasmāt syandanam uttamam // / //
analyzed: rājñā śāṃtanunā vipra tasmāt syandanam uttamam
translated: O brāhmaṇa, that king Śāntanu transgressed the remnants of the worship of god Narasiṃha.

original: devadattaṃ tad āroḍhum aśaktas tatkṣaṇād abhūt /
analyzed: devadattam tat āroḍhum aśaktaḥ tad kṣaṇāt abhūt
translated: Therefore, he became instantly incapable of ascending that excellent chariot given by the god.

original: kim iyaṃ me gatir bhagnā sahasā vai rathāt tataḥ // / //
analyzed: kim iyam me gatiḥ bhagnā sahasā vai rathāt tatas
translated: Why is my movement suddenly obstructed from this chariot?

original: duḥkhaṃ cintayatas tasya saṃprāpto nāradaḥ kila /
analyzed: duḥkham cintayataḥ tasya saṃprāptaḥ nāradaḥ kila
translated: While he was thinking like this, Nārada came to him.

original: kiṃ viṣaṇṇaḥ sthito rājann iti pṛṣṭaḥ sa śāṃtanuḥ // / //
analyzed: kim viṣaṇṇaḥ sthitaḥ rājan iti pṛṣṭaḥ sa śāṃtanuḥ
translated: When asked, O king, why are you dejected? Śāntanu said:

original: nāradaitan na jānāmi gatibhaṅgasya kāraṇam /
analyzed: nārada etat na jānāmi gati bhaṅgasya kāraṇam
translated: O Nārada, I do not know the cause of this obstruction in my movement.

original: ityukto nārado dhyātvā jñātvā tatkāraṇaṃ tataḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ nāradaḥ dhyātvā jñātvā tad kāraṇam tatas
translated: When this was said, Nārada meditated and knowing the cause,

original: śāṃtanuṃ prāha rājānaṃ vinayena yataḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: śāṃtanum prāha rājānam vinayena yatas sthitaḥ
translated: he spoke to king Śāntanu, who was standing humbly:

original: yatra kvāpi tvayā rājan narasiṃhasya vai dhruvam // / //
analyzed: yatra kvāpi tvayā rājan narasiṃhasya vai dhruvam
translated: O king, wherever you may be, you must certainly

original: nirmālyo laṅghitas tasmād rathārohaṇakarmaṇi /
analyzed: nirmālyaḥ laṅghitaḥ tasmāt ratha ārohaṇa karmaṇi
translated: have transgressed the garland of Lord Narasimha. Therefore, in the act of ascending the chariot,

original: gatir bhagnā mahārāja śrūyatām atra kāraṇam // / //
analyzed: gatiḥ bhagnā mahā rāja śrūyatām atra kāraṇam
translated: your progress has been obstructed, O great king. Listen to the reason here.

original: antarvedyāṃ purā rājann āsīt kaścin mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: antarvedyām purā rājan āsīt kaścid mahāmatiḥ
translated: O king, formerly in the inner sacrificial ground, there was a very intelligent man,

original: mālākāro ravir nāmnā tena vṛndāvanaṃ kṛtam // / //
analyzed: mālākāraḥ raviḥ nāmnā tena vṛndāvanam kṛtam
translated: named Ravi, a garland maker, by whom Vrindavan was created.

original: vividhāni ca puṣpārthaṃ vanāni sukṛtāni vai /
analyzed: vividhāni ca puṣpa artham vanāni su kṛtāni vai
translated: And various forests were well-made for the sake of flowers,

original: mallikāmālatījāti bakulādīni sarvaśaḥ // / //🔽prākāram ucchritaṃ tasya svabhūmau cāpi vistṛtam /
analyzed: mallikā mālatī jāti bakula ādīni sarvaśas  prākāram ucchritam tasya sva bhūmau ca api vistṛtam
translated: all kinds of jasmine, malati, jati, bakula and so on.🔽His enclosure was raised and extended on his own land,

original: alaṅghyam apraveśyaṃ ca kṛtvā cakre svakaṃ gṛham // / //
analyzed: a laṅghyam a praveśyam ca kṛtvā cakre svakam gṛham
translated: and having made it uncrossable and unenterable, he made his own house.

original: gṛhaṃ praviśya taddvāraṃ bhaven nānyatra sattama /
analyzed: gṛham praviśya tat dvāram bhavet na anyatra sattama
translated: Having entered the house, that door would be nowhere else, O best one.

original: evaṃ kṛtvā nu vasato mālākārasya dhīmataḥ // / //
analyzed: evam kṛtvā nu vasataḥ mālākārasya dhīmataḥ
translated: Having thus made it, the intelligent garland maker lived there.

original: puṣpitaṃ tad vanaṃ tv āsīd gandhāmoditadiṅmukham /🔽bhāryayā saha puṣpāṇi samāhṛtya dine dine // / //
analyzed: puṣpitam tat vanam tu āsīt gandha āmodita diṅmukham  bhāryayā saha puṣpāṇi samāhṛtya dine dine
translated: That forest was in full bloom, with its fragrance wafting in all directions.🔽Having collected flowers day after day with his wife,

original: kṛtvā mālāṃ yathānyāyaṃ narasiṃhasya nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtvā mālām yathānyāyam narasiṃhasya nityaśas
translated: having made a garland in the proper way, he always offered it to Narasimha.

original: dadau kāścid dvijebhyaś ca kāścid vikrīya poṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: dadau kāścid dvijebhyaḥ ca kāścid vikrīya poṣaṇam
translated: He gave some to the Brahmins and sold some for sustenance.

original: cakre samāt prajīvī ca bhāryāder ātmanas tathā /
analyzed: cakre samāt prajīvī ca bhāryā ādeḥ ātmanaḥ tathā
translated: He made arrangements for his livelihood, wife and self.

original: atha svargād upāgamya indraputro rathena vai // / //
analyzed: atha svargāt upāgamyaḥ indra putraḥ rathena vai
translated: Then, Indra's son, having come down from heaven by chariot,

original: apsarogaṇasaṃyukto niśi puṣpāṇi saṃharet /
analyzed: apsaraḥ gaṇa saṃyuktaḥ niśi puṣpāṇi saṃharet
translated: Accompanied by a group of celestial nymphs, would collect flowers at night.

original: tadgandhalipsuḥ sarvāṇi vicityāhṛtya gacchati // / //
analyzed: tad gandha lipsuḥ sarvāṇi vicitya āhṛtya gacchati
translated: Desiring the fragrance of all of them, he would collect them after examining and then leave.

original: dine dine hṛte puṣpe mālākāro 'py acintayat /
analyzed: dine dine hṛte puṣpe mālākāraḥ pi acintayat
translated: When the flower was taken away day by day, the garland maker also thought,

original: nānyad dvāraṃ vanasyāsyā laṅghyaprākāram unnatam // / //
analyzed: na anyat dvāram vanasya asyāḥ laṅghya prākāram unnatam
translated: There is no other way to enter this forest, with its high walls that cannot be breached.

original: samastapuṣpajātasya haraṇe niśi vai nṛṇām /
analyzed: samasta puṣpa jātasya haraṇe niśi vai nṛṇām
translated: In the nightly removal of all kinds of flowers by men,

original: ahaṃ śaktiṃ na paśyāmi kim idaṃ nu parīkṣaye // / //
analyzed: aham śaktim na paśyāmi kim idam nu parīkṣaye
translated: I do not see any means. What should I examine?

original: iti saṃcintya medhāvī jāgrad rātrau vane sthitaḥ /
analyzed: iti saṃcintya medhāvī jāgrat rātrau vane sthitaḥ
translated: Thinking thus, the wise one, awake at night, remained in the forest.

original: tathaivāgatya puṣpāṇi saṃgṛhītva gataḥ pumān // / //
analyzed: tathā eva āgatya puṣpāṇi saṃgṛhītvā gataḥ pumān
translated: The man came as before, collected the flowers and left.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā duḥkhito 'tīva mālyajīvī vane 'bhavat /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā tīva mālya jīvī vane bhavat
translated: Seeing him, the garland-maker became very unhappy in the forest.

original: tato nidrāṃ gataḥ svapne dṛṣṭavāṃs taṃ nṛkesarim // / //
analyzed: tatas nidrām gataḥ svapne dṛṣṭavān tam nṛkesarim
translated: Then, having fallen asleep, he saw that man-lion in a dream.

original: tadvākyaṃ śrutavāṃś caivaṃ nirmālyaṃ mama putraka /
analyzed: tad vākyam śrutavān ca evam nirmālyam mama putraka
translated: And having heard those words, My son, this is my garland-remnant,

original: ānīya kṣipyatāṃ kṣipraṃ puṣpārāmasamīpataḥ // / //
analyzed: ānīya kṣipyatām kṣipram puṣpārāma samīpataḥ
translated: Bring it quickly and throw it near the flower garden.

original: indraputrasya duṣṭasya nānyad asti nivāraṇam /
analyzed: indra putrasya duṣṭasya na anyat asti nivāraṇam
translated: There is no other way to stop the wicked son of Indra.

original: iti śrutvā harer vākyaṃ narasiṃhasya dhīmataḥ // / //
analyzed: iti śrutvā hareḥ vākyam narasiṃhasya dhīmataḥ
translated: Having heard these words of Hari, the wise Narasimha,

original: buddhvānīya tu nirmālyaṃ tathā cakre yathoditam /🔽so 'py āgatya yathāpūrvaṃ rathenālakṣitena tu // / //
analyzed: buddhvā ānīya tu nirmālyam tathā cakre yathā uditam  saḥ pi āgatya yathāpūrvam rathena alakṣitena tu
translated: he understood and brought the discarded offerings and did as instructed.🔽He too came as before, unnoticed by the chariot,

original: rathād uttīrya puṣpāṇi vicinvaṃs tadbhuvi sthitam /
analyzed: rathāt uttīrya puṣpāṇi vicinvan tad bhuvi sthitam
translated: having descended from the chariot, searching for flowers, he stood on that ground.

original: nirmālyaṃ indrasūnur aniṣṭakṛt // / //
analyzed: nirmālyam laṅghayāmase indra sūnuḥ aniṣṭa kṛt
translated: The son of Indra, the doer of undesirable acts, the discarded offerings,

original: tatas tasya na śaktiḥ syad rathārohaṇakarmaṇi /
analyzed: tatas tasya na śaktiḥ syat ratha ārohaṇa karmaṇi
translated: then he would not have the ability to ascend the chariot.

original: uktaḥ sārathinā caiva rathasyārohaṇe tava // / //
analyzed: uktaḥ sārathinā ca eva rathasya ārohaṇe tava
translated: And the charioteer said to him, In your ascent of the chariot,

original: narasiṃhasya nirmālya laṅghane nāsti yogyatā /
analyzed: narasiṃhasya nirmālya laṅghane nāsti yogyatā
translated: there is no eligibility in trampling on the discarded offerings of Narasimha.

original: gacchāmi divam evāhaṃ tvaṃ bhūmyāṃ vasa māruha // / //
analyzed: gacchāmi divam eva aham tvam bhūmyām vasa mā āruha
translated: I will go to heaven itself, you stay on earth, mount the chariot.

original: tenaivam ukto matimāṃs tam āha harinandanaḥ /
analyzed: tena evam uktaḥ matimān tam āha harinandanaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the wise son of Hari said to him,

original: pāpasya nodanaṃ tv atra karmaṇā yena me bhavet // / //
analyzed: pāpasya nodanam tu atra karmaṇā yena me bhavet
translated: By what action can I incite his sin here,

original: tad uktvā gaccha nākaṃ tvaṃ karmāsmān sārathe drutam // / //
analyzed: tat uktvā gaccha nākam tvam karma asmān sārathe drutam
translated: having said that, go to heaven, O charioteer, quickly perform the act for me.

original: sārathir uvāca /
analyzed: sārathiḥ uvāca
translated: The charioteer said:

original: rāmasattre kurukṣetre dvādaśābde tu nityaśaḥ // / //
analyzed: rāmasattre kurukṣetre dvādaśa abde tu nityaśas
translated: In the Rama sacrifice at Kurukshetra, for twelve years, every day.

original: dvijocchiṣṭāpanayanaṃ kṛtvā tvaṃ śuddhim eṣyasi /
analyzed: dvija ucchiṣṭa apanayanam kṛtvā tvam śuddhim eṣyasi
translated: Having removed the remnants of food from the Brahmins, you will attain purity.

original: ity uktvāsau gataḥ svargaṃ sārathir devasevitam // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā asau gataḥ svargam sārathiḥ deva sevitam
translated: Having said this, the charioteer went to heaven, served by the gods.

original: indrasūnuḥ kurukṣetraṃ prāptaḥ sārasvataṃ taṭam /
analyzed: indrasūnuḥ kurukṣetram prāptaḥ sārasvatam taṭam
translated: The son of Indra reached Kurukshetra, to the banks of the Sarasvati.

original: rāmasattre tathā kuryād dvijocchiṣṭasya mārjanam // / //
analyzed: rāmasattre tathā kuryāt dvija ucchiṣṭasya mārjanam
translated: And in the Rama sacrifice, he should remove the remnants of food from the Brahmins.

original: pūrṇe dvādaśame varṣe tam ūcuḥ śaṅkitā dvijāḥ /
analyzed: pūrṇe dvādaśame varṣe tam ūcuḥ śaṅkitāḥ dvijāḥ
translated: When the twelfth year was completed, the suspicious Brahmins said to him:

original: kas tvaṃ brūhi mahābhāga nityam ucchiṣṭamārjakaḥ // / //
analyzed: kaḥ tvam brūhi mahābhāga nityam ucchiṣṭa mārjakaḥ
translated: Who are you, O blessed one? You are always removing the remnants of food.

original: na bhuñjase ca naḥ sattre śaṅkā no mahatī bhavet /
analyzed: na bhuñjase ca naḥ sattre śaṅkā naḥ mahatī bhavet
translated: You do not eat in our sacrifice. We have great suspicion.

original: ityuktaḥ kathayitvā tu yathāvṛttam anukramāt // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ kathayitvā tu yathāvṛttam anukramāt
translated: Thus addressed, he told them everything in due order,

original: jagāma tridivaṃ kṣipraṃ rathena tanayo hareḥ /
analyzed: jagāma tridivam kṣipram rathena tanayaḥ hareḥ
translated: And quickly went to heaven in a chariot, the son of Hari.

original: tasmāt tvam api bhūpāla brāhmaṇocchiṣṭam ādarāt // / //
analyzed: tasmāt tvam api bhūpāla brāhmaṇa ucchiṣṭam ādarāt
translated: Therefore, O king, you should respectfully remove the remnants of food from the Brahmins,

original: mārjanaṃ kuru rāmasya sattre dvādaśavārṣike /
analyzed: mārjanam kuru rāmasya sattre dvādaśa vārṣike
translated: In the twelve-year sacrifice of Rama.

original: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ paraṃ nāsti sarvapāpaharaṃ param // / //
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ param na asti sarva pāpa haram param
translated: There is nothing higher than the Brahmins, nothing higher than the remover of all sins.

original: evaṃ kṛte devadatta syandanārohaṇe gatiḥ /
analyzed: evam kṛte devadatta syandana ārohaṇe gatiḥ
translated: When this is done, O Devadatta, there is the attainment of riding in a chariot.

original: bhaviṣyati mahīpāla prāyaścitte kṛte tava // / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyati mahīpāla prāyaścitte kṛte tava
translated: O king, when the expiation is performed by you, it will be so.

original: ata ūrdhvaṃ ca nirmālyaṃ mā laṅghaya mahāmate /
analyzed: atas ūrdhvam ca nirmālyam mā laṅghaya mahāmate
translated: Hereafter, do not transgress the remnants of worship, O greatly wise one,

original: narasiṃhasya devasya tathānyeṣāṃ divaukasām // / //🔽ityuktaḥ śāṃtanus tena brāhmaṇocchiṣṭamārjanam /
analyzed: narasiṃhasya devasya tathā anyeṣām divaukasām  iti uktaḥ śāṃtanuḥ tena brāhmaṇa ucchiṣṭa mārjanam
translated: Of Lord Narasimha and other gods.🔽 Thus addressed by him, Shantanu,

original: kṛtavān dvādaśābdaṃ tu āruroha rathaṃ ca tam // / //
analyzed: kṛtavān dvādaśa abdam tu āruroha ratham ca tam
translated: Having performed the purification of the remnants of the Brahmana's food for twelve years, ascended that chariot.

original: evaṃ purvam aśaktiḥ syād rathārohe mahīkṣitaḥ /
analyzed: evam syāt ratha ārohe mahīkṣitaḥ
translated: Thus, O lord of the earth, in the beginning, the king was unable to ascend the chariot.

original: paścāt tasyaiva viprendra śaktir evam ajāyata // / //
analyzed: paścāt tasya eva vipra indra śaktiḥ evam ajāyata
translated: But later, O best of Brahmanas, he became able.

original: evaṃ te kathito vipra doṣo nirmālyalaṅghane /
analyzed: evam te kathitaḥ vipra doṣaḥ nirmālya laṅghane
translated: Thus, O Brahmin, the sin of transgressing the remnants of worship has been told by me.

original: puṇyaṃ tathā dvijānāṃ tu proktam ucchiṣṭamārjane // / //
analyzed: puṇyam tathā dvijānām tu proktam ucchiṣṭa mārjane
translated: And the merit of purifying the remnants of Brahmins has been described.

original: bhaktyā dvijocchiṣṭam ihāpamārjayec chucir naro yaḥ susamāhitātmā /
analyzed: bhaktyā dvija ucchiṣṭam iha apamārjayet śuciḥ naraḥ yaḥ su samāhita ātmā
translated: A pure man who, with a well-composed mind, wipes the remnants of a Brahmin here with devotion,

original: sa pāpabandhaṃ pravihāya bhuṅkte gavāṃ pradānasya phalaṃ divi sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa pāpa bandham pravihāya bhuṅkte gavām pradānasya phalam divi sthitaḥ
translated: He, having abandoned the bondage of sin, enjoys the fruit of giving cows, remaining in heaven.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe śāṃtanucaritaṃ nāmāṣṭaviṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe śāṃtanucaritam nāma aṣṭaviṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-eighth chapter in the Narasimha Purana, named the story of Shantanu.

original: śrīsūta uvācaḥ
analyzed: śrī sūtaḥ uvācaḥ
translated: Shrisuta said:

original: ḥśaṃtanayor yojanagandhāyāṃ vicitravīryaḥ /
analyzed: ḥśaṃtanayoḥ yojana gandhāyām vicitra vīryaḥ
translated: Shantanu had a son named Vichitravirya through his wife Ganga.

original: ḥsa tu hastināpure sthitvā prajāḥ svadharmeṇa pālayan devāṃś ca yāgaiḥ pitṛṃś ca śrāddhaiḥ saṃtarpya saṃjātaputro divam āruroha // /
analyzed: ḥsa tu hastināpure sthitvā prajāḥ svadharmeṇa pālayan devān ca yāgaiḥ pitṛn ca śrāddhaiḥ saṃtarpya saṃjāta putraḥ divam āruroha  /
translated: He ruled the kingdom righteously from Hastinapura, satisfied the gods with sacrifices and the ancestors with funeral ceremonies, and after begetting sons ascended to heaven.

original: ḥvicitravīryasyāmbālikāyāṃ pāṇḍuḥ putro jajñe /
analyzed: vicitravīryasya ambālikāyām pāṇḍuḥ putraḥ jajñe
translated: Vichitravirya had a son named Pandu through his wife Ambika.

original: ḥso 'pi rājyaṃ dharmataḥ kṛtvā muniśāpāc charīraṃ vihāya devalokam avāpa /
analyzed: ḥsaḥ pi rājyam dharmataḥ kṛtvā muni śāpāt śarīram vihāya deva lokam avāpa
translated: He too ruled the kingdom righteously, but due to a sage's curse he left his body and went to heaven.

original: ḥtasya pāṇḍoḥ kuntidevyām arjunaḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥtasya pāṇḍoḥ kuntidevyām arjunaḥ
translated: Pandu had a son named Arjuna through Kunti.

original: ḥsa tu mahatā tapasā śaṃkaraṃ toṣayitvā pāśupatam astram avāpya triviṣṭapādhipateḥ
analyzed: ḥsa tu mahatā tapasā śaṃkaram toṣayitvā pāśupatam astram avāpya triviṣṭapa adhipateḥ
translated: He pleased Shiva with great austerities, obtained the Pashupata weapon, and killed the enemies of Indra,

original: śatrūn nivātakavacān dānavān hatvā khāṇḍavavanam agner yathāruci nivedya tṛptāgnito
analyzed: śatrūn nivāta kavacān dānavān hatvā khāṇḍava vanam agneḥ yathāruci nivedya
translated: the Nivatakavachas, and offered the Khandava forest to Agni as he wished.

original: divyān varān avāpya suyodhanena hṛtarājyo dharmabhīmanakulasahadevadraupadīsahito
analyzed: divyān varān avāpya suyodhanena hṛta rājyaḥ dharma bhīma nakula sahadeva draupadī sahitaḥ
translated: After obtaining divine boons, he lost his kingdom to Suyodhana and lived incognito with Dharma, Bhima, Nakula, Sahadeva, and Draupadi

original: virāṭanagare 'jñātavāsaṃ caritvā gograhe ca bhīṣmadroṇakṛpaduryodhanakarṇādīn jitvā
analyzed: virāṭa nagare jñāta vāsam caritvā gograhe ca bhīṣma droṇa kṛpa duryodhana karṇa ādīn jitvā
translated: in Virata's city, and after defeating Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, Duryodhana, Karna, and others in the cattle raid,

original: samastagomaṇḍalaṃ nivartayitvā bhrātṛbhiḥ saha virāṭarājakṛtapūjo vāsudevasahitaḥ🔽kurukṣetre dhārtarāṣṭrair bahubalair yuddhaṃ kurvan bhīṣmadroṇakṛpaśalyakarṇādibhir
analyzed: samasta go maṇḍalam nivartayitvā bhrātṛbhiḥ saha virāṭa rāja kṛta pūjaḥ vāsudeva sahitaḥ  kurukṣetre dhārtarāṣṭraiḥ bahu balaiḥ yuddham kurvan bhīṣma droṇa kṛpa śalya karṇa ādibhiḥ
translated: Having brought back the entire cow-pen, along with his brothers, honored by King Virata, accompanied by Vasudeva,🔽fighting in Kurukshetra with the many powerful sons of Dhritarashtra, with Bhishma, Drona, Kripa, Shalya, Karna and others,

original: bhūriparākramaiḥ kṣatriyair nānādeśāgatair anekair api rājaputraiḥ saha duryodhanādīn
analyzed: bhūri parākramaiḥ kṣatriyaiḥ nānā deśa āgataiḥ anekaiḥ api rāja putraiḥ saha duryodhana ādīn
translated: with many powerful Kshatriyas who had come from various countries, and with many princes, having killed Duryodhana and the other sons of Dhritarashtra,

original: dhārtarāṣṭrān hatvā svarājyaṃ prāpya dharmeṇa rājyaṃ paripālya bhrātṛbhiḥ saha mudito
analyzed: dhārtarāṣṭrān hatvā sva rājyam prāpya dharmeṇa rājyam paripālya bhrātṛbhiḥ saha
translated: having regained his own kingdom, righteously ruling the kingdom, joyful with his brothers,

original: divam āruroha // / //
analyzed: divam āruroha
translated: he ascended to heaven.

original: ḥarjunasya subhadrāyām abhimanyuḥ /
analyzed: ḥarjunasya subhadrāyām abhimanyuḥ
translated: Arjuna had Abhimanyu through Subhadra.

original: ḥyena bhāratayuddhe cakravyūhaṃ praviśyānekabhūbhujo nidhanaṃ prāpitāḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥyena bhārata yuddhe cakra vyūham praviśya aneka bhūbhujaḥ nidhanam prāpitāḥ
translated: By whom, having entered the chakra vyuha in the Mahabharata war, many kings were brought to death.

original: ḥabhimanyor uttarāyāṃ parīkṣitaḥ /
analyzed: ḥabhimanyoḥ uttarāyām parīkṣitaḥ
translated: Abhimanyu had Parikshit through Uttara.

original: ḥso 'py abhiṣikto vanaṃ gacchatā dharmaputreṇa rājyaṃ kṛtvā rājaputro nākaṃ saṃprāpya reme // / //
analyzed: ḥsaḥ pi abhiṣiktaḥ vanam gacchatā dharmaputreṇa rājyam kṛtvā rāja putraḥ nākam saṃprāpya reme
translated: He too, having ruled the kingdom when Yudhishthira went to the forest, having become a prince, attained heaven and rejoiced.

original: ḥparīkṣitān mātṛvatyāṃ janamejayaḥ /
analyzed: ḥ parīkṣitān mātṛvatyām janamejayaḥ
translated: Parikshit had Janamejaya through Matsyavati.

original: ḥyena brahmahatyāvāraṇārthaṃ mahābhārataṃ vyāsaśiṣyād vaiśaṃpāyanāt sādyantaṃ śrutam // / //
analyzed: ḥyena brahmahatyā vāraṇa artham mahābhāratam vyāsa śiṣyāt vaiśaṃpāyanāt sādi antam śrutam
translated: By whom the Mahabharata was heard from the disciple of Vyasa, Vaishampayana, from beginning to end, for the purpose of warding off the sin of Brahmanicide.

original: ḥrājyaṃ ca dharmataḥ kṛtvā divam āruroha /
analyzed: ḥrājyam ca dharmataḥ kṛtvā divam āruroha
translated: Having righteously ruled the kingdom, he ascended to heaven.

original: ḥjanamejayasya puṣpavatyāṃ śatānīkaḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥ janamejayasya puṣpavatyām śatānīkaḥ
translated: Janamejaya's son Shatanika in Pushpavati...

original: ḥsa tu dharmeṇa rājyaṃ kurvan saṃsāraduḥkhād viraktaḥ śaunakopadeśena kriyāyogena sakalalokanāthaṃ viṣṇum ārādhya niṣkāmo vaiṣṇavaṃ padam avāpa
analyzed: ḥsa tu dharmeṇa rājyam kurvan saṃsāra duḥkhāt viraktaḥ śaunaka upadeśena kriyā yogena sakala loka nātham viṣṇum ārādhya niṣkāmaḥ vaiṣṇavam padam avāpa
translated: But he, ruling the kingdom righteously, detached from the sufferings of the world, having worshipped Vishnu, the lord of all people, by the yoga of action according to the instruction of Shaunaka, attained the desireless Vaishnava state.

original: ḥtasya śatānīkasya phalavatyāṃ sahasrānīkaḥ // / //
analyzed: śatānīkasya phalavatyām sahasrānīkaḥ
translated: Shatanika's son Sahasranika in Phalavati...

original: ḥsa tu bāla evābhiṣikto narasiṃhe 'tyantaṃ bhaktimān abhavat /
analyzed: ḥsa tu bālaḥ evā abhiṣiktaḥ narasiṃhe tyantam bhaktimān abhavat
translated: But he, consecrated even as a child, became extremely devoted to Narasimha.

original: ḥtasya caritam upariṣṭād bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: ḥtasya caritam upariṣṭāt bhaviṣyati
translated: And his story will be above...

original: ḥsahasrānīkasya mṛgavantyām udayanaḥ /
analyzed: ḥsahasrānīkasya mṛgavantyām udayanaḥ
translated: Sahasranika's son Udayana in Mrigavanti.

original: ḥso 'pi rājyaṃ kṛtvā dharmato nārāyaṇam ārādhya tatpuram avāpa // / //
analyzed: rājyam kṛtvā dharmataḥ nārāyaṇam ārādhya tat puram avāpa
translated: He also, having ruled the kingdom righteously, having worshipped Narayana, attained his city...

original: ḥudayanasya vāsavadattāyāṃ naravāhanaḥ /
analyzed: ḥudayanasya vāsavadattāyām naravāhanaḥ
translated: Udayana's son Naravahana in Vasavadatta.

original: ḥsa tu yathānyāyaṃ rājyaṃ kṛtvā divam avāpa /
analyzed: ḥsa tu yathānyāyam rājyam kṛtvā divam avāpa
translated: But he, having ruled the kingdom righteously, attained heaven.

original: ḥnaravāhanasyāśvamedhadattāyāṃ kṣemakaḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥ naravāhanasya aśvamedha dattāyām kṣemakaḥ
translated: Naravahana's son was Kshemaka, born to Ashvamedhadatta.

original: ḥsa ca rājyasthaḥ prajāḥ paripālya mlecchābhibhūte jagati jñānabalāt kalāpagrāmam āśritaḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥsa ca rājya sthaḥ prajāḥ paripālya mleccha abhibhūte jagati jñāna balāt kalāpa grāmam āśritaḥ
translated: While ruling, he protected the subjects. In a world oppressed by barbarians, he resorted to Kalagrama through the power of knowledge.

original: yaḥ śraddadhānaḥ paṭhate śṛṇoti vā harau ca bhaktiṃ caritaṃ mahībhṛtām /
analyzed: yaḥ śraddadhānaḥ paṭhate śṛṇoti vā harau ca bhaktim caritam mahībhṛtām
translated: He who reads or listens with faith to the devotion to Hari and the deeds of the kings,

original: sa saṃtatiṃ prāpya viśuddhakarmakṛd divaṃ samāsādya vasec ciraṃ sukhī // / //
analyzed: sa saṃtatim prāpya viśuddha karma kṛt divam samāsādya vaset ciram sukhī
translated: Obtaining progeny and performing pure deeds, he attains heaven and dwells there happily for a long time.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe śaṃtanusaṃtativarṇanaṃ nāma ekonatriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe śaṃtanusaṃtativarṇanam nāma ekonatriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-ninth chapter in the Narasimha Purana, describing the lineage of Shantanu.

original: śrīsūta uvāca /
analyzed: śrī sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Shrisuta said:

original: ataḥ paraṃ pravakṣyāmi bhūgolaṃ dvijasattamāḥ /
analyzed: atas param pravakṣyāmi bhū golam dvijasattamāḥ
translated: Hereafter, O best of Brahmins, I shall describe the earth.

original: saṃkṣepāt parvatākīrṇaṃ nadībhiś ca samantataḥ // / //🔽ḥjambuplakṣaśālmalakuśakrauñcaśākapuṣkarasaṃjñāḥ sapta dvīpāḥ /
analyzed: saṃkṣepāt parvata ākīrṇam nadībhiḥ ca samantataḥ  ḥ jambu plakṣa śālmala kuśa krauñca śāka puṣkara saṃjñāḥ sapta dvīpāḥ
translated: In brief, it is covered with mountains and rivers on all sides.🔽The seven islands are known as Jambudvipa, Plakṣa, Śālmali, Kuśa, Krauñca, Śāka, and Puṣkara.

original: ḥlakṣayojanapramāṇāj jambudvīpād uttarottaradviguṇāḥ /
analyzed: ḥlakṣa yojana pramāṇāt jambudvīpāt uttarottara dviguṇāḥ
translated: They are twice as large as the Jambudvipa, which is one lakh yojanas in extent, increasing progressively.

original: ḥlavaṇekṣurasasurāsarpirdadhidugdhasvacchodakasaṃjñaiḥ parasparaṃ dviguṇaiḥ saptasamudrair valayākārais te dvīpāḥ paridhiṣṭhitāḥ // /
analyzed: ḥ lavaṇa ikṣu rasa surā sarpiḥ dadhi dugdha svaccha udaka saṃjñaiḥ parasparam dviguṇaiḥ sapta samudraiḥ valaya ākāraiḥ te dvīpāḥ paridhiṣṭhitāḥ  /
translated: The islands are surrounded by seven oceans, each twice as large as the one within, named after the salt, sugarcane juice, liquor, ghee, curd, milk, and clear water oceans, in the form of a ring.

original: ḥyo 'sau manuputraḥ priyavrato nāma sa saptadvīpādhipatir babhūva /
analyzed: sau manu putraḥ priyavrataḥ nāma sa saptadvīpā adhipatiḥ babhūva
translated: The son of Manu named Priyavrata became the lord of the seven islands.

original: ḥtasya agnīdhrādayo daśa putrā babhūvuḥ // / //
analyzed: agnīdhra ādayaḥ daśa putrāḥ babhūvuḥ
translated: He had ten sons, beginning with Agnidhra, who were...

original: ḥtrayaḥ pravrajitāḥ /
analyzed: ḥ trayaḥ pravrajitāḥ
translated: Three of them renounced the world.

original: ḥśiṣṭānāṃ saptānāṃ saptadvīpāḥ pitrā dattāḥ /
analyzed: ḥśiṣṭānām saptānām sapta dvīpāḥ pitrā dattāḥ
translated: The remaining seven islands were given to the remaining seven sons by their father.

original: ḥtatra jambudvīpādhipater agnīdhrasya nava putrāḥ jātāḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥtatra jambudvīpa adhipateḥ agnīdhrasya nava putrāḥ jātāḥ
translated: Of them, Agnidhra, the lord of Jambudwipa, had nine sons who were...

original: nābhiḥ kiṃpuruṣaś caiva harivarṣa ilāvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: nābhiḥ kiṃpuruṣaḥ ca eva harivarṣaḥ ilāvṛtaḥ
translated: Nabhi, Kimpurusha, Harivarsha, Ilavrita,

original: ramyo hiraṇyayaś caiva kurur bhadraś ca ketumān // / //
analyzed: ramyaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ ca eva kuruḥ bhadraḥ ca ketumān
translated: Ramya, Hiranyaya, Kuru, Bhadra, Ketumant...

original: ḥnavavarṣāḥ vibhajya putrebhyaḥ pitrā dattā vanaṃ praviśatā /
analyzed: vibhajya putrebhyaḥ pitrā dattā vanam praviśatā
translated: Having divided the nine islands, they were given to the sons by their father, who entered the forest.

original: ḥagnīdhrīyaṃ himāhvayam /
analyzed: ḍagnīdhrīyam himāhvayam
translated: The Agnidhra is called Hima.

original: ḥyasyādhipatir nābheḥ ṛṣabhaḥ putro babhūva // / //
analyzed: ḥyasya adhipatiḥ nābheḥ ṛṣabhaḥ putraḥ babhūva
translated: The lord of which is Nabhi, whose son was Rishabha...

original: ḥṛṣabhād bharato bharatena cirakālaṃ dharmeṇa pālitatvād idaṃ bhārataṃ varṣam abhūt /
analyzed: ḥṛṣabhāt bharataḥ bharatena cira kālam dharmeṇa pālita tvāt idam bhāratam varṣam abhūt
translated: From Rishabha, it became the Bharata Varsha, ruled for a long time by Bharata with righteousness.

original: ḥilāvṛtasya madhye meruḥ suvarṇamayaś caturaśītisahasrāṇi yojanāni tasyocchrāyaḥ /
analyzed: madhye meruḥ suvarṇa mayaḥ caturaśīti sahasrāṇi yojanāni tasya ucchrāyaḥ
translated: In the middle of the Hīlavarta, Meru is made of gold, and its height is eighty-four thousand yojanas.

original: ḥṣoḍaśasahasram apy adhastād avagāḍhaḥ /
analyzed: ḥṣoḍaśa sahasram api adhastāt avagāḍhaḥ
translated: It is sunk down sixteen thousand yojanas below.

original: ḥtaddviguṇo mūrdhni vistāraḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥ tad dviguṇaḥ mūrdhni vistāraḥ
translated: Its width at the top is twice that.

original: ḥtanmadhye brahmaṇaḥ purī /
analyzed: ḥ tad madhye brahmaṇaḥ purī
translated: In its middle is the city of Brahmā.

original: ḥaindryām indrasya cāmarāvatī /
analyzed: ḥaindryām indrasya ca amarāvatī
translated: In the northeast is Indra's Amarāvatī.

original: ḥāgneyyām agnes tejovatī /
analyzed: ḥ āgneyyām agneḥ tejovatī
translated: In the southeast is Agni's Tejovatī.

original: ḥyāmyāṃ yamasya saṃyamanī /
analyzed: ḥyāmyām yamasya saṃyamanī
translated: In the south is Yama's Saṃyamanī.

original: ḥnairṛtyāṃ nirṛter bhayaṃkarī /🔽ḥvāruṇyāṃ varuṇasya viśvāvatī /
analyzed: ḥnairṛtyām nirṛteḥ bhayaṃkarī  vāruṇyām varuṇasya viśvāvatī
translated: In the southwest is Nirṛti's Bhayaṅkarī.🔽In the west is Varuṇa's Viśvavati.

original: ḥvāyavyāṃ vāyor gandhavatī /
analyzed: ḥ vāyavyām vāyoḥ gandhavatī
translated: In the northwest is Vāyu's Gandhavatī.

original: ḥudīcyāṃ somasya vibhāvarīti /
analyzed: ḥ udīcyām somasya vibhāvarī iti
translated: In the north is Soma's Vibhāvarī.

original: ḥnavavarṣānvitaṃ jambūdvīpaṃ puṇyaparvataiḥ puṇyanadībhir anvitam // / //
analyzed: ḥnava varṣa anvitam jambūdvīpam puṇya parvataiḥ puṇya nadībhiḥ anvitam
translated: Jambūdvīpa, endowed with nine Varṣas and meritorious mountains and rivers, is...

original: ḥkiṃpuruṣādīny aṣṭavarṣāṇi puṇyavatāṃ bhogasthānāni sākṣād bhāratavarṣam ekaṃ karmabhūmiś cāturvarṇyayutam // / //
analyzed: ḥkiṃpuruṣa ādīni aṣṭa varṣāṇi puṇyavatām bhogasthānāni sākṣāt bhārata varṣam ekam karma bhūmiḥ cāturvarṇya yutam
translated: The eight Varṣas beginning with Kiṃpuruṣa are places of enjoyment for the meritorious, and the single Bhārata Varṣa is the land of action, inhabited by the four castes, and is...

original: tatraiva karmabhiḥ svargaṃ kṛteḥ prāpsyanti mānavāḥ /
analyzed: tatra eva karmabhiḥ svargam kṛteḥ prāpsyanti mānavāḥ
translated: There, by their own actions, men will attain heaven in the Kṛta age.

original: muktiś cātraiva niṣkāmaiḥ prāpyate jñānakarmabhiḥ /
analyzed: muktiḥ ca atra eva niṣkāmaiḥ prāpyate jñāna karmabhiḥ
translated: And here alone, by knowledge and action, liberation is attained by those who are desireless.

original: adhogatim ito vipra yānti vai pāpakāriṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: adhogatim itas vipra yānti vai pāpa kāriṇaḥ
translated: O Brahmin, those who commit sinful acts go downwards from here.

original: ḥye pāpakāriṇas tān viddhi pātālatale narake koṭisamanvitān // / //
analyzed: ḥye pāpa kāriṇaḥ tān viddhi pātāla tale narake koṭi samanvitān
translated: Know that those who commit sinful acts, along with millions, go to the hell in the netherworld.

original: ḥatha sapta kulaparvatāḥ kathyante /
analyzed: atha sapta kulaparvatāḥ kathyante
translated: Now the seven Kula mountains are described.

original: ḥmahendro malayaḥ śuktimān ṛṣyamūkaḥ sahyaparvato vindhyaḥ pāriyātraḥ /
analyzed: ḥmahendraḥ malayaḥ śuktimān ṛṣyamūkaḥ sahya parvataḥ vindhyaḥ pāriyātraḥ
translated: Mahendra, Malaya, Shuktiman, Rishyamuka, Sahya mountain, Vindhya, Paripatra.

original: ḥity ete bhārate kulaparvatāḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥ iti ete bhārate kulaparvatāḥ
translated: These are the Kula mountains in Bharata.

original: ḥnarmadā surasā ṛṣikulyā bhīmarathī kṛṣṇāveṇī candrabhāgā tāmraparṇī ity etāḥ sapta nadyaḥ /
analyzed: narmadā surasā ṛṣikulyā bhīmarathī kṛṣṇā veṇī candrabhāgā tāmraparṇī iti etāḥ sapta nadyaḥ
translated: Narmada, Surasa, Rishikulya, Bhimarathi, Krishnaveni, Chandrabhaga, Tamraparni - these are the seven rivers.

original: ḥgaṅgā yamunā godāvarī tuṅgabhadrā kāverī sarayūr ity etā mahānadyaḥ papaghnyaḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥgaṅgā yamunā godāvarī tuṅgabhadrā kāverī sarayūḥ iti etāḥ mahā nadyaḥ papaghnyaḥ
translated: Ganga, Yamuna, Godavari, Tungabhadra, Kaveri, Sarayu - these are the great rivers that destroy sins.

original: jambunāmnā ca vikhyātaṃ jambudvīpam idaṃ śubham /
analyzed: jambu nāmnā ca vikhyātam jambudvīpam idam śubham
translated: This auspicious Jambudvipa is famous by the name of Jambu.

original: lakṣayojanavistīrṇam idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ tu bhāratam // / //
analyzed: lakṣa yojana vistīrṇam idam śreṣṭham tu bhāratam
translated: This best of Bharata extends for a lakh yojanas.

original: ḥṛkṣadvīpādipuṇyā janapadāḥ /
analyzed: ṛkṣadvīpa ādi puṇyāḥ janapadāḥ
translated: The holy countries like Rishyadvipa.

original: ḥniṣkāmā ye svadharmeṇa narasiṃhaṃ yajanti te tatra nivasanti /
analyzed: ḥniṣkāmāḥ ye svadharmeṇa narasiṃham yajanti te tatra nivasanti
translated: Those who are desireless and worship Narasimha according to their own dharma, they reside there.

original: ḥadhikārakṣayān muktiṃ ca prāpnuvanti // / //
analyzed: ḥadhikāra kṣayāt muktim ca prāpnuvanti
translated: They attain liberation by the exhaustion of their eligibility.

original: ḥjambvādyāḥ svādūdakāntāḥ sapta payodhayaḥ /
translated: The seven oceans are from Jambū to Svadhāka.

original: ḥtataḥ parā hiraṇmayī bhūmiḥ /🔽ḥtato lokālokaparvataḥ eṣa bhūrlokaḥ // / //🔽ḥasyopari antarikṣalokaḥ /
analyzed: ḥ tatas parā hiraṇmayī bhūmiḥ  ḥ tatas lokāloka parvataḥ eṣa bhūrlokaḥ  ḥasya upari antarikṣa lokaḥ
translated: Beyond that is the golden land.🔽Beyond that is the Lokāloka mountain. This is the earth world.🔽Above it is the sky world.

original: ḥkhecarāṇāṃ ramyas tadūrdhvaṃ svargalokaḥ // / //
analyzed: ramyaḥ tad ūrdhvam svarga lokaḥ
translated: Above that is the heavenly world, delightful to the sky-dwellers.

original: svargasthānaṃ mahāpuṇyaṃ procyamānaṃ nibodhata /
analyzed: svarga sthānam mahā puṇyam procyamānam nibodhata
translated: Listen to the description of the extremely meritorious abode of heaven,

original: bhārate kṛtapuṇyānāṃ devānām api cālayam // / //
analyzed: bhārate kṛta puṇyānām devānām api ca ālayam
translated: The abode of the gods who have performed meritorious deeds in Bhārata.

original: madhye pṛthivyām adrīndro bhāsvān merur hiraṇmayaḥ /
analyzed: madhye pṛthivyām adri indraḥ bhāsvān meruḥ hiraṇmayaḥ
translated: In the middle of the earth, the shining golden Meru mountain,

original: yojanānāṃ sahasrāṇi caturāśītim ucchritaḥ // / //
analyzed: yojanānām sahasrāṇi catura aśītim ucchritaḥ
translated: Eighty-four thousand yojanas high.

original: praviṣṭaḥ ṣoḍaśādhastād dharaṇyāṃ dharaṇīdharaḥ /
analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ ṣoḍaśa adhastāt dharaṇyām dharaṇīdharaḥ
translated: Sixteen yojanas below the earth, the mountain supporting the earth,

original: tāvatpramāṇā pṛthivī parvatasya samantataḥ // / //
analyzed: tāvat pramāṇā pṛthivī parvatasya samantataḥ
translated: The earth is of the same extent all around the mountain.

original: tasya śṛṅgatrayaṃ mūrdhni svargo yatra pratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya śṛṅga trayam mūrdhni svargaḥ yatra pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: On its peak are three summits, where heaven is established,

original: nānādrumalatākīrṇaṃ nānāpuṣpopaśobhitam // / //🔽madhyamaṃ paścimaṃ pūrvaṃ meroḥ śṛṅgāṇi trīṇi vai /
analyzed: nānā druma latā ākīrṇam nānā puṣpa upaśobhitam  madhyamam paścimam pūrvam meroḥ śṛṅgāṇi trīṇi vai
translated: Filled with various trees and creepers, adorned with various flowers.🔽The three peaks of Meru are the middle, western and eastern.

original: madhyamaṃ sphāṭikaṃ śṛṅgaṃ vaiḍūryamaṇikāmayam // / //
analyzed: madhyamam sphāṭikam śṛṅgam vaiḍūrya maṇikā mayam
translated: The middle peak is made of crystal, the western of lapis lazuli, and the eastern of gold.

original: indranīlamayaṃ pūrvaṃ māṇikyaṃ paścimaṃ smṛtam /
analyzed: indranīla mayam pūrvam māṇikyam paścimam smṛtam
translated: The eastern peak is said to be made of sapphires, and the western one of rubies.

original: yojanānāṃ sahasrāṇi niyutāni caturdaśa // / //
analyzed: yojanānām sahasrāṇi niyutāni caturdaśa
translated: The middle peak rises fourteen thousand yojanas and niyutas.

original: ucchritaṃ madhyamaṃ śṛṅgaṃ svargo yatra triviṣṭapaḥ /
analyzed: ucchritam madhyamam śṛṅgam svargaḥ yatra triviṣṭapaḥ
translated: That is heaven, the abode of the thirty gods.

original: aprabhāntaritaṃ śṛṅgaṃ mūrdhni chatrākṛti sthitam // / //
analyzed: aprabhā antaritam śṛṅgam mūrdhni chatra ākṛti sthitam
translated: The peak above, invisible from the other peaks, is shaped like a parasol.

original: pūrvam uttaraśṛṅgāṇām antaraṃ madhyamasya ca /
analyzed: pūrvam uttara śṛṅgāṇām antaram madhyamasya ca
translated: The distance between the eastern and northern peaks and the middle peak,

original: triviṣṭapo nākapṛṣṭhe hy apsarāḥ santi nirvṛtāḥ // / //
analyzed: triviṣṭapaḥ nāka pṛṣṭhe hi apsarāḥ santi nirvṛtāḥ
translated: the heaven of the thirty gods is on the peak of heaven, where the celestial nymphs are content.

original: ānando 'tha pramodaś ca svargaśṛṅge tu madhyame /
analyzed: pramodaḥ ca svarga śṛṅge tu madhyame
translated: Bliss and joy are on the middle peak of heaven,

original: śvetaś ca pauṣṭikaś caiva upaśobhanamanmathau // / //
analyzed: śvetaḥ ca pauṣṭikaḥ ca eva upaśobhana manmathau
translated: white, nourishing, beautiful, and passionate.

original: āhlādaḥ svargarājā vai svargaśṛṅge tu paścime /
analyzed: āhlādaḥ svarga rājā vai svargaśṛṅge tu paścime
translated: Delight is the king of heaven on the western peak of heaven,

original: nirmamo nirahaṃkāraḥ saubhāgyaś cātinirmalaḥ // / //
analyzed: nirmamaḥ nirahaṃkāraḥ saubhāgyaḥ ca ati nirmalaḥ
translated: free from possessiveness and egotism, fortunate and extremely pure.

original: svargāś caiva dvijaśreṣṭha pūrvaśṛṅge samāsthitaḥ /
analyzed: svargāḥ ca eva dvijaśreṣṭha pūrva śṛṅge samāsthitaḥ
translated: And the heavens are established on the eastern peak, O best of the twice-born.

original: ekaviṃśāni svargā vai niviṣṭā merumūrdhani // / //
analyzed: ekaviṃśāni svargāḥ vai niviṣṭāḥ meru mūrdhani
translated: The twenty-one heavens are situated on the peak of Meru.

original: ahiṃsādānakartāro yajñānaṃ tapasāṃ tathā /
analyzed: ahiṃsā dāna kartāraḥ tapasām tathā
translated: Those who practice non-violence, charity, and sacrifice, and austerities,

original: tat teṣu nivasanti sma janāḥ krodhavivarjitāḥ // / //
analyzed: tat teṣu nivasanti sma janāḥ krodha vivarjitāḥ
translated: they dwell there, free from anger.

original: jalapraveśe cānandaṃ pramodaṃ vahnisāhase /
analyzed: jala praveśe ca ānandam pramodam vahni sāhase
translated: In water-entry, he attains bliss; in the daring of fire, joy;

original: bhṛguprapāte saukhyaṃ ca raṇaṃ caivāsya nirmalam // / //
analyzed: bhṛgu prapāte saukhyam ca raṇam ca eva asya nirmalam
translated: In the fall from Bhrigu's peak, happiness; and his battle is pure.

original: anāśake tu saṃnyāse mṛto gacchet triviṣṭapam /
analyzed: anāśake tu saṃnyāse mṛtaḥ gacchet triviṣṭapam
translated: In fasting unto death and renunciation, one who dies goes to heaven.

original: ṛtuyājī nākapṛṣṭhaṃ agnihotrī ca nirvṛtim // / //
analyzed: ṛtu yājī nāka pṛṣṭham agnihotrī ca nirvṛtim
translated: One who offers sacrifices at the proper time goes to the heavenly realm; one who offers the agnihotra oblation attains fulfillment.

original: taḍāgakūpakartā ca labhate pauṣṭikaṃ dvijaḥ /
analyzed: taḍāga kūpa kartā ca labhate pauṣṭikam dvijaḥ
translated: One who constructs ponds and wells obtains nourishment.

original: suvarṇadāyī saubhāgyaṃ labhan svargaṃ tapaḥ phalam // / //
analyzed: suvarṇa dāyī saubhāgyam labhan svargam tapaḥ phalam
translated: One who gives gold obtains good fortune, heaven, and the fruits of austerity.

original: śītakāle mahāvahniṃ prajvālayati yo naraḥ /
analyzed: śīta kāle mahā vahnim prajvālayati yaḥ naraḥ
translated: One who lights a great fire during the cold season,

original: sarvasattvahitārthāya svargaṃ so 'psarasaṃ labhet // / //🔽hiraṇyagopradāne hi nirahaṃkāram āpnuyāt /
analyzed: sarva sattva hita arthāya svargam saḥ psarasam labhet  hiraṇya go pradāne hi nirahaṃkāram āpnuyāt
translated: for the benefit of all beings, attains heaven and the apsarases.🔽By the gift of gold and cows, one attains freedom from ego.

original: bhūmidānena śuddhena labhate śāntikaṃ padam // / //🔽raupyadānena svargaṃ tu nirmalaṃ labhate naraḥ /
analyzed: bhūmi dānena śuddhena labhate śāntikam padam  raupya dānena svargam tu nirmalam labhate naraḥ
translated: By the pure gift of land, one obtains the state of peace.🔽By the gift of silver, a man obtains a pure heaven.

original: aśvadānena puṇyāhaṃ kanyādānena maṅgalam // / //
analyzed: aśva dānena puṇyāham kanyā dānena maṅgalam
translated: By the gift of a horse, one obtains merit; by the gift of a virgin, good fortune.

original: dvijebhyas tarpaṇaṃ kṛtvā dattvā vastrāṇi bhaktitaḥ /
analyzed: dvijebhyaḥ tarpaṇam kṛtvā dattvā vastrāṇi bhaktitaḥ
translated: Having offered libations to the Brahmins and given garments with devotion,

original: śvetaṃ tu labhate svargaṃ yatra gatvā na śocate // / //
analyzed: śvetam tu labhate svargam yatra gatvā na śocate
translated: one obtains a white heaven, going to which one does not grieve.

original: kapilāgopradānena paramārthe mahīyate /
analyzed: kapilā go pradānena parama arthe mahīyate
translated: By the gift of a tawny cow, one is honored in the supreme truth.

original: govṛṣasya pradānena svargaṃ manmathām āpnuyāt // / //🔽māghamāse saritsnāyī tiladhenupradas tathā /
analyzed: go vṛṣasya pradānena svargam āpnuyāt
translated: By the gift of a bull, one attains heaven and passion.🔽One who bathes in the river in the month of Magha, gives sesame and a cow,

original: chatropānahadātā ca svargaṃ yāty upaśobhanam // / //
analyzed: chatra upānaha dātā ca svargam yāti upaśobhanam
translated: and gives an umbrella and sandals, goes to heaven and is honored.

original: devatāyatanaṃ kṛtvā dvijaśuśrūṣakas tathā /
analyzed: devatāyatanam kṛtvā dvija śuśrūṣakaḥ tathā
translated: One who builds a temple for deities, serves Brahmins,

original: tīrthayātrāparaś caiva svargarāje mahīyate // / //
analyzed: tīrtha yātrā paraḥ ca eva svargarāje mahīyate
translated: and is devoted to pilgrimages, is honored in the heavenly realm.

original: ekānnabhogī yo martyo naktabhogī ca nityaśaḥ /
analyzed: eka anna bhogī yaḥ martyaḥ nakta bhogī ca nityaśas
translated: A mortal who eats only one meal a day, eats only at night,

original: upavāsī trirātrādyaiḥ śāntaḥ svargaṃ śubhaṃ labhet // / //
analyzed: upavāsī tri rātra ādyaiḥ śāntaḥ svargam śubham labhet
translated: and fasts for three nights and so on, being peaceful, attains auspicious heaven.

original: saritsnāyī jitakrodho brahmacārī dṛḍhavrataḥ /
analyzed: sarit snāyī jita krodhaḥ brahmacārī dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: One who bathes in the river, conquers anger, is celibate, firm in vows,

original: nirmalaṃ svargam āpnoti yathābhūtahite rataḥ /
analyzed: nirmalam svargam āpnoti yathā bhūta hite rataḥ
translated: and is devoted to the welfare of beings, attains a pure heaven.

original: vidyādānena medhāvī nirahaṃkāram āpnuyāt // / //
analyzed: vidyā dānena medhāvī nirahaṃkāram āpnuyāt
translated: The wise one attains freedom from ego by the gift of knowledge.

original: yena yena hi bhāvena yad yad dānaṃ prayacchati /
analyzed: yena yena hi bhāvena yat yat dānam prayacchati
translated: Whatever gift one gives with whatever intention,

original: tat tat svargam avāpnoti yad yad icchati mānavaḥ // / //
analyzed: tat tat svargam avāpnoti yat yat icchati mānavaḥ
translated: that one attains heaven, whatever one desires as a human.

original: catvāri atidānāni kanyā gaur bhūḥ sarasvatī /
analyzed: catvāri atidānāni kanyā gauḥ bhūḥ sarasvatī
translated: Four are the greatest gifts: a virgin, a cow, land, and eloquence.

original: narakād uddharanty ete jayavāhanadohanāt // / //
analyzed: narakāt uddharanti ete jaya vāhana dohanāt
translated: They deliver from hell through the gift of a victorious vehicle.

original: yas tu sarvāṇi dānāni brāhmaṇebhyaḥ prayacchati /
analyzed: yaḥ tu sarvāṇi dānāni brāhmaṇebhyaḥ prayacchati
translated: He who gives all gifts to the Brahmins,

original: saṃprāpya na nivarteta svargaṃ śāntam anāmayam // / //
analyzed: saṃprāpya na nivarteta svargam śāntam anāmayam
translated: Having attained, does not return to heaven, which is peaceful and free from disease.

original: śṛṅge tu paścime yatra brahmā tatra sthitaḥ svayam /
analyzed: śṛṅge tu paścime yatra brahmā tatra sthitaḥ svayam
translated: On the western peak, where Brahma himself resides,

original: pūrvaśṛṅge svayaṃ viṣṇuḥ madhye caiva śivaḥ sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: pūrva śṛṅge svayam viṣṇuḥ madhye ca eva śivaḥ sthitaḥ
translated: On the eastern peak, Vishnu himself, and in the middle, Shiva resides.

original: ataḥ paraṃ tu viprendra svargādhvānam imaṃ śṛṇu /
analyzed: atas param tu vipra indra svarga adhvānam imam śṛṇu
translated: From here onwards, O chief of Brahmins, listen to this path to heaven.

original: vimalaṃ vipulaṃ buddham upary upari saṃsthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: vimalam vipulam buddham upari upari saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Pure, vast, enlightened, situated higher and higher,

original: prathame tu kumāras tu dvitīye mātaraḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: prathame tu kumāraḥ tu dvitīye mātaraḥ sthitaḥ
translated: In the first, Kumara, in the second, the mothers reside,

original: tṛtīye siddhagandharvās turye vidyādharā dvija // / //
analyzed: tṛtīye siddha gandharvāḥ turye vidyādharāḥ dvija
translated: In the third, the Siddhas and Gandharvas, in the fourth, the Vidyadharas, O Brahmin,

original: pañcame nāgarājā ca ṣaṣṭhe tu vinatāsutaḥ /
analyzed: pañcame nāga rājā ca ṣaṣṭhe tu vinatā sutaḥ
translated: In the fifth, the king of Nagas, in the sixth, Vinata's son,

original: saptame divyapitaro dharmarājas tathāṣṭame /
analyzed: saptame divya pitaraḥ dharmarājaḥ tathā aṣṭame
translated: In the seventh, the divine ancestors, and in the eighth, Dharmaraja,

original: navame tu tathā dakṣa ādityo daśame pathi // / //
analyzed: navame tu tathā dakṣaḥ ādityaḥ daśame pathi
translated: In the ninth, Daksha, and in the tenth path, the sun.

original: bhūrlokāc chatasahasrād ūrdhvaṃ carati bhāskaraḥ /
analyzed: bhūrlokāt śata sahasrāt ūrdhvam carati bhāskaraḥ
translated: The sun moves above a hundred thousand from the earth-world,

original: yojanānāṃ sahasre dve viṣṭambhanasamaṃ tataḥ // / //
analyzed: yojanānām sahasre dve viṣṭambhana samam tatas
translated: Two thousand yojanas from there, it is supported.

original: triguṇaṃ pariṇāhena sūryabimbaṃ pramāṇataḥ /
analyzed: triguṇam pariṇāhena sūrya bimbam pramāṇataḥ
translated: The diameter of the sun is three times that of the sun's disc.

original: somapuryāṃ vibhāvaryāṃ madhyāhne cāryamā yadā /
analyzed: somapuryām vibhāvaryām madhyāhne ca aryamā yadā
translated: When the sun is at midday in the city of Soma (Moon), in Vibhāvarī (Mars),

original: mahendrasyāmarāvatyāṃ tadā tiṣṭhati bhāskaraḥ // / //
analyzed: mahendrasya amarāvatyām tadā tiṣṭhati bhāskaraḥ
translated: then the sun is in the city of Mahendra (Jupiter), in Amarāvatī (Venus).

original: madhyāhne tv amarāvatyāṃ yadā bhavati bhāskaraḥ /
analyzed: madhyāhne tu amarāvatyām yadā bhavati bhāskaraḥ
translated: When the sun is at midday in Amarāvatī (Venus),

original: tadā saṃyamane yāmye tatrodyaṃs tu pradṛśyate // / //
analyzed: tadā saṃyamane yāmye tatra udyan tu pradṛśyate
translated: then it is seen rising in Saṃyama (Saturn), in Yāmya (Rahu).

original: meruṃ pradakṣiṇaṃ kurvan bhāty eva savitā sadā /
analyzed: merum pradakṣiṇam kurvan bhāti eva savitā sadā
translated: The sun always shines, circumambulating Meru,

original: dhruvādhāras tathottiṣṭhan vālikhilyādibhiḥ stutaḥ // / //
analyzed: dhruva ādhāraḥ tathā uttiṣṭhan vālikhilya ādibhiḥ stutaḥ
translated: rising as the support of Dhruva, praised by Vālakhilyas and others.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe bhūgolakathane triṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe bhū gola kathane triṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirtieth chapter in the Narasimha Purana, in the Bhugolakatha (Geography of the Earth).

original: bharadvāja uvāca /
analyzed: bharadvājaḥ uvāca
translated: Bharadvaja said:

original: ko 'sau dhruvaḥ kasya sutaḥ sūryādhāro 'bhavat katham /
analyzed: kaḥ sau dhruvaḥ kasya sutaḥ sūrya ādhāraḥ bhavat katham
translated: Who is that Dhruva? Whose son was he? How did he become the support of the sun?

original: vicintya kathayāśu tvaṃ sūta jīva samāḥ śatam // / //
analyzed: vicintya kathaya āśu tvam sūta jīva samāḥ śatam
translated: Having thought, tell me quickly, O Sūta, may you live a hundred years.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Sūta said:

original: manoḥ svāyaṃbhuvasyāsīd uttānacaraṇaḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: manoḥ svāyaṃbhuvasya āsīt uttānacaraṇaḥ sutaḥ
translated: Uttānapacharaṇa was the son of Manu Svāyambhuva.

original: tasya kṣitipater vipra dvau sutau saṃbabhūvatuḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya kṣitipateḥ vipra dvau sutau saṃbabhūvatuḥ
translated: O Brahmin, that king had two sons.

original: surucyām uttamo jyeṣṭhaḥ sunītyāṃ tu dhruvo 'paraḥ /
analyzed: surucyām uttamaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ sunītyām tu paraḥ
translated: The elder was Uttama, born of Suruci, and the younger was Dhruva, born of Sunīti.

original: madhyesabhaṃ narapater upaviṣṭasya caikadā // / //
analyzed: madhyesabham narapateḥ upaviṣṭasya ca ekadā
translated: Once, in the midst of the assembly, while the king was seated,

original: sunītyā rājasevāyai niyukto 'laṃkṛtaḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: sunītyā rāja sevāyai niyuktaḥ laṃkṛtaḥ sutaḥ
translated: The son, adorned and appointed by Sunīti for royal service,

original: dhruvo dhātreyikāputraiḥ samaṃ vinayatatparaḥ // / //
analyzed: dhruvaḥ dhātreyikā putraiḥ samam vinaya tatparaḥ
translated: Dhruva, along with the sons of his step-mother, devoted to humility,

original: sa gatvottānacaraṇaṃ kṣoṇīśaṃ praṇanāma ha /
analyzed: sa gatvā uttāna caraṇam kṣoṇīśam praṇanāma ha
translated: Having gone, bowed to King Uttānapāda.

original: dṛṣṭvottamaṃ tadutsaṅge niviṣṭaṃ janakasya vai // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā uttamam tad utsaṅge niviṣṭam janakasya vai
translated: Seeing the excellent one seated on his lap, the son of Janaka,

original: prāpya siṃhāsanasthaṃ ca nṛpatiṃ bālacāpalāt /
analyzed: prāpya siṃhāsana stham ca nṛpatim bāla cāpalāt
translated: Having reached the king seated on the throne, out of childish fickleness,

original: ārurukṣum avekṣyāmuṃ surucir dhruvam abravīt // / //
analyzed: ārurukṣum avekṣya amum suruciḥ dhruvam abravīt
translated: Seeing him desirous of ascending, Suruci spoke to Dhruva,

original: surucir uvāca /
analyzed: suruciḥ uvāca
translated: Suruci said:

original: daurbhageya kim āroḍhum iccher aṅkaṃ mahīpateḥ /
analyzed: daurbhageya kim āroḍhum iccheḥ aṅkam mahīpateḥ
translated: O son of an unfortunate woman, why do you wish to ascend the lap of the king?

original: bāla bāliśabuddhitvād abhāgyājāṭharodbhavaḥ // / //
analyzed: bāla bāliśa buddhi tvāt abhāgya a jāṭhara udbhavaḥ
translated: O child, due to your childish intellect, you are born in the womb of an unfortunate one.

original: asmin siṃhāsane sthātuṃ sukṛtaṃ kiṃ tvayā kṛtam // / //
analyzed: asmin siṃhāsane sthātum su kṛtam kim tvayā kṛtam
translated: What good deed have you done to be able to sit on this throne?

original: yadi syāt sukṛtaṃ tat kiṃ durbhāgyodarago 'bhavaḥ /
analyzed: yadi syāt su kṛtam tat kim durbhāgya udara gaḥ bhavaḥ
translated: If there were any good deed, why were you born in the womb of an unfortunate one?

original: anenaivānumānena budhyasva svalpapuṇyatām // / //
analyzed: anena eva anumānena budhyasva su alpa puṇya tām
translated: By this inference, understand your own small merit.

original: bhūtvā rājakumāro 'pi nālaṃkuryā mamodaram /
analyzed: bhūtvā na alaṃkuryāḥ mama udaram
translated: Even becoming the prince, you did not adorn my womb.

original: sukukṣijaṃ amuṃ paśya tvam uttamam anuttamam // / //
analyzed: su kukṣi jam amum paśya tvam uttamam anuttamam
translated: See this excellent one, born in a good womb, the unsurpassed one.

original: adhijānu dharājaner mānena paribṛṃhitam // / //
analyzed: adhijānu dharā janeḥ mānena paribṛṃhitam
translated: Exalted by the pride of the high-born king, who has his knee on his head.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

original: madhyerājasabhaṃ bālas tayeti paribhartsitaḥ // / //🔽nipatannetrabāṣpāmbur dhairyāt kiṃcin na coktavān /
analyzed: madhyerāja sabham bālaḥ tayā iti paribhartsitaḥ  nipatat netra bāṣpa ambuḥ dhairyāt kiṃcid na ca uktavān
translated: The boy, thus rebuked by her in the midst of the royal assembly,🔽Falling down with tears in his eyes, did not say anything out of patience.

original: ucitaṃ nocitaṃ kiṃcin nocivān so 'pi pārthivaḥ // / //
analyzed: ucitam na ucitam kiṃcid na ūcivān saḥ pi pārthivaḥ
translated: The king also did not say anything, whether proper or improper.

original: niyantrito mahiṣyāś ca tasyāḥ saubhāgyagauravāt /
analyzed: niyantritaḥ mahiṣyāḥ ca tasyāḥ saubhāgya gauravāt
translated: He was restrained by the queen's good fortune and honor.

original: visarjitasabhālokaṃ śokaṃ saṃhṛtya ceṣṭitaiḥ // / //🔽śaiśavaiḥ sa śiśur natvā nṛpaṃ svasadanaṃ yayau /
analyzed: visarjita sabhā lokam śokam saṃhṛtya ceṣṭitaiḥ  śaiśavaiḥ sa śiśuḥ natvā nṛpam sva sadanam yayau
translated: Having dismissed the people from the assembly, he concealed his grief with gestures.🔽The child, with childish behavior, bowed to the king and went to his own house.

original: sunītir nītinilayam avalokyātha bālakam // / //
analyzed: sunītiḥ nīti nilayam avalokya atha bālakam
translated: Suniti, seeing the child, the abode of good policy,

original: mukhalakṣmyaiva cājñāsīd dhruvaṃ rājāpamānitam /
analyzed: mukha lakṣmyā eva ca ajñāsīt dhruvam rāja apamānitam
translated: She knew from the beauty of his face that Dhruva was certainly insulted by the king.

original: atha dṛṣṭvā sunītiṃ tu raho 'ntaḥpuravāsinīm // / //
analyzed: atha dṛṣṭvā sunītim tu rahaḥ ntaḥpura vāsinīm
translated: Then, seeing Suniti, who was living in the inner quarters,

original: āliṅgya dīrghaṃ niḥśvasya muktakaṇṭhaṃ ruroda ha /
analyzed: āliṅgya dīrgham niḥśvasya mukta kaṇṭham ruroda ha
translated: Embracing him, he sighed deeply and wept aloud.

original: sāntvayitvā sunītis taṃ vadanaṃ parimārjya ca // / //
analyzed: sāntvayitvā sunītiḥ tam vadanam parimārjya ca
translated: Having consoled him and wiped his face, Suniti

original: dukūlāñcalasaṃparkair vījya taṃ mṛdupāṇinā /
analyzed: dukūla añcala saṃparkaiḥ vījya tam mṛdu pāṇinā
translated: Fanning him with the touch of the hem of her silken garment, with her soft hand,

original: papraccha tanayaṃ mātā vada rodanakāraṇam // / //
analyzed: papraccha tanayam mātā vada rodana kāraṇam
translated: The mother asked her son, Tell me, why are you crying?

original: vidyamāne narapatau śiśo kenāpamānitaḥ // / //
analyzed: vidyamāne narapatau śiśo kena apamānitaḥ
translated: When the king is alive, by whom was the child insulted?

original: dhruva uvāca /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ uvāca
translated: Dhruva said:

original: saṃpṛcche janani tvāhaṃ saṃyak śaṃsa mamāgrataḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃpṛcche janani tvā aham saṃyak śaṃsa mama agratas
translated: O mother, I ask you, tell me correctly in front of me...

original: bhāryātve 'pi ca sāmānye kathaṃ sā suruciḥ priyā /
analyzed: bhāryā tve ca sāmānye katham sā suruciḥ priyā
translated: How is that Suruci dear to you, even though you are both wives?

original: kathaṃ na bhavatī mātaḥ priyā kṣitipater asi // / //
analyzed: katham na bhavatī mātar priyā kṣitipateḥ asi
translated: O mother, how is it that you are not dear to the king?

original: katham uttamatāṃ prāpta uttamaḥ suruceḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: katham uttama tām prāptaḥ uttamaḥ suruceḥ sutaḥ
translated: How did Uttama attain superiority, and how is Uttama the son of Suruci?

original: kumāratve 'pi sāmānye kathaṃ cāham anuttamaḥ // / //
analyzed: kumāra tve sāmānye katham ca aham anuttamaḥ
translated: How am I also inferior, even though I am a prince?

original: kathaṃ tvaṃ mandabhāgyāsi sukukṣiḥ suruciḥ katham /
analyzed: katham tvam mandabhāgyā asi su kukṣiḥ su ruciḥ katham
translated: How are you unfortunate, and how is Suruci fortunate?

original: kathaṃ nṛpāsanaṃ yogyam uttamasya kathaṃ na me // / //
analyzed: katham nṛpāsanam yogyam uttamasya katham na me
translated: How is the throne worthy of Uttama, and how not of me?

original: kathaṃ me sukṛtaṃ tuccham uttamasyottamaṃ katham /
analyzed: katham me su kṛtam tuccham uttamasya uttamam katham
translated: How is my good deed meager, and how is Uttama's excellent?

original: iti śrutvā vacas tasya sunītir nītimacchiśoḥ // / //🔽kiṃcid ucchvasya śanakaiḥ śiśuśokopaśāntaye /
analyzed: iti śrutvā vacaḥ tasya sunītiḥ nītimat śiśoḥ  kiṃcid ucchvasya śanakais śiśu śoka upaśāntaye
translated: Having heard these words of the child, Suniti, the mother of the child who was devoted to good conduct...

original: svabhāvamadhurāṃ vāṇīṃ vaktuṃ samupacakrame // / //
analyzed: svabhāva madhurām vāṇīm vaktum samupacakrame
translated: Having sighed a little, she slowly began to speak in a naturally sweet voice for the sake of alleviating the grief of the child...

original: sunītir uvāca /
analyzed: sunītiḥ uvāca
translated: Suniti said:

original: ayi tāta mahābuddhe viśuddhenāntarātmanā /
analyzed: ayi tāta mahābuddhe viśuddhena antarātmanā
translated: O father, O greatly intelligent one, with a pure inner self...

original: nivedayāmi te sarvaṃ māvamāne matiṃ kṛthāḥ // / //
analyzed: nivedayāmi te sarvam mā avamāne matim kṛthāḥ
translated: I tell you everything, do not entertain any disrespect towards me.

original: tayā yad uktaṃ tat sarvaṃ tathyam eva na cānyathā /
analyzed: tayā yat uktam tat sarvam tathyam eva na ca anyathā
translated: Everything that she said is true, and not otherwise.

original: yadi sā mahiṣī rājño rājñīnām ativallabhā // / //
analyzed: yadi sā mahiṣī rājñaḥ rājñīnām ati vallabhā
translated: If she is the queen of the king, the most beloved of the queens,

original: mahāsukṛtasaṃbhārair uttamaś cottamodare /
analyzed: mahā sukṛta saṃbhāraiḥ uttamaḥ ca uttama udare
translated: and the best, born in the womb of an excellent woman, through great accumulations of merit,

original: uvāsa tasyāḥ puṇyāyā nṛpasiṃhāsanocitaḥ // / //🔽ātapatraṃ ca candrābhaṃ śubhe cāpi hi cāmare /
analyzed: uvāsa tasyāḥ puṇyāyāḥ nṛpa siṃhāsana ucitaḥ  ātapatram ca candra ābham śubhe ca api hi cāmare
translated: he, fit for the lion throne of a king, dwelt in her womb, which was auspicious,🔽and also a parasol shining like the moon, and auspicious yak-tail fans,

original: bhadrāsanaṃ tathoccaṃ ca sindhurāś ca madotkaṭāḥ // / //
analyzed: bhadrāsanam tathā uccam ca sindhurāḥ ca mada utkaṭāḥ
translated: and an elevated throne, and intoxicated Sindhu horses,

original: turaṃgamāś ca turagā anādhivyādhi jīvitam /
analyzed: turaṃgamāḥ ca turagāḥ anādhivyādhi jīvitam
translated: and swift horses, and a life free from illness and disease,

original: niḥsapatnaṃ śubhaṃ rājyaṃ prāpyaṃ viṣṇuprasādataḥ // / //
analyzed: niḥsapatnam śubham rājyam prāpyam viṣṇu prasādataḥ
translated: and a kingdom free from rivals and auspicious, to be obtained by the grace of Vishnu.

original: sūta uvāca /
analyzed: sūtaḥ uvāca
translated: Suta said:

original: ity ākarṇya sunītyās tan mātur vākyam aninditam /
analyzed: iti ākarṇya sunītyāḥ tat mātuḥ vākyam aninditam
translated: Having heard these words of his mother Suniti, which were faultless,

original: saunīteyo dhruvo vācam ādade vaktum uttaram // / //
analyzed: saunīteyaḥ dhruvaḥ vācam ādade vaktum uttaram
translated: Dhruva, the son of Suniti, began to speak in reply.

original: dhruva uvāca /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ uvāca
translated: Dhruva said:

original: janayitri sunīte me śṛṇu vākyam anākulam /
analyzed: janayitri su nīte me śṛṇu vākyam an ākulam
translated: O mother Suniti, listen to my words without distraction.

original: uttānacaraṇād anyan nāstīti me matiḥ śubhe // / //
analyzed: uttāna caraṇāt anyat nā asti iti me matiḥ śubhe
translated: O auspicious one, it is my opinion that there is nothing else but Uttanacharana.

original: siddhārtho 'smy amba yady asti kaścid āśritakāmadhuk /
analyzed: siddhārthaḥ smi amba yadī asti kaścid āśrita kāmadhuk
translated: O mother, if there is anyone who can fulfill the desires of those who have resorted to him,

original: adyaiva sakalārādhyaṃ tam ārādhya jagatpatim // / //
analyzed: adyā eva sakala ārādhyam tam ārādhya jagatpatim
translated: then today itself I will worship that Lord of the universe, who is worshipped by all,

original: tattadāsāditaṃ viddhi padam anyair durāsadam /
analyzed: tat tat āsāditam viddhi padam anyaiḥ durāsadam
translated: and attain that state which is difficult for others to attain.

original: ekam eva hi sāhāyyaṃ mātar me kartum arhasi // / //
analyzed: ekam eva hi sāhāyyam mātar me kartum arhasi
translated: O mother, you should grant me this one help.

original: anujñāṃ dehi me viṣṇuṃ yathā cārādhayāmy aham // / //
analyzed: anujñām dehi me viṣṇum yathā ca ārādhayāmi aham
translated: Grant me permission so that I can worship Vishnu.

original: sunītir uvāca /
analyzed: sunītiḥ uvāca
translated: Suniti said:

original: anujñātuṃ na śaknomi tvām uttānaśayāṅgaja // / //🔽saptāṣṭavarṣadeśīyaḥ krīḍāyogyo 'si putraka /
analyzed: anujñātum na śaknomi tvām uttāna śaya aṅgaja  sapta aṣṭa varṣa deśīyaḥ krīḍā yogyaḥ si putraka
translated: O son of Uttanasha, I am unable to give you permission.🔽O son, you are only seven or eight years old and are fit for play.

original: tvadekatanayā tāta tvadādhāraikajīvitā // / //
analyzed: tvad eka tanayā tāta tvad ādhāra eka jīvitā
translated: O father, I have only one son and my life depends on you.

original: labdho 'si katibhiḥ kaṣṭhair iṣṭā saṃprārthya devatāḥ /
analyzed: labdhaḥ u si katibhiḥ kaṣṭhaiḥ iṣṭā saṃprārthya devatāḥ
translated: You were obtained after many hardships, having worshipped the gods.

original: yadā yadā bahir yāsi raṃtuṃ tricaturaṃ padam /
analyzed: yadā yadā bahis yāsi raṃtum tricaturam padam
translated: Whenever you go out to play, taking three or four steps,

original: tadā tadā mama prāṇas tāta tvām upagacchati // / //
analyzed: tadā tadā mama prāṇaḥ tāta tvām upagacchati
translated: my life, O father, goes after you.

original: dhruva uvāca /
analyzed: dhruvaḥ uvāca
translated: Dhruva said:

original: adya yāvat pitā mātā tvaṃ cottānapado vibhuḥ /
analyzed: adya yāvat pitā mātā tvam ca uttānapadaḥ vibhuḥ
translated: From today onwards, my father, mother, and you, O Lord of Uttana,

original: adyaprabhṛti me mātā pitā viṣṇur na śaṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: adya prabhṛti me mātā pitā viṣṇuḥ na śaṃśayaḥ
translated: from today onwards, Vishnu is undoubtedly my father and mother.

original: sunītir uvāca /
analyzed: sunītiḥ uvāca
translated: Suniti said:

original: viṣṇor ārādhane nāhaṃ vāraye tvāṃ suputraka /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ ārādhane na aham vāraye tvām su putraka
translated: I do not forbid you, my good son, in the worship of Vishnu.

original: jihvā me śatadhā yāti yadi tvāṃ vārayāmi bhoḥ // / //
analyzed: jihvā me śatadhā yāti yadi tvām vārayāmi bhoḥ
translated: My tongue will split into a hundred pieces if I were to forbid you, O lord.

original: ity anujñām iva prāpya jananīcaraṇāmbujau /
analyzed: iti anujñām iva prāpya jananī caraṇa ambujau
translated: Having thus obtained permission, as it were, from his mother's lotus feet,

original: parikramya praṇamyātha tapase sa dhruvo yayau // / //
analyzed: parikramya praṇamya atha tapase sa dhruvaḥ yayau
