original: tasmād bhave 'smin kila cārurūpe duḥkhākare naiva patanti santaḥ // / //
analyzed: tasmāt bhave smin kila cāru rūpe duḥkha ākare nā eva patanti santaḥ
translated: Therefore, the good ones do not fall into this beautiful but sorrowful existence.

original: patanty atho 'tattvavidaḥ sumūḍhā vahnau pataṃgā iva darśanīye /
analyzed: patanti atho tattva vidaḥ su mūḍhāḥ vahnau pataṃgāḥ iva darśanīye
translated: But the very deluded ones who do not know the truth fall, like moths into a beautiful fire.

original: yady asti nānyac charaṇaṃ sukhāya yuktaṃ tadaitat patanaṃ sukhābhe // / //
analyzed: yadi asti na anyat śaraṇam sukhāya yuktam tadā etat patanam sukha ābhe
translated: If there is no other refuge for happiness, then falling into this, which appears to be happiness, is appropriate.

original: avindatām annam aho kṛśānāṃ yuktaṃ hi piṇyākatuṣādibhakṣaṇam /
analyzed: avindatām annam aho kṛśānām yuktam hi piṇyāka tuṣa ādi bhakṣaṇam
translated: For those who do not find food, it is appropriate to eat oil-cakes, husks and so on.

original: asti tv ajaṃ śrīpatipādapadma dvaṃdvārcanaprāpyam anantam ādyam // / //
analyzed: asti tu ajam śrīpati pāda padma dvaṃdva arcana prāpyam anantam ādyam
translated: But there is the unborn, infinite, primordial [happiness] to be attained by worshipping the two lotus feet of the Lord of Shri.

original: akleśataḥ prāpyam idaṃ visṛjya mahāsukhaṃ yo 'nyasukhāni vāñchet /
analyzed: akleśataḥ prāpyam idam visṛjya mahā sukham yaḥ nyasukhāni vāñchet
translated: He who, having attained this great happiness without difficulty, desires other pleasures,

original: rājyaṃ karasthaṃ svam asau visṛjya bhikṣām aṭed dīnamanāḥ sumūḍhaḥ // / //🔽tac cārcyate śrīpatipādapadma dvaṃdvaṃ na vastrair na dhanaiḥ śramair na /
analyzed: rājyam kara stham svam asau visṛjya bhikṣām aṭet dīna manāḥ su mūḍhaḥ  tat ca arcyate śrīpati pāda padma dvaṃdvam na vastraiḥ na dhanaiḥ śramaiḥ na
translated: Having abandoned his own kingdom in his hand, he would beg for alms with a humble mind, being greatly deluded.

original: ananyacittena nareṇa kiṃtu uccāryate keśava mādhaveti // / //
analyzed: an anya cittena nareṇa kiṃtu uccāryate keśava mādhava iti
translated: And that is worshipped, not with clothes, wealth, or toil, but by a man with a one-pointed mind, uttering Keshava Madhava to the pair of lotus feet of the Lord of Shri.

original: evaṃ bhavaṃ duḥkhamayaṃ viditvā daityātmajāḥ sādhu hariṃ bhajadhvam /
analyzed: evam bhavam duḥkha mayam viditvā daitya ātmajāḥ sādhu harim bhajadhvam
translated: Knowing existence to be thus full of suffering, O sons of the demon, worship Hari well.

original: evaṃ jano janmaphalaṃ labheta no ced bhavābdhau prapated adho 'dhaḥ // / //🔽tasmād bhave 'smin hṛdi śaṅkacakra gadādharaṃ devam anantam īḍyam /
analyzed: evam janaḥ janma phalam labheta no ced bhava abdhau prapatet adhas dhas  tasmāt bhave smin hṛdi śaṅka cakra gadā dharam devam anantam īḍyam
translated: Thus a person would obtain the fruit of birth; otherwise, he would fall lower and lower in the ocean of existence.

original: smarantu nityaṃ varadaṃ mukundaṃ sadbhaktiyogena nivṛttakāmāḥ // / //
analyzed: smarantu nityam vara dam mukundam sat bhakti yogena nivṛtta kāmāḥ
translated: Therefore, in this existence, remember in the heart the god Ananta, the holder of the conch, discus, and mace, the giver of boons, Mukunda, with the yoga of true devotion, with desires renounced.

original: anāstikatvāt kṛpayā bhavadbhyo vadāmi guhyaṃ bhavasindhusaṃsthāḥ /
analyzed: anāstika tvāt kṛpayā bhavadbhyaḥ vadāmi guhyam bhava sindhu saṃsthāḥ
translated: Out of non-atheism, out of compassion, I tell you the secret, you who are in the ocean of existence.

original: sarveṣu bhūteṣu ca mitrabhāvaṃ bhajantv ayaṃ sarvagato hi viṣṇuḥ // / //
analyzed: sarveṣu bhūteṣu ca mitra bhāvam bhajantu ayam sarva gataḥ hi viṣṇuḥ
translated: May all beings attain the state of friends, for Vishnu is present everywhere.

original: daityaputrā ūcuḥ /
analyzed: daitya putrāḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The sons of the demon said:

original: prahlāda tvaṃ vayaṃ cāpi bālabhāvān mahāmate /
analyzed: prahlāda tvam vayam ca api bāla bhāvāt mahāmate
translated: O Prahlada, you and we also, O greatly wise one, due to childishness,

original: ṣaṇḍāmarkāt paraṃ mitraṃ guruṃ cānyaṃ na vidmahe // / //
analyzed: ṣaṇḍāmarkāt param mitram gurum ca anyam na vidmahe
translated: We do not know of any other friend or preceptor superior to Śaṇḍāmārka.

original: tvayaitac chikṣitaṃ kutra tathyaṃ no vada nistuṣam // / //
analyzed: tvayā etat śikṣitam kutra tathyam naḥ vada nistuṣam
translated: Where did you learn this? Tell us the truth, free from chaff.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlada said:

original: yadā tātaḥ prayāto me taporthaṃ kānanaṃ mahat // / //
analyzed: yadā tātaḥ prayātaḥ me tapaḥ rtham kānanam mahat
translated: When my father went to a great forest for austerities,

original: tadā cendraḥ samāgatya puraṃ tasya rurodha ha /
analyzed: tadā ca indraḥ samāgatya puram tasya rurodha ha
translated: then Indra came and besieged his city.

original: mṛtaṃ vijñāya daityendraṃ hiraṇyakaśipuṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: mṛtam vijñāya daitya indram hiraṇyakaśipum tadā
translated: Knowing that the lord of demons, Hiranyakashipu, was dead,

original: indro me jananīṃ gṛhya prayāto manmathāgninā /
analyzed: indraḥ me jananīm gṛhya prayātaḥ manmatha agninā
translated: Indra took my mother and left, burning with the fire of passion.

original: dahyamāno mahābhāgāṃ mārge gacchati satvaram // / //
analyzed: dahyamānaḥ mahābhāgām mārge gacchati sa tvaram
translated: Burning, the illustrious one was going quickly on the road.

original: tadā māṃ garbhagaṃ jñātvā nārado devadarśanaḥ /
analyzed: tadā mām garbha gam jñātvā nāradaḥ devadarśanaḥ
translated: Then Narada, who had the appearance of a god, knowing that I was in her womb,

original: āgatyendraṃ jagādoccair mūḍha muñca pativratām // / //
analyzed: āgatya indram jagāda uccais mūḍha muñca pativratām
translated: came and said loudly to Indra, Fool, release the faithful wife.

original: asyā garbhe sthito yo 'sau sa vai bhāgavatottamaḥ /
analyzed: asyāḥ garbhe sthitaḥ sa vai bhāgavata uttamaḥ
translated: He who is in her womb is the best devotee of Vishnu.

original: tac chrutvā nāradavaco mātaraṃ praṇipatya me // / //
analyzed: tat śrutvā nārada vacaḥ mātaram praṇipatya me
translated: Hearing those words of Narada, bowing to my mother,

original: viṣṇubhaktyā pramucyātha gataḥ svaṃ bhuvanaṃ hariḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇu bhaktyā pramucya atha gataḥ svam bhuvanam hariḥ
translated: Indra, out of devotion to Vishnu, released her and went to his own world.

original: nāradas tāṃ samānīya āśramaṃ svaṃ śubhavrataḥ // / //
analyzed: nāradaḥ tām samānīya āśramam svam śubha vrataḥ
translated: Narada, of good vows, brought her to his hermitage,🔽and I was born from her in the hermitage.

original: mām uddiśya mahābhāgām etad vai kathitaṃ tadā /
analyzed: mām uddiśya mahābhāgām etat vai kathitam tadā
translated: For my sake, O highly blessed ones, this was said by him at that time.

original: tathā me vismṛtaṃ naiva bālābhyāsād danoḥ sutāḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā me vismṛtam nā eva bāla abhyāsāt danoḥ sutāḥ
translated: And so, O sons of Danu, it has not been forgotten by me, through the practice from childhood.

original: viṣṇoś cānugraheṇaiva nāradasyopadeśataḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇoḥ ca anugraheṇa eva nāradasya upadeśataḥ
translated: By the grace of Vishnu and by the instruction of Narada,

original: ekadā guptacaryāyāṃ gato 'sau rākṣasādhipaḥ // / //
analyzed: ekadā gupta caryāyām sau rākṣasa adhipaḥ
translated: once, when he had gone on a secret mission, that lord of the Rakshasas,

original: śṛṇoti rātrau nagare jaya rāmeti kīrtanam /
analyzed: śṛṇoti rātrau nagare jaya rāma iti kīrtanam
translated: heard in the night in the city the glorification of Rama's victory.

original: avait putrakṛtaṃ sarvaṃ balavān dānaveśvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: avait putra kṛtam sarvam balavān dānava īśvaraḥ
translated: The powerful lord of the Danavas understood everything done by his son,

original: athāhūyāha daityendraḥ krodhāndhaḥ sa purohitān /
analyzed: athā āhūya āha daitya indraḥ krodha andhaḥ sa purohitān
translated: then the king of the Daityas, blinded with anger, called his priests and said:

original: re re kṣudradvijā yūyam atimumūrṣatāṃ gatāḥ // / //
analyzed: re re kṣudra dvijāḥ yūyam ati mumūrṣa tām gatāḥ
translated: O you wretched Brahmins, you have gone to the point of death.

original: prahlādo 'yaṃ mṛṣālāpān vakty anyān pāṭhayaty api /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ yam mṛṣā ālāpān vakti anyān pāṭhayati api
translated: This Prahlada speaks lies and teaches others too.

original: iti nirbhartsya tān viprān śvasan rājāviśad gṛham // / //
analyzed: iti nirbhartsya tān viprān śvasan rājā aviśat gṛham
translated: Having thus rebuked the Brahmins, the king, sighing, entered his house.

original: na ca putravadhe cintāṃ jahau svavadhakāriṇīm /
analyzed: na ca putra vadhe cintām jahau sva vadha kāriṇīm
translated: And he did not give up his anxiety about his own death, which was the cause of his son's death.

original: āsannamaraṇo 'marṣāt kṛtyam ekaṃ vimṛśya saḥ // / //🔽akṛtyam eva daityādīn āhūyopādiśad rahaḥ /
analyzed: āsanna maraṇaḥ marṣāt kṛtyam ekam vimṛśya saḥ  akṛtyam eva daitya ādīn āhūya upādiśat rahaḥ
translated: The one who was about to die, out of anger, having considered one thing to be done,🔽unwisely called the Daityas and others and secretly taught them:🔽Today, in the night, the wicked Prahlada, while asleep, with fierce🔽 Translation: For my sake, O highly blessed ones, this was said by him at that time.

original: adya kṣapāyāṃ prahlādaṃ prasuptaṃ duṣṭam ulbaṇaiḥ // / //
analyzed: adya kṣapāyām prahlādam prasuptam duṣṭam ulbaṇaiḥ
translated: And so, O sons of Danu, it has not been forgotten by me, through the practice from childhood.🔽 By the grace of Vishnu and by the instruction of Narada,🔽once, when he had gone on a secret mission, that lord of the Rakshasas,🔽heard in the night in the city the glorification of Rama's victory.🔽The powerful lord of the Danavas understood everything done by his son,🔽then the king of the Daityas, blinded with anger, called his priests and said:🔽O you wretched Brahmins, you have gone to the point of death.🔽This Prahlada speaks lies and teaches others too.🔽Having thus rebuked the Brahmins, the king, sighing, entered his house.🔽And he did not give up his anxiety about his own death, which was the cause of his son's death.🔽The one who was about to die, out of anger, having considered one thing to be done,🔽unwisely called the Daityas and others and secretly taught them:🔽Today, in the

original: nāgapāśair dṛḍhaṃ baddhvā madhye nikṣipatāmbudheḥ /
analyzed: nāgapāśaiḥ dṛḍham baddhvā madhye nikṣipata ambudheḥ
translated: Binding him tightly with serpent-nooses, they threw him into the middle of the ocean.

original: tadājñāṃ śirasādāya dadṛśus tam upetya te // / //
analyzed: tad ājñām śirasā ādāya dadṛśuḥ tam upetya te
translated: Taking his command on their heads, they saw him, having approached him,

original: rātripriyaṃ samādhisthaṃ prabuddhaṃ suptavat sthitam /
analyzed: rātripriyam samādhi stham prabuddham supta vat sthitam
translated: Delighting in the night, absorbed in meditation, awakened, as if sleeping.

original: saṃchinnarāgalobhādi mahābandhaṃ kṣapācarāḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃchinna rāga lobha ādi mahā bandham kṣapācarāḥ
translated: The night-walkers, having cut off his great bonds of passion, greed, etc.,

original: babandhus taṃ mahātmānaṃ phalgubhiḥ sarparajjubhiḥ /
analyzed: babandhuḥ tam mahātmānam phalgubhiḥ sarpa rajjubhiḥ
translated: Bound that great soul with thin serpent-ropes.

original: garuḍadhvajabhaktaṃ taṃ buddhvāhibhir abuddhayaḥ // / //
analyzed: garuḍa dhvaja bhaktam tam buddhvā ahibhiḥ abuddhayaḥ
translated: Knowing him to be devoted to the banner of Garuda, the unwise serpents

original: jalaśāyipriyaṃ nītvā jalarāśau nicikṣipuḥ /
analyzed: jalaśāyi priyam nītvā jala rāśau nicikṣipuḥ
translated: Having taken him, dear to the one who lies in the water, threw him into the mass of water.

original: balinas te 'calān daityā tasyopari nidhāya ca // / //
analyzed: balinaḥ te calān daityā tasya upari nidhāya ca
translated: Those powerful demons, having placed immovable ones on top of him,

original: śaśaṃsus taṃ priyaṃ rājñe drutaṃ tān so 'py amānayat /🔽prahlādaṃ cābdhimadhyasthaṃ tam aurvāgnim ivāparam // / //
analyzed: śaśaṃsuḥ tam priyam rājñe drutam tān saḥ api amānayat  prahlādam ca abdhi madhya stham tam aurva agnim iva aparam
translated: Announced him to the king, and he quickly honored them.🔽And Prahlada, remaining in the ocean, like a second fire of Aurva,

original: jvalantaṃ tejasā viṣṇor grāhā bhūribhiyātyajan /🔽sa cābhinnacidānanda sindhumadhye samāhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: jvalantam tejasā viṣṇoḥ grāhāḥ bhūri bhiyā atyajan  sa ca abhinna cit ānanda sindhu madhye samāhitaḥ
translated: Blazing with the splendor of Vishnu, the planets abandoned him out of great fear.🔽And he, absorbed in the middle of the ocean of undivided consciousness and bliss,

original: na veda baddham ātmānaṃ lavaṇāmbudhimadhyagam /
analyzed: na veda baddham ātmānam lavaṇa ambudhi madhya gam
translated: Did not know that his soul was bound, in the middle of the salt ocean.

original: atha brahmāmṛtāmbhodhi /
analyzed: atha brahma amṛta ambhodhi
translated: Then Brahma, the ocean of nectar,

original: maye svasmin sthite munau // / //🔽yayau kṣobhaṃ dvitīyābdhi praveśād iva sāgaraḥ /
analyzed: maye svasmin sthite munau  yayau kṣobham dvitīya abdhi praveśāt iva sāgaraḥ
translated: when the sage remained in himself.🔽It was agitated, like the ocean by the entry of a second ocean.

original: kleśāt kleśān ivoddhūya prahlādam atha vīcayaḥ // / //
analyzed: kleśāt kleśān iva uddhūya prahlādam atha vīcayaḥ
translated: The waves, as if shaking off their distress, then went to the shore, as if from the ocean.

original: ninyus tīre 'plavāmbhodheḥ gurūktaya ivāmbudheḥ /
analyzed: ninyuḥ tīre plava ambhodheḥ guru uktayaḥ iva ambudheḥ
translated: The words of the guru lead to the shore of the ocean of worldly existence.

original: dhyānena viṣṇubhūtaṃ taṃ bhagavān varuṇālayaḥ // / //
analyzed: dhyānena viṣṇu bhūtam tam bhagavān varuṇālayaḥ
translated: The illustrious abode of Varuna, having made him full of Vishnu through meditation,

original: vinyasya tīre ratnāni gṛhītvā draṣṭum āyayau /
analyzed: vinyasya tīre ratnāni gṛhītvā draṣṭum āyayau
translated: placed the jewels on the shore and took them to see.

original: tāvad bhagavatādiṣṭaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ pannagāśanaḥ // / //
analyzed: tāvat bhagavatā ādiṣṭaḥ prahṛṣṭaḥ pannagāśanaḥ
translated: By that time, the delighted serpent-eater, instructed by the Lord,

original: bandhanāhīn samabhyetya bhakṣayitvā punar yayau /🔽athābabhāṣe prahlādaṃ gambhīradhvanir arṇavaḥ // / //
analyzed: bandhana ahīn samabhyetya bhakṣayitvā punar yayau  athā ābabhāṣe prahlādam gambhīra dhvaniḥ arṇavaḥ
translated: approaching the bound snakes, ate them and went away again.🔽Then the deep-voiced ocean spoke to Prahlada,

original: praṇamya divyarūpaḥ san samādhisthaṃ hareḥ priyam /
analyzed: praṇamya divya rūpaḥ san samādhi stham hareḥ priyam
translated: having bowed to him, the dear one of Hari, dwelling in meditation, with a divine form.

original: prahlāda bhagavadbhakta puṇyātmann arṇavo 'smy aham // / //
analyzed: prahlāda bhagavat bhakta puṇya ātman arṇavaḥ smi aham
translated: O Prahlada, O devotee of the Lord, O virtuous one, I am the ocean.

original: cakṣurbhyām atha māṃ dṛṣṭvā pāvayārthinam āgatam /
analyzed: cakṣurbhyām atha mām dṛṣṭvā pāvaya arthinam āgatam
translated: Having seen me with your eyes, sanctify me, the supplicant who has come.

original: ity ambudhigiraḥ śrutvā sa mahātmā hareḥ priyaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti ambudhi giraḥ śrutvā sa mahātmā hareḥ priyaḥ
translated: Having heard these words of the ocean, the great-souled one, the dear one of Hari,

original: udvīkṣya sahasā devaṃ taṃ natvāhāsurātmajaḥ /
analyzed: udvīkṣya sahasā devam tam natvā āha asura ātmajaḥ
translated: suddenly beholding the Lord, bowed to him and spoke, the son of the demon.

original: kadāgataṃ bhagavatā tam athāmbudhir abravīt // / //
analyzed: kadāgatam bhagavatā tam atha ambudhiḥ abravīt
translated: The ocean said to him, When did you come here, O Lord?

original: yoginn ajñātavṛttas tvam aparāddhaṃ tavāsuraiḥ /
analyzed: yogin ajñāta vṛttaḥ tvam aparāddham tava asuraiḥ
translated: O Yogi, you are ignorant of the events, the Asuras have offended you.

original: baddhas tvam ahibhir daityair mayi kṣipto 'dya vaiṣṇava // / //
analyzed: baddhaḥ tvam ahibhiḥ daityaiḥ mayi kṣiptaḥ dya vaiṣṇava
translated: You were bound by the serpents and the Daityas, and today you were thrown into me, O devotee of Vishnu.

original: tatas tūrṇaṃ mayā tīre nyastas tvaṃ phaṇinaś ca tān /
analyzed: tatas tūrṇam mayā tīre nyastaḥ tvam phaṇinaḥ ca tān
translated: Then I quickly placed you on the shore and the serpents too.

original: idānīm eva garuḍo bhakṣayitvā gato mahān // / //
analyzed: idānīm eva garuḍaḥ bhakṣayitvā gataḥ mahān
translated: Just now the great Garuda has eaten them and gone away.

original: mahātmann anugṛhṇīṣva tvaṃ māṃ satsaṅgam ārthinam /
analyzed: mahātman anugṛhṇīṣva tvam mām sat saṅgam ārthinam
translated: O great soul, favor me, who desires the association of the good.

original: gṛhāṇemāni ratnāni pūjyas tvaṃ me harir yathā // / //
analyzed: gṛhāṇa imāni ratnāni pūjyaḥ tvam me hariḥ yathā
translated: Accept these jewels, you are as venerable to me as Hari.

original: yady apy etair na te kṛtyaṃ ratnair dāsyāmy athāpy aham /
analyzed: yadi api etaiḥ na te kṛtyam ratnaiḥ dāsyāmi atha api aham
translated: Even if you have no use for these jewels, I will still give them to you.

original: dīpān nivedayaty eva bhāskarasyāpi bhaktimān // / //
analyzed: dīpān nivedayati eva bhāskarasya api bhaktimān
translated: Even a devotee offers lamps to the sun.

original: tvam āpatsv api ghorāsu viṣṇunaiva hi rakṣitaḥ /
analyzed: tvam āpatsu api ghorāsu viṣṇunā eva hi rakṣitaḥ
translated: You have been protected by Vishnu alone even in terrible calamities.

original: tvādṛśā nirmalātmāno na santi bahavo 'rkavat // / //
analyzed: tvādṛśāḥ nirmala ātmānaḥ na santi bahavaḥ rka vat
translated: There are not many like you, pure souls, like the sun.

original: bahunā kiṃ kṛtārtho 'smi yat tiṣṭhāmi tvayā saha /
analyzed: bahunā kim kṛtārthaḥ smi yat tiṣṭhāmi tvayā saha
translated: What is the use of much talk? I am fortunate that I am staying with you.

original: ālapāmi kṣaṇam api nekṣe hy etat phalopamām // / //
analyzed: ālapāmi kṣaṇam api nā īkṣe hi etat phala upamām
translated: I speak for a moment, but I do not see this as having any fruit.

original: ity abdhinā stutaḥ śrīśa māhātmyavacanaiḥ svayam /
analyzed: iti abdhinā stutaḥ śrīśa māhātmya vacanaiḥ svayam
translated: Thus praised by the ocean with words of greatness, the Lord of Shri,

original: yayau lajjāṃ praharṣaṃ ca prahlādo bhagavatpriyaḥ // / //
analyzed: yayau lajjām praharṣam ca prahlādaḥ bhagavat priyaḥ
translated: Prahlada, dear to the Lord, went into both shame and joy.

original: pratigṛhya sa ratnāni vatsalaḥ prāha vāridhim /
analyzed: pratigṛhya sa ratnāni vatsalaḥ prāha vāridhim
translated: Accepting the jewels, the affectionate one spoke to the ocean:

original: mahātman sutarāṃ dhanyaḥ śete tvayi hi sa prabhuḥ // / //
analyzed: mahātman sutarām dhanyaḥ śete tvayi hi sa prabhuḥ
translated: O magnanimous one, the Lord himself sleeps in you, indeed, you are most blessed.

original: kalpānte 'pi jagat kṛtsnaṃ grasitvā sa jaganmayaḥ /
analyzed: kalpa ante jagat kṛtsnam grasitvā sa jagat mayaḥ
translated: At the end of the kalpa, having swallowed the entire world, that one who is the essence of the world,

original: tvayy evaikārṇavībhūte śete kila mahātmani // / //
analyzed: tvayi evā ekārṇavībhūte śete kila mahātmani
translated: sleeps in you alone, when you have become the one ocean, in that magnanimous one, it is said.

original: locanābhyāṃ jagannāthaṃ draṣṭum icchāmi vāridhe /
analyzed: locanābhyām jagannātham draṣṭum icchāmi vāridhe
translated: O ocean, I wish to see the Lord of the world with my eyes.

original: tvaṃ paśyasi sadā dhanyas tatropāyaṃ prayaccha me // / //
analyzed: tvam paśyasi sadā dhanyaḥ tatra upāyam prayaccha me
translated: You are always blessed to see him. Give me the means to do so.

original: uktveti pādāvanataṃ tūrṇam utthāpya sāgaraḥ /🔽prahlādaṃ prāha yogīndra tvaṃ paśyasi sadā hṛdi // / //
analyzed: uktvā iti pāda avanatam tūrṇam utthāpya sāgaraḥ  prahlādam prāha yogi indra tvam paśyasi sadā hṛdi
translated: Having said this, the ocean quickly raised Prahlada, who had bowed at his feet,🔽and spoke to him: You always see him in your heart, O lord of yogis.

original: draṣṭum icchasy athākṣibhyāṃ stuhi taṃ bhaktavatsalam /🔽uktveti sindhuḥ prahlādam ātmanaḥ sa jale 'viśat // / //
analyzed: draṣṭum icchasi atha akṣibhyām stuhi tam bhakta vatsalam  uktvā iti sindhuḥ prahlādam ātmanaḥ sa jale viśat
translated: If you wish to see him with your eyes, praise him, who is affectionate towards his devotees.🔽Having said this, the ocean entered his own waters, along with Prahlada.

original: gate nadīndre sthitvaiko hariṃ rātrau sa daityajaḥ /
analyzed: gate nadīndre sthitvā ekaḥ harim rātrau sa daitya jaḥ
translated: When the king of rivers had left, the demon's son remained alone, worshipping Hari at night.

original: bhaktyāstaud iti manvānas taddarśanam asaṃbhavam // / //
analyzed: bhaktyā astaut iti manvānaḥ tad darśanam asaṃbhavam
translated: Thinking that it was impossible to see him, he praised him with devotion.

original: prahlāda uvāca /
analyzed: prahlādaḥ uvāca
translated: Prahlāda said:

original: vedāntavākyaśatamārutasaṃpravṛddha vairāgyavahniśikhayā paritāpya cittam /
analyzed: vedānta vākya śata māruta saṃpravṛddha vairāgya vahni śikhayā paritāpya cittam
translated: The wise ones purify the mind, which is fanned by the hundreds of breezes of Vedanta statements and the flames of the fire of renunciation,

original: saṃśodhayanti yadavekṣaṇayogyatāyai dhīrāḥ sadaiva sa kathaṃ mama gocaraḥ syāt // / //
analyzed: saṃśodhayanti yad avekṣaṇa yogya tāyai dhīrāḥ sadā eva sa katham mama gocaraḥ syāt
translated: for the sake of becoming worthy of beholding him. How can he, who is always like that, be within my reach?

original: mātsaryaroṣasmaralobhamoha madādibhir vā sudṛḍhaiḥ suṣaḍbhiḥ /
analyzed: mātsarya roṣa smara lobha moha mada ādibhiḥ vā su dṛḍhaiḥ su ṣaḍbhiḥ
translated: Or by the six very strong coverings of miserliness, anger, lust, greed, delusion, pride, etc.,

original: uparyuparyāvaraṇaiḥ subaddham andhaṃ mano me kva hariḥ kva vāham // / //
analyzed: upari upari āvaraṇaiḥ su baddham andham manaḥ me kva hariḥ kva vā aham
translated: my blind mind is very well bound above and below. Where is Hari? Where am I?

original: yaṃ dhātṛmukhyā vibudhā bhayeṣu śāntyarthinaḥ kṣīranidher upāntam /
analyzed: yam dhātṛ mukhyāḥ vibudhāḥ bhayeṣu śānti arthinaḥ kṣīranidheḥ upāntam
translated: The gods led by Brahmā, seeking peace in times of fear,

original: gatvottamastotrakṛtaḥ kathaṃcit paśyanti taṃ draṣṭum aho mamāśā // / //
analyzed: gatvā uttama stotra kṛtaḥ kathaṃcid paśyanti tam draṣṭum aho mama āśā
translated: having somehow gone to the edge of the ocean of milk and offered the best praises, see him. Oh! My hope to see him!

original: ayogyam ātmānam itīśadarśane sa manyamānas tadanāptikātaraḥ /
analyzed: ayogyam ātmānam iti īśa darśane sa manyamānaḥ tad anāpti kātaraḥ
translated: Considering himself unworthy in the vision of the Lord, afraid of not attaining him,

original: udvegaduḥkhārṇavamagnamānasaḥ srutāśrudhāro nṛpa mūrcchito 'patat // / //
analyzed: udvega duḥkha arṇava magna mānasaḥ sruta aśru dhāraḥ nṛpa patat
translated: with a mind immersed in the ocean of distress and sorrow, with tears flowing, O king, he fell down in a faint.

original: atha kṣaṇāt sarvagataś caturbhujaḥ śubhākṛtir bhaktajanaikavallabhaḥ /
analyzed: atha kṣaṇāt sarva gataḥ catur bhujaḥ śubha ākṛtiḥ bhakta jana eka vallabhaḥ
translated: Then in a moment, the all-pervading one with four arms, of auspicious form, the sole beloved of devotees,

original: duḥsthaṃ tam āśliṣya sudhāmayair bhujais tatraiva bhūpāvir abhūd dayānidhiḥ // / //
analyzed: duḥstham tam āśliṣya sudhā mayaiḥ bhujaiḥ tatra eva bhūpa āviḥ abhūt dayā nidhiḥ
translated: embraced him who was in a bad state with his nectar-like arms, and there only the ocean of compassion, the king, appeared.

original: sa labdhasaṃjño 'tha tadaṅgasaṅgād unmīlitākṣaḥ sahasā dadarśa /🔽prasannavaktraṃ kamalāyatākṣaṃ sudīrghabāhuṃ yamunāsavarṇam // / //
analyzed: sa labdha saṃjñaḥ tad aṅga saṅgāt unmīlita akṣaḥ sahasā dadarśa  prasanna vaktram kamala āyata akṣam su dīrgha bāhum yamunā savarṇam
translated: Then, having regained consciousness from contact with his body, with his eyes opened, he suddenly saw🔽a pleasant-faced one with eyes long like lotus petals, with very long arms, and the color of Yamuna,

original: udāratejomayam aprameyaṃ gadāriśaṅkhāmbujacārucihnitam /
analyzed: udāra tejaḥ mayam aprameyam gadā ari śaṅkha ambuja cāru cihnitam
translated: immeasurable, full of great splendor, beautifully marked with the marks of the mace, discus, conch, and lotus,

original: sthitaṃ samāliṅgya vibhuṃ sa dṛṣṭvā prakampito vismayabhītiharṣaiḥ // / //
analyzed: sthitam samāliṅgya vibhum sa dṛṣṭvā prakampitaḥ vismaya bhīti harṣaiḥ
translated: standing, having embraced the Lord. Seeing him, he trembled with fear, wonder, and joy.

original: tat svapnam evātha sa manyamānaḥ svapne 'pi paśyāmi hariṃ kṛtārtham /
analyzed: tat svapnam eva atha sa manyamānaḥ svapne pi paśyāmi harim kṛtārtham
translated: Then, considering it a dream, he thought, I see Hari, who has accomplished his purpose, even in a dream.

original: iti praharṣārṇavamagnacetāḥ svānandamūrchāṃ sa punaś ca bheje // / //
analyzed: iti praharṣa arṇava magna cetāḥ sva ānanda mūrchām sa punar ca bheje
translated: Thus, with his mind immersed in the ocean of joy, he again experienced the swoon of bliss.

original: tataḥ kṣitāv eva niviśya nāthaḥ kṛtvā tam aṅke svajanaikabandhuḥ /
analyzed: tatas kṣitau eva niviśya nāthaḥ kṛtvā tam aṅke sva jana eka bandhuḥ
translated: Then, the Lord, having settled him on the ground, placing him on his lap, the sole friend of his people,

original: śanair vidhunvan karapallavena spṛśan muhur mātṛvad āliliṅga // / //
analyzed: śanais vidhunvan karapallavena spṛśan muhur mātṛ vat āliliṅga
translated: slowly shaking with his tender hand, touching him again and again like a mother, embraced him.

original: tataś cireṇa prahlādaḥ saṃmukhonmīlitekṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatas cireṇa prahlādaḥ saṃmukha unmīlita īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: Then after a long time, Prahlada, with eyes opened wide in front,

original: āluloke jagannāthaṃ vismayāviṣṭacetasā // / //
analyzed: āluloke jagannātham vismaya āviṣṭa cetasā
translated: looked at the Lord of the universe with a mind filled with wonder.

original: tataś cirāt taṃ saṃbhāvya dhīraḥ śrīśāṅkaśāyinam /
analyzed: tatas cirāt tam saṃbhāvya dhīraḥ śrīśāṅka śāyinam
translated: Then after a long time, the wise one, recognizing the glorious Sha Shankara,

original: ātmānaṃ sahasottasthau sadyaḥ sabhayasaṃbhramaḥ // / //🔽praṇāmāyāpatac corvyāṃ prasīdeti vadan muhuḥ /
analyzed: ātmānam sahasā uttasthau sadyas sa bhaya saṃbhramaḥ  praṇāmāya apatat ca urvyām prasīda iti vadan muhur
translated: suddenly rose up with fear and confusion.🔽And falling on the ground to offer salutations, repeatedly saying Be pleased,

original: saṃbhramāt sa bahujño 'pi nānyāṃ pūjoktim asmarat // / //
analyzed: saṃbhramāt sa bahu jñaḥ na anyām pūjā uktim asmarat
translated: out of confusion, even though he was very learned, he could not remember any other words of worship.

original: tam athābhayahastena gadāśaṅkhāridhṛk prabhuḥ /
analyzed: tam atha abhaya hastena gadā śaṅkha ari dhṛk prabhuḥ
translated: Then the Lord, holding the conch, discus, and sword in his hands,

original: gṛhītvā prahlādaṃ sa dayānidhiḥ // / //
analyzed: gṛhītvā sthāpayāmasa prahlādam sa dayā nidhiḥ
translated: took hold of Prahlada, the abode of compassion.

original: karābjasparśanāhlāda galadaśruṃ savepathum /🔽bhūyo 'thāhlādayan svāmī taṃ jagādeti sāntvayan // / //
analyzed: kara abja sparśana āhlāda galat aśrum sa vepathum  bhūyas thā āhlādayan svāmī tam jagāda iti sāntvayan
translated: With the bliss of the touch of his lotus hand, tears flowing and trembling,🔽the Lord, delighting him again, spoke to him in this way, comforting him.

original: sabhayaṃ saṃbhramaṃ vatsa madgauravakṛtaṃ tyaja /
analyzed: sa bhayam saṃbhramam vatsa mad gaurava kṛtam tyaja
translated: O child, give up the fear and confusion caused by my greatness.

original: naivaṃ priyo me bhakteṣu svādhīnapraṇayī bhava // / //
analyzed: na evam priyaḥ me bhakteṣu svādhīna praṇayī bhava
translated: Do not be like this. Be devoted to me, who am self-dependent and dear to my devotees.

original: nityaṃ saṃpūrṇakāmasya janmāni vividhāni me /
analyzed: nityam saṃpūrṇa kāmasya janmāni vividhāni me
translated: I have various births, always with all my desires fulfilled,

original: bhaktasarveṣṭadānāya tasmāt kiṃ te priyaṃ vada // / //
analyzed: bhakta sarva iṣṭa dānāya tasmāt kim te priyam vada
translated: for the sake of giving all that is desired by the devotees. Therefore, tell me what is dear to you.

original: atha vyajijñapad viṣṇuṃ prahlādaḥ prāñjalir naman /
analyzed: atha vyajijñapat viṣṇum prahlādaḥ prāñjaliḥ naman
translated: Then Prahlada, with folded hands, bowed to Vishnu and said:

original: salaulyam utphulladṛśā paśyann evaṃ ca tanmukham // / //
analyzed: sa laulyam utphulla dṛśā paśyan evam ca tad mukham
translated: Looking at his face with eyes wide open in eagerness,

original: nāpy ayaṃ varadānāya kālo naiṣa prasīda me /
analyzed: nā api ayam vara dānāya kālaḥ nā eṣa prasīda me
translated: This is not the time for granting boons, be gracious to me.

original: tvaddarśanāmṛtāsvādād antarātmā na tṛpyati // / //🔽brahmādidevair durlakṣyaṃ tvām eva paśyataḥ prabho /
analyzed: tvad darśana amṛta āsvādāt antarātmā na tṛpyati  brahma ādi devaiḥ durlakṣyam tvām eva paśyataḥ prabho
translated: My inner self is not satisfied with the nectar of beholding you.

original: tṛptiṃ neṣyati me cittaṃ kalpāyutaśatair api // / //
analyzed: tṛptim neṣyati me cittam kalpa ayuta śataiḥ api
translated: O Lord, even if I were to see you for hundreds of thousands of kalpas, my mind will not be satisfied, for you are difficult to be seen even by Brahma and other gods.

original: naivam etad dhy atṛptasya tvāṃ dṛṣṭvānyad vṛṇoti kim /🔽tataḥ smitasudhāpūraiḥ pūrayan sa priyaṃ priyāt // / //
analyzed: na evam etat hi atṛptasya tvām dṛṣṭvā anyat vṛṇoti kim  tatas smita sudhā pūraiḥ pūrayan sa priyam priyāt
translated: How can one who is not satisfied with beholding you, desire anything else?

original: yojayan mokṣalakṣmyaiva taṃ jagāda jagatpatiḥ /
analyzed: yojayan mokṣa lakṣmyā eva tam jagāda jagatpatiḥ
translated: Then, filling his beloved with the nectar of his smile, the Lord of the universe spoke to him, uniting him with the glory of liberation.

original: satyaṃ maddarśanād anyad vatsa naivāsti te priyam // / //
analyzed: satyam mad darśanāt anyat vatsa nā evā asti te priyam
translated: Truly, O child, there is nothing dearer to you than beholding me.

original: kiṃcit te dātum iṣṭaṃ me matpriyārthaṃ vṛṇīṣva tat /
analyzed: kiṃcid te dātum iṣṭam me mad priya artham vṛṇīṣva tat
translated: I wish to give you something, choose it for the sake of pleasing me.

original: prahlādo 'thābravīd dhīmān deva janmāntareṣv api // / //
analyzed: prahlādaḥ thā bravīt dhīmān deva janmāntareṣu api
translated: Then the wise Prahlada said: O God, even in my future births,

original: dāsas tavāhaṃ bhūyāsaṃ garutmān iva bhaktimān /
analyzed: dāsaḥ tava aham bhūyāsam garutmān iva bhaktimān
translated: I wish to be your servant, devoted like Garuda.

original: athāha nāthaḥ prahlādaṃ saṃkaṭaṃ khalv idaṃ kṛtam // / //
analyzed: atha āha nāthaḥ prahlādam saṃkaṭam khalu idam kṛtam
translated: Then the Lord said to Prahlada, This is indeed a difficult situation you have created.

original: ahaṃ tavātmadānecchus tvaṃ tu bhṛtyatvam icchasi /
analyzed: aham tava ātma dāna icchuḥ tvam tu bhṛtya tvam icchasi
translated: I am desirous of giving you my own self, but you desire to be my servant.

original: varān anyāṃś ca varaya dhīman daityeśvarātmaja // / //🔽prahlādo 'pi punaḥ prāha bhaktakāmapradaṃ harim /
analyzed: varān anyān ca varaya dhīman daitya īśvara ātmaja  prahlādaḥ pi punar prāha bhakta kāma pradam harim
translated: O wise one, O son of the lord of demons, choose other boons.

original: prasīda sāstu me nātha tvadbhaktiḥ sāttvikī sthirā // / //
analyzed: prasīda sā astu me nātha tvad bhaktiḥ sāttvikī sthirā
translated: Prahlada also said to Hari, the giver of desires to devotees, Be pleased, O Lord, let there be stable and pure devotion to you for me.

original: anayātha ca tvāṃ naumi nṛtyāmi tvatparaḥ sadā /🔽athābhituṣṭo bhagavān priyam āha priyaṃvadam // / //
analyzed: anayā atha ca tvām naumi nṛtyāmi tvad paraḥ sadā  athā abhituṣṭaḥ bhagavān priyam āha priyaṃvadam
translated: By this, I praise you and always dance, being devoted to you.

original: vatsa yad yad abhīṣṭaṃ te tat tad astu sukhī bhava /
analyzed: vatsa yat yat abhīṣṭam te tat tat astu sukhī bhava
translated: Then the satisfied Lord spoke to the sweet-voiced one, O dear one, let whatever is desired by you be so, be happy.

original: antarhite ca mayy atra mā khida tvaṃ mahāmate // / //
analyzed: antarhite ca mayi atra mā khida tvam mahāmate
translated: And when I disappear from here, O greatly wise one, do not grieve.

original: tvaccittān nāpayāsyāmi kṣīrābdher iva supriyāt /
analyzed: tvad cittāt na apayāsyāmi kṣīrābdheḥ iva su priyāt
translated: I will not depart from you, who are devoted to me, just as the ocean of milk does not depart from the very dear one.

original: punar dvitridinais tvaṃ māṃ draṣṭā duṣṭavadhodyatam // / //
analyzed: punar dvi tri dinaiḥ tvam mām draṣṭā duṣṭa vadha udyatam
translated: In two or three days, you will see me again, ready to kill the wicked,

original: apūrvāviṣkṛtākāraṃ nṛsiṃhaṃ pāpabhīṣaṇam /
analyzed: apūrva āviṣkṛta ākāram nṛsiṃham pāpa bhīṣaṇam
translated: in the form of Narasimha, never seen before, terrifying to the sinful.🔽Having said this, as he was bowing down and looking on with great longing,🔽the Lord, the abode of compassion, spoke to him again, O Prahlada, I am pleased with you. Choose a boon.🔽Prahlada, the best of devotees, said to the Lord, O Lord, if you are pleased with me, then let there be no fear from anywhere for me.

original: uktvety ataḥ praṇamataḥ paśyataś cātilālasam // / //
analyzed: uktvā iti atas praṇamataḥ paśyataḥ ca ati lālasam
translated: The Lord said, So be it, and disappeared. Prahlada, the best of devotees, was satisfied.

original: atuṣṭasyaiva tasyeśo māyayāntar dadhe hariḥ /
analyzed: atuṣṭasya eva tasya īśaḥ māyayā antar dadhe hariḥ
translated: The Lord Hari, being dissatisfied, disappeared from within him by His Maya.

original: tato haṭhād adṛṣṭvā taṃ sarvato bhaktavatsalam // / //
analyzed: tatas haṭhāt a dṛṣṭvā tam sarvatas bhakta vatsalam
translated: Then, not seeing Him everywhere by force, the one who was affectionate towards His devotees...

original: hāhety aśruplutaḥ procya vavande sa cirād iti /
analyzed: hāhā iti aśru plutaḥ procya vavande sa cirāt iti
translated: ... having cried out Alas! for a long time, he worshipped Him, saying, I am yours.

original: śrūyamāṇe 'tha paritaḥ pratibuddhajanasvane // / //
analyzed: śrūyamāṇe tha paritas pratibuddha jana svane
translated: When the sound of the awakened people was heard all around...

original: utthāyābdhitaṭād dhīmān prahlādaḥ svapuraṃ yayau // / //
analyzed: utthāya abdhi taṭāt dhīmān prahlādaḥ sva puram yayau
translated: ... the wise Prahlada, having risen from the shore of the ocean, went to his own city...

original: atha ditijasutaś ciraṃ prahṛṣṭaḥ smṛtibalataḥ paritas tam eva paśyan /
analyzed: atha ditija sutaḥ ciram prahṛṣṭaḥ smṛti balataḥ paritas tam eva paśyan
translated: Then, the son of the demon, being delighted for a long time, seeing Him everywhere by the power of memory,

original: harimanujagatiṃ tv alaṃ ca paśyan gurugṛham utpulakaḥ śanair avāpa // / //
analyzed: hari manu ja gatim tu alam ca paśyan guru gṛham utpulakaḥ śanais avāpa
translated: and seeing Hari, the protector of the world of men, with horripilation, he slowly reached the house of his Guru...

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe narasiṃhaprādurbhāve tricatvāriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe narasiṃha prādurbhāve tricatvāriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the thirty-fourth chapter in the Narasimha incarnation in the Narasimha Purana.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: athāgataṃ te prahlādaṃ dṛṣṭvā daityāḥ suvismitāḥ /
analyzed: atha āgatam te prahlādam dṛṣṭvā daityāḥ su vismitāḥ
translated: Then, seeing Prahlada come back, the demons were greatly amazed.

original: śaśaṃsur daityapataye yaiḥ kṣiptaḥ sa mahārṇave // / //
analyzed: śaśaṃsuḥ daitya pataye yaiḥ kṣiptaḥ sa mahā arṇave
translated: They reported to the lord of the demons, by whom he was thrown into the great ocean...

original: svasthaṃ tam āgataṃ śrutvā daityarāḍ vismayākulaḥ /
analyzed: svastham tam āgatam śrutvā daitya rāj vismaya ākulaḥ
translated: Hearing that he had come back safe and sound, the chief of the demons was filled with wonder.🔽Let him be summoned, he said, being under the sway of death due to anger...

original: āhūyatāṃ ca ity āha krodhān mṛtyuvaśe sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: āhūyatām ca iti āha krodhāt mṛtyu vaśe sthitaḥ
translated: and he said, 'Let him be summoned,' and so, out of anger, he came under the sway of death.

original: tathāsurair durānītaḥ samāsīnaṃ sa divyadṛk /
analyzed: tathā asuraiḥ durānītaḥ samāsīnam sa divya dṛś
translated: In the same way, the one with divine sight saw the lord of the demons, who was seated with the asuras, who had brought him difficulty,

original: āsannamṛtyuṃ daityendraṃ dadarśātyūrjitaśriyam // / //
analyzed: āsanna mṛtyum daitya indram dadarśa ati ūrjita śriyam
translated: who was about to die, whose prosperity was extremely great,

original: nīlāṃśumiśramāṇikya dyuticchannavibhūṣaṇam /
translated: whose ornaments were covered with the luster of sapphires mixed with rubies,

original: sadhūmāgnim iva vyāptam uccāsanacitisthitam // / //🔽daṃṣṭrotkaṭair ghoratarair ghanacchavibhir udbhaṭaiḥ /
analyzed: sa dhūma agnim iva vyāptam ucca āsana citi sthitam  daṃṣṭra utkaṭaiḥ ghorataraiḥ ghana chavibhiḥ udbhaṭaiḥ
translated: who was pervaded by smoke-like fire, who was seated on a high sacrificial altar,

original: kumārgadarśibhir daityair yamadūtair ivāvṛtam // / //
analyzed: ku mārga darśibhiḥ daityaiḥ yama dūtaiḥ iva āvṛtam
translated: who was surrounded by the demons who showed the wrong path, by the messengers of Yama, who were fierce, very dark, and terrible with protruding fangs,

original: dūrāt praṇamya pitaraṃ prāñjalis tu vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: dūrāt praṇamya pitaram prāñjaliḥ tu vyavasthitaḥ
translated: who was from a distance bowing to his father, standing with folded hands.

original: athāhākaraṇakrodhaḥ sa khalo bhartsayan sutam // / //
analyzed: atha āhākaraṇa krodhaḥ sa khalaḥ bhartsayan sutam
translated: Then the wicked one, who was angry without reason, rebuking his son,

original: bhagavatpriyam atyuccair mṛtyum evāśrayann iva /
analyzed: bhagavat priyam atyuccais mṛtyum eva āśrayan iva
translated: as if taking refuge in death itself, spoke very loudly to the one dear to the Lord,

original: mūḍha re śṛṇu madvākyam etad evāntimaṃ dhruvam // / //
analyzed: mūḍha re śṛṇu mad vākyam etat evā antimam dhruvam
translated: O fool, listen to my words, this is certainly the last one.

original: ito na tvāṃ pravakṣyāmi śrutvā kuru yathepsitam /
analyzed: itas na tvām pravakṣyāmi śrutvā kuru yathepsitam
translated: From now on I will not speak to you, having heard, do as you wish.

original: uktveti drūtam ākṛṣya candrahāsāsim adbhutam // / //
analyzed: uktvā iti drūtam ākṛṣya candra hāsa asim adbhutam
translated: Having said this, quickly drawing the wonderful sword Chandrahāsa,

original: saṃbhramād vīkṣitaḥ sarvaiś cālayann āha taṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: saṃbhramāt vīkṣitaḥ sarvaiḥ cālayan āha tam punar
translated: looked at in alarm by all, shaking it, he said to him again,🔽O son, listen to my words, this is certainly the last one.

original: kva cāsti mūḍha te viṣṇuḥ sa tvām adya prarakṣatu // / //
analyzed: kva ca asti mūḍha te viṣṇuḥ sa tvām adya prarakṣatu
translated: Where is that Vishnu of yours? Let him protect you now.

original: tvayoktaṃ sa hi sarvatra kasmāt stambhe na dṛśyate /
analyzed: tvayā uktam sa hi sarvatra kasmāt stambhe na dṛśyate
translated: You said he is everywhere. Why is he not seen in the pillar?

original: yadi paśyāmi taṃ viṣṇum adhunā stambhamadhyagam // / //
analyzed: yadi paśyāmi tam viṣṇum adhunā stambha madhya gam
translated: If I see that Vishnu now, in the middle of the pillar,

original: tarhi tvāṃ na vadhiṣyāmi bhaviṣyasi dvidhānyathā /
analyzed: tarhi tvām na vadhiṣyāmi bhaviṣyasi dvidhā anyathā
translated: then I will not kill you. Otherwise, you will be destroyed.

original: prahlādo 'pi tathā dṛṣṭvā dadhyau taṃ parameśvaram // / //
analyzed: prahlādaḥ pi tathā dṛṣṭvā dadhyau tam parameśvaram
translated: Prahlada also, seeing thus, meditated on that Supreme Lord,

original: puroktaṃ tadvacaḥ smṛtvā praṇanāma kṛtāñjaliḥ /
analyzed: purā uktam tat vacaḥ smṛtvā praṇanāma kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: remembering those words spoken before, he bowed down with folded hands.

original: tāvatprasphuṭitastambho vīkṣito daityasūnunā // / //
analyzed: tāvat prasphuṭita stambhaḥ vīkṣitaḥ daitya sūnunā
translated: Then the pillar burst open, and the demon's son looked,

original: ādarśarūpe daityasya khaḍgajo yaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ /
analyzed: ādarśa rūpe daityasya khaḍga jaḥ yaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: in the mirror-like form of the demon, where the sword was placed,

original: tanmadhye dṛśyate rūpaṃ bahuyojanam āyatam // / //
analyzed: tad madhye dṛśyate rūpam bahu yojanam āyatam
translated: in the middle of that, a form was seen, extending over many yojanas,

original: atiraudraṃ mahākāyaṃ dānavānāṃ bhayaṃkaram /🔽mahānetraṃ mahāvaktraṃ mahādaṃṣṭraṃ mahābhujam // / //
analyzed: ati raudram mahā kāyam dānavānām bhayaṃkaram  mahā netram mahā vaktram mahā daṃṣṭram mahā bhujam
translated: very fierce, with a huge body, terrifying to the demons,🔽with large eyes, a large face, large fangs, and large arms,

original: mahānakhaṃ mahāpādaṃ kālāgnisadṛśānanam /
analyzed: mahā nakham mahā pādam kālāgni sadṛśa ānanam
translated: with large nails, large feet, a face like the fire of destruction,

original: karṇāntakṛtavistāra vadanaṃ cātibhīṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: karṇa anta kṛta vistāra vadanam ca ati bhīṣaṇam
translated: with a face extending to the end of the ears, and extremely terrifying.

original: kṛtvetthaṃ nārasiṃhaṃ tu yayau viṣṇus trivikramaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtvā ittham nārasiṃham tu yayau viṣṇuḥ trivikramaḥ
translated: Having thus created the Man-lion, Vishnu went to Trivikrama.

original: narasiṃhaḥ stambhamadhyād nirgatya praṇanāda ca // / //
analyzed: narasiṃhaḥ stambha madhyāt nirgatya praṇanāda ca
translated: Narasimha emerged from the middle of the pillar and roared.

original: ninādaśravaṇād daityā narasiṃham aveṣṭayan /
analyzed: nināda śravaṇāt daityāḥ narasiṃham aveṣṭayan
translated: Hearing the roar, the demons surrounded Narasimha.

original: tān hatvā sakalāṃs tatra svapauruṣaparākramāt // / //
analyzed: tān hatvā sakalān tatra sva pauruṣa parākramāt
translated: Having killed all of them there with his own valor and prowess,

original: babhañja ca sabhāṃ divyāṃ hiraṇyakaśipor nṛpa /
analyzed: babhañja ca sabhām divyām hiraṇyakaśipoḥ nṛpa
translated: he also destroyed the divine assembly hall of King Hiranyakashipu.

original: abhyetya narasiṃhaṃ mahābhaṭāḥ // / //
analyzed: vārayāmasuḥ abhyetya narasiṃham mahā bhaṭāḥ
translated: The great warriors approached Narasimha and fought with him.

original: te tu rājan kṣaṇād eva narasiṃhena vai hatāḥ /
analyzed: te tu rājan kṣaṇāt eva narasiṃhena vai hatāḥ
translated: O king, they were killed by Narasimha in an instant.

original: tataḥ śastrāṇi varṣanti narasiṃhe pratāpini // / //
analyzed: tatas śastrāṇi varṣanti nara siṃhe pratāpini
translated: Then weapons rained down on the powerful Narasimha.

original: sa tu kṣaṇena bhagavān hatvā tad balam ojasā /
analyzed: sa tu kṣaṇena bhagavān hatvā tat balam ojasā
translated: In an instant, the Lord killed that army with his might.

original: nanāda ca mahānādaṃ diśaḥ śabdena pūrayan // / //
analyzed: nanāda ca mahā nādam diśaḥ śabdena pūrayan
translated: He roared a great roar, filling the directions with the sound.

original: tān mṛtān api vijñāya punar anyān mahāsuraḥ /
analyzed: tān mṛtān api vijñāya punar anyān mahā asuraḥ
translated: Knowing them to be dead, the great demon again ordered

original: aṣṭāśītisahasrāṇi hetihastān samādiśat // / //
analyzed: aṣṭāśīti sahasrāṇi heti hastān samādiśat
translated: eighty-eight thousand others with weapons in their hands.

original: te 'py āgatya vai taṃ devaṃ rurudhuḥ sarvato diśam /
analyzed: te pi āgatya vai tam devam rurudhuḥ sarvatas diśam
translated: They too came and surrounded the Lord from all sides.

original: hatvā tān akhilān yuddhe yudhyamāno nanāda saḥ // / //
analyzed: hatvā tān akhilān yuddhe yudhyamānaḥ nanāda saḥ
translated: Having killed all of them in the battle while fighting, he roared.

original: punaḥ sabhāṃ babhañjāsau hiraṇyakaśipoḥ śubhām /
analyzed: punar sabhām babhañja asau hiraṇyakaśipoḥ śubhām
translated: He again destroyed the auspicious assembly hall of Hiranyakashipu.

original: tān hatān api vijñāya krodhasaṃraktalocanaḥ // / //
analyzed: tān hatān api vijñāya krodha saṃrakta locanaḥ
translated: Knowing them to be slain, his eyes red with anger,

original: tato hiraṇyakaśipur niścakrāma mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: tatas hiraṇyakaśipuḥ niścakrāma mahā balaḥ
translated: Then the greatly powerful Hiraṇyakaśipu came out.

original: uvāca ca mahīpāla dānavān baladarpitān // / //
analyzed: uvāca ca mahīpāla dānavān bala darpitān
translated: And he said to the Dānavas proud of their strength, O king:

original: hanyatāṃ hanyatām eva gṛhyatāṃ gṛhyatām ayam /
analyzed: hanyatām hanyatām eva gṛhyatām gṛhyatām ayam
translated: Let him be killed, let him be killed; let him be seized, let him be seized.

original: ity evaṃ vadatas tasya pramukhe tu mahāsurān // / //
analyzed: iti evam vadataḥ tasya pramukhe tu mahā asurān
translated: While he was saying this, the great Asuras in front,

original: yudhyamānān raṇe hatvā narasiṃho nanāda ca /
analyzed: yudhyamānān raṇe hatvā narasiṃhaḥ nanāda ca
translated: Having killed the fighting ones in the battle, the Man-Lion roared.

original: tato 'tidudruvur daityā hataśeṣā diśo diśaḥ // / //
analyzed: tidudruvuḥ daityāḥ hata śeṣāḥ diśaḥ diśaḥ
translated: Then the remaining demons fled in all directions.

original: yāvad dhatā yudhyamānā daityāḥ koṭisahasraśaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat hatāḥ yudhyamānāḥ daityāḥ koṭi sahasraśas
translated: As many millions of fighting demons were killed,

original: narasiṃhena tāvac ca nabhobhāgaṃ gato raviḥ // / //
analyzed: narasiṃhena tāvat ca nabhaḥ bhāgam gataḥ raviḥ
translated: By that time the sun had gone to the sky.

original: śastrāstravarṣacaturaṃ hiraṇyakaśipuṃ javāt /
analyzed: śastra astra varṣa caturam hiraṇyakaśipum javāt
translated: Skilful in raining weapons and missiles, Hiraṇyakaśipu quickly,

original: pragṛhya tu balād rājan narasiṃho mahābalaḥ // / //
analyzed: pragṛhya tu balāt rājan narasiṃhaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: Seizing him with force, O king, the greatly powerful Man-Lion,

original: saṃdhyākāle gṛhadvāri sthitvorau sthāpya taṃ ripum /
analyzed: saṃdhyā kāle gṛha dvāri sthitvā ūrau sthāpya tam ripum
translated: Having placed his enemy on his lap at the door of the house at the time of evening,

original: vajratulyamahoraskaṃ hiraṇyakaśipuṃ ruṣā /
analyzed: vajra tulya mahā uraskam hiraṇyakaśipum ruṣā
translated: The great-chested Hiraṇyakaśipu, with anger,

original: nakhair kisalayam iva dārayaty āha so 'suraḥ // / //
analyzed: nakhaiḥ kisalayam iva dārayati āha saḥ suraḥ
translated: The demon said, as if tearing him with his claws like a tender sprout.

original: yatrākhaṇḍaladantidantamusalāny ākhaṇḍitāny āhave dhārā yatra pinākapāṇiparaśor ākuṇṭhatām āgamat /
analyzed: yatra ākhaṇḍala danti danta musalāni ākhaṇḍitāni āhave dhārā yatra pinākapāṇi paraśoḥ ākuṇṭha tām āgamat
translated: Where the tusks of Indra's elephant were shattered in battle, and where the edge of Shiva's trident became blunt,

original: tan me tāvad uro nṛsiṃhakarajair vyādīryate sāṃprataṃ daive durjanatāṃ gate tṛṇam api prāyo 'py avajñāyate // / //
analyzed: tat me tāvat uraḥ nṛsiṃha kara jaiḥ vyādīryate sāṃpratam daive durjana tām gate tṛṇam api prāyas u pi avajñāyate
translated: my chest is now being torn apart by the claws of Narasimha. When fate becomes wicked, even a blade of grass is generally disregarded.

original: evaṃ vadati daityendre dadāra narakesarī /
analyzed: evam vadati daitya indre dadāra narakesarī
translated: As the lord of the demons was speaking thus, Narasimha tore apart

original: hṛdayaṃ daityarājasya padmapatram iva dvipaḥ // / //
analyzed: hṛdayam daitya rājasya padma patram iva dvipaḥ
translated: the heart of the king of demons, like an elephant tearing apart a lotus leaf.

original: śakale dve tirobhūte nakharandhre mahātmane /
analyzed: śakale dve tirobhūte nakha randhre mahātmane
translated: The two pieces disappeared into the wounds of the great soul's claws.

original: tataḥ kva yāto duṣṭo 'sāv iti devo 'tivismitaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas kva yātaḥ duṣṭaḥ sau iti devaḥ ti vismitaḥ
translated: Then the god, greatly astonished, thought, Where has that wicked one gone?

original: nirīkṣya sarvato rājan vṛthaitat karma me 'bhavat /
analyzed: nirīkṣya sarvatas rājan vṛthā etat karma me bhavat
translated: Looking everywhere, O king, this act of mine has become futile.

original: iti saṃcintya rājendra narasiṃho mahābalaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti saṃcintya rāja indra narasiṃhaḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: Thinking thus, O lord of kings, the greatly powerful Narasimha

original: vyadhūnayat karāv uccais tatas te śakale nṛpa /
analyzed: vyadhūnayat karau uccais tatas te śakale nṛpa
translated: raised his arms high, and then, O king, the two pieces fell

original: nakharandhrān nipatite bhūmau reṇusame hareḥ // / //
analyzed: nakha randhrāt nipatite bhūmau reṇu same hareḥ
translated: on the ground covered with dust from Hari's claws.

original: dṛṣṭvā vyatītasaṃroṣo jahāsa parameśvaraḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā vyatīta saṃroṣaḥ jahāsa parameśvaraḥ
translated: Seeing this, the Supreme Lord, his anger gone, laughed.

original: puṣpavarṣaṃ ca varṣanto narasiṃhasya mūrdhani // / //
analyzed: puṣpa varṣam ca varṣantaḥ narasiṃhasya mūrdhani
translated: And they rained flowers on the head of Narasimha.

original: devā sabrahmakāḥ sarve āgatāḥ prītisaṃyutāḥ /
analyzed: devā sa brahmakāḥ sarve āgatāḥ prīti saṃyutāḥ
translated: All the gods along with Brahma came together with joy.

original: āgatya narasiṃhaṃ paraṃ prabhum // / //
analyzed: āgatya pūjayāmasuḥ narasiṃham param prabhum
translated: Having come, they praised the supreme lord Narasimha.

original: brahmā ca daityarājānaṃ prahlādam abhiṣecayat /
analyzed: brahmā ca daitya rājānam prahlādam abhiṣecayat
translated: Brahma consecrated Prahlada, the king of demons.

original: dharme ratiḥ samastānāṃ janānām abhavat tadā // / //
analyzed: dharme ratiḥ samastānām janānām abhavat tadā
translated: All the people then became devoted to righteousness.

original: indro 'pi sarvadevais tu hariṇā sthāpito divi /
analyzed: indraḥ pi sarva devaiḥ tu hariṇā sthāpitaḥ divi
translated: Indra was also established in heaven by Hari along with all the gods.

original: narasiṃho 'pi bhagavān sarvalokahitāya vai // / //
analyzed: narasiṃhaḥ pi bhagavān sarva loka hitāya vai
translated: The lord Narasimha, for the welfare of all the worlds,

original: śrīśailaśikharaṃ prāpya viśrutaḥ surapūjitaḥ /
analyzed: śrīśaila śikharam prāpya viśrutaḥ sura pūjitaḥ
translated: reached the peak of Shri mountain and became famous, worshipped by the gods.

original: sthito bhaktahitārthāya abhaktānāṃ kṣamāya ca // / //
analyzed: sthitaḥ bhakta hita arthāya abhaktānām kṣamāya ca
translated: He remained there for the welfare of devotees and for the destruction of non-devotees.

original: ity etan narasiṃhasya māhātmyaṃ yaḥ paṭhen naraḥ /
analyzed: iti etat narasiṃhasya māhātmyam yaḥ paṭhet naraḥ
translated: A man who reads this greatness of Narasimha,

original: śṛṇoti vā nṛpaśreṣṭha mucyate sarvapātakaiḥ // / //
analyzed: śṛṇoti vā nṛpa śreṣṭha mucyate sarva pātakaiḥ
translated: or listens to it, O best of kings, is freed from all sins.

original: naro vā yadi vā nārī śṛṇoty ākhyānam uttamam /
analyzed: naraḥ vā yadi vā nārī śṛṇoti ākhyānam uttamam
translated: Whether a man or a woman, who listens to this excellent story,

original: vaidhavyād duḥkhaśokāc ca duṣṭasaṅgāt pramucyate // / //
analyzed: vaidhavyāt duḥkha śokāt ca duṣṭa saṅgāt pramucyate
translated: is freed from widowhood, sorrow, grief, and association with the wicked.

original: duśśīlo 'pi durācāro duṣprajo doṣakarmakṛt /
analyzed: duśśīlaḥ pi durācāraḥ duṣprajaḥ doṣa karma kṛt
translated: Even an ill-behaved person, of bad conduct, with bad offspring, a sinner,

original: adharmiṣṭho 'nabhogī ca śṛṇvan śuddho bhaven naraḥ // / //
analyzed: adharmiṣṭhaḥ na bhogī ca śṛṇvan śuddhaḥ bhavet naraḥ
translated: an unrighteous person, and one without enjoyments, becomes pure by listening to this.

original: hariḥ sureśo naralokapūjito hitāya lokasya carācarasya /
analyzed: hariḥ sureśaḥ nara loka pūjitaḥ hitāya lokasya carācarasya
translated: Hari, the lord of gods, worshipped by the world of men, for the welfare of the moving and unmoving world,

original: kṛtvā virūpaṃ ca purātmamāyayā hiraṇyakaṃ duḥkhakaraṃ nakhaiś chinat // / //
analyzed: kṛtvā virūpam ca purā ātma māyayā hiraṇyakam duḥkha karam nakhaiḥ chinat
translated: Having assumed a terrible form in the past through his own illusion, he tore apart Hiraṇyakaśipu, the cause of suffering, with his nails.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe narasiṃhaprādurbhāvo nāma catuścatvāriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe narasiṃhaprādurbhāvaḥ nāma catuścatvāriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-fourth chapter named The Incarnation of Narasimha in the Narasimha Purana.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: śṛṇu rājan samāsena vāmanasya parākramam /
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan samāsena vāmanasya parākramam
translated: Listen, O king, to the prowess of Vamana in brief,

original: baliyāge hatā yena purā daityāḥ sahasraśaḥ // / //
analyzed: bali yāge hatāḥ yena purā daityāḥ sahasraśas
translated: By whom thousands of demons were killed in the sacrifice of Bali in the past.

original: virocanasutaḥ pūrvaṃ mahābalaparākramaḥ /
analyzed: virocana sutaḥ pūrvam mahā bala parākramaḥ
translated: The son of Virochana, who was formerly endowed with great strength and valor,

original: trailokyaṃ bubhuje jitvā devān indrapurogamān // / //
analyzed: trailokyam bubhuje jitvā devān indra purogamān
translated: Having conquered the three worlds, enjoyed it, along with the gods led by Indra.

original: tataḥ kṛśatarā devā babhūvus tena khaṇḍitāḥ /
analyzed: tatas kṛśatarāḥ devāḥ babhūvuḥ tena khaṇḍitāḥ
translated: Then the gods, who were defeated by him, became even more emaciated.

original: indraṃ kṛśataraṃ dṛṣṭvā naṣṭarājyaṃ nṛpottama // / //
analyzed: indram kṛśataram dṛṣṭvā naṣṭa rājyam nṛpa uttama
translated: O best of kings, seeing Indra even more emaciated and deprived of his kingdom,

original: aditir devamātā yā sātapyat paramaṃ tapaḥ /
analyzed: aditiḥ deva mātā yā sā atapyat paramam tapaḥ
translated: Aditi, the mother of the gods, performed the highest austerity.

original: tuṣṭāva vāgbhir iṣṭābhiḥ praṇipatya janārdanam // / //
analyzed: tuṣṭāva vāgbhiḥ iṣṭābhiḥ praṇipatya janārdanam
translated: Having bowed down, she praised Janardana with pleasing words.

original: tataḥ stutyābhisaṃtuṣṭo devadevo janārdanaḥ /
analyzed: tatas stutya abhisaṃtuṣṭaḥ devadevaḥ janārdanaḥ
translated: Then Janardana, the god of gods, was pleased with the praise,

original: sthitvā tatpurato vācam uvāca madhusūdanaḥ // / //
analyzed: sthitvā tad puratas vācam uvāca madhusūdanaḥ
translated: Standing before her, Madhusudana spoke these words:

original: tava putro bhaviṣyāmi subhage balibandhanaḥ /
analyzed: tava putraḥ bhaviṣyāmi subhage bali bandhanaḥ
translated: O blessed one, I will be born as your son, the fetter of Bali.

original: ity uktvā tāṃ gato viṣṇuḥ svagṛhaṃ sā samāyayau // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā tām gataḥ viṣṇuḥ sva gṛham sā samāyayau
translated: Having said this, Vishnu went to his own abode, and she returned home.

original: tataḥ kālena sā garbham avāpa nṛpa kaśyapāt /
analyzed: tatas kālena sā garbham avāpa nṛpa kaśyapāt
translated: Then, O king, in due course, she conceived from Kashyapa.

original: ajāyata sa viśveśo bhagavān vāmanākṛtiḥ // / //
analyzed: ajāyata sa viśveśaḥ bhagavān vāmana ākṛtiḥ
translated: The Lord of the universe, the illustrious one, was born in the form of a dwarf.

original: tasmiñ jāte samāgatya brahmā lokapitāmahaḥ /
analyzed: tasmin jāte samāgatya brahmā lokapitāmahaḥ
translated: When he was born, Brahma, the grandfather of the worlds, came there.

original: jātakarmādikāḥ sarvāḥ kriyās tatra cakāra vai // / //
analyzed: jātakarma ādikāḥ sarvāḥ kriyāḥ tatra cakāra vai
translated: And he performed all the rites beginning with the birth ceremony.

original: kṛtopanayano devo brahmacārī sanātanaḥ /
analyzed: kṛta upanayanaḥ devaḥ brahmacārī sanātanaḥ
translated: The eternal Lord, having undergone the thread ceremony, as a celibate,

original: aditiṃ capy anujñāpya yajñaśālāṃ baler yayau // / //
analyzed: aditim capī anujñāpya yajña śālām baleḥ yayau
translated: and with Aditi's permission, went to Bali's sacrificial hall.

original: gacchataḥ pādavikṣepāc cacāla sakalā mahī /
analyzed: gacchataḥ pāda vikṣepāt cacāla sakalā mahī
translated: As he was going, the entire earth trembled from the shaking of his feet.

original: yajñabhāgān na gṛhṇanti dānavāś ca baler makhāt // / //
analyzed: yajña bhāgān na gṛhṇanti dānavāḥ ca baleḥ makhāt
translated: The demons did not accept their shares of the sacrificial offerings from Bali's sacrifice.

original: praśāntāś cāgnayas tatra ṛtvijo mantrataś cyutāḥ /
analyzed: praśāntāḥ ca agnayaḥ tatra ṛtvijaḥ mantrataḥ cyutāḥ
translated: The fires were extinguished there, and the priests deviated from the mantras.

original: viparītam idaṃ dṛṣṭvā śukram āha mahābalaḥ // / //
analyzed: viparītam idam dṛṣṭvā śukram āha mahā balaḥ
translated: Seeing this reversal, the greatly powerful one said to Shukra:

original: na gṛhṇanti mune kasmād dhavirbhāgaṃ mahāsurāḥ /
analyzed: na gṛhṇanti mune kasmāt haviḥ bhāgam mahā asurāḥ
translated: O sage, why do the great demons not accept their shares of the sacrificial offerings?

original: kasmāc ca vahnayaḥ śāntāḥ kasmād bhūś calati dvija // / //
analyzed: kasmāt ca vahnayaḥ śāntāḥ kasmāt bhūḥ calati dvija
translated: Why are the fires extinguished? Why does the earth tremble, O twice-born?

original: kasmāc ca mantrato bhraṣṭā ṛtvijaḥ sakalā amī /
analyzed: kasmāt ca mantrataḥ bhraṣṭāḥ ṛtvijaḥ sakalāḥ amī
translated: And why have all these priests fallen from their mantras?

original: ityukto balinā śukro dānavendraṃ vaco 'bravīt // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ balinā śukraḥ dānava indram vacaḥ bravīt
translated: Thus addressed by Bali, Shukra spoke these words to the lord of the demons:

original: śukra uvāca /
analyzed: śukraḥ uvāca
translated: Shukra said:

original: he bale śṛṇu me vākyaṃ tvayā devā nirākṛtāḥ /
analyzed: he bale śṛṇu me vākyam tvayā devāḥ nirākṛtāḥ
translated: O Bali, listen to my words. You have expelled the gods.

original: teṣāṃ rājyapradānāya adityām acyuto 'sura // / //
analyzed: teṣām rājya pradānāya adityām sura
translated: For the sake of granting them the kingdom, the imperishable one, O demon, has been born to Aditi.

original: devadevo jagadyoniḥ saṃjāto vāmanākṛtiḥ /
analyzed: devadevaḥ jagadyoniḥ saṃjātaḥ vāmana ākṛtiḥ
translated: The god of gods, the source of the universe, has taken the form of a dwarf.

original: sa tv āgacchati te yajñaṃ tadpadanyāsakampitā // / //
analyzed: sa tu āgacchati te yajñam tad padanyāsa kampitā
translated: He is coming to your sacrifice, and the earth trembles at the touch of his feet.

original: calatīyaṃ mahī sarvā tenādyāsurabhūpate /
analyzed: calati iyam mahī sarvā tena adya asura bhūpate
translated: O lord of the demons, the entire earth trembles today because of his presence.

original: tatsaṃnidhānād asurā na gṛhṇanti havir makhe // / //
analyzed: tad saṃnidhānāt asurāḥ na gṛhṇanti haviḥ makhe
translated: Because of his presence, the demons do not accept oblations in the sacrifice.

original: tavāgnayo 'pi vai śāntā vāmanāgamanād dhi bhoḥ /
analyzed: tava agnayaḥ pi vai śāntāḥ vāmana āgamanāt hi bhoḥ
translated: O lord, your fires are also extinguished because of the arrival of the dwarf.

original: ṛtvijaś ca na bhāsante homamantro bale 'dhunā // / //
analyzed: ṛtvijaḥ ca na bhāsante homa mantraḥ bale
translated: And the priests do not shine in the homa mantras now, O Bali.

original: asurāṇāṃ śriyo hanti surāṇāṃ bhūtir uttamā /
analyzed: asurāṇām śriyaḥ hanti surāṇām bhūtiḥ uttamā
translated: It destroys the prosperity of the demons and is the supreme good fortune of the gods.

original: ityuktaḥ sa baliḥ prāha śukraṃ nītimatāṃ varam // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sa baliḥ prāha śukram nītimatām varam
translated: Thus addressed, Bali said to Shukra, the best among those who know policy:

original: śṛṇu brahman vaco me tvam āgate vāmane makhe /
analyzed: śṛṇu brahman vacaḥ me tvam āgate vāmane makhe
translated: Listen, O Brahmin, to my words. When the dwarf comes to the sacrifice,

original: yan mayā cādya kartavyaṃ vāmanasyāsya dhīmataḥ // / //
analyzed: yat mayā ca adya kartavyam vāmanasya asya dhīmataḥ
translated: What should be done by me today for this intelligent Vamana?

original: tan me vada mahābhāga tvaṃ hi naḥ paramo guruḥ // / //
analyzed: tat me vada mahābhāga tvam hi naḥ paramaḥ guruḥ
translated: Tell me that, O illustrious one, for you are our supreme guru.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: iti saṃcoditaḥ śukraḥ sa rājñā balinā nṛpa // / //
analyzed: iti saṃcoditaḥ śukraḥ sa rājñā balinā nṛpa
translated: Thus urged by King Bali, O king,

original: tam uvāca baliṃ vākyaṃ mamāpi śṛṇu sāṃpratam /
analyzed: tam uvāca balim vākyam mama api śṛṇu sāṃpratam
translated: he spoke these words to Bali: Now listen to me also.

original: devānām upakārāya bhavatāṃ saṃkṣayāya ca // / //
analyzed: devānām upakārāya bhavatām saṃkṣayāya ca
translated: For the benefit of the gods and for your destruction,

original: sa nūnam āyāti bale tava yajñe na śaṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: sa nūnam āyāti bale tava yajñe na śaṃśayaḥ
translated: he will surely come to your sacrifice, O Bali, there is no doubt.

original: āgate vāmane deve tvayā tasya mahātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: āgate vāmane deve tvayā tasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: When the god Vamana arrives, you should not make a promise to that great soul,

original: pratijñā naiva kartavyā dadāmy etat taveti vai /
analyzed: pratijñā nā eva kartavyā dadāmi etat tava iti vai
translated: saying 'I will give this to you.'

original: iti śrutvā vacas tasya balir balavatāṃ varaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti śrutvā vacaḥ tasya baliḥ balavatām varaḥ
translated: Having heard these words, Bali, the best among the strong,

original: uvāca tāṃ śubhāṃ vāṇīṃ śukram ātmapurohitam /
analyzed: uvāca tām śubhām vāṇīm śukram ātma purohitam
translated: spoke these auspicious words to Shukra, his own priest:

original: āgate vāmane śukra yajñe me madhusūdane // / //
analyzed: āgate vāmane śukra yajñe me madhusūdane
translated: When Vamana, Shukra, comes to my sacrifice, the slayer of Madhu,

original: na śakyate pratikhyātuṃ dānaṃ prati mayā guro /
analyzed: na śakyate pratikhyātum dānam prati mayā guro
translated: it is not possible for me to refuse to give, O guru.

original: anyeṣām api jantūnām ity uktaṃ te mayādhunā // / //
analyzed: anyeṣām api jantūnām iti uktam te mayā adhunā
translated: This has been told to you by me now, even to other beings.

original: kiṃ punar vāsudevasya āgatasya tu śārṅgiṇaḥ /
analyzed: kim punar vāsudevasya āgatasya tu śārṅgiṇaḥ
translated: What to speak of Vasudeva, who has come with the Sharnga bow?

original: tvayā vighno na kartavyo vāmane 'trāgate dvija // / //
analyzed: tvayā vighnaḥ na kartavyaḥ vāmane trāgate dvija
translated: O dwarf, you should not create any obstacles for the brahmin who has come here.

original: yad yad dravyaṃ prārthayate tat tad dravyaṃ dadāmy aham /
analyzed: yat yat dravyam prārthayate tat tat dravyam dadāmi aham
translated: Whatever wealth he asks for, I shall give him that wealth.

original: kṛtārtho 'haṃ muniśreṣṭha yady āgacchati vāmanaḥ // / //🔽ity evaṃ vadatas tasya yajñaśālāṃ sa vāmanaḥ /
analyzed: kṛtārthaḥ ham muni śreṣṭha yadi āgacchati vāmanaḥ  iti evam vadataḥ tasya yajña śālām sa vāmanaḥ
translated: O best of sages, if the dwarf comes, I shall be satisfied.🔽While he was saying this, the dwarf entered the sacrificial hall.

original: āgatya praviveśātha praśaśaṃsa baler makham // / //
analyzed: āgatya praviveśa atha praśaśaṃsa baleḥ makham
translated: Having arrived, he praised Bali's sacrifice.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā sahasā rājan rājā daityādhipo baliḥ /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā sahasā rājan rājā daitya adhipaḥ baliḥ
translated: O king, seeing him suddenly, Bali, the lord of the demons,

original: upacāreṇa saṃpūjya vākyam etad uvāca ha // / //
analyzed: upacāreṇa saṃpūjya vākyam etat uvāca ha
translated: worshipped him with hospitality and spoke these words:

original: yad yat prārthayase māṃ tvaṃ devadeva dhanādikam /
analyzed: yat yat prārthayase mām tvam devadeva dhana ādikam
translated: O god of gods, whatever wealth etc. you ask from me,

original: tat sarvaṃ tava dāsyāmi māṃ yācasvādya vāmana // / //
analyzed: tat sarvam tava dāsyāmi mām yācasva adya vāmana
translated: I shall give you all that. O dwarf, ask me today.

original: ityukto vāmanas tatra nṛpendra balinā tadā /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ vāmanaḥ tatra nṛpa indra balinā tadā
translated: Thus addressed by Bali, the lord of men, the god of gods, the dwarf,

original: deveśo bhūmer dehi padatrayam // / //
analyzed: yācayāmasa deveśaḥ bhūmeḥ dehi pada trayam
translated: said to Bali, the lord of the demons, Give me three steps of land.

original: mamāgniśaraṇārthāya na me 'rthe 'sti prayojanam /
analyzed: mama agni śaraṇa arthāya na me rthe sti prayojanam
translated: For the sake of my sacrificial fire, I have no need for wealth.

original: ityukto vāmanenātha baliḥ prāha ca vāmanam // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ vāmanena atha baliḥ prāha ca vāmanam
translated: Thus addressed by the dwarf, Bali then spoke to the dwarf:

original: padatrayeṇa cet tṛptir mayā dattaṃ padatrayam /
analyzed: pada trayeṇa ced tṛptiḥ mayā dattam pada trayam
translated: If you are satisfied with three steps, I have given you three steps.

original: evam ukte tu balinā vāmano balim abravīt // / //
analyzed: evam ukte tu balinā vāmanaḥ balim abravīt
translated: When this was said by Bali, Vamana spoke to Bali:

original: dīyatāṃ me kare toyaṃ yadi dattaṃ padatrayam /
analyzed: dīyatām me kare toyam yadi dattam pada trayam
translated: Give me water in my hand, if the three steps have been given.

original: ityukto devadevena tadā tatra svayaṃ baliḥ // / //🔽sajalaṃ hemakalaśaṃ gṛhītvotthāya bhaktitaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ devadevena tadā tatra svayam baliḥ  sa jalam hema kalaśam gṛhītvā utthāya bhaktitaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by the god of gods, Bali himself🔽stood up, holding a golden pot full of water, and with devotion.

original: yāvat sa vāmanakare toyaṃ dātum upasthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: yāvat sa vāmana kare toyam dātum upasthitaḥ
translated: As he was about to give water in Vamana's hand,

original: tāvac chukraḥ kalaśago jaladhārāṃ rorodha ha /
analyzed: tāvat śukraḥ kalaśa gaḥ jala dhārām rorodha ha
translated: Shukra obstructed the stream of water from the pot.

original: tataś ca vāmanaḥ kruddhaḥ pavitrāgreṇa sattama // / //
analyzed: tatas ca vāmanaḥ kruddhaḥ pavitra agreṇa sattama
translated: Then Vamana, O best, became angry

original: udake kalaśadvāri tacchukrākṣim avedhayat /
analyzed: udake kalaśa dvāri tat śukra akṣim avedhayat
translated: and with the tip of his sacred thread, he pierced Shukra's eye on the door of the water pot.

original: tato vyapagataḥ śukro viddhaikākṣo narottama // / //🔽toyadhārā nipatitā vāmanasya kare punaḥ /
analyzed: tatas vyapagataḥ śukraḥ viddha eka akṣaḥ narottama  toya dhārā nipatitā vāmanasya kare punar
translated: Then Shukra, O best of men, with his eye pierced, departed,🔽and the stream of water fell again in Vamana's hand.

original: kare nipatite toye vāmano vavṛdhe kṣaṇāt // / //
analyzed: kare nipatite toye vāmanaḥ vavṛdhe kṣaṇāt
translated: When the water fell in his hand, Vamana grew in a moment,

original: pādenaikena vikrāntā tenaiva sakalā mahī /
analyzed: pādena ekena vikrāntā tena eva sakalā mahī
translated: with one foot he covered the entire earth,

original: antarikṣaṃ dvitīyena dyaus tṛtīyena sattama // / //
analyzed: antarikṣam dvitīyena dyauḥ tṛtīyena sattama
translated: with the second the sky, and with the third, O best, the heaven.

original: anekān dānavān hatvā hṛtvā tribhuvanaṃ baleḥ /
analyzed: anekān dānavān hatvā hṛtvā tribhuvanam baleḥ
translated: Having killed many demons and taken away the three worlds from Bali,🔽he gave it to Shakra. Having obtained the kingdom, Shakra was delighted.

original: puraṃdarāya trailokyaṃ dattvā balim uvāca ha // / //
analyzed: puraṃdarāya trailokyam dattvā balim uvāca ha
translated: Having given the three worlds to Purandara, he spoke to Bali:

original: yasmāt te bhaktito dattaṃ toyam adya kare mama /
analyzed: yasmāt te bhaktitaḥ dattam toyam adya kare mama
translated: Since you have offered me water with devotion today,

original: tasmāt te sāṃprataṃ dattaṃ pātālatalam uttamam // / //
analyzed: tasmāt te sāṃpratam dattam pātāla talam uttamam
translated: therefore, I have now given you the excellent netherworld.

original: tatra gatvā mahābhāga bhuṅkṣva tvaṃ matprasādataḥ /
analyzed: tatra gatvā mahābhāga bhuṅkṣva tvam mad prasādataḥ
translated: Having gone there, O illustrious one, enjoy by my grace.

original: vaivasvate 'ntare 'tīte punar indro bhaviṣyasi // / //
analyzed: vaivasvate ntare tīte punar indraḥ bhaviṣyasi
translated: When the Vaivasvata (Dvāpara) yuga is over, you will again become Indra.

original: praṇamya ca tato gatvā talaṃ bhogam avāptavān // / //
analyzed: praṇamya ca tatas gatvā talam bhogam avāptavān
translated: Having bowed down, he went and obtained enjoyment in the netherworld.

original: śukro 'pi svargam āruhya prasādād vāmanasya vai /
analyzed: śukraḥ u pi svargam āruhya prasādāt vāmanasya vai
translated: Śukra also, by the grace of Vāmana, ascended to heaven.

original: samāgatās tribhuvanaṃ rājan devasamanvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: samāgatāḥ tribhuvanam rājan deva samanvitaḥ
translated: O king, having assembled the three worlds along with the gods,

original: yaḥ smaret prātar utthāya vāmanasya kathām imām /
analyzed: yaḥ smaret prātar utthāya vāmanasya kathām imām
translated: he who would remember this story of Vāmana upon rising in the morning,

original: sarvapāpavinirmukto viṣṇuloke mahīyate // / //
analyzed: sarva pāpa vinirmuktaḥ viṣṇu loke mahīyate
translated: being freed from all sins, is honored in Viṣṇu's world.

original: itthaṃ purā vāmanarūpam āsthito harir baler hṛtya jagattrayaṃ nṛpa /
analyzed: ittham purā vāmana rūpam āsthitaḥ hariḥ baleḥ hṛtya jagattrayam nṛpa
translated: Thus, O king, in ancient times, Hari, having assumed the form of Vāmana, took away the three worlds from Bali,

original: kṛtvā prasādaṃ ca divaukasāṃ pater dattvā trilokaṃ sa yayau mahodadhim // / //
analyzed: kṛtvā prasādam ca divaukasām pateḥ dattvā trilokam sa yayau mahā udadhim
translated: and having done a favor to the lord of the heaven-dwellers, and having given back the three worlds, he went to the great ocean.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe vāmanaprādurbhāve pañcacatvāriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe vāmanaprādurbhāve pañcacatvāriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-fifth chapter in the Narasimha Purana, in the birth of Vamana, the twenty-fourth section.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: ataḥ paraṃ pravakṣyāmi prādurbhāvaṃ hareḥ śubham /
analyzed: atas param pravakṣyāmi prādurbhāvam hareḥ śubham
translated: Hereafter I shall describe the auspicious incarnation of Vishnu.

original: jāmadagnyaṃ purā yena kṣatram utsāditaṃ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: jāmadagnyam purā yena kṣatram utsāditam śṛṇu
translated: Listen how in ancient times he destroyed the Kshatriyas as Jamadagni's son.

original: purā devagaṇair viṣṇuḥ stutaḥ kṣīrodadhau nṛpa /
analyzed: purā deva gaṇaiḥ viṣṇuḥ stutaḥ kṣīrodadhau nṛpa
translated: In ancient times, O king, Vishnu was praised by the hosts of gods in the Milky Ocean.

original: ṛṣibhiś ca mahābhāgair jamadagneḥ suto 'bhavat // / //
analyzed: ṛṣibhiḥ ca mahābhāgaiḥ jamadagneḥ sutaḥ bhavat
translated: And by the greatly fortunate sages, he became the son of Jamadagni.

original: parśurāma iti khyātaḥ sarvalokeṣu sa prabhuḥ /
analyzed: parśurāmaḥ iti khyātaḥ sarva lokeṣu sa prabhuḥ
translated: That Lord became famous in all the worlds as Parashurama.

original: duṣṭānāṃ nigrahaṃ kartum avatīrṇo mahītale // / //
analyzed: duṣṭānām nigraham kartum avatīrṇaḥ mahī tale
translated: He descended on earth to punish the wicked.

original: kṛtavīryasutaḥ śrīmān kārtavīryo 'bhavat purā /
analyzed: kṛtavīrya sutaḥ śrīmān kārtavīryaḥ bhavat purā
translated: In ancient times, the prosperous Kartavirya was the son of Kritavirya.

original: dattātreyaṃ samārādhya cakravartitvam āptavān // / //
analyzed: dattātreyam samārādhya cakravarti tvam āptavān
translated: Having propitiated Dattatreya, he attained the status of a universal emperor.

original: sa kadācin mahābhāgo jamadagnyāśramaṃ yayau /
analyzed: sa kadācid mahābhāgaḥ jamadagni āśramam yayau
translated: Once that greatly fortunate one went to the hermitage of Jamadagni.

original: jamadagnis tu taṃ dṛṣṭvā caturaṅgabalānvitam // / //
analyzed: jamadagniḥ tu tam dṛṣṭvā catur aṅga bala anvitam
translated: Jamadagni, seeing him accompanied by a four-division army,

original: uvāca madhuraṃ vākyaṃ kārtavīryaṃ nṛpottamam /
analyzed: uvāca madhuram vākyam kārtavīryam nṛpa uttamam
translated: spoke these sweet words to Kartavirya, the best of kings:

original: mucyatām atra te senā atithis tvaṃ samāgataḥ /
analyzed: mucyatām atra te senā atithiḥ tvam samāgataḥ
translated: Let your army be released here. You have come as a guest.

original: vanyādikaṃ mayā dattaṃ bhuktvā gaccha mahāmate // / //🔽pramucya senāṃ munivākyagauravāt sthito nṛpas tatra mahānubhāvaḥ /
analyzed: vanya ādikam mayā dattam bhuktvā gaccha mahāmate  pramucya senām muni vākya gauravāt sthitaḥ nṛpaḥ tatra mahā anubhāvaḥ
translated: Having enjoyed the forest produce etc. given by me, go, O greatly wise one.🔽The king, of great majesty, having released the army, remained there out of respect for the sage's words.

original: āmantrya rājānam alaṅghyakīrtir muniḥ sa dhenuṃ ca dudoha dogdhrīm // / //
analyzed: āmantrya rājānam a laṅghya kīrtiḥ muniḥ sa dhenum ca dudoha dogdhrīm
translated: The sage, whose fame was unassailable, having greeted the king, milked the yielding cow.

original: hastyaśvaśālā vividhā narāṇāṃ gṛhāṇi citrāṇi ca toraṇāni /
analyzed: hasti aśva śālāḥ vividhāḥ narāṇām gṛhāṇi citrāṇi ca toraṇāni
translated: Elephant stables, horse stables, various houses of men, and colorful archways,

original: sāmantayogyāni śubhāni rājan samicchatāṃ yāni sukānanāni // / //
analyzed: sāmanta yogyāni śubhāni rājan samicchatām yāni su kānanāni
translated: Auspicious and suitable for vassals, O king, which are desired to have beautiful forests.

original: gṛhaṃ variṣṭhaṃ bahubhūmikaṃ punaḥ samanvitaṃ sādhuguṇair upaskaraiḥ /
analyzed: gṛham variṣṭham bahu bhūmikam punar samanvitam sādhu guṇaiḥ upaskaraiḥ
translated: Again, the best house with many floors, endowed with good qualities and utensils,

original: dugdhvā prakalpan munir āha pārthivaṃ gṛhaṃ kṛtaṃ te praviśeha rājan // / //
analyzed: dugdhvā muniḥ āha pārthivam gṛham kṛtam te praviśa iha rājan
translated: Having milked and arranged, the sage said to the king, This house is made, O king, please enter.

original: ime ca mantripravarā janās te gṛheṣu divyeṣu viśantu śīghram /
analyzed: ime ca mantri pravarāḥ janāḥ te gṛheṣu divyeṣu viśantu śīghram
translated: And let these best ministers and people quickly enter the divine houses.

original: hastyaśvajātyaś ca viśantu śālāṃ bhṛtyāś ca nīceṣu gṛheṣu santu // / //
analyzed: hasti aśva jātyaḥ ca viśantu śālām bhṛtyāḥ ca nīceṣu gṛheṣu santu
translated: And let the elephant and horse breeds enter the stable, and let the servants be in the lower houses.

original: ityuktamātre muninā nṛpo 'sau gṛhaṃ variṣṭhaṃ praviveśa rājā /
analyzed: iti ukta mātre muninā nṛpaḥ sau gṛham variṣṭham praviveśa rājā
translated: As soon as this was said by the sage, the king entered the best house.

original: anyeṣu cānyeṣu gṛheṣu satsu muniḥ punaḥ pārthivam ābabhāṣe // / //
analyzed: anyeṣu ca anyeṣu gṛheṣu satsu muniḥ punar pārthivam ābabhāṣe
translated: and in other houses, the sage again spoke to the king:

original: snānapradānārtham idaṃ mayā te prakalpitaṃ strīśatam uttamaṃ nṛpa /
analyzed: snāna pradāna artham idam mayā te prakalpitam strī śatam uttamam nṛpa
translated: O king, I have prepared this excellent hundred women for your bath and gifts.

original: snāhi tvam adyātra yathāprakāmaṃ yathā surendro divi nṛtyagītaiḥ // / //
analyzed: snāhi tvam adya atra yathāprakāmam yathā sura indraḥ divi nṛtya gītaiḥ
translated: Bathe here today as much as you like, as Indra of the gods does in heaven with dances and songs.

original: sa snātavāṃs tatra surendravan nṛpo gītyādiśabdair madhuraiś ca vādyaiḥ /
analyzed: sa snātavān tatra sura indra vat nṛpaḥ gīti ādi śabdaiḥ madhuraiḥ ca vādyaiḥ
translated: The king bathed there like Indra of the gods, with the sounds of singing etc. and sweet musical instruments.

original: snātasya tasyāśu ca dadau munir bhūpa dve // / //
analyzed: snātasya tasya āśu śubhe ca vastre dadau muniḥ bhūpa vibhūṣite dve
translated: As soon as he had bathed, the sage quickly gave the king two

original: paridhāya vastraṃ ca kṛtottarīyaḥ kṛtakriyo viṣṇupūjāṃ cakāra /
analyzed: paridhāya vastram ca kṛta uttarīyaḥ kṛta kriyaḥ viṣṇu pūjām cakāra
translated: Having put on clothes and a shawl, and performed his duties, he worshipped Vishnu.

original: muniś ca dugdhvānnamayaṃ mahāgiriṃ nṛpāya bhṛtyāya ca dattavān asau // / //
analyzed: muniḥ ca dugdhvā anna mayam mahā girim nṛpāya bhṛtyāya ca dattavān asau
translated: And the sage, having churned the great mountain of food, gave it to the king and his servants.

original: yāvat sa rājā bubhuje sabhṛtyas tāvac ca sūryo gatavān nṛpāstam /
