analyzed: yāvat sa rājā bubhuje sa bhṛtyaḥ tāvat ca sūryaḥ gatavān nṛpa astam
translated: While the king was eating with his servants, the sun went to the western direction, O king.

original: rātrau ca gītādivinodayuktaḥ śete sa rājā muninirmite gṛhe // / //
analyzed: rātrau ca gīta ādi vinoda yuktaḥ śete sa rājā muni nirmite gṛhe
translated: And the king, engaged in entertainment with singing etc. at night, slept in the house built by the sage.

original: tataḥ prabhāte vimale svapnalabdham ivābhavat /
analyzed: tatas prabhāte vimale svapna labdham iva abhavat
translated: Then, when the clear morning came, it was as if obtained in a dream.

original: bhūmibhāgaṃ tataḥ kaṃcid dṛṣṭvāsau cintayan nṛpaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhūmi bhāgam tatas kaṃcid dṛṣṭvā asau cintayan nṛpaḥ
translated: Having seen a certain part of the ground, the king thought.

original: kim iyaṃ tapasaḥ śaktir muner asya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: kim iyam tapasaḥ śaktiḥ muneḥ asya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Is this the power of the penance of this great sage,

original: surabhyā vā mahābhāga brūhi me tvaṃ purohita // / //
analyzed: surabhyā vā mahābhāga brūhi me tvam purohita
translated: or of the cow, O illustrious one? Tell me, O priest.

original: ityuktaḥ kārtavīryeṇa tam uvāca purohitaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ kārtavīryeṇa tam uvāca purohitaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Kartavirya, the priest said to him:

original: muneḥ sāmarthyam apy asti siddhiś ceyaṃ hi gor nṛpa // / //
analyzed: muneḥ sāmarthyam api asti siddhiḥ ca iyam hi goḥ nṛpa
translated: The sage also has power, O king, and this is the cow's success.

original: tathāpi sā na hartavyā tvayā lobhān narādhipa /
analyzed: tathā api sā na hartavyā tvayā lobhāt narādhipa
translated: Nevertheless, O king, you should not take her out of greed.

original: yas tv etāṃ hartum icched vai tasya nāśo dhruvaṃ bhavet // / //
analyzed: yaḥ tu etām hartum icchet vai tasya nāśaḥ dhruvam bhavet
translated: For whoever wishes to take her, his destruction will surely come.

original: atha mantrivaraḥ prāha brāhmaṇo brāhmaṇapriyaḥ /
analyzed: atha mantri varaḥ prāha brāhmaṇaḥ brāhmaṇa priyaḥ
translated: Then the best of ministers, the brahmin who was dear to the brahmins, said:

original: rājakāryaṃ ne paśyed vai svapakṣasyaiva poṣaṇāt // / //
analyzed: rāja kāryam paśyet vai sva pakṣasya eva poṣaṇāt
translated: The king should not see the affairs of state, for he nurtures only his own side.

original: he rājaṃs tvayi tiṣṭhanti gṛhāṇi vividhāni ca /
analyzed: he rājan tvayi tiṣṭhanti gṛhāṇi vividhāni ca
translated: O king, various houses,

original: tathā suvarṇapātrāṇi śayanādīni ca striyaḥ // / //🔽tāṃ dhenuṃ prāpya rājendra līyamānāni tatkṣaṇāt /
analyzed: tathā suvarṇa pātrāṇi śayana ādīni ca striyaḥ  tām dhenum prāpya rāja indra līyamānāni tad kṣaṇāt
translated: golden vessels, beds and women are all in you.🔽Having obtained that cow, O lord of kings, we saw them all disappearing in an instant.

original: asmābhis tatra dṛṣṭāni nīyatāṃ dhenur uttamā // / //
analyzed: asmābhiḥ tatra dṛṣṭāni nīyatām dhenuḥ uttamā
translated: Let the best cow be taken away.

original: tavaiva yogyā rājendra yadīcchasi mahāmate /
analyzed: tava eva yogyā rāja indra yadi icchasi mahāmate
translated: If you wish, O lord of kings, O greatly wise one,

original: gatavāham ānayiṣyāmi ājñāṃ me dehi bhūbhuja // / //
analyzed: gatavāham ānayiṣyāmi ājñām me dehi bhūbhuja
translated: I will bring her back even if she has gone. Give me your command, O lord of the earth.

original: ityukto mantriṇā rājā tathety āha nṛpottama /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ mantriṇā rājā tathā iti āha nṛpa uttama
translated: Thus addressed by the minister, the king, the best of kings, said So be it.

original: sacivas tatra gatvātha surabhiṃ hartum ārabhat // / //
analyzed: sacivaḥ tatra gatvā atha surabhim hartum ārabhat
translated: The minister went there and began to take away Surabhi.

original: sacivaṃ jamadagniḥ samantataḥ /
analyzed: vārayāmasa sacivam jamadagniḥ samantataḥ
translated: Jamadagni surrounded the minister on all sides.

original: rājayogyām imāṃ brahman dehi rājñe mahāmate // / //
analyzed: rāja yogyām imām brahman dehi rājñe mahāmate
translated: O Brahmana, O greatly wise one, give this, fit for a king, to the king.

original: tvaṃ tu śākaphalāhārī kiṃ dhenvā te prayojanam /
analyzed: tvam tu śāka phala āhārī kim dhenvā te prayojanam
translated: You subsist on vegetables and fruits, what use have you for a cow?

original: ity uktvā tāṃ balād dhṛtvā netuṃ mantrī pracakrame // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā tām balāt dhṛtvā netum mantrī pracakrame
translated: Having said this, the minister forcibly seized her and started to take her away.

original: punaḥ sabhāryaḥ sa munir taṃ nṛpam /
analyzed: punar sa bhāryaḥ sa muniḥ vārayāmasa tam nṛpam
translated: Again, the sage, along with his wife, went to the king.

original: tato mantrī suduṣṭātmā muniṃ hatvā tu taṃ nṛpa // / //
analyzed: tatas mantrī su duṣṭa ātmā munim hatvā tu tam nṛpa
translated: Then the extremely wicked-minded minister, having killed the sage, took the cow to the king.

original: brahmahā netum ārebhe vāyumārgeṇa sā gatā /
analyzed: brahma hā netum ārebhe vāyu mārgeṇa sā gatā
translated: The cow, killed by the minister, went along the aerial path.

original: rājā ca kṣubdhahṛdayo yayau māhiṣmatīṃ purīm // / //
analyzed: rājā ca kṣubdha hṛdayaḥ yayau māhiṣmatīm purīm
translated: The king, with a disturbed heart, went to the city of Mahishmati.

original: munipatnī suduḥkhārtā rodayantī bhṛśaṃ tadā /
analyzed: muni patnī su duḥkha ārtā rodayantī bhṛśam tadā
translated: The sage's wife, extremely afflicted with grief, wept bitterly.

original: trisaptakṛtvaḥ svāṃ kukṣiṃ pārthiva // / //
analyzed: tri sapta kṛtvas svām kukṣim tāḍayāmasa pārthiva
translated: O king, she struck her belly twenty-one times.

original: tac chṛṇvann āgato rāmo gṛhītaparaśus tadā /
analyzed: tat śṛṇvan āgataḥ rāmaḥ gṛhīta paraśuḥ tadā
translated: Hearing that, Rama came, taking his axe.

original: puṣpādīni gṛhītvā tu vanān mātaram abravīt // / //
analyzed: puṣpa ādīni gṛhītvā tu vanāt mātaram abravīt
translated: Having taken flowers etc. from the forest, he said to his mother:

original: alam amba prahāreṇa nimittād viditaṃ mayā /
analyzed: alam amba prahāreṇa nimittāt viditam mayā
translated: Enough, mother, of striking, I have understood the reason.

original: haniṣyāmi durācāram arjunaṃ duṣṭamantriṇam // / //
analyzed: haniṣyāmi durācāram arjunam duṣṭa mantriṇam
translated: I will kill the wicked Arjuna, the evil minister.

original: tvayaikaviṃśavāreṇa yasmāt kukṣiś ca tāḍitā /
analyzed: tvayā ekaviṃśa vāreṇa yasmāt kukṣiḥ ca tāḍitā
translated: Since you have kicked my belly twenty-one times,

original: triḥsaptakṛtvas tasmāt tu haniṣye bhuvi pārthivān // / //
analyzed: tris sapta kṛtvas tasmāt tu haniṣye bhuvi pārthivān
translated: therefore, I will kill the kings on earth twenty-one times.

original: iti kṛtvā pratijñāṃ sa gṛhītvā paraśuṃ yayau /
analyzed: iti kṛtvā pratijñām sa gṛhītvā paraśum yayau
translated: Having made this vow, he took his axe and went away.

original: māhiṣmatīṃ purīṃ prāpya kārtavīryam athāhvayat // / //
analyzed: māhiṣmatīm purīm prāpya kārtavīryam atha āhvayat
translated: Having reached the city of Mahishmati, he challenged Kartavirya.

original: yuddhārtham āgataḥ so 'tha anekākṣauhiṇīyutaḥ /
analyzed: yuddha artham āgataḥ saḥ tha aneka akṣauhiṇī yutaḥ
translated: He came for battle, accompanied by many Akṣauhiṇīs.

original: tayor yuddham abhūt tatra bhairavaṃ lomaharṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: tayoḥ yuddham abhūt tatra bhairavam loma harṣaṇam
translated: Their battle was fierce, making the hair stand on end.

original: piśitāśijanānandaṃ śastrāstraśatasaṃkulam /
analyzed: piśitāśi jana ānandam śastra astra śata saṃkulam
translated: It delighted the flesh-eating people, and was full of hundreds of weapons and missiles.

original: tataḥ paraśurāmo 'bhūn mahābalaparākramaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas paraśurāmaḥ bhūt mahā bala parākramaḥ
translated: Then Paraśurāma became one of great strength and valor.

original: paraṃ jyotir acintyātmā viṣṇuḥ kāraṇamūrtimān /
analyzed: param jyotiḥ acintya ātmā viṣṇuḥ kāraṇa mūrtimān
translated: The supreme light, of inconceivable soul, Viṣṇu, the embodiment of the cause,

original: kārtavīryabalaṃ sarvam anekaiḥ kṣatriyaiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: kārtavīrya balam sarvam anekaiḥ kṣatriyaiḥ saha
translated: having killed all the strength of Kartavirya, along with many Kṣatriyas,

original: hatvā nipātya bhūmau tu paramādbhutavikramaḥ /🔽kārtavīryasya bāhūnāṃ vanaṃ ciccheda roṣavān /
analyzed: hatvā nipātya bhūmau tu parama adbhuta vikramaḥ  kārtavīryasya bāhūnām vanam ciccheda roṣavān
translated: having struck them down on the ground, with supreme and wonderful valor,🔽the angry one cut down the forest of arms of Kartavirya.

original: chinne bāhuvane tasya śiraś ciccheda bhārgavaḥ // / //
analyzed: chinne bāhu vane tasya śiraḥ ciccheda bhārgavaḥ
translated: When the forest of his arms was cut down, Bhārgava cut off his head.

original: viṣṇuhastād vadhaṃ prāpya cakravartī sa pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇu hastāt vadham prāpya cakravartī sa pārthivaḥ
translated: That king, having met his death at the hands of Vishnu, became a Chakravartin (universal monarch).

original: divyarūpadharaḥ śrīmān divyagandhānulepanaḥ // / //
analyzed: divya rūpa dharaḥ śrīmān divya gandha anulepanaḥ
translated: Possessing a divine form, prosperous, anointed with divine fragrances,

original: divyaṃ vimānam āruhya viṣṇulokam avāptavān /
analyzed: divyam vimānam āruhya viṣṇu lokam avāptavān
translated: he ascended a divine chariot and attained Vishnu's world.

original: krodhāt paraśurāmo 'pi mahābalaparākramaḥ // / //🔽triḥsaptakṛtvo bhūmyāṃ vai pārthivān nijaghāna saḥ /
analyzed: krodhāt paraśurāmaḥ mahā bala parākramaḥ  tris sapta kṛtvas bhūmyām vai pārthivān nijaghāna saḥ
translated: Out of anger, the immensely strong and valorous Parashurama🔽killed the kings on earth twenty-one times.

original: kṣatriyāṇāṃ vadhāt tena bhūmer bhāro 'vatāritaḥ // / //
analyzed: kṣatriyāṇām vadhāt tena bhūmeḥ bhāraḥ vatāritaḥ
translated: By killing the Kshatriyas, he removed the burden from the earth.

original: bhūmiś ca sakalā dattā kaśyapāya mahātmane /
analyzed: bhūmiḥ ca sakalā dattā kaśyapāya mahātmane
translated: And the entire earth was given to the great-souled Kashyapa.

original: ity eṣa jāmadagnyākhyaḥ prādurbhāvo mayoditaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti eṣa jāmadagnya ākhyaḥ prādurbhāvaḥ mayā uditaḥ
translated: Thus has been narrated the manifestation known as Jamadagni's son.

original: yaś ca tac chṛṇuyād bhaktyā sarvapāpaiḥ pramucyate // / //
analyzed: yaḥ ca tat śṛṇuyāt bhaktyā sarva pāpaiḥ pramucyate
translated: One who listens to this with devotion becomes free from all sins.

original: avatīrya bhūmau harir eṣa sākṣāt triḥsaptakṛtvaḥ kṣitipān nihatya sa /
analyzed: avatīrya bhūmau hariḥ eṣa sākṣāt triḥsapta kṛtvas kṣitipān nihatya sa
translated: Hari himself descended on earth, killed the kings twenty-one times,

original: kṣātraṃ ca tejo pravibhajya rājan rāmaḥ sthito 'dyāpi girau mahendre // / //
analyzed: kṣātram ca tejaḥ pravibhajya rājan rāmaḥ sthitaḥ girau mahā indre
translated: and divided the Kshatriya energy, O king. Rama still resides on Mount Mahendra.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe paraśurāmaprādurbhāvo nāma ṣaṭcatvāriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe paraśurāmaprādurbhāvaḥ nāma ṣaṭcatvāriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-sixth chapter in the Narasimha Purana on the manifestation of Parashurama.

original: śrīmārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: śrī mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Shree Markandeya said:

original: śṛṇu rājan pravakṣyāmi prādurbhāvaṃ hareḥ śubham /
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan pravakṣyāmi prādurbhāvam hareḥ śubham
translated: Listen, O king, I shall narrate the auspicious manifestation of Hari,

original: nihato rāvaṇo yena sagaṇo devakaṇṭakaḥ // / //
analyzed: nihataḥ rāvaṇaḥ yena sa gaṇaḥ deva kaṇṭakaḥ
translated: By whom Ravana, the thorn of the gods, was killed along with his followers.

original: brahmaṇo mānasaḥ putraḥ pulastyo 'bhūn mahāmuniḥ /
analyzed: brahmaṇaḥ mānasaḥ putraḥ pulastyaḥ bhūt mahā muniḥ
translated: Pulastya, the great sage, was the mental son of Brahma.

original: tasya vai viśravā nāma putro 'bhūt tasya rākṣasaḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya vai viśravāḥ nāma putraḥ bhūt tasya rākṣasaḥ
translated: His son was named Vishrava, who was a rakshasa.

original: tasmāj jāto mahāvīro rāvaṇo lokarāvaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt jātaḥ mahā vīraḥ rāvaṇaḥ loka rāvaṇaḥ
translated: From him was born the great hero Ravana, the screamer of the worlds.

original: tapasā mahatā yuktaḥ sa tu lokān upādravat // / //
analyzed: tapasā mahatā yuktaḥ sa tu lokān upādravat
translated: He was endowed with great austerities and attacked the worlds.

original: sendrā devā jitāstena gandharvāḥ kiṃnarās tathā /
analyzed: sa indrāḥ devāḥ jitāḥ tena gandharvāḥ kiṃnarāḥ tathā
translated: The gods with Indra were defeated by him, as well as the gandharvas and kinnaras.

original: yakṣāś ca dānavāś caiva tena rājan vinirjitāḥ // / //
analyzed: yakṣāḥ ca dānavāḥ ca eva tena rājan vinirjitāḥ
translated: The yakshas and danavas were also conquered by him, O king.

original: striyaś caiva surūpiṇyo hṛtās tena durātmanā /
analyzed: striyaḥ ca eva surūpiṇyaḥ hṛtāḥ tena durātmanā
translated: And the beautiful women were abducted by that evil-minded one.

original: devādīnāṃ nṛpaśreṣṭha ratnāni vividhani ca // / //
analyzed: deva ādīnām nṛpa śreṣṭha ratnāni ca
translated: The gems of the gods and others, O best of kings, were also taken by him.

original: raṇe kuberaṃ nijitya rāvaṇo baladarpitaḥ /
analyzed: raṇe kuberam nijitya rāvaṇaḥ bala darpitaḥ
translated: Having defeated Kubera in battle, Ravana, proud of his strength,

original: tatpurīṃ jagṛhe laṅkāṃ vimānaṃ cāpi puṣpakam // / //
analyzed: tat purīm jagṛhe laṅkām vimānam ca api puṣpakam
translated: Seized his city Lanka and the Pushpaka chariot.

original: tasyāṃ puryāṃ daśagrīvo rakṣasām adhipo 'bhavat /
analyzed: tasyām puryām daśagrīvaḥ rakṣasām adhipaḥ bhavat
translated: In that city, the ten-headed one became the lord of the rakshasas.

original: putrāś ca bahavas tasya babhūvur amitaujasaḥ // / //
analyzed: putrāḥ ca bahavaḥ tasya babhūvuḥ amita ojasaḥ
translated: And he had many sons of immeasurable prowess.

original: rākṣasāś ca tam āśritya mahābalaparākramāḥ /
analyzed: rākṣasāḥ ca tam āśritya mahā bala parākramāḥ
translated: And the rakshasas, relying on him, who were greatly strong and valorous,

original: anekakoṭayo rājan laṅkāyāṃ nivasanti ye // / //
analyzed: aneka koṭayaḥ rājan laṅkāyām nivasanti ye
translated: Many crores of whom, O king, lived in Lanka...

original: devān pitṝn manuṣyāṃś ca vidyādharagaṇān api /
analyzed: devān pitṝn manuṣyān ca vidyādhara gaṇān api
translated: The gods, the ancestors, humans, the hosts of vidyadharas,

original: yakṣāṃś caiva tataḥ sarve ghātayanti divāniśam // / //
analyzed: yakṣān ca eva tatas sarve ghātayanti divāniśam
translated: And the yakshas, all of them, day and night, they caused to be killed...

original: saṃtrastaṃ tadbhayād eva jagad āsīc carācaram /
analyzed: saṃtrastam tad bhayāt eva jagat āsīt carācaram
translated: The world, with its moving and unmoving beings, was terrified by that fear,

original: duḥkhābhibhūtam atyarthaṃ saṃbabhūva narādhipa // / //
analyzed: duḥkha abhibhūtam atyartham saṃbabhūva narādhipa
translated: And was extremely overwhelmed by suffering, O lord of men...

original: etasminn eva kāle tu devāḥ sendrā maharṣayaḥ /
analyzed: etasmin eva kāle tu devāḥ sa indrāḥ mahā ṛṣayaḥ
translated: At this very time, the gods with Indra, the great sages,

original: siddhā vidyādharāś caiva gandharvāḥ kiṃnarās tathā // / //
analyzed: siddhāḥ vidyādharāḥ ca eva gandharvāḥ kiṃnarāḥ tathā
translated: The siddhas, vidyadharas, gandharvas, kinnaras,

original: guhyakā bhujagā yakṣā ye cānye svargavāsinaḥ /
analyzed: guhyakāḥ bhujagāḥ yakṣāḥ ye ca anye svarga vāsinaḥ
translated: The guhyakas, serpents, yakshas, and others who dwell in heaven,

original: brahmāṇam agrataḥ kṛtvā śaṃkaraṃ ca narādhipa // / //🔽te yayur hatavikrāntāḥ kṣīrābdhes taṭam uttamam /
analyzed: brahmāṇam agratas kṛtvā śaṃkaram ca narādhipa  te yayuḥ hata vikrāntāḥ kṣīrābdheḥ taṭam uttamam
translated: Placing Brahma and Shankara at the forefront, O lord of men...🔽They went, their valor destroyed, to the excellent shore of the Milk Ocean.

original: tatrārādhya hariṃ devās tasthuḥ prāñjalayas tadā // / //🔽brahmā ca viṣṇum ārādhya gandhapuṣpādibhiḥ śubhaiḥ /
analyzed: tatra ārādhya harim devāḥ tasthuḥ prāñjalayaḥ tadā  brahmā ca viṣṇum ārādhya gandha puṣpa ādibhiḥ śubhaiḥ
translated: There, the gods, having propitiated Hari, stood with folded hands...🔽And Brahma, having propitiated Vishnu with fragrant flowers and other auspicious things,

original: prāñjaliḥ praṇato bhūtvā vāsudevam athāstuvan // / //
analyzed: prāñjaliḥ praṇataḥ bhūtvā vāsudevam atha astuvan
translated: With folded hands and bowed down, he then praised Vasudeva...

original: brahmovāca /
analyzed: brahmā uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

original: namaḥ kṣīrābdhivāsāya nāgaparyaṅkaśāyine /
analyzed: namaḥ kṣīrābdhi vāsāya nāga paryaṅka śāyine
translated: Salutations to the one who resides in the Milky Ocean, to the one who lies on the bed of serpents,

original: namaḥ śrīkarasaṃspṛṣṭa divyapādāya viṣṇave // / //
analyzed: namaḥ śrī kara saṃspṛṣṭa divi apādāya viṣṇave
translated: Salutations to Vishnu, whose divine feet are touched by the auspicious hands,

original: namas te yoganidrāya yogāntarbhāvitāya ca /
analyzed: namaḥ te yoganidrāya yoga antar bhāvitāya ca
translated: Salutations to you, the sleep of yoga, to the one contemplated within yoga,

original: tārkṣyāsanāya devāya govindāya namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: tārkṣyāsanāya devāya govindāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the god seated on Garuda, to Govinda, salutations again and again.

original: namaḥ kṣīrābdhikallola spṛṣṭamātrāya śārṅgiṇe /
analyzed: namaḥ kṣīrābdhi kallola spṛṣṭa mātrāya śārṅgiṇe
translated: Salutations to the wielder of the Sharnga bow, who is merely touched by the waves of the Milky Ocean,

original: namo 'ravindapādāya padmanābhāya viṣṇave // / //
analyzed: namaḥ ravinda pādāya padmanābhāya viṣṇave
translated: Salutations to the lotus-footed Vishnu, to the one with the navel like a lotus,

original: bhaktārcitasupādāya namo yogapriyāya vai /
analyzed: bhakta arcita su pādāya namaḥ yoga priyāya vai
translated: Salutations to the one whose feet are worshipped by devotees, to the one who loves yoga,

original: śubhāṅgāya sunetrāya mādhavāya namo namaḥ // / //🔽sukeśāya sunetrāya sulalāṭāya cakriṇe /
analyzed: śubha aṅgāya sunetrāya mādhavāya namaḥ namaḥ  su keśāya su netrāya su lalāṭāya cakriṇe
translated: Salutations again and again to Madhava, to the one with auspicious limbs, to the one with beautiful eyes.🔽To the one with beautiful hair, to the one with beautiful eyes, to the one with a beautiful forehead, to the wielder of the discus,

original: suvaktrāya sukarṇāya śrīdharāya namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: su vaktrāya su karṇāya śrīdharāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: To the one with a beautiful face, to the one with beautiful ears, salutations again and again to the prosperous one.

original: suvakṣase sunābhāya padmanābhāya vai namaḥ /
analyzed: su vakṣase sunābhāya padmanābhāya vai namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one with a beautiful chest, to the one with a beautiful navel, to the one with the navel like a lotus,

original: subhruve cārudehāya cārudantāya śārṅgiṇe // / //
analyzed: su bhruve cāru dehāya cāru dantāya śārṅgiṇe
translated: To the one with beautiful eyebrows, to the one with a beautiful body, to the one with beautiful teeth, to the wielder of the Sharnga bow.

original: cārujaṅghāya divyāya keśavāya namo namaḥ /
analyzed: cārujaṅghāya divyāya keśavāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the one with beautiful thighs, to the divine one, to Keshava,

original: sunakhāya suśāntāya suvidyāya gadābhṛte // / //
analyzed: su nakhāya su śāntāya su vidyāya gadā bhṛte
translated: To the one with beautiful nails, to the one with great peace, to the one with excellent knowledge, to the wielder of the club,

original: dharmapriyāya devāya vāmanāya namo namaḥ /
analyzed: dharma priyāya devāya vāmanāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the god who loves dharma, to the dwarf.

original: asuraghnāya cogrāya rakṣoghnāya namo namaḥ // / //
analyzed: asura ghnāya ca ugrāya rakṣaḥ ghnāya namaḥ namaḥ
translated: Salutations again and again to the slayer of demons, to the fierce one, to the destroyer of demons.

original: devānām ārtināśāya bhīmakarmakṛte namaḥ /
analyzed: devānām ārti nāśāya bhīma karma kṛte namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the one who destroys the distress of the gods, to the one who performs terrible deeds.

original: namas te lokanāthāya rāvaṇāntakṛte namaḥ // / //
analyzed: namaḥ te loka nāthāya rāvaṇa anta kṛte namaḥ
translated: Salutations to you, the lord of the worlds, to the one who put an end to Ravana.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: iti stuto hṛṣīkeśas tutoṣa parameṣṭhinā /
analyzed: iti stutaḥ hṛṣīkeśaḥ tutoṣa parameṣṭhinā
translated: Thus praised, Hrishikesha was pleased with the Supreme Lord.

original: svarūpaṃ darśayitvā tu pitāmaham uvāca ha // / //
analyzed: sva rūpam darśayitvā tu pitāmaham uvāca ha
translated: Having shown his own form, he spoke to the Grandfather.

original: kimarthaṃ tu suraiḥ sārdham āgatas tvaṃ pitāmaha /
analyzed: kimartham tu suraiḥ sārdham āgataḥ tvam pitāmaha
translated: Why have you come with the gods, O Grandfather?

original: yat kāryaṃ brūhi me brahman yadarthaṃ saṃstutas tvayā // / //
analyzed: yat kāryam brūhi me brahman yad artham saṃstutaḥ tvayā
translated: Tell me, O Brahman, what is to be done, for which you have praised me.

original: ityukto devadevena viṣṇunā prabhaviṣṇunā /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ devadevena viṣṇunā prabhaviṣṇunā
translated: Thus addressed by Vishnu, the god of gods, the powerful one,

original: sarvadevagaṇaiḥ sārdhaṃ brahmā prāha janārdanam // / //
analyzed: sarva deva gaṇaiḥ sārdham brahmā prāha janārdanam
translated: Brahma, along with all the hosts of gods, spoke to Janardana.

original: brahmovāca /
analyzed: brahmā uvāca
translated: Brahma said:

original: nāśitaṃ tu jagat sarvaṃ rāvaṇena durātmanā /
analyzed: nāśitam tu jagat sarvam rāvaṇena durātmanā
translated: The entire world has been destroyed by the evil-minded Ravana.

original: sendrāḥ parājitās tena bahuśo rakṣasā vibho // / //
analyzed: sa indrāḥ parājitāḥ tena bahuśas rakṣasā vibho
translated: He has defeated the gods many times, O powerful one, along with Indra.

original: rākṣasair bhakṣitā martyā yajñāś cāpi vidūṣitāḥ /
analyzed: rākṣasaiḥ bhakṣitāḥ martyāḥ yajñāḥ ca api vidūṣitāḥ
translated: Mortals have been devoured by the rakshasas, and sacrifices have been defiled.

original: devakanyā hṛtās tena balāc chatasahasraśaḥ // / //
analyzed: deva kanyāḥ hṛtāḥ tena balāt śata sahasraśas
translated: Hundreds of thousands of divine maidens have been abducted by him by force.

original: tvām ṛte puṇḍarīkākṣa rāvaṇasya vadhaṃ prati /
analyzed: tvām ṛte puṇḍarīkākṣa rāvaṇasya vadham prati
translated: Except for you, O lotus-eyed one, for the sake of Ravana's destruction,

original: na samarthā yato devās tvam atas tadvadhaṃ kuru // / //
analyzed: na samarthāḥ yatas devāḥ tvam atas tad vadham kuru
translated: Since the gods are incapable of doing so, you should bring about his destruction.

original: ityukto brahmaṇā viṣṇur brahmāṇam idam abravīt /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ brahmaṇā viṣṇuḥ brahmāṇam idam abravīt
translated: Thus addressed by Brahma, Vishnu said this to Brahma:

original: śṛṇuṣvāvahito brahman yad vadāmi hitaṃ vacaḥ // / //
analyzed: śṛṇuṣva avahitaḥ brahman yat vadāmi hitam vacaḥ
translated: Listen attentively, O Brahma, to the beneficial words I speak.

original: sūryavaṃśodbhavaḥ śrīmān rājāsīd bhuvi vīryavān /
analyzed: sūrya vaṃśa udbhavaḥ śrīmān rājā āsīt bhuvi vīryavān
translated: There was a glorious and powerful king on earth, born in the solar dynasty.

original: nāmnā daśarathakhyātas tasya putro bhavāmy aham // / //
analyzed: nāmnā daśaratha khyātaḥ tasya putraḥ bhavāmi aham
translated: I will be his son, known by the name Dasharatha.

original: rāvaṇasya vadhārthāya caturdhāṃśena sattama /
analyzed: rāvaṇasya vadha arthāya caturdhāṃśena sattama
translated: For the sake of Ravana's destruction, O best one, with a fourth part of myself.

original: svāṃśair vānararūpeṇa sakalā devatāgaṇāḥ // / //
analyzed: sva aṃśaiḥ vānara rūpeṇa sakalāḥ devatā gaṇāḥ
translated: All the hosts of gods in their own parts in the form of monkeys.

original: vartāyantāṃ viśvakartaḥ syād evaṃ rāvaṇakṣayaḥ /
analyzed: vartāyantām viśvakartaḥ syāt evam rāvaṇa kṣayaḥ
translated: May they wander, O creator of the universe, so that Ravana may be destroyed.

original: ityukto devadevena brahmā lokapitāmahaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ devadevena brahmā lokapitāmahaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by the god of gods, Brahma, the grandfather of the worlds.

original: devāś ca te praṇamyātha merupṛṣṭhaṃ tadā yayuḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ ca te praṇamya atha meru pṛṣṭham tadā yayuḥ
translated: And the gods, having bowed, then went to the peak of Meru.

original: svāṃśair vānararūpeṇa avateruś ca bhūtale // / //
analyzed: sva aṃśaiḥ vānara rūpeṇa avateruḥ ca bhū tale
translated: And they descended to the earth in their own parts in the form of monkeys.

original: athāputro daśaratho munibhir vedapāragaiḥ /
analyzed: atha aputraḥ daśarathaḥ munibhiḥ vedapāragaiḥ
translated: Then Dasharatha, who had no son, with sages who had mastered the Vedas.

original: iṣṭiṃ tu putraprāptikarīṃ nṛpaḥ // / //
analyzed: iṣṭim tu kārayāmasa putra prāpti karīm nṛpaḥ
translated: The king performed a sacrifice that brings about the birth of a son.

original: tataḥ sauvarṇapātrasthaṃ havir ādāya pāyasam /
analyzed: tatas sauvarṇa pātra stham haviḥ ādāya pāyasam
translated: Then, taking the oblation of milk-rice contained in a golden vessel,

original: vahniḥ kuṇḍāt samuttasthau nūnaṃ devena noditaḥ // / //
analyzed: vahniḥ kuṇḍāt samuttasthau nūnam devena noditaḥ
translated: The fire rose from the pit, surely urged by the god.

original: ādāya munayo mantrāc cakruḥ piṇḍadvayaṃ śubham /
analyzed: ādāya munayaḥ mantrāt cakruḥ piṇḍa dvayam śubham
translated: The sages, taking the two auspicious balls from the mantra,

original: datte kauśalyakaikeyyor dve // / //🔽te piṇḍaprāśane kāle sumitrāyā mahāmate /
analyzed: datte kauśalya kaikeyyoḥ dve piṇḍe mantra mantrite  te piṇḍaprāśane kāle sumitrāyāḥ mahāmate
translated: gave them to Kauśalyā and Kaikeyī, the two...🔽O greatly wise one, at the time of consuming the balls, to Sumitrā,

original: piṇḍābhyām alpam alpaṃ tu subhāginyāḥ prayacchataḥ // / //
analyzed: piṇḍābhyām alpam alpam tu subhāginyāḥ prayacchataḥ
translated: they gave a little bit from the two balls to the fortunate one...

original: tatas tāḥ rājapatnyo yathāvidhi /
analyzed: tatas tāḥ prāśayāmasuḥ rāja patnyaḥ yathāvidhi
translated: Then those royal wives, as prescribed,

original: piṇḍān devakṛtān prāśya prāpur garbhān aninditān // / //
analyzed: piṇḍān deva kṛtān prāśya prāpuḥ garbhān aninditān
translated: having consumed the balls offered by the god, obtained faultless wombs...

original: evaṃ viṣṇur daśarathāj jātas tatpatniṣu triṣu /
analyzed: evam viṣṇuḥ daśarathāt jātaḥ tad patniṣu triṣu
translated: Thus Viṣṇu was born from Daśaratha to his three wives,

original: svāṃśair lokahitāyaiva caturdhā jagatīpate // / //
analyzed: sva aṃśaiḥ loka hitāya eva caturdhā jagatīpate
translated: in four parts, O lord of the world, for the welfare of the people...

original: rāmaś ca lakṣmaṇaś caiva bharataḥ śatrughnaiva ca /🔽jātakarmādikaṃ prāpya saṃskāraṃ munisaṃskṛtam // / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ ca lakṣmaṇaḥ ca eva bharataḥ śatrughna eva ca  jātakarma ādikam prāpya saṃskāram muni saṃskṛtam
translated: Rāma, Lakṣmaṇa, Bharata, and Śatrughna,🔽having received the sacraments beginning with the birth rite, performed by the sages...

original: mantrapiṇḍavaśād yogaṃ prāpya cerur yathārbhakāḥ /
analyzed: mantra piṇḍa vaśāt yogam prāpya ceruḥ yathā arbhakāḥ
translated: having attained yoga by the power of the mantra balls, they behaved like children.

original: rāmaś ca lakṣmaṇaś caiva saha nityaṃ viceratuḥ // / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ ca lakṣmaṇaḥ ca eva saha nityam viceratuḥ
translated: Rāma and Lakṣmaṇa always roamed together...

original: janmādikṛtasaṃskārau pituḥ prītikarau nṛpa /
analyzed: janma ādi kṛta saṃskārau pituḥ prīti karau nṛpa
translated: having received the sacraments performed from birth, they delighted their father, O king.

original: vavṛdhāte mahāvīryau śrutiśabdātilakṣaṇau // / //
analyzed: vavṛdhāte mahā vīryau śruti śabda atilakṣaṇau
translated: And grew up, those two of great prowess, surpassing the range of hearing.

original: bharataḥ kaikayo rājan bhrātrā saha gṛhe 'vasat /
analyzed: bharataḥ kaikayaḥ rājan bhrātrā saha gṛhe vasat
translated: Bharata, the king of the Kaikeyas, O king, lived with his brother in the house.

original: vedaśāstrāṇi bubudhe śastraśāstraṃ nṛpottama // / //
analyzed: veda śāstrāṇi bubudhe śastra śāstram nṛpa uttama
translated: He understood the Vedas and scriptures, and the science of arms, O best of kings.

original: etasminn eva kāle tu viśvāmitro mahātapā /
analyzed: etasmin eva kāle tu viśvāmitraḥ mahā tapā
translated: In the meantime, Vishvamitra, the great ascetic,

original: yāgena yaṣṭum ārebhe vidhinā madhusūdanam // / //
analyzed: yāgena yaṣṭum ārebhe vidhinā madhusūdanam
translated: began to worship Madhusudana (Krishna) with a sacrifice, according to the prescribed rules.

original: sa tu vighnena yāgo 'bhūd rākṣasair bahuśaḥ purā /
analyzed: sa tu vighnena yāgaḥ bhūt rākṣasaiḥ bahuśas purā
translated: But that sacrifice was repeatedly obstructed by Rakshasas in the past.

original: netuṃ sa yāgarākṣārthaṃ saṃprāpto rāmalakṣmaṇau // / //
analyzed: netum sa yāga rākṣa artham saṃprāptaḥ rāma lakṣmaṇau
translated: To take away the Rakshasas for the sake of the sacrifice, he obtained Rama and Lakshmana.

original: viśvāmitro nṛpaśreṣṭha tatpitur mandiraṃ śubham /
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ nṛpa śreṣṭha tad pituḥ mandiram śubham
translated: Vishvamitra, O best of kings, went to the auspicious abode of his father.

original: daśarathas tu taṃ dṛṣṭvā pratyutthāya mahāmatiḥ // / //
analyzed: daśarathaḥ tu tam dṛṣṭvā pratyutthāya mahāmatiḥ
translated: Dasharatha, seeing him, rose up, and the greatly wise one,

original: arghyapādyādividhina viśvāmitram apūjayat /
analyzed: arghya pādya ādi vidhina viśvāmitram apūjayat
translated: worshipped Vishvamitra with the rites of Arghya, water for washing the feet, and so on.

original: sa pūjito muniḥ prāha rājānaṃ rājasaṃmnidhau // / //
analyzed: sa pūjitaḥ muniḥ prāha rājānam rāja saṃmnidhau
translated: The worshipped sage said to the king in the presence of the king:

original: śṛṇu rājan daśaratha yadartham aham āgataḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan daśaratha yad artham aham āgataḥ
translated: Listen, O king Dasharatha, why I have come.

original: tat kāryaṃ nṛpaśārdūla kathayāmi tavāgrataḥ // / //
analyzed: tat kāryam nṛpa śārdūla kathayāmi tava agratas
translated: I shall tell you that task, O tiger among kings.

original: rākṣasair nāśito yāgo bahuśo me durāsadaiḥ /
analyzed: rākṣasaiḥ nāśitaḥ yāgaḥ bahuśas me durāsadaiḥ
translated: My sacrifice has been destroyed many times by the invincible Rakshasas.

original: yajñasya rakṣaṇārthaṃ me dehi tvaṃ rāmalakṣmaṇau // / //🔽rājā daśarathaḥ śrutvā viśvāmitravaco nṛpa /
analyzed: yajñasya rakṣaṇa artham me dehi tvam rāma lakṣmaṇau  rājā daśarathaḥ śrutvā viśvāmitra vacaḥ nṛpa
translated: For the protection of the sacrifice, give me Rama and Lakshmana.🔽Having heard the words of Vishvamitra, O king,

original: viṣaṇṇavadano bhūtva viśvāmitram uvāca ha // / //
analyzed: viṣaṇṇa vadanaḥ bhūtvā viśvāmitram uvāca ha
translated: King Dasharatha, with a sorrowful face, said to Vishvamitra:

original: bālābhyāṃ mama putrābhyāṃ kiṃ te kāryaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bālābhyām mama putrābhyām kim te kāryam bhaviṣyati
translated: What work will be accomplished by my two young sons?

original: ahaṃ tvayā sahāgatya śaktyā rakṣāmi te makham // / //
analyzed: aham tvayā saha āgatya śaktyā rakṣāmi te makham
translated: I myself, coming with you, will protect your sacrifice to the best of my ability.

original: rājñas tu vacanaṃ śrutvā rājānaṃ munir abravīt /
analyzed: rājñaḥ tu vacanam śrutvā rājānam muniḥ abravīt
translated: Having heard the king's words, the sage said to the king:

original: rāmo 'pi śaknute nūnaṃ sarvān nāśayituṃ nṛpa // / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ u pi śaknute nūnam sarvān nāśayitum nṛpa
translated: O king, Rama alone is certainly able to destroy all of them.

original: rāmeṇaiva hi te śakyā na tvayā rākṣasā nṛpa /
analyzed: rāmeṇa eva hi te śakyāḥ na tvayā rākṣasāḥ nṛpa
translated: O king, the Rakshasas are indeed capable of being destroyed only by Rama, not by you.

original: ato me dehi rāmaṃ ca na cintāṃ kartum arhasi // / //
analyzed: atas me dehi rāmam ca na cintām kartum arhasi
translated: Therefore, give me Rama, and you should not worry.

original: ityukto muninā tena viśvāmitreṇa dhīmatā /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ muninā tena viśvāmitreṇa dhīmatā
translated: Having been thus addressed by the sage, the wise Vishvamitra,

original: tuṣṇīṃ sthitvā kṣaṇaṃ rājā munivaryam uvāca ha // / //
analyzed: tuṣṇīm sthitvā kṣaṇam rājā muni varyam uvāca ha
translated: the king remained silent for a moment and then said to the best of sages:

original: yad bravīmi muniśreṣṭha prasannas tvaṃ nibodha me /
analyzed: yat bravīmi muni śreṣṭha prasannaḥ tvam nibodha me
translated: O best of sages, listen to me with a composed mind, as I speak.

original: rājīvalocanaṃ rāmam ahaṃ dāsye sahānujam // / //
analyzed: rājīva locanam rāmam aham dāsye sahānujam
translated: I will give you the lotus-eyed Rama along with his younger brother.

original: kiṃ tv asya jananī brahman adṛṣṭvainaṃ mariṣyati /
analyzed: kim tu asya jananī brahman a dṛṣṭvā enam mariṣyati
translated: But, O Brahmana, his mother will die without seeing him.

original: ato 'haṃ caturaṅgeṇa balena sahito mune // / //
analyzed: atas ham catur aṅgeṇa balena sahitaḥ mune
translated: Therefore, O sage, I, along with a four-fold army,

original: āgatya rākṣasān hanmīty evaṃ me manasi sthitam /
analyzed: āgatya rākṣasān hanmi iti evam me manasi sthitam
translated: have come to kill the Rakshasas - this is what is in my mind.

original: viśvāmitraḥ punaḥ prāha rājānam amitaujasam // / //
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ punar prāha rājānam amita ojasam
translated: Vishvamitra again spoke to the king of immeasurable prowess,

original: nājño rāmo nṛpaśreṣṭha sa sarvajñaḥ samaḥ kṣamaḥ /
analyzed: na ajñaḥ rāmaḥ nṛpa śreṣṭha sa sarva jñaḥ samaḥ kṣamaḥ
translated: Rama is not ignorant, O best of kings, he is omniscient, impartial and forgiving.

original: śeṣanārāyaṇāv etau tava putrau na saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: śeṣa nārāyaṇau etau tava putrau na saṃśayaḥ
translated: These two, Shesha and Narayana, are undoubtedly your sons.

original: duṣṭānāṃ nigrahārthāya śiṣṭānāṃ pālanāya ca /
analyzed: duṣṭānām nigraha arthāya śiṣṭānām pālanāya ca
translated: For the purpose of restraining the wicked and protecting the virtuous,

original: avatīrṇau na saṃdeho gṛhe tava narādhipa // / //
analyzed: avatīrṇau na saṃdehaḥ gṛhe tava narādhipa
translated: they have undoubtedly descended into your house, O king of men.

original: na mātrā na tvayā rājan śokaḥ kāryo 'tra cāṇv api /
analyzed: na mātrā na tvayā rājan śokaḥ kāryaḥ ca aṇu api
translated: O king, neither by the mother nor by you should any grief be felt in this matter, not even the slightest.

original: niḥkṣepe ca mahārāja arpayiṣyāmi te sutau // / //🔽ityukto daśarathas tena viśvāmitreṇa dhīmatā /
analyzed: niḥkṣepe ca mahā rāja arpayiṣyāmi te sutau  iti uktaḥ daśarathaḥ tena viśvāmitreṇa dhīmatā
translated: And, O great king, I shall entrust your sons to you, when the time comes for their return.🔽Thus addressed by the wise Vishvamitra,

original: tacchāpabhīto manasā nīyatām ity abhāṣata // / //
analyzed: tad śāpa bhītaḥ manasā nīyatām iti abhāṣata
translated: King Dasharatha, fearing his curse, thought in his mind, Let them be taken.

original: kṛcchrāt pitrā vinirmuktaṃ rāmam ādāya sānujam /
analyzed: kṛcchrāt pitrā vinirmuktam rāmam ādāya sa anujam
translated: Then, with difficulty, the king released Rama, taking him and his younger brother,

original: tataḥ siddhāśramaṃ rājan saṃpratasthe sa kauśikaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas siddhāśramam rājan saṃpratasthe sa kauśikaḥ
translated: and Koushika, O king, set out for the hermitage of Siddhashrama.

original: taṃ prasthitam athālokya rājā daśarathas tadā /
analyzed: tam prasthitam atha ālokya rājā daśarathaḥ tadā
translated: Seeing him set out, King Dasharatha then,

original: anuvrajyābravīd etad vaco daśarathas tadā // / //
analyzed: anuvrajya abravīt etat vacaḥ daśarathaḥ tadā
translated: and said these words to Dasha ratha:

original: aputro 'haṃ purā brahman bahubhiḥ kāmyakarmabhiḥ /
analyzed: aputraḥ ham purā brahman bahubhiḥ kāmya karmabhiḥ
translated: In the past, O Brahman, I was sonless, having performed many desired rites.

original: muniprasādād adhunā putravān asmi sattama // / //
analyzed: muni prasādāt adhunā putravān asmi sattama
translated: Now, O best of sages, I have become a father through your grace.

original: manasā tadviyogaṃ tu na śakṣyāmi viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: manasā tad viyogam tu na śakṣyāmi viśeṣataḥ
translated: But I am unable to bear the separation from him in my mind, especially.

translated: You alone know, O sage, take him away quickly and give him back to me.

analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ rājānam viśvāmitraḥ bravīt punar
translated: Thus addressed, Vishvamitra spoke again to the king:

analyzed: samāpta yajñaḥ ca punar neṣye rāmam ca lakṣmaṇam
translated: After the sacrifice is completed, I will take Rama and Lakshmana back.

analyzed: satya pūrvam tu dāsyāmi na cintām kartum arhasi  iti uktaḥ preṣayāmasa rāmam lakṣmaṇa saṃyutam
translated: But I will give them back truthfully, you should not worry.🔽Thus addressed, the king, though unwilling, out of fear of the sage's curse,

analyzed: an icchan api rājā asau muni śāpa bhayāt nṛpaḥ

original: ity evamukto muninā rāmas taṃ munim abravīt // / //
analyzed: iti evam uktaḥ muninā rāmaḥ tam munim abravīt
translated: Thus addressed by the sage, Rama spoke to that sage:

analyzed: katham hi strī vadham kuryām aham adya mahā mune
translated: How can I kill a woman today, O great sage?

analyzed: strī vadhe tu mahā pāpam pravadanti manīṣiṇaḥ

analyzed: iti rāma vacaḥ śrutvā viśvāmitraḥ uvāca tam

analyzed: tasyāḥ tu nidhanāt rāma janāḥ sarve nirākulāḥ

analyzed: bhavanti satatam tasmāt tasyāḥ puṇya pradaḥ vadhaḥ

analyzed: iti evam vādini munau viśvāmitre niśācarī

analyzed: muninā preritaḥ rāmaḥ tām dṛṣṭvā vivṛta ānanām

analyzed: udyata eka bhuja yaṣṭim āyatīm śroṇi lambi puruṣa antra mekhalām

analyzed: tām vilokya vanitā vadhe ghṛṇām patriṇā saha mumoca rāghavaḥ

original: śaraṃ saṃdhāya vegena tena tasyā uraḥsthalam /

original: vipāṭitaṃ dvidhā rājan sā papāta mamāra ca // / //
analyzed: vipāṭitam dvidhā rājan sā papāta mamāra ca

original: ghātayitvā tu tām evaṃ tāv ānīya munis tu tau /
analyzed: ghātayitvā tu tām evam tau ānīya muniḥ tu tau
translated: Having thus killed her, the sage brought them both🔽and said to Rama, the descendant of Kakutstha:

analyzed: prāpayāmasa tam tatra nānā ṛṣi niṣevitam

analyzed: nānā druma latā ākīrṇam nānā puṣpa upaśobhitam

original: nānānirjharatoyāḍhyaṃ vindhyaśailāntarasthitam // / //
analyzed: nānā nirjhara toya āḍhyam vindhya śaila antara sthitam
translated: Rich with the waters of various waterfalls, situated in the Vindhya mountain range,

original: śākamūlaphalopetaṃ divyaṃ siddhāśramaṃ svakam /
analyzed: śāka mūla phala upetam divyam siddhāśramam svakam
translated: Endowed with vegetables, roots and fruits, his own divine hermitage of the Siddhas,

original: rakṣārthaṃ tāv ubhau sthāpya śikṣayitvā viśeṣataḥ // / //🔽tataś cārabdhavān yāgaṃ viśvāmitro mahātapāḥ /
analyzed: rakṣā artham tau ubhau sthāpya śikṣayitvā viśeṣataḥ  tatas ca ārabdhavān yāgam viśvāmitraḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: Having placed them both there for protection, and having instructed them in particular,🔽Then Vishvamitra, of great austerities, began the sacrifice.

original: dīkṣāṃ praviṣṭe ca munau viśvāmitre mahātmani // / //
analyzed: dīkṣām praviṣṭe ca munau viśvāmitre mahātmani
translated: And when the great sage Vishvamitra had entered the initiation,

original: yajñe tu vitate tatra karma kurvanti ṛtvijaḥ /
analyzed: yajñe tu vitate tatra karma kurvanti ṛtvijaḥ
translated: And when the sacrifice was spread out there, the priests were performing the rites.

original: mārīcaś ca subāhuś ca bahavaś cānyarākṣasāḥ // / //
analyzed: mārīcaḥ ca subāhuḥ ca bahavaḥ ca anya rākṣasāḥ
translated: And Maricha, and Subahu, and many other Rakshasas,

original: āgatā yāganāśāya rāvaṇena niyojitāḥ /
analyzed: āgatāḥ yāga nāśāya rāvaṇena niyojitāḥ
translated: Came to destroy the sacrifice, appointed by Ravana.

original: tān āgatān sa vijñāya rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ // / //
analyzed: tān āgatān sa vijñāya rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: And Rama, the lotus-eyed one, having recognized them as they came,

original: śareṇa subāhuṃ dharaṇītale /
analyzed: śareṇa pātayāmasa su bāhum dharaṇī tale
translated: With an arrow, sent Subahu to the ground.

original: asṛkpravāhaṃ varṣantaṃ mārīcaṃ bhallakena tu // / //
analyzed: asṛj pravāham varṣantam mārīcam bhallakena tu
translated: And with a broad arrow, he struck Maricha, who was raining a stream of blood,

original: pratāḍya nītavān abdhiṃ yathā parṇaṃ tu vāyunā /
analyzed: pratāḍya nītavān abdhim yathā parṇam tu vāyunā
translated: And carried him to the ocean, as a leaf is carried by the wind.

original: śeṣāṃs tu hatavān rāmo lakṣmaṇāś ca niśācarān // / //
analyzed: śeṣān tu hatavān rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇāḥ ca niśācarān
translated: And Rama and Lakshmana killed the remaining Rakshasas.

original: rāmeṇa rakṣitamakho viśvāmitro mahāyaśāḥ /🔽samāpya yāgaṃ vidhivat ṛtvijān // / //
analyzed: rāmeṇa rakṣita makhaḥ viśvāmitraḥ mahā yaśāḥ  samāpya yāgam vidhivat pūjayāmase ṛtvijān
translated: The great sage Vishvamitra, whose sacrifice was protected by Rama,🔽having completed the sacrifice according to the rules, and having duly worshipped

original: sadasyān api saṃpūjya yathārhaṃ ca hy ariṃdama /
analyzed: sadasyān api saṃpūjya yathārham ca hi ariṃdama
translated: the priests and the assembly members, O chastiser of enemies,

original: rāmaṃ ca lakṣmaṇaṃ caiva bhaktitaḥ // / //
analyzed: rāmam ca lakṣmaṇam ca eva pūjayāmasa bhaktitaḥ

analyzed: tatas deva gaṇaḥ tuṣṭaḥ yajña bhāgena sattama

analyzed: nivārya rākṣasa bhayam kārayitvā tu tad makham

analyzed: śrutvā nānā kathāḥ puṇyāḥ rāmaḥ bhrātṛ samanvitaḥ
translated: having heard various auspicious stories, Rama, accompanied by his brothers,

analyzed: tena nītaḥ vinīta ātmā ahalyā yatra tiṣṭhati
translated: was taken by him, with a humble mind, to where Ahalya was staying.

original: vyabhicārān mahendreṇa bhartrā śaptā hi sā purā // / //
analyzed: vyabhicārāt mahā indreṇa bhartrā śaptā hi sā purā
translated: She had been cursed by her husband, the great Indra, for her infidelity.

original: pāṣāṇabhūtā rājendra tasya rāmasya darśanāt /
analyzed: pāṣāṇa bhūtāḥ rāja indra tasya rāmasya darśanāt
translated: She had become a stone, O lord of kings, but due to seeing Rama,

original: ahalyā muktaśāpā ca jagāma gautamaṃ prati // / //
analyzed: ahalyā mukta śāpā ca jagāma gautamam prati
translated: Ahalya, freed from the curse, went to Gautama.

original: viśvāmitras tatas tatra vai kṣaṇam /
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ tatas tatra cintayāmasa vai kṣaṇam
translated: Then Vishvamitra, the great ascetic, thought for a moment:

original: kṛtadāro mayā neyo rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛtadāraḥ mayā neyaḥ rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: I must take Rama, the lotus-eyed one, who has taken a wife.

original: iti saṃcintya tau gṛhya viśvāmitro mahātapāḥ /
analyzed: iti saṃcintya tau gṛhya viśvāmitraḥ mahā tapāḥ
translated: Having thought this, Vishvamitra, the great ascetic, took the two brothers,🔽and went to the hermitage of the great sage Bharadvaja.

original: śiṣyaiḥ parivṛto 'nekair jagāma mithilāṃ prati // / //🔽nānādeśād athāyātā janakasya niveśanam /
analyzed: śiṣyaiḥ parivṛtaḥ nekaiḥ jagāma mithilām prati  nānādeśāt atha āyātāḥ janakasya niveśanam
translated: Surrounded by many disciples, he went towards Mithila.

original: rājaputrā mahāvīryāḥ pūrvaṃ sītābhikāṅkṣiṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: rāja putrāḥ mahā vīryāḥ pūrvam sītā abhikāṅkṣiṇaḥ
translated: Then the princes of great valor, who had come from various countries and who had earlier desired Sita,

original: tān dṛṣṭvā pūjayitvā tu janakaś ca yathārhataḥ /
analyzed: tān dṛṣṭvā pūjayitvā tu janakaḥ ca yathārhataḥ
translated: having seen them, Janaka honored them as befitting.

original: yat sītāyāḥ samutpannaṃ dhanur māheśvaraṃ mahat // / //
analyzed: yat sītāyāḥ samutpannam dhanuḥ māheśvaram mahat
translated: The great bow of Mahesha, which arose from Sita,

original: arcitaṃ gandhamālābhī ramyaśobhāsamanvite /
analyzed: arcitam gandha mālābhiḥ ramya śobhā samanvite
translated: having been worshipped with fragrant garlands, endowed with charming beauty,

original: raṅge mahati vistīrṇe tad dhanuḥ // / //
analyzed: raṅge mahati vistīrṇe sthāpayāmasa tat dhanuḥ
translated: on a large and spacious stage, that bow

original: uvāca ca nṛpān sarvāṃs tadoccair janako nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: uvāca ca nṛpān sarvān tadā uccais janakaḥ nṛpaḥ
translated: and the king Janaka loudly said to all the kings:

original: ākarṣaṇād idaṃ yena dhanur bhagnaṃ nṛpātmajāḥ // / //
analyzed: ākarṣaṇāt idam yena dhanuḥ bhagnam nṛpa ātmajāḥ
translated: O princes, whoever can bend this bow and string it,

original: tasyeyaṃ dharmato bhāryā sītā sarvāṅgaśobhanā /
analyzed: tasya iyam dharmataḥ bhāryā sītā sarva aṅga śobhanā
translated: to him, according to dharma, this Sita, beautiful in all limbs, belongs.

original: ity evaṃ śrāvite tena janakena mahātmanā // / //
analyzed: iti evam śrāvite tena janakena mahātmanā
translated: Thus addressed by the great-souled Janaka,

original: kramād ādāya te tat tu sajyīkartum athābhavan /🔽dhanuṣā tāḍitāḥ sarve kramāt tena mahīpate // / //
analyzed: kramāt ādāya te tat tu sajyīkartum atha abhavan  dhanuṣā tāḍitāḥ sarve kramāt tena mahīpate
translated: they gradually took up the bow and tried to string it.🔽All of them were struck by the bow, O king, in turn by him.

original: vidhūya patitā rājan vilajjās tatra pārthivāḥ /
analyzed: vidhūya patitāḥ rājan vilajjāḥ tatra pārthivāḥ
translated: Shaken off and fallen down, O king, the kings there were ashamed.

original: teṣu bhagneṣu janakas tad dhanus tryambakaṃ nṛpa // / //
analyzed: teṣu bhagneṣu janakaḥ tat dhanuḥ tryambakam nṛpa
translated: When they were shattered, Janaka, O king, installed that bow of Shiva.

original: saṃsthāpya sthitavān vīro rāmāgamanakāṅkṣayā /
analyzed: saṃsthāpya sthitavān vīraḥ rāma āgamana kāṅkṣayā
translated: The hero remained there with a desire for Rama's arrival.

original: viśvāmitras tataḥ prāpto mithilādhipater gṛham // / //
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ tatas prāptaḥ mithilā adhipateḥ gṛham
translated: Then Vishvamitra reached the house of the lord of Mithila.

original: janako 'pi ca taṃ dṛṣṭvā viśvāmitraṃ gṛhāgatam /
analyzed: janakaḥ pi ca tam dṛṣṭvā viśvāmitram gṛha āgatam
translated: Janaka also, seeing Vishvamitra come to his house,

original: rāmalakṣmaṇasaṃyuktaṃ śiṣyaiś cābhigataṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: rāma lakṣmaṇa saṃyuktam śiṣyaiḥ ca abhigatam tadā
translated: with Rama and Lakshmana, and with disciples who had come,

original: taṃ pūjayitvā vidhivat prājñaṃ viprānuyāyinam /
analyzed: tam pūjayitvā vidhivat prājñam vipra anuyāyinam
translated: having duly worshipped the wise one followed by the Brahmins,

original: rāmaṃ raghupatiṃ cāpi lāvaṇyādiguṇair yutam // / //
analyzed: rāmam raghu patim ca api lāvaṇya ādi guṇaiḥ yutam
translated: and also Rama, the lord of the Raghus, endowed with beauty and other qualities,

original: śīlācāraguṇopetaṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ ca mahāmatim /
analyzed: śīla ācāra guṇa upetam lakṣmaṇam ca mahāmatim
translated: and the greatly intelligent Lakshmana endowed with good conduct and virtues,

original: pūjayitvā yathānyāyaṃ janakaḥ prītamānasaḥ // / //🔽hemapīṭhe sukhāsīnaṃ śiṣyaiḥ pūrvāparair vṛtam /
analyzed: pūjayitvā yathānyāyam janakaḥ prīta mānasaḥ  hema pīṭhe sukha āsīnam śiṣyaiḥ pūrva aparaiḥ vṛtam
translated: having worshipped them in the proper way, Janaka, with a delighted mind,🔽to Vishvamitra, who was comfortably seated on a golden seat, surrounded by his disciples, past and future,

original: viśvāmitram uvācātha kiṃ kartavyaṃ mayeti saḥ // / //
analyzed: viśvāmitram uvāca atha kim kartavyam mayā iti saḥ
translated: he said, What should be done by me?

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: iti śrutvā vacas tasya muniḥ prāha mahīpatim /
analyzed: iti śrutvā vacaḥ tasya muniḥ prāha mahīpatim
translated: Hearing these words of his, the sage said to the king:

original: eṣa rāmo mahārāja viṣṇuḥ sākṣān mahīpatiḥ // / //
analyzed: eṣa rāmaḥ mahā rāja viṣṇuḥ sākṣāt mahīpatiḥ
translated: This Rama, O great king, is Vishnu himself, the lord of the earth.

original: rakṣārthaṃ viṣṭapānāṃ tu jāto daśarathātmajaḥ /
analyzed: rakṣā artham viṣṭapānām tu jātaḥ daśaratha ātmajaḥ
translated: He has been born as the son of Dasharatha for the protection of the people.

original: asmai sītāṃ prayaccha tvaṃ devakanyām iva sthitām // / //
analyzed: asmai sītām prayaccha tvam deva kanyām iva sthitām
translated: Give Sita to him, who is like a celestial maiden.

original: asyā vivāhe rājendra dhanurbhaṅgam ūdīritam /
analyzed: asyāḥ vivāhe rāja indra dhanuḥ bhaṅgam
translated: O lord of kings, in the marriage of this (Rama), the breaking of the bow is announced.

original: tad ānaya bhavadhanur arcayasva janādhipa // / //
analyzed: tat ānaya bhava dhanuḥ arcayasva janādhipa
translated: Bring that Bhava's bow and worship it, O lord of men.

original: tathety uktvā ca rājā hi bhavacāpaṃ tad adbhutam /
analyzed: tathā iti uktvā ca rājā hi bhava cāpam tat adbhutam
translated: Saying So be it, the king brought that wonderful Bhava's bow,

original: anekabhūbhujāṃ bhaṅgi pūrvavat // / //
analyzed: aneka bhūbhujām bhaṅgi sthāpayāmasa pūrvavat
translated: which had previously been broken by many kings, as before.

original: tato daśarathasuto viśvāmitreṇa coditaḥ /
analyzed: tatas daśaratha sutaḥ viśvāmitreṇa coditaḥ
translated: Then the son of Dasharatha, urged by Vishvamitra,

original: teṣāṃ madhyāt samutthāya rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ // / //
analyzed: teṣām madhyāt samutthāya rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: Rama, the lotus-eyed one, rose from among them,

original: praṇamya viprān devāṃś ca dhanur ādāya tat tadā /🔽sajyaṃ kṛtvā mahābāhur jyāghoṣam akarot tadā // / //
analyzed: praṇamya viprān devān ca dhanuḥ ādāya tat tadā  sajyam kṛtvā mahā bāhuḥ jyā ghoṣam akarot tadā
translated: bowed to the Brahmins and gods, took up the bow,🔽and the mighty-armed one made it stringed and twanged the string.

original: ākṛṣyamāṇaṃ tu balāt tena bhagnaṃ mahad dhanuḥ /
analyzed: ākṛṣyamāṇam tu balāt tena bhagnam mahat dhanuḥ
translated: But that great bow was forcibly drawn and broken by him,

original: sītā ca mālam ādāya śubhāṃ rāmasya mūrdhani // / //
analyzed: sītā ca mālam ādāya śubhām rāmasya mūrdhani
translated: and Sita, taking a beautiful garland, placed it on Rama's head,

original: kṣiptvā sarvakṣatriyasaṃnidhau /
analyzed: kṣiptvā saṃvarayāmasa sarva kṣatriya saṃnidhau
translated: and threw it into the midst of all the Kshatriyas.

original: tatas te kṣatriyāḥ kruddhā rāmam āsādya sarvataḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas te kṣatriyāḥ kruddhāḥ rāmam āsādya sarvatas
translated: Then those angry Kshatriyas, approaching Rama from all sides,

original: mumucuḥ śarajālāni garjayanto mahābalāḥ /
analyzed: mumucuḥ śara jālāni garjayantaḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: discharged nets of arrows, roaring, those mighty ones.

original: tān nirīkṣya tato rāmo dhanur ādāya vegavān // / //🔽jyāghoṣatalaghoṣeṇa tān nṛpān /🔽ciccheda śarajālāni teṣāṃ svāstrai rathāṃs tataḥ // / //
analyzed: tān nirīkṣya tatas rāmaḥ dhanuḥ ādāya vegavān  jyā ghoṣa tala ghoṣeṇa kampayāmasa tān nṛpān  ciccheda śara jālāni teṣām sva astraiḥ rathān tatas
translated: Seeing them, Rama, the powerful one, took up his bow.🔽With the twang of the bowstring and the sound of his palms, he cut off the nets of arrows of those kings.

original: dhanūṃṣi ca patākāś ca rāmaś ciccheda līlayā /
analyzed: dhanūṃṣi ca patākāḥ ca rāmaḥ ciccheda līlayā
translated: Then he cut down their chariots, bows and flags with his own weapons, all this with ease.

original: saṃnahya svabalaṃ sarvaṃ mithilādhipatis tataḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃnahya sva balam sarvam mithilā adhipatiḥ tatas
translated: Then the lord of Mithila, having assembled his entire army,

original: jāmātaraṃ raṇe rakṣan pārṣṇigrāho babhūva ha /
analyzed: jāmātaram raṇe rakṣan pārṣṇigrāhaḥ babhūva ha
translated: became a rearguard, protecting his son-in-law in battle.

original: lakṣmaṇas ca mahāvīro vidrāvya yudhi tān nṛpān // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ ca mahā vīraḥ vidrāvya yudhi tān nṛpān
translated: And Lakshmana, the great hero, having routed those kings in battle,

original: hastyaśvāñ jagṛhe teṣāṃ syandanāni bahūni ca /
analyzed: hasti aśvām jagṛhe teṣām syandanāni bahūni ca
translated: seized their elephants, horses and many chariots.

original: vāhanāni parityajya palāyanaparān nṛpān // / //
analyzed: vāhanāni parityajya palāyana parān nṛpān
translated: The kings, intent on fleeing, abandoned their mounts.

original: tān nihantuṃ ca dhāvat sa pṛṣṭhato lakṣmaṇas tadā /
analyzed: tān nihantum ca dhāvat sa pṛṣṭhatas lakṣmaṇaḥ tadā
translated: Lakshmana then ran after them to kill them.

original: mithilādhipatis taṃ ca kauśikaḥ // / //🔽jitasenaṃ mahāvīraṃ rāmaṃ bhrātrā samanvitam /
analyzed: mithilā adhipatiḥ tam ca vārayāmasa kauśikaḥ  jitasenam mahā vīram rāmam bhrātrā samanvitam
translated: And the lord of Mithila, the descendant of Kushika,🔽the great hero Jitasena, along with his brother,

original: ādāya prativeśātha janakaḥ svagṛhaṃ śubham // / //
analyzed: ādāya prativeśā atha janakaḥ sva gṛham śubham
translated: Janaka took Rama to his auspicious house.

original: dūtaṃ ca tadā daśarathāya saḥ /
analyzed: dūtam ca preṣayāmasa tadā daśarathāya saḥ
translated: And he sent a messenger to Dasharatha then.

original: śrutvā dūtamukhāt sarvaṃ viditārthaḥ saḥ pārthivaḥ // / //
analyzed: śrutvā dūta mukhāt sarvam vidita arthaḥ saḥ pārthivaḥ
translated: Having heard everything from the messenger's mouth, the king, having understood the matter,

original: sabhāryaḥ sasutaḥ śrīmān hastyaśvarathavāhanaḥ /
analyzed: sa bhāryaḥ sa sutaḥ śrīmān hasti aśva ratha vāhanaḥ
translated: The prosperous one, with his wife and son, with elephants, horses, chariots and vehicles,

original: mithilām ājagāmāśu svabalena samanvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: mithilām ājagāma āśu sva balena samanvitaḥ
translated: quickly arrived in Mithila, accompanied by his own army.

original: janako 'py asya satkāraṃ kṛtvā svāṃ ca sutāṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: janakaḥ pi asya satkāram kṛtvā svām ca sutām tatas
translated: Janaka also, having shown him due respect, then

original: vidhivat kṛtaśulkāṃ tāṃ dadau rāmāya pārthiva // / //
analyzed: vidhivat kṛta śulkām tām dadau rāmāya pārthiva
translated: gave his daughter, whose price had been duly paid, to Rama, the king.

original: aparāś ca sutās tisro rūpavatyaḥ svalaṃkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: aparāḥ ca sutāḥ tisraḥ rūpavatyaḥ su alaṃkṛtāḥ
translated: And he had three other beautiful and well-adorned daughters,

original: tribhyas tu lakṣmaṇādibhyaḥ svakanyā vidhivad dadau // / //
analyzed: tribhyaḥ tu lakṣmaṇa ādibhyaḥ sva kanyāḥ vidhivat dadau
translated: whom he duly gave to the three beginning with Lakshmana.

original: evaṃ kṛtavivāho 'sau rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: evam kṛta vivāhaḥ sau rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: Thus the lotus-eyed Rama, having performed the wedding,

original: bhrātṛbhir mātṛbhiḥ sārdhaṃ pitrā balavatā saha // / //
analyzed: bhrātṛbhiḥ mātṛbhiḥ sārdham pitrā balavatā saha
translated: together with his brothers, mothers, and powerful father,

original: dināni katicit tatra sthito vividhabhojanaiḥ /🔽tato 'yodhyāpurīṃ gantum utsukaṃ sasutaṃ nṛpam /
analyzed: dināni katicid tatra sthitaḥ vividha bhojanaiḥ  tatas yodhyā purīm gantum utsukam sa sutam nṛpam
translated: stayed there for a few days, with various kinds of food.🔽Seeing the king, along with his sons, eager to go to the city of Ayodhya,

original: dṛṣṭvā daśarathaṃ rājā sītāyāḥ pradadau vasu // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā daśaratham rājā sītāyāḥ pradadau vasu
translated: King Janaka gave wealth to Sita.

original: ratnāni divyāni bahūni dattvā rāmāya vastrāṇy atiśobhanāni /
analyzed: ratnāni divyāni bahūni dattvā rāmāya vastrāṇi ati śobhanāni
translated: Having given Rama many divine jewels and extremely beautiful garments,

original: hastyaśvadāsān api karmayogyān dāsījanāṃś ca pravarāḥ striyaś ca // / //
analyzed: hasti aśva dāsān api karma yogyān dāsī janān ca pravarāḥ striyaḥ ca
translated: elephants, horses, slaves fit for work, female slaves, and excellent women,

original: sītāṃ suśīlāṃ bahuratnabhūṣitāṃ rathaṃ samāropya sutāṃ surūpām /
analyzed: sītām su śīlām bahu ratna bhūṣitām ratham samāropya sutām surūpām
translated: Placing Sita, of good conduct, adorned with many jewels, and his beautiful daughter on the chariot,

original: vedādighoṣair bahumaṅgalaiś ca saṃpreṣayāṃ āsa sa pārthivo balī // / //
analyzed: veda ādi ghoṣaiḥ bahu maṅgalaiḥ ca saṃpreṣayān āsa sa pārthivaḥ balī
translated: And with the sounds of the Vedas and many auspicious things, that powerful king sent her off.

original: preṣayitvā sutāṃ diyāṃ natvā daśarathaṃ nṛpam /
analyzed: preṣayitvā sutām diyām natvā daśaratham nṛpam
translated: Having sent off his daughter to be given in marriage, having bowed to King Dasharatha,

original: viśvāmitraṃ namaskṛtya janakaḥ saṃnivṛttavān // / //
analyzed: viśvāmitram namaskṛtya janakaḥ saṃnivṛttavān
translated: And having paid homage to Vishvamitra, Janaka returned.

original: tasya patnyo mahābhāgāḥ śikṣayitvā sutāṃ tadā /
analyzed: tasya patnyaḥ mahābhāgāḥ śikṣayitvā sutām tadā
translated: His greatly fortunate wives, having instructed their daughter,

original: bhartṛbhaktiṃ kuru śubhe śvaśrūṇāṃ śvaśurasya ca // / //
analyzed: bhartṛ bhaktim kuru śubhe śvaśrūṇām śvaśurasya ca
translated: Said, O auspicious one, practice devotion to your mothers-in-law and father-in-law.

original: śvaśrūṇām arpayitvā tāṃ nivṛttā viviśuḥ puram /
analyzed: śvaśrūṇām arpayitvā tām nivṛttāḥ viviśuḥ puram
translated: Having entrusted her to the mothers-in-law, they returned and entered the city.

original: tatas tu rāmaṃ gacchantam ayodhyāṃ prabalānvitam // / //
analyzed: tatas tu rāmam gacchantam ayodhyām prabala anvitam
translated: Then Rama, going to Ayodhya with a large following,

original: śrutvā paraśurāmo vai panthānaṃ saṃrurodha ha /
analyzed: śrutvā paraśurāmaḥ vai panthānam saṃrurodha ha
translated: Hearing this, Parasurama blocked the path.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā rājapuruṣāḥ sarve te dīnamānasāḥ // / //
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā rāja puruṣāḥ sarve te dīna mānasāḥ
translated: Seeing him, all those royal messengers were dejected.

original: āsīd daśarathaś cāpi duḥkhaśokapariplutaḥ /
analyzed: āsīt daśarathaḥ ca api duḥkha śoka pariplutaḥ
translated: And Dasharatha was also overwhelmed with grief and sorrow.

original: sabhāryaḥ saparīvāro bhārgavasya bhayān nṛpa // / //
analyzed: sa bhāryaḥ sa parīvāraḥ bhārgavasya bhayāt nṛpa
translated: With his wives and relatives, the king, out of fear of the son of Bhrigu,

original: tato 'bravīj janān sarvān rājānaṃ ca suduḥkhitam /
analyzed: tatas bravīt janān sarvān rājānam ca su duḥkhitam
translated: Then he said to all the people and the greatly sorrowful king:🔽O king, do not be afraid. I will do what is beneficial for you.

original: vasiṣṭhaś corjitatapā brahmacārī mahāmuniḥ // / //
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ ca ūrjita tapāḥ brahmacārī mahā muniḥ
translated: And Vashishtha, the great sage of rigid austerities and celibacy,

original: vasiṣṭha uvāca /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ uvāca
translated: Vashishtha said:

original: yuṣmābhir atra rāmārthaṃ na kāryaṃ duḥkham aṇv api // / //
analyzed: yuṣmābhiḥ atra rāma artham na kāryam duḥkham aṇu api
translated: You should not feel even the slightest sorrow here for Rama's sake.

original: pitrā vā mātṛbhir vāpi anyair bhṛtyajanair api /
analyzed: pitrā vā mātṛbhiḥ vā api anyaiḥ bhṛtya janaiḥ api
translated: By his father, or by his mothers, or by any other servants,

original: ayaṃ hi nṛpate rāma sākṣād viṣṇus tu te gṛhe // / //
analyzed: ayam hi nṛpate rāma sākṣāt viṣṇuḥ tu te gṛhe
translated: O king, this Rama is indeed Vishnu himself in your house.

original: jagataḥ pālanārthāya janmaprāpto na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: jagataḥ pālana arthāya janma prāptaḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that he has taken birth for the protection of the world.

original: yasya saṃkīrtyaṃ nāmāpi bhavabhītiḥ praṇaśyati // / //
analyzed: yasya saṃkīrtyam nāma api bhava bhītiḥ praṇaśyati
translated: Even the fear of existence perishes by glorifying his name.

original: brahma mūrtaṃ svayaṃ yatra bhayādes tatra kā kathā /
analyzed: brahma mūrtam svayam yatra bhaya ādeḥ tatra kā kathā
translated: Where Vishnu himself, the embodiment of Brahman, is present, what to speak of other fears?

original: yatra saṃkīrtyate rāma kathāmātram api prabho // / //
analyzed: yatra saṃkīrtyate rāma kathā mātram api prabho
translated: O Rama, where even a mere story of you is glorified, O Lord,

original: nopasargabhayaṃ tatra nākālamaraṇaṃ nṛṇām /
analyzed: na upasarga bhayam tatra na akāla maraṇam nṛṇām
translated: there is no fear of calamities, nor untimely death for men.

original: ityukte bhārgavo rāmo rāmam āhāgrataḥ sthitam // / //
analyzed: iti ukte bhārgavaḥ rāmaḥ rāmam āha agratas sthitam
translated: Having said this, Rama Bhargava said to Rama standing in front of him:

original: tyaja tvaṃ rāmasaṃjñāṃ tu mayā vā saṃgaraṃ kuru /
analyzed: tyaja tvam rāma saṃjñām tu mayā vā saṃgaram kuru
translated: You should abandon the name Rama and fight with me.

original: ityukte rāghavaḥ prāha bhārgavaṃ taṃ pathi sthitam // / //
analyzed: iti ukte rāghavaḥ prāha bhārgavam tam pathi sthitam
translated: Having been told this, Raghava said to Bhargava standing on the path:

original: rāmasaṃjñāṃ kutas tyakṣye tvayā yotsye sthiro bhava /
analyzed: rāma saṃjñām kutas tyakṣye tvayā yotsye sthiraḥ bhava
translated: How can I abandon the name Rama? I will fight with you. Be steady.

original: ity uktvā taṃ pṛthak sthitvā rāmo rājīvalocanaḥ // / //🔽jyāghoṣam akarod vīro vīrasyaivāgratas tadā /
analyzed: iti uktvā tam pṛthak sthitvā rāmaḥ rājīva locanaḥ  jyā ghoṣam akarot vīraḥ vīrasya eva agratas tadā
translated: Having said this, the lotus-eyed Rama stood apart,🔽and the hero made the twang of his bowstring in front of the hero himself.

original: tataḥ paraśurāmasya dehān niṣkramya vaiṣṇavam // / //
analyzed: tatas paraśurāmasya dehāt niṣkramya vaiṣṇavam
translated: Then, from the body of Parashurama, the Vishnu-like form

original: paśyatāṃ sarvabhūtānāṃ tejo rāmamukhe 'viśat /
analyzed: paśyatām sarva bhūtānām tejaḥ rāma mukhe viśat
translated: entered Rama's mouth, while all the beings were watching.

original: dṛṣṭvā taṃ bhārgavo rāmaḥ prasannavadano 'bravīt // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tam bhārgavaḥ rāmaḥ prasanna vadanaḥ bravīt
translated: Seeing that, the Bhargava Rama spoke with a cheerful face,

original: rāma rāma mahābāho rāmas tvaṃ nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: rāma rāma mahā bāho rāmaḥ tvam na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Rama, Rama, O mighty-armed one, you are Rama, there is no doubt about it.

original: viṣṇur eva bhavāñ jāto jñāto 'sy adya mayā vibho // / //
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ eva jātaḥ jñātaḥ si adya mayā vibho
translated: You are indeed Vishnu, O Lord, I have come to know you today.

original: gaccha vīra yathākāmaṃ devakāryaṃ ca vai kuru /
analyzed: gaccha vīra yathākāmam deva kāryam ca vai kuru
translated: Go, O hero, as you wish, and perform the work of the gods.

original: duṣṭānāṃ nidhanaṃ kṛtvā śiṣṭāṃś ca paripālaya // / //
analyzed: duṣṭānām nidhanam kṛtvā śiṣṭān ca paripālaya
translated: Having destroyed the wicked and protected the righteous,

original: yāhi tvaṃ svecchayā rāma ahaṃ gacche tapovanam /
analyzed: yāhi tvam sva icchayā rāma aham gacche tapaḥ vanam
translated: go as you please, O Rama, I shall go to the penance grove.

original: ity uktvā pūjitas tais tu munibhāvena bhārgavaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā pūjitaḥ taiḥ tu muni bhāvena bhārgavaḥ
translated: Having said this, the Bhargava sage, worshipped by them with the honor due to a sage,

original: mahendrādriṃ jagāmātha tapase dhṛtamānasaḥ /
analyzed: mahendra adrim jagāma atha tapase dhṛta mānasaḥ
translated: went to the Mahendra mountain, with his mind set on austerities.

original: tatas tu jātaharṣās te janā daśarathaś ca ha // / //
analyzed: tatas tu jāta harṣāḥ te janāḥ daśarathaḥ ca ha
translated: Then, those people and Dasharatha were filled with joy,

original: purīm ayodhyāṃ saṃprāpya rāmeṇa saha pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: purīm ayodhyām saṃprāpya rāmeṇa saha pārthivaḥ
translated: and the king, having reached the city of Ayodhya with Rama,

original: divyaśobhāṃ purīṃ kṛtvā sarvato bhadraśālinīm // / //
analyzed: divya śobhām purīm kṛtvā sarvatas bhadra śālinīm
translated: Having made the city divine and auspicious in every way,

original: pratyutthāya tataḥ paurāḥ śaṅkhatūryādibhiḥ svanaiḥ /
analyzed: pratyutthāya tatas paurāḥ śaṅkha tūrya ādibhiḥ svanaiḥ
translated: then the citizens, rising up, with the sounds of conches, trumpets and others,

original: viśantaṃ rāmam āgatya kṛtadāraṃ raṇe 'jitam // / //
analyzed: viśantam rāmam āgatya kṛta dāram raṇe jitam
translated: approaching the unconquered Rama who has entered with his wife after the battle,

original: taṃ vīkṣya harṣitāḥ santo viviśus tena vai purīm /
analyzed: tam vīkṣya harṣitāḥ santaḥ viviśuḥ tena vai purīm
translated: seeing him, being delighted, they entered the city with him.

original: tau dṛṣṭvā sa muniḥ prāptau rāmaṃ lakṣmaṇam antike // / //
analyzed: tau dṛṣṭvā sa muniḥ prāptau rāmam lakṣmaṇam antike
translated: Seeing those two, Rama and Lakshmana, near him, the sage

original: daśarathāya tatpitre mātṛbhyaś ca viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: daśarathāya tad pitre mātṛbhyaḥ ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: handed them over to his father Dasharatha and especially to his mothers,

original: tau samarpya muniśreṣṭhas tena rājñā ca pūjitaḥ /
analyzed: tau samarpya muni śreṣṭhaḥ tena rājñā ca pūjitaḥ
translated: and the best of sages, having been honored by the king,

original: viśvāmitraś ca sahasā pratigantuṃ mano dadhe // / //
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ ca sahasā pratigantum manaḥ dadhe
translated: Vishvamitra suddenly made up his mind to return.

original: samarpya rāmaṃ sa muniḥ sahānujaṃ sabhāryam agre pitur ekavallabham /
analyzed: samarpya rāmam sa muniḥ sahānujam sa bhāryam agre pituḥ eka vallabham
translated: Having handed over Rama, with his younger brother and wife, to his father, the beloved of his only wife,

original: punaḥ punaḥ śrāvya hasan mahāmatir jagāma siddhāśramam evam ātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: punar punar śrāvya hasan mahāmatiḥ jagāma siddhāśramam evam ātmanaḥ
translated: the greatly wise sage, smiling again and again, went to his own hermitage of the Siddhas.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe rāmaprādurbhāve saptacatvāriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe rāmaprādurbhāve saptacatvāriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-seventh chapter in the Rakshasa-Vadha Parva of the Adi Parva in the holy Mahabharata.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: kṛtadāro mahātejā rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: kṛta dāraḥ mahā tejāḥ rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: The greatly powerful lotus-eyed Rama, having taken a wife,

original: pitre sumahatīṃ prītiṃ janānām upapādayan // / //
analyzed: pitre su mahatīm prītim janānām upapādayan
translated: And brought great joy to the people to their father.

original: ayodhyāyāṃ sthito rāmaḥ sarvabhogasamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: ayodhyāyām sthitaḥ rāmaḥ sarva bhoga samanvitaḥ
translated: Rama, endowed with all enjoyments, stayed in Ayodhya,

original: prītyā nandaty ayodhyāyāṃ rāme raghupatau nṛpa // / //
analyzed: prītyā nandati ayodhyāyām rāme raghupatau nṛpa
translated: And out of affection, Rama, the lord of the Raghus, rejoiced in Ayodhya, O king.

original: bhrātā śatrughnasahito bharato mātulaṃ yayau /
analyzed: bhrātā śatrughna sahitaḥ bharataḥ mātulam yayau
translated: His brother Bharata, accompanied by Shatrughna, went to his maternal uncle.

original: tato daśaratho rājā prasamīkṣya suśobhanam // / //
analyzed: tatas daśarathaḥ rājā prasamīkṣya su śobhanam
translated: Then King Dasharatha, seeing his son to be very handsome,

original: yuvānaṃ balinaṃ yogyaṃ bhūpasiddhyai sutaṃ kavim /
analyzed: yuvānam balinam yogyam bhūpa siddhyai sutam kavim
translated: A young man, strong and fit for the accomplishment of kingship, a wise one,

original: abhiṣicya rājyabhāraṃ rāme saṃsthāpya vaiṣṇavam // / //
analyzed: abhiṣicya rājya bhāram rāme saṃsthāpya vaiṣṇavam
translated: Having consecrated Rama and established the burden of the kingdom in him, the descendant of the Yadu lineage,

original: padaṃ prāptuṃ mahad yatnaṃ kariṣyāmīty acintayat /
analyzed: padam prāptum mahat yatnam kariṣyāmi iti acintayat
translated: He thought, I will make great efforts to attain the great state.

original: saṃcintya tatparo rājā sarvadikṣu samādiśat // / //
analyzed: saṃcintya tad paraḥ rājā sarva dikṣu samādiśat
translated: Having thought about it, the king, intent on that, ordered in all directions,

original: prājñān bhṛtyān mahīpālān mantrigaṇaś ca tvarānvitaḥ /
analyzed: prājñān bhṛtyān mahīpālān mantri gaṇaḥ ca tvarā anvitaḥ
translated: Wise servants, rulers of the earth, and the group of ministers, quickly.

original: rāmābhiṣekadravyāṇi ṛṣiproktāni yāni vai // / //
analyzed: rāma abhiṣeka dravyāṇi ṛṣi proktāni yāni vai
translated: The articles for Rama's consecration, as stated by the sages,

original: tāni bhṛtyāḥ samāhṛtya śīghram āgantum arhatha /
analyzed: tāni bhṛtyāḥ samāhṛtya śīghram āgantum arhatha
translated: You servants should collect them and return quickly.

original: dūtāmātyāḥ samādeśāt sarvadikṣu narādhipān // / //
analyzed: dūta amātyāḥ samādeśāt sarva dikṣu narādhipān
translated: The messengers and ministers, by order, to the kings in all directions,

original: āhūya tān samāhṛtya śīghram āgantum arhatha /
analyzed: āhūya tān samāhṛtya śīghram āgantum arhatha
translated: Having invited them and collected them, should return quickly.

original: ayodhyāpuram atyarthaṃ sarvaśobhāsamanvitam // / //🔽janāḥ kuruta sarvatra nṛtyagītādinanditam /
analyzed: ayodhyā puram atyartham sarva śobhā samanvitam  janāḥ kuruta sarvatra nṛtya gīta ādi nanditam
translated: Ayodhya city is extremely endowed with all kinds of beauty.🔽People, everywhere, celebrate with dance, singing and other festivities.

original: puravāsijanānandaṃ deśavāsimanaḥpriyam // / //
analyzed: pura vāsi jana ānandam deśa vāsi manaḥ priyam
translated: The delight of the citizens, pleasing to the minds of the people of the country,

original: rāmābhiṣekaṃ vipulaṃ śvo bhaviṣyati jānatha /
analyzed: rāma abhiṣekam vipulam śvas bhaviṣyati jānatha
translated: Know that Rama's great consecration will take place tomorrow.

original: śrutvetthaṃ mantriṇaḥ prāhus taṃ nṛpaṃ praṇipatya ca // / //
analyzed: śrutvā ittham mantriṇaḥ prāhuḥ tam nṛpam praṇipatya ca
translated: Having heard this, the ministers bowed down to the king and said,

original: śobhanaṃ te mataṃ rājan yad idaṃ paribhāṣitam /
analyzed: śobhanam te matam rājan yat idam paribhāṣitam
translated: O king, this idea expressed by you is excellent.

original: rāmābhiṣekam asmākaṃ sarveṣāṃ ca priyaṃkaram // / //
analyzed: rāma abhiṣekam asmākam sarveṣām ca priyaṃkaram
translated: Rama's consecration will bring joy to all of us.

original: ityukto daśarathas tais tān sarvān punar abravīt /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ daśarathaḥ taiḥ tān sarvān punar abravīt
translated: Thus addressed by them, Dasharatha again spoke to them all,

original: ānīyantāṃ drutaṃ sarve saṃbhārā mama śāsanāt // / //
analyzed: ānīyantām drutam sarve saṃbhārāḥ mama śāsanāt
translated: Let all the necessary articles be brought quickly, by my order.

original: sarvataḥ sārabhūtā ca purī ceyaṃ samantataḥ /
analyzed: sarvatas sāra bhūtā ca purī ca iyam samantataḥ
translated: This city, which is the essence of everything, should be adorned all around.

original: adya śobhānvitā kāryā kartavyaṃ yāgamaṇḍalam // / //
analyzed: adya śobhā anvitā kāryā kartavyam yāga maṇḍalam
translated: Today, the sacrificial altar should be made beautiful.

original: ity evamuktā rājñā te mantriṇaḥ śīghrakāriṇaḥ /
analyzed: iti evam uktāḥ rājñā te mantriṇaḥ śīghrakāriṇaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by the king, the ministers, who acted quickly,

original: tathaiva cakrus te sarve punaḥ punar udīritāḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā eva cakruḥ te sarve punar punar udīritāḥ
translated: Did exactly as they were told, again and again.

original: prāptaharṣaḥ sa rājā ca śubhaṃ dinam udīkṣayan /
analyzed: prāpta harṣaḥ sa rājā ca śubham dinam udīkṣayan
translated: The king, filled with joy, looked forward to the auspicious day,

original: kauśalyā lakṣmaṇaś caiva sumitrā nāgaro janaḥ // / //
analyzed: kauśalyāḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ ca eva sumitrāḥ nāgaraḥ janaḥ
translated: Kausalyā, Lakṣmaṇa, Sumitrā, and the citizens,

original: rāmābhiṣekam ākarṇya mudaṃ prāpyātiharṣitaḥ /🔽śvaśruśvaśurayoḥ samyak śuśrūṣaṇaparā tu sā // / //
analyzed: rāma abhiṣekam ākarṇya mudam prāpya ati harṣitaḥ  śvaśru śvaśurayoḥ samyak śuśrūṣaṇa parā tu sā
translated: having heard about Rāma's consecration, were filled with great joy and delight.🔽She was devoted to properly serving her mother-in-law and father-in-law.

original: mudānvitā sitā sītā bhartur ākarṇya śobhanam /
analyzed: mudā anvitā sitā sītā bhartuḥ ākarṇya śobhanam
translated: Sītā, filled with joy, having heard the auspicious news about her husband,

original: śvobhāviny abhiṣeke tu rāmasya viditātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: śvas bhāvini abhiṣeke tu rāmasya vidita ātmanaḥ
translated: when the consecration of Rāma, who knew his self, was to take place the next day,

original: dāsī tu mantharānāmnī kaikeyyāḥ kubjarūpiṇī /
analyzed: dāsī tu mantharā nāmnī kaikeyyāḥ kubja rūpiṇī
translated: a maid named Mantharā, who was hunchbacked, of Kaikeyī,

original: svāṃ svāminīṃ tu kaikeyīm idaṃ vacanam abravīt // / //
analyzed: svām svāminīm tu kaikeyīm idam vacanam abravīt
translated: spoke these words to her own mistress Kaikeyī:

original: śṛṇu rājñi mabhābhāge vacanaṃ mama śobhanam /
analyzed: śṛṇu rājñi mabhābhāge vacanam mama śobhanam
translated: Listen, O queen, O you who are endowed with great fortune, to my auspicious words.

original: tvatpatis tu mahārājas tava nāśāya codyataḥ // / //
analyzed: tvad patiḥ tu mahā rājaḥ tava nāśāya ca udyataḥ
translated: Your husband, the great king, is ready to destroy you.

original: rāmo 'sau kauśalīputraḥ śvo bhaviṣyati bhūpatiḥ /
analyzed: kauśalīputraḥ śvas bhaviṣyati bhūpatiḥ
translated: That Rāma, the son of Kausalyā, will become the king tomorrow.

original: vasuvāhanakośādi rājyaṃ ca sakalaṃ śubhe // / //
analyzed: vasu vāhana kośa ādi rājyam ca sakalam śubhe
translated: The entire kingdom, with its wealth, vehicles, treasury, and all, O auspicious one,

original: bhaviṣyaty adya rāmasya bharatasya na kiṃcana /
analyzed: bhaviṣyati adya rāmasya bharatasya na kiṃcana
translated: will belong to Rāma today, and nothing will be left for Bharata.

original: bharato 'pi gato dūraṃ mātulasya gṛhaṃ prati // / //
analyzed: bharataḥ pi gataḥ dūram mātulasya gṛham prati
translated: Bharata has also gone far away to his maternal uncle's house.

original: hā kaṣṭaṃ mandabhāgyāsi sāpatnyād duḥkhitā bhṛśam /
analyzed: hā kaṣṭam mandabhāgyā asi sāpatnyāt duḥkhitā bhṛśam
translated: Alas, you are unfortunate, greatly afflicted by your co-wife.

original: saivam ākarṇya kaikeyī kubjām idam athābravīt // / //
analyzed: sā evam ākarṇya kaikeyī kubjām idam atha abravīt
translated: Having heard this, Kaikeyi then said this to the hunchback:

original: paśya me dakṣatāṃ kubje adyaiva tvaṃ vicakṣaṇe /
analyzed: paśya me dakṣa tām kubje adyā eva tvam vicakṣaṇe
translated: Look at my skill, O hunchback, O you of cleverness, even today.

original: yathā tu sakalaṃ rājyaṃ bharatasya bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: yathā tu sakalam rājyam bharatasya bhaviṣyati
translated: As to how the entire kingdom will be for Bharata,

original: rāmasya vanavāsaś ca tathā yatnaṃ karomy aham /
analyzed: rāmasya vana vāsaḥ ca tathā yatnam karomi aham
translated: and how Rama will go to the forest, I am making an effort.

original: ity uktvā mantharāṃ sā tu unmucya svāṅgabhūṣaṇam // / //🔽vastraṃ puṣpāṇi conmucya sthūlavāsodharābhavat /
analyzed: iti uktvā mantharām sā tu unmucya sva aṅga bhūṣaṇam  vastram puṣpāṇi ca unmucya sthūla vāsaḥ dharā bhavat
translated: Having said this to Manthara, she removed the ornaments from her own body,🔽and having removed her clothes and flowers, she became clad in coarse garments.

original: nirmālyapuṣpadhṛk kaṣṭā kaśmalāṅgī virūpiṇī // / //
translated: Bearing faded flowers, wretched, with a discolored body, deformed,

original: bhasmadhūlyādinirdigdhā bhasmadhūlyā tathā śrite /🔽bhūbhāge śāntadīpe sā saṃdhyākāle suduḥkhitā // / //
analyzed: bhasma dhūlya ādi nirdigdhāḥ bhasma dhūlyā tathā śrite  bhū bhāge śānta dīpe sā saṃdhyā kāle su duḥkhitā
translated: smeared with ash and dust, and covered with ash and dust,🔽on the ground, with the lamps extinguished, she, extremely miserable,

original: lalāṭe śvetacailaṃ tu baddhvā suṣvāpa bhāminī /
analyzed: lalāṭe śveta cailam tu baddhvā suṣvāpa bhāminī
translated: at twilight, bound a white cloth on her forehead, and the beautiful one went to sleep.

original: mantribhiḥ saha kāryāṇi saṃmantrya sakalāni tu // / //
analyzed: mantribhiḥ saha kāryāṇi saṃmantrya sakalāni tu
translated: Having consulted with the ministers on all matters to be done,

original: puṇyāhaḥsvastimāṅgalyaiḥ sthāpya rāmaṃ tu maṇḍale /🔽ṛṣibhis tu vasiṣṭhādyaiḥ sārdhaṃ saṃbhāramaṇḍape // / //
analyzed: puṇya ahar svasti māṅgalyaiḥ sthāpya rāmam tu maṇḍale  ṛṣibhiḥ tu vasiṣṭha ādyaiḥ sārdham saṃbhāra maṇḍape
translated: having placed Rama in a circle with the auspicious benedictions of the sacred thread,🔽together with the sages Vashishtha and others, in the preparation hall,

original: vṛddhijāgaraṇīyaiś ca sarvatas tūryanādite /
analyzed: vṛddhi jāgaraṇīyaiḥ ca sarvatas tūrya nādite
translated: with the elders, the night vigil, and the sound of musical instruments all around,

original: gītanṛtyasamakīrṇe śaṅkhakāhalaniḥsvanaiḥ // / //
analyzed: gīta nṛtya sama kīrṇe śaṅkha kāhala niḥsvanaiḥ
translated: Filled with singing and dancing, and the sounds of conches and drums.

original: svayaṃ daśarathas tatra sthitvā pratyāgataḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: svayam daśarathaḥ tatra sthitvā pratyāgataḥ punar
translated: King Dasharatha himself stayed there for a while and then returned.

original: kaikeyyā veśmano dvāraṃ jaradbhiḥ parirakṣitam // / //
analyzed: kaikeyyāḥ veśmanaḥ dvāram jaradbhiḥ parirakṣitam
