translated: The door of Kaikeyi's abode was guarded by old men.

original: rāmābhiṣekaṃ kaikeyīṃ vaktukāmaḥ sa pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: rāma abhiṣekam kaikeyīm vaktu kāmaḥ sa pārthivaḥ
translated: The king, desirous of speaking to Kaikeyi about Rama's consecration,

original: kaikeyībhavanaṃ vīkṣya sāndhakāram athābravīt // / //
analyzed: kaikeyī bhavanam vīkṣya sa andhakāram atha abravīt
translated: seeing Kaikeyi's abode in darkness, said:

original: andhakāram idaṃ kasmād adya te mandire priye /
analyzed: andhakāram idam kasmāt adya te mandire priye
translated: O beloved, why is this darkness in your abode today?

original: rāmābhiṣekaṃ harṣāya antyajā api menire // / //
analyzed: rāma abhiṣekam harṣāya antyajāḥ api menire
translated: Even the low-born rejoiced in Rama's consecration.

original: gṛhālaṃkaraṇaṃ kurvanty adya lokā manoharam /
analyzed: gṛha alaṃkaraṇam kurvanti adya lokāḥ manoharam
translated: Today people are adorning their houses with charming decorations.

original: tvayādya na kṛtaṃ kasmād ity uktvā ca mahīpatiḥ // / //
analyzed: tvayā adya na kṛtam kasmāt iti uktvā ca mahīpatiḥ
translated: Why have you not done so today? saying this, the king,

original: jvālayitvā gṛhe dīpān praviveśa gṛhaṃ nṛpaḥ /
analyzed: jvālayitvā gṛhe dīpān praviveśa gṛham nṛpaḥ
translated: having lit lamps in the house, entered the house.

original: aśobhanāṅgīṃ kaikeyīṃ svapatnīṃ patitāṃ bhuvi // / //🔽dṛṣṭvā daśarathaḥ prāha tasyāḥ priyam idaṃ tv iti /
analyzed: aśobhana aṅgīm kaikeyīm sva patnīm patitām bhuvi  dṛṣṭvā daśarathaḥ prāha tasyāḥ priyam idam tu iti
translated: Seeing his wife Kaikeyi, with an inauspicious form, fallen on the ground,🔽Dasharatha said to her this pleasing word:

original: āśliṣyotthāya tāṃ rājā śṛṇu me paramaṃ vacaḥ // / //
analyzed: āśliṣya utthāya tām rājā śṛṇu me paramam vacaḥ
translated: Having embraced her and raised her up, the king said, Listen to my supreme words.

original: svamātur adhikāṃ nityaṃ yas te bhaktiṃ karoti vai /
analyzed: sva mātuḥ adhikām nityam yaḥ te bhaktim karoti vai
translated: He who always shows you devotion greater than to his own mother,

original: tasyābhiṣekaṃ rāmasya śvo bhaviṣyati śobhane // / //
analyzed: tasya abhiṣekam rāmasya śvas bhaviṣyati śobhane
translated: Tomorrow, O auspicious one, the consecration of Rama will take place.

original: ityuktā pārthivenāpi kiṃcin novāca sā śubhā /
analyzed: iti uktā pārthivena api kiṃcid nā uvāca sā śubhā
translated: Thus addressed by the king, the auspicious one did not say anything.

original: muñcantī dīrgham uṣṇaṃ ca roṣocchvāsaṃ muhur muhuḥ // / //
analyzed: muñcantī dīrgham uṣṇam ca roṣa ucchvāsam muhur muhur
translated: Emitting long and hot sighs of anger again and again,

original: tasthāv āśliṣya hastābhyāṃ pārthivaḥ prāha roṣitām /
analyzed: tasthau āśliṣya hastābhyām pārthivaḥ prāha roṣitām
translated: the king embraced her with his arms and said to the angry one:

original: kiṃ te kaikeyi duḥkhasya kāraṇaṃ vada śobhane // / //
analyzed: kim te kaikeyi duḥkhasya kāraṇam vada śobhane
translated: What is the cause of your sorrow, O Kaikeyi? Tell me, O auspicious one.

original: vastrābharaṇaratnādi yad yad icchasi śobhane /
analyzed: vastra ābharaṇa ratna ādi yat yat icchasi śobhane
translated: Whatever garments, ornaments, jewels, etc. you desire, O auspicious one,

original: tat tvaṃ gṛhṇīṣva niḥśaṅkaṃ bhāṇḍārāt sukhinī bhava // / //
analyzed: tat tvam gṛhṇīṣva niḥśaṅkam bhāṇḍārāt sukhinī bhava
translated: take them without hesitation from the treasury and be happy.

original: bhāṇḍāreṇa mama śubhe śvo 'rthasiddhir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: bhāṇḍāreṇa mama śubhe śvas rtha siddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: O auspicious one, tomorrow I will have success in my purpose,

original: yadābhiṣekaṃ saṃprāpte rāme rājīvalocane // / //
analyzed: yadā abhiṣekam saṃprāpte rāme rājīva locane
translated: when the consecration of Rama, the lotus-eyed one, is at hand.

original: bhāṇḍāgārasya me dvāraṃ mayā muktaṃ nirargalam /
analyzed: bhāṇḍāgārasya me dvāram mayā muktam nirargalam
translated: The door of my treasury will be opened by me without obstruction.

original: bhaviṣyati punaḥ pūrṇaṃ rāme rājyaṃ praśāsati // / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyati punar pūrṇam rāme rājyam praśāsati
translated: It will be full again when Rama rules the kingdom.

original: bahu mānaya rāmasya abhiṣekaṃ mahātmanaḥ /🔽ityuktā rājavaryeṇa kaikeyī pāpalakṣaṇā // / //
analyzed: bahu mānaya rāmasya abhiṣekam mahātmanaḥ  iti uktā rāja varyeṇa kaikeyī pāpa lakṣaṇā
translated: Honor the consecration of the great Rama greatly.🔽Thus addressed by the best of kings, Kaikeyi, of sinful characteristics,

original: kumatir nirghṛṇā duṣṭā kubjayā śikṣitābravīt /
analyzed: kumatiḥ nirghṛṇā duṣṭā kubjayā śikṣitā bravīt
translated: the evil-minded, merciless, wicked one, instructed by the hunchback, said:

original: rājānaṃ svapatiṃ vākyaṃ krūram atyantaniṣṭhuram // / //
analyzed: rājānam sva patim vākyam krūram atyanta niṣṭhuram
translated: To her husband, the king, harsh words, extremely cruel.

original: ratnādi sakalaṃ yat te tan mamaiva na saṃśayaḥ /🔽devāsuramahāyuddhe prītyā yan me varadvayam // / //
analyzed: ratna ādi sakalam yat te tat mama eva na saṃśayaḥ  deva asura mahā yuddhe prītyā yat me vara dvayam
translated: All the jewels and everything else that you have, without a doubt, belongs to me.🔽In the great battle between the gods and demons, out of affection, you gave me two boons.

original: purā dattaṃ tvayā rājaṃs tad idānīṃ prayaccha me /
analyzed: purā dattam tvayā rājan tat idānīm prayaccha me
translated: O king, now give me that.

original: ityuktaḥ pārthivaḥ prāha kaikeyīm aśubhāṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ pārthivaḥ prāha kaikeyīm aśubhām tadā
translated: Thus addressed, the king then spoke to the inauspicious Kaikeyi:

original: adattam apy ahaṃ dāsye tava nānyasya vā śubhe /
analyzed: adattam api aham dāsye tava na anyasya vā śubhe
translated: I will give you, O auspicious one, what has not been given to anyone else.

original: kiṃ me pratiśrutaṃ pūrvaṃ dattam eva mayā tava // / //
analyzed: kim me pratiśrutam pūrvam dattam eva mayā tava
translated: What was promised by me before? It has already been given to you.

original: śubhāṅgī bhava kalyāṇi tyaja kopam anarthakam /
analyzed: śubha aṅgī bhava kalyāṇi tyaja kopam anarthakam
translated: Be auspicious, O fortunate one, abandon this fruitless anger.

original: rāmābhiṣekajaṃ harṣaṃ bhajottiṣṭha sukhī bhava // / //🔽ityuktā rājavaryeṇa kaikeyī kalahapriyā /
analyzed: rāma abhiṣeka jam harṣam bhaja uttiṣṭha sukhī bhava  iti uktā rāja varyeṇa kaikeyī kalaha priyā
translated: Rejoice in Rama's consecration, rise up and be happy.🔽Thus addressed by the excellent king, Kaikeyi, who loved quarrels,

original: uvāca paruṣaṃ vākyaṃ rājño maraṇakāraṇam // / //
analyzed: uvāca paruṣam vākyam rājñaḥ maraṇa kāraṇam
translated: Spoke harsh words, the cause of the king's death:

original: varadvayaṃ pūrvadattaṃ yadi dāsyasi me vibho /
analyzed: vara dvayam pūrva dattam yadi dāsyasi me vibho
translated: If you will give me the two boons that were given to me before, O lord,

original: śvobhūte gacchatu vanaṃ rāmo 'yaṃ kośalātmajaḥ // / //
analyzed: śvobhūte gacchatu vanam rāmaḥ yam kośala ātmajaḥ
translated: Tomorrow, let this Rama, the son of Kosala, go to the forest.

original: dvādaśābdaṃ nivasatu tvadvākyād daṇḍake vane /
analyzed: dvādaśa abdam nivasatu tvad vākyāt daṇḍake vane
translated: By your word, let him dwell in the Dandaka forest for twelve years.

original: abhiṣekaṃ ca rājyaṃ ca bharatasya bhaviṣyati // / //
analyzed: abhiṣekam ca rājyam ca bharatasya bhaviṣyati
translated: And the consecration and kingdom will be for Bharata.

original: ity ākarṇya sa kaikeyyā vacanaṃ ghoram apriyam /🔽papāta bhuvi niḥsaṃjño rājā sāpi vibhūṣitā // / //
analyzed: iti ākarṇya sa kaikeyyāḥ vacanam ghoram apriyam  papāta bhuvi niḥsaṃjñaḥ rājā sā api vibhūṣitā
translated: Having heard these terrible and unpleasant words of Kaikeyi,🔽The king fell unconscious on the ground, and she, adorned,

original: rātriśeṣaṃ nayitvā tu prabhāte sā mudāvatī /
analyzed: rātri śeṣam nayitvā tu prabhāte sā mudāvatī
translated: Having passed the rest of the night, in the morning, full of joy,

original: dūtaṃ sumantram āhaivaṃ rāma ānīyatām iti // / //
analyzed: dūtam sumantram āha evam rāmaḥ ānīyatām iti
translated: She said to the messenger Sumantra, Bring Rama here.

original: rāmas tu kṛtapuṇyāhaḥ kṛtasvastyayano dvijaiḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ tu kṛta puṇya ahaḥ kṛta svastyayanaḥ dvijaiḥ
translated: Rama, having had the auspicious rites performed by the Brahmins, and having had the benedictions pronounced,

original: yāgamaṇḍapamadhyasthaḥ śaṅkhatūryaravānvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: yāga maṇḍapa madhya sthaḥ śaṅkha tūrya rava anvitaḥ
translated: In the middle of the sacrificial pavilion, accompanied by the sounds of conches and drums,

original: tam āsādya tato dūtaḥ praṇipatya puraḥsthitaḥ /
analyzed: tam āsādya tatas dūtaḥ praṇipatya puras sthitaḥ
translated: Approaching him, the messenger bowed down and stood before him.

original: rāma rāma mahābāho ājñāpayati te pitā // / //
analyzed: rāma rāma mahā bāho ājñāpayati te pitā
translated: Rama, O Rama of mighty arms, your father commands you.

original: drutam uttiṣṭha gaccha tvaṃ yatra tiṣṭhati te pitā /
analyzed: drutam uttiṣṭha gaccha tvam yatra tiṣṭhati te pitā
translated: Rise quickly and go where your father is.

original: ityuktas tena dūtena śīghram utthāya rāghavaḥ // / //🔽anujñāpya dvijān prāptaḥ kaikeyyā bhavanaṃ prati /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ tena dūtena śīghram utthāya rāghavaḥ  anujñāpya dvijān prāptaḥ kaikeyyāḥ bhavanam prati
translated: Thus addressed by the messenger, the swift-rising Raghava,🔽Having taken leave of the Brahmins, reached Kaikeyi's abode.

original: praviśantaṃ gṛhaṃ rāmaṃ kaikeyī prāha nirghṛṇā // / //
analyzed: praviśantam gṛham rāmam kaikeyī prāha nirghṛṇā
translated: As Rama was entering the house, the merciless Kaikeyi said,

original: pitus tava mataṃ vatsa idaṃ te prabravīmy aham /
analyzed: pituḥ tava matam vatsa idam te prabravīmi aham
translated: O child, this is the opinion of your father, I am telling you.

original: vane vasa mahābāho gatvā tvaṃ dvādaśābdakam // / //
analyzed: vane vasa mahā bāho gatvā tvam dvādaśa abdakam
translated: O mighty-armed one, go to the forest and live there for twelve years.

original: adyaiva gamyatāṃ vīra tapase dhṛtamānasaḥ /
analyzed: adyā eva gamyatām vīra tapase dhṛta mānasaḥ
translated: O hero, go this very day for austerities, with a resolute mind.

original: na cintyam anyathā vatsa ādarāt kuru me vacaḥ // / //
analyzed: na cintyam anyathā vatsa ādarāt kuru me vacaḥ
translated: O child, do not think otherwise, but out of respect, do my bidding.

original: etac chrutvā pitur vākyaṃ rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: etat śrutvā pituḥ vākyam rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: Having heard these words of his father, Rama, having eyes like lotus petals,

original: tathety ājñāṃ gṛhītvāsau namaskṛtya ca tāv ubhau // / //
analyzed: tathā iti ājñām gṛhītvā asau namaskṛtya ca tau ubhau
translated: accepted the command, and having bowed to both of them,

original: niṣkramya tadgṛhād rāmo dhanur ādāya veśmataḥ /
analyzed: niṣkramya tad gṛhāt rāmaḥ dhanuḥ ādāya veśmataḥ
translated: Rama, having taken his bow from the house,

original: kauśalyāṃ ca namaskṛtya sumitrāṃ gantum udyataḥ // / //
analyzed: kauśalyām ca namaskṛtya sumitrām gantum udyataḥ
translated: having paid homage to Kausalya and Sumitra, was ready to depart.

original: tac chrutvā tu tataḥ paurā duḥkhaśokapariplutāḥ /
analyzed: tat śrutvā tu tatas paurāḥ duḥkha śoka pariplutāḥ
translated: Having heard that, the citizens, overwhelmed with grief and sorrow,

original: vivyathuś cātha saumitriḥ kaikeyīṃ prati roṣitaḥ // / //
analyzed: vivyathuḥ ca atha saumitriḥ kaikeyīm prati roṣitaḥ
translated: were distressed, and Saumitri (Lakshmana) was enraged with Kaikeyi.

original: tatas taṃ rāghavo dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇaṃ raktalocanam /
analyzed: tatas tam rāghavaḥ dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇam rakta locanam
translated: Then Raghava (Rama), seeing Lakshmana with eyes reddened,

original: dharmajño dharmavāgbhir mahāmatiḥ // / //
analyzed: vārayāmasa dharma jñaḥ dharma vāgbhiḥ mahāmatiḥ
translated: the greatly wise one, knowing dharma, with words of dharma,

original: tatas tu tatra ye vṛddhās tān praṇamya munīṃś ca saḥ /
analyzed: tatas tu tatra ye vṛddhāḥ tān praṇamya munīn ca saḥ
translated: Then, having bowed to the elders and sages there,

original: rāmo rathaṃ khinnasūtaṃ prasthānāyāruroha vai // / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ ratham khinna sūtam prasthānāya āruroha vai
translated: Rama ascended the chariot with its weary charioteer for departure.

original: ātmīyaṃ sakalaṃ dravyaṃ brāhmaṇebhyo nṛpātmajaḥ /
analyzed: ātmīyam sakalam dravyam brāhmaṇebhyaḥ nṛpa ātmajaḥ
translated: The prince (Rama) gave all his wealth to the Brahmins,

original: śraddhayā parayā dattvā vastrāṇi vividhāni ca // / //
analyzed: śraddhayā parayā dattvā vastrāṇi vividhāni ca
translated: Having given with supreme faith various garments,

original: tisraḥ śvaśrūḥ samāmantrya śvaśuraṃ ca visaṃjñitam /
analyzed: tisraḥ śvaśrūḥ samāmantrya śvaśuram ca visaṃjñitam
translated: Having addressed the three mothers-in-law and the unconscious father-in-law,

original: muñcantam aśrudhārāṇi netrayoḥ śokajāni ca // / //🔽paśyatī sarvataḥ sītā cāruroha tathā ratham /
analyzed: muñcantam aśru dhārāṇi netrayoḥ śoka jāni ca  paśyatī sarvatas sītā ca āruroha tathā ratham
translated: Who was shedding tears of grief from his eyes,🔽Sita looked all around and then boarded the chariot.

original: ratham āruhya gacchantaṃ sītayā saha rāghavam // / //
analyzed: ratham āruhya gacchantam sītayā saha rāghavam
translated: Seeing Raghava going with Sita, having boarded the chariot,

original: dṛṣṭvā sumitrā vacanaṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ cāha duḥkhitā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā sumitrā vacanam lakṣmaṇam ca āha duḥkhitā
translated: Sumitra, afflicted with grief, spoke these words to Lakshmana:

original: rāmaṃ daśarathaṃ viddhi māṃ viddhi janakātmajām // / //
analyzed: rāmam daśaratham viddhi mām viddhi janakātmajām
translated: Know Rama to be Dasharatha, know me to be Janaka's daughter,

original: ayodhyām aṭavīṃ viddhi vraja tābhyāṃ guṇākara /
analyzed: ayodhyām aṭavīm viddhi vraja tābhyām guṇa ākara
translated: Know Ayodhya to be the forest, go with them, O you who are a mine of virtues.

original: mātraivamukto dharmātmā stanakṣīrārdradehayā // / //
analyzed: mātrā evam uktaḥ dharma ātmā stana kṣīra ārdra dehayā
translated: Thus addressed by his mother, whose body was moist with breast milk, the righteous one,

original: tāṃ natvā cāruyānaṃ tam āruroha sa lakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tām natvā cāru yānam tam āruroha sa lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Having bowed to her, Lakshmana boarded that beautiful chariot.

original: gacchato lakṣmaṇo bhrātā sītā caiva pativratā // / //🔽rāmasya pṛṣṭhato yātau purād dhīrau mahāmate /
analyzed: gacchataḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ bhrātā sītā ca eva pativratā  rāmasya pṛṣṭhatas yātau purāt dhīrau mahāmate
translated: As they were going, Lakshmana, the brother, and Sita, devoted to her husband,🔽The two wise ones, of great intellect, followed Rama from the city.

original: vidhicchinnābhiṣekaṃ taṃ rāmaṃ rājīvalocanam // / //
analyzed: vidhi chinna abhiṣekam tam rāmam rājīva locanam
translated: The lotus-eyed Rama, whose consecration was interrupted by fate,

original: ayodhyāyā viniṣkrāntam anuyātāḥ purohitāḥ /
analyzed: ayodhyāyāḥ viniṣkrāntam anuyātāḥ purohitāḥ
translated: As he was leaving Ayodhya, the priests followed him.

original: mantriṇaḥ pauramukhyāś ca duḥkhena mahatānvitāḥ // / //
analyzed: mantriṇaḥ paura mukhyāḥ ca duḥkhena mahatā anvitāḥ
translated: The ministers and the chief citizens were filled with great sorrow.

original: taṃ ca prāpya hi gacchantaṃ rāmam ūcur idaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: tam ca prāpya hi gacchantam rāmam ūcuḥ idam vacaḥ
translated: And as he was about to depart, they spoke these words to Rama:

original: rāma rāma mahābāho gantuṃ nārhasi śobhana // / //
analyzed: rāma rāma mahā bāho gantum nā arhasi śobhana
translated: O Rama, O mighty-armed one, it is not proper for you to go, O auspicious one.

original: rājann atra nivartasva vihāyāsmān kva gacchasi /
analyzed: rājan atra nivartasva vihāya asmān kva gacchasi
translated: O king, turn back here. Abandoning us, where are you going?

original: ityukto rāghavas tais tu tān uvāca dṛḍhavrataḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ rāghavaḥ taiḥ tu tān uvāca dṛḍha vrataḥ
translated: Thus addressed by them, Raghava, firm in his vow, spoke to them:

original: gacchadhvaṃ mantriṇaḥ paurā gacchadhvaṃ ca purodhasaḥ /
analyzed: gacchadhvam mantriṇaḥ paurāḥ gacchadhvam ca purodhasaḥ
translated: Go, ministers and citizens, go, priests.

original: pitrādeśaṃ mayā kāryam abhiyāsyāmi vai vanam // / //
analyzed: pitṛ ādeśam mayā kāryam abhiyāsyāmi vai vanam
translated: I must carry out the command of my father. I will go to the forest.

original: dvādaśābdaṃ vrataṃ caitan nītvāhaṃ daṇḍake vane /
analyzed: dvādaśa abdam vratam ca etat nītvā aham daṇḍake vane
translated: Having spent this vow of twelve years in the Dandaka forest,

original: āgacchāmi pituḥ pādaṃ mātṝṇāṃ draṣṭum añjasā // / //
analyzed: āgacchāmi pituḥ pādam mātṝṇām draṣṭum añjasā
translated: I will return to see my father's feet and my mothers without delay.

original: ity uktvā tāñ jagāmātha rāmaḥ satyaparāyaṇaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā tām jagāma atha rāmaḥ satya parāyaṇaḥ
translated: Having said this, Rama, devoted to truth, went away.

original: taṃ gacchantaṃ punar yātāḥ pṛṣṭhato duḥkhitā janāḥ // / //
analyzed: tam gacchantam punar yātāḥ pṛṣṭhatas duḥkhitāḥ janāḥ
translated: The sorrowful people again followed him as he was leaving.

original: punaḥ prāha sa kākutstho gacchadhvaṃ nagarīm imām /
analyzed: punar prāha sa kākutsthaḥ gacchadhvam nagarīm imām
translated: Again Kakutstha said, Go to the city.

original: mātṝś ca pitaraṃ caiva śatrughnaṃ nagarīm imām // / //
analyzed: mātṝḥ ca pitaram ca eva śatrughnam nagarīm imām
translated: To your mothers and father and to the city.

original: prajāḥ samastās tatrasthā rājyaṃ bharatam eva ca /
analyzed: prajāḥ samastāḥ tatrasthāḥ rājyam bharatam eva ca
translated: All the subjects residing there, as well as the kingdom and Bharata,

original: pālayadhvaṃ mahābhāgās tapase yāmy ahaṃ vanam // / //
analyzed: pālayadhvam mahābhāgāḥ tapase yāmi aham vanam
translated: you greatly fortunate ones, rule over them. I will go to the forest for austerities.

original: atha lakṣmaṇam āhedaṃ vacanaṃ rāghavas tadā /
analyzed: atha lakṣmaṇam āha idam vacanam rāghavaḥ tadā
translated: Then Raghava spoke these words to Lakshmana:

original: sītām arpaya rājānaṃ janakaṃ mithileśvaram // / //
analyzed: sītām arpaya rājānam janakam mithilā īśvaram
translated: Entrust Sita to King Janaka, the lord of Mithila.

original: pitṛmātṛvaśe tiṣṭha gaccha lakṣmaṇa yāmy aham /
analyzed: pitṛ mātṛ vaśe tiṣṭha gaccha lakṣmaṇa yāmi aham
translated: O Lakshmana, remain under the control of your father and mother. I am going.

original: ityuktaḥ prāha dharmātmā lakṣmaṇo bhrātṛvatsalaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ prāha dharma ātmā lakṣmaṇaḥ bhrātṛ vatsalaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Lakshmana, the righteous one who loved his brother, said:

original: maivam ājñāpaya vibho mām adya karuṇākara /
analyzed: mā evam ājñāpaya vibho mām adya karuṇākara
translated: Do not command me thus, O lord, O you who are full of compassion.

original: gantum icchasi yatra tvam avaśyaṃ tatra yāmy aham // / //
analyzed: gantum icchasi yatra tvam avaśyam tatra yāmi aham
translated: Wherever you wish to go, I must certainly go there.

original: ityukto lakṣmaṇenāsau sītāṃ tām āha rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ lakṣmaṇena asau sītām tām āha rāghavaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Lakshmana, Raghava spoke to Sita:

original: sīte gaccha mamādeśāt pitaraṃ prati śobhane // / //
analyzed: sīte gaccha mama ādeśāt pitaram prati śobhane
translated: O Sita, go to my father, O beautiful one, on my command.

original: sumitrāyā gṛhe cāpi kauśalyāyāḥ sumadhyame /
analyzed: sumitrāyāḥ gṛhe ca api kauśalyāyāḥ sumadhyame
translated: And in the house of Sumitra and Kausalya, O slender-waisted one,

original: nivartasva hi tāvat tvaṃ yāvad āgamanaṃ mama // / //
analyzed: nivartasva hi tāvat tvam yāvat āgamanam mama
translated: return for the time being, until my return.

original: ityuktā rāghavenāpi sītā prāha kṛtāñjaliḥ /
analyzed: iti uktā rāghavena api sītā prāha kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Raghava, Sita said with folded hands:

original: yatra gatvā vane vāsaṃ tvaṃ karoṣi mahābhuja // / //
analyzed: yatra gatvā vane vāsam tvam karoṣi mahā bhuja
translated: O mighty-armed one, wherever you go to dwell in the forest,

original: tatra gatvā tvayā sārdhaṃ vasāmy aham ariṃdama /
analyzed: tatra gatvā tvayā sārdham vasāmi aham ariṃdama
translated: O chastiser of foes, having gone there, I shall live with you.

original: viyogaṃ no sahe rājaṃs tvayā satyavatā kvacit // / //
analyzed: viyogam no sahe rājan tvayā satyavatā kvacid
translated: O king, I cannot bear separation from you, O truthful one, anywhere.

original: atas tvāṃ prārthayiṣyāmi dayāṃ kuru mama prabho /
analyzed: atas tvām prārthayiṣyāmi dayām kuru mama prabho
translated: Therefore, I shall request you, have mercy on me, O lord.

original: gantum icchasi yatra tvam avaśyaṃ tatra yāmy aham // / //
analyzed: gantum icchasi yatra tvam avaśyam tatra yāmi aham
translated: Wherever you wish to go, I must certainly go there.

original: nānāyānair upagatāñ janān vīkṣya sa pṛṣṭhataḥ /
analyzed: nānā yānaiḥ upagatām janān vīkṣya sa pṛṣṭhatas
translated: Seeing the people coming with various vehicles behind him,

original: yoṣitāṃ ca gaṇān rāmo dharmavit // / //
analyzed: yoṣitām ca gaṇān rāmaḥ vārayāmasa dharma vid
translated: and the groups of women, Rama, the knower of dharma,

original: nivṛttya sthīyatāṃ svairam ayodhyāyāṃ janāḥ striyaḥ /
analyzed: nivṛttya sthīyatām svairam ayodhyāyām janāḥ striyaḥ
translated: turned back and said, Stay here at your leisure in Ayodhya, O people and women.

original: gatvāhaṃ daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ tapase dhṛtamānasaḥ // / //
analyzed: gatvā aham daṇḍaka araṇyam tapase dhṛta mānasaḥ
translated: Having gone to the Dandaka forest, I shall fix my mind on austerities.

original: katipayābdād āyāsye nānyathā satyam īritam /
analyzed: katipaya abdāt āyāsye na anyathā satyam īritam
translated: After a few years, I shall return. This is the truth I speak.

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā vaidehyā ca svabhāryayā // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā vaidehyā ca sva bhāryayā
translated: With my brother Lakshmana and my wife Vaidehi,

original: janān nivartya rāmo 'sau jagāma ca guhāśramam /
analyzed: janān nivartya sau jagāma ca guhā āśramam
translated: having turned back the people, Rama went to the Guha hermitage.

original: guhas tu rāmabhakto 'sau svabhāvād eva vaiṣṇavaḥ // / //
analyzed: guhaḥ tu sau svabhāvāt eva vaiṣṇavaḥ
translated: Guha, a devotee of Rama, was naturally a devotee of Vishnu.

original: kṛtāñjalipuṭo bhūtvā kiṃ kartavyam iti sthitaḥ /
analyzed: kṛta añjali puṭaḥ bhūtvā kim kartavyam iti sthitaḥ
translated: With folded hands, he stood there, asking, What should be done?

original: mahatā tapasaānītā guruṇā yā hi vaḥ purā // / //
analyzed: mahatā tapasā ānītāḥ guruṇā yāḥ hi vaḥ purā
translated: That which was brought to you by your Guru in ancient times through great austerities,

original: bhāgīrathena yā bhūmiṃ sarvapāpaharā śubhā /🔽nānāmunijanair juṣṭā kūrmamatsyasamākulā // / //
analyzed: bhāgīrathena yā bhūmim sarva pāpa harā śubhā  nānā muni janaiḥ juṣṭā kūrma matsya samākulā
translated: The land along the Bhagirathi, which removes all sins and is auspicious,🔽frequented by various sages, filled with turtles and fish,

original: gaṅgā tuṅgormimālāḍhyā sphaṭikābhajalāvahā /🔽guhopanītanāvā tu tāṃ gaṅgāṃ sa mahādyutiḥ // / //
analyzed: guhā upanīta nāvā tu tām gaṅgām sa mahā dyutiḥ
translated: the Ganges, adorned with waves from the Tungas, carrying water with the color of crystal,🔽the illustrious Rama, having crossed that Ganges by boat brought by Guha,

original: uttīrya bhagavān rāmo bharadvājāśramaṃ subham /
analyzed: uttīrya bhagavān rāmaḥ bharadvāja āśramam subham
translated: having crossed the Ganges, went to the auspicious hermitage of Bharadvaja,

original: prayāge tu tatas tasmin snātvā tīrthe yathāvidhi // / //
analyzed: prayāge tu tatas tasmin snātvā tīrthe yathāvidhi
translated: having bathed in that tirtha at Prayaga according to the rules,

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā rāghavaḥ sītayā saha /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā rāghavaḥ sītayā saha
translated: the descendant of Raghu, along with his brother Lakshmana and Sita,

original: bharadvājāśrame tatra viśrāntas tena pūjitaḥ // / //
analyzed: bharadvāja āśrame tatra viśrāntaḥ tena pūjitaḥ
translated: having rested in that hermitage of Bharadvaja, honored by him,

original: tataḥ prabhāte vimale tam anujñāpya rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: tatas prabhāte vimale tam anujñāpya rāghavaḥ
translated: then, when the morning was clear, having taken leave of him, Rama,

original: bharadvājoktamārgeṇa citrakūṭaṃ śanair yayau // / //
analyzed: bharadvāja ukta mārgeṇa citrakūṭam śanais yayau
translated: slowly went to Chitrakuta along the path indicated by Bharadvaja,

original: nānādrumalatākīrṇaṃ puṇyatīrtham anuttamam /
analyzed: nānā druma latā ākīrṇam puṇya tīrtham anuttamam
translated: covered with various trees and creepers, an excellent and holy tirtha,

original: tāpasaṃ veṣam āsthāya jahnukanyām atītya vai // / //
analyzed: tāpasam veṣam āsthāya jahnukanyām atītya vai
translated: having assumed the attire of an ascetic, having crossed the daughter of Jahnu,

original: gate rāme sabhārye tu saha bhrātrā sasārathau /
analyzed: gate rāme sa bhārye tu saha bhrātrā sa sārathau
translated: when Rama had gone with his wife and brother, along with the charioteer,

original: ayodhyām avasan bhūpa naṣṭasobhāṃ suduḥkhitāḥ // / //
analyzed: ayodhyām avasan bhūpa naṣṭa sobhām su duḥkhitāḥ
translated: the kings remained in Ayodhya, their splendor gone, extremely miserable.

original: naṣṭasaṃjño daśarathaḥ śrutvā vacanam apriyam /
analyzed: naṣṭa saṃjñaḥ daśarathaḥ śrutvā vacanam apriyam
translated: Dasharatha, having heard the unpleasant words

original: rāmapravāsajananaṃ kaikeyyā mukhaniḥsṛtam // / //
analyzed: rāma pravāsa jananam kaikeyyāḥ mukha niḥsṛtam
translated: emitted from Kaikeyi's mouth, causing Rama's exile, lost his senses.

original: labdhasaṃjñaḥ kṣaṇād rājā rāma rāmeti cukruśe /
analyzed: labdha saṃjñaḥ kṣaṇāt rājā rāma rāma iti cukruśe
translated: Having regained consciousness in a moment, the king cried out Rama, Rama!

original: kaikeyy uvāca bhūpālaṃ bharataṃ cābhiṣecaya // / //
analyzed: kaikeyī uvāca bhūpālam bharatam ca abhiṣecaya
translated: Kaikeyi said: Consecrate Prince Bharata as king.

original: sītālakṣmaṇasaṃyukto rāmacandro vanaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: sītā lakṣmaṇa saṃyuktaḥ rāmacandraḥ vanam gataḥ
translated: Rama, along with Sita and Lakshmana, went to the forest.

original: putraśokābhisaṃtapto rājā daśarathas tadā // / //
analyzed: putra śoka abhisaṃtaptaḥ rājā daśarathaḥ tadā
translated: King Dasharatha, tormented by grief for his son,

original: vihāya dehaṃ duḥkhena devalokaṃ gatas tadā /
analyzed: vihāya deham duḥkhena deva lokam gataḥ tadā
translated: left his body in sorrow and went to the world of the gods.

original: tatas tasya mahāpuryyām ayodhyāyām ariṃdama // / //
analyzed: tatas tasya mahā puryyām ayodhyāyām ariṃdama
translated: Then, in that great city of Ayodhya, O destroyer of enemies,

original: rurudur duḥkhaśokārtā janāḥ sarve ca yoṣitaḥ /
analyzed: ruruduḥ duḥkha śoka ārtāḥ janāḥ sarve ca yoṣitaḥ
translated: all the people and women lamented in grief and sorrow.

original: kauśalyā ca sumitrā ca kaikeyī kaṣṭakāriṇī // / //
analyzed: kauśalyā ca sumitrā ca kaikeyī kaṣṭa kāriṇī
translated: Kausalya, Sumitra, and the evil-doing Kaikeyi

original: parivārya mṛtaṃ tatra rurudus tāḥ patiṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: parivārya mṛtam tatra ruruduḥ tāḥ patim tatas
translated: surrounded their dead husband and wept.

original: tataḥ purohitas tatra vasiṣṭhaḥ sarvadharmavit // / //
analyzed: tatas purohitaḥ tatra vasiṣṭhaḥ sarva dharma vid
translated: Then Vasishtha, the priest there, who knew all duties,

original: tailadroṇyāṃ vinikṣipya mṛtaṃ rajakalevaram /
analyzed: taila droṇyām vinikṣipya mṛtam raja kalevaram
translated: placed the dead washerman's corpse in a pot of oil.

original: dūtaṃ vai sahamantrigaṇaiḥ sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: dūtam vai preṣayāmasa saha mantri gaṇaiḥ sthitaḥ
translated: and stood with the messengers and the group of ministers.

original: sa gatvā yatra bharataḥ śatrughnena saha sthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa gatvā yatra bharataḥ śatrughnena saha sthitaḥ
translated: He went to the place where Bharata was staying with Shatrughna,

original: tatra prāpya tathā vārtā saṃnivartya nṛpātmajau // / //
analyzed: tatra prāpya tathā vārtā saṃnivartya nṛpa ātmajau
translated: and having obtained the news there, he turned back the princes,

original: tāv ānīya tataḥ śīghram ayodhyāṃ punar āgataḥ /
analyzed: tau ānīya tatas śīghram ayodhyām punar āgataḥ
translated: and having brought them back quickly, he returned to Ayodhya.

original: krūrāṇi dṛṣṭvā bharato nimittāni ca vai pathi // / //
analyzed: krūrāṇi dṛṣṭvā bharataḥ nimittāni ca vai pathi
translated: Seeing inauspicious omens on the way, Bharata

original: viparītaṃ tv ayodhyāyām iti mene sa pārthivaḥ /
analyzed: viparītam tu ayodhyāyām iti mene sa pārthivaḥ
translated: considered Ayodhya to be in a state of reverse.

original: niḥśobhāṃ nirgataśrīkāṃ duḥkhaśokānvitāṃ purīm // / //
analyzed: niḥśobhām nirgata śrīkām duḥkha śoka anvitām purīm
translated: The city was devoid of beauty, bereft of glory, filled with sorrow and grief,

original: kaikeyyagnivinirdagdhām ayodhyāṃ praviveśa saḥ /
analyzed: kaikeyī agni vinirdagdhām ayodhyām praviveśa saḥ
translated: as if burnt by the fire of Kaikeyi, he entered Ayodhya.

original: duḥkhānvitā janāḥ sarve tau dṛṣṭvā rurudur bhṛśam // / //
analyzed: duḥkha anvitāḥ janāḥ sarve tau dṛṣṭvā ruruduḥ bhṛśam
translated: All the people, seeing them, were filled with sorrow and wept bitterly,

original: hā tāta rāma hā sīte lakṣmaṇeti punaḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: hā tāta rāma hā sīte lakṣmaṇa iti punar punar
translated: again and again crying out Alas, father Rama! Alas, Sita! Alas, Lakshmana!

original: ruroda bharatas tatra śatrughnaś ca suduḥkhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: ruroda bharataḥ tatra śatrughnaḥ ca su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: Bharata and Shatrughna wept there, greatly afflicted.

original: kaikeyyās tatkṣaṇāc chrutvā cukrodha bharatas tadā /
analyzed: kaikeyyāḥ tad kṣaṇāt śrutvā cukrodha bharataḥ tadā
translated: Hearing about it from Kaikeyi at that very moment, Bharata became angry then.

original: duṣṭā tvaṃ duṣṭacittā ca yayā rāmaḥ pravāsitaḥ // / //
analyzed: duṣṭā tvam duṣṭa cittā ca yayā rāmaḥ pravāsitaḥ
translated: You are wicked and evil-minded, by whom Rama was exiled,🔽along with his brother Lakshmana and Sita, to the forest,

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā rāghavaḥ sītayā vanam /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā rāghavaḥ sītayā vanam
translated: the descendant of Raghu.

original: sāhasaṃ kiṃ kṛtaṃ duṣṭe tvayā sadyo 'lpabhāgyayā // / //
analyzed: sāhasam kim kṛtam duṣṭe tvayā sadyas lpabhāgyayā
translated: O wicked one, what rash act have you done, you of little good fortune?

original: udvāsya sītayā rāmaṃ lakṣmaṇena mahātmanā /
analyzed: udvāsya sītayā rāmam lakṣmaṇena mahātmanā
translated: Having made Sītā, the great-souled Lakṣmaṇa, and Rāma leave,

original: mamaiva putraṃ rājānaṃ karotv iti matis tava // / //
analyzed: mama eva putram rājānam karotu iti matiḥ tava
translated: your intention is to make my son the king.

original: duṣṭāyā naṣṭabhāgyāyāḥ putro 'haṃ bhāgyavarjitaḥ /
analyzed: duṣṭāyāḥ naṣṭa bhāgyāyāḥ putraḥ ham bhāgya varjitaḥ
translated: I, the son of a wicked and unfortunate mother, am devoid of good fortune.

original: bhrātrā rāmeṇa rahito nāhaṃ rājyaṃ karomi vai // / //
analyzed: bhrātrā rāmeṇa rahitaḥ na aham rājyam karomi vai
translated: Separated from my brother Rāma, I will not rule the kingdom.

original: yatra rāmo naravyāghraḥ padmapatrāyatekṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yatra rāmaḥ nara vyāghraḥ padma patra āyata īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: Where Rāma, the best among men, with eyes long like lotus petals,

original: dharmajño sarvaśāstrajño matimān bandhuvatsalaḥ // / //
analyzed: sarva śāstra jñaḥ matimān bandhu vatsalaḥ
translated: knower of dharma, knower of all scriptures, wise, and affectionate towards his relatives,

original: sītā ca yatra vaidehī niyamavratacāriṇī /
analyzed: sītā ca yatra vaidehī niyama vrata cāriṇī
translated: and where Sītā, the daughter of the king of Videha, who observes vows and rituals,

original: pativratā mahābhāgā sarvalakṣaṇasaṃyutā // / //
analyzed: pativratā mahābhāgā sarva lakṣaṇa saṃyutā
translated: a devoted wife, greatly fortunate, endowed with all good qualities,

original: lakṣmaṇaś ca mahāvīryo guṇavān bhrātṛvatsalaḥ /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ ca mahā vīryaḥ guṇavān bhrātṛ vatsalaḥ
translated: and the greatly valorous Lakṣmaṇa, virtuous, and affectionate towards his brother,

original: tatra yāsyāmi kaikeyi mahat pāpaṃ tvayā kṛtam // / //
analyzed: tatra yāsyāmi kaikeyi mahat pāpam tvayā kṛtam
translated: there I will go, O Kaikeyī, you have committed a great sin.

original: rāma eva mama bhrātā jyeṣṭho matimatāṃ varaḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ eva mama bhrātā jyeṣṭhaḥ matimatām varaḥ
translated: Rāma alone is my elder brother, the best among the wise.

original: sa eva rājā duṣṭātme bhṛtyo 'haṃ tasya vai sadā // / //
analyzed: saḥ eva rājā duṣṭa ātme bhṛtyaḥ ham tasya vai sadā
translated: He alone is the king, O wicked one, I am always his servant.

original: ity uktvā mātaraṃ tatra ruroda bhṛśaduḥkhitaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā mātaram tatra ruroda bhṛśa duḥkhitaḥ
translated: Having said this to his mother there, he wept bitterly, greatly afflicted.

original: hā rājan pṛthivīpāla māṃ vihāya suduḥkhitam // / //
analyzed: hā rājan pṛthivīpāla mām vihāya su duḥkhitam
translated: O king, O protector of the earth, leaving me in great sorrow, where have you gone?

original: kva gato 'sy adya vai tāta kiṃ karomīha tad vada /
analyzed: kva gataḥ sī adya vai tāta kim karomi iha tat vada
translated: Where have you gone today, father? Tell me what I should do now.

original: bhrātā pitrā samaḥ kvāste jyeṣṭho me karunākaraḥ // / //
analyzed: bhrātā pitrā samaḥ kva āste jyeṣṭhaḥ me karunākaraḥ
translated: Where is my eldest brother, the compassionate one, who is like a father to me?

original: sītā ca mātṛtulyā me kva gato lakṣmaṇaś ca ha /🔽ity evaṃ vilapantaṃ taṃ bharataṃ mantribhiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: sītā ca mātṛ tulyā me kva gataḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ ca ha  iti evam vilapantam tam bharatam mantribhiḥ saha
translated: Where has Sita, who is like a mother to me, and Lakshmana gone?🔽 Thus lamenting, along with the ministers,

original: vasiṣṭho bhagavān āha kālakarmavibhāgavit /
analyzed: vasiṣṭhaḥ bhagavān āha kāla karma vibhāga vid
translated: the illustrious Vasishtha, who knows the division of time and action, said to Bharata:

original: uttiṣṭhottiṣṭha vatsa tvaṃ na śokaṃ kartum arhasi // / //
analyzed: uttiṣṭha uttiṣṭha vatsa tvam na śokam kartum arhasi
translated: Rise, rise, my child, you should not grieve.

original: karmakālavaśād eva pitā te svargam āsthitaḥ /
analyzed: karma kāla vaśāt eva pitā te svargam āsthitaḥ
translated: Your father has gone to heaven due to the power of the time of action.

original: tasya saṃskārakāryāṇi karmāṇi kuru śobhana // / //🔽rāmo 'pi duṣṭanāśāya śiṣṭānāṃ pālanāya ca /
analyzed: tasya saṃskāra kāryāṇi karmāṇi kuru śobhana  duṣṭa nāśāya śiṣṭānām pālanāya ca
translated: Do the auspicious rites for him.

original: avatīrṇo jagatsvāmī svāṃśena bhuvi mādhavaḥ // / //
analyzed: avatīrṇaḥ jagatsvāmī sva aṃśena bhuvi mādhavaḥ
translated: Rama, the lord of the world, an incarnation of Vishnu, has descended on earth with a part of himself, to destroy the wicked and protect the virtuous.

original: prāyas tatrāsti rāmeṇa kartavyaṃ lakṣmaṇena ca /
analyzed: prāyas tatra asti rāmeṇa kartavyam lakṣmaṇena ca
translated: Most of the tasks there are to be done by Rama and Lakshmana,

original: yatrāsau bhagavān vīraḥ karmaṇā tena coditaḥ // / //
analyzed: yatra asau bhagavān vīraḥ karmaṇā tena coditaḥ
translated: where the illustrious hero is impelled by that deed.

original: tat kṛtvā punar āyāti rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: tat kṛtvā punar āyāti rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: Having done that, the lotus-eyed Rama will return.

original: ityukto bharatas tena vasiṣṭhena mahātmanā // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ bharataḥ tena vasiṣṭhena mahātmanā
translated: Thus addressed by the great-souled Vashishtha,

original: saṃskāraṃ vidhidṛṣṭena karmaṇā /
analyzed: saṃskāram lambhayāmasa vidhi dṛṣṭena karmaṇā
translated: Bharata performed the funeral rites according to the prescribed rituals.

original: agnihotrāgninā dagdhvā pitur dehaṃ vidhānataḥ // / //
analyzed: agnihotra agninā dagdhvā pituḥ deham vidhānataḥ
translated: Having cremated his father's body in the sacrificial fire according to the rules,

original: snātvā sarayvāḥ salile kṛtvā tasyodakakriyām /
analyzed: snātvā sarayvāḥ salile kṛtvā tasya udakakriyām
translated: he bathed in the waters of the Sarayu and performed the water rites for him.

original: śatrughnena saha śrīmān mātṛbhir bāndhavaiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: śatrughnena saha śrīmān mātṛbhiḥ bāndhavaiḥ saha
translated: The prosperous one, along with Shatrughna, his mothers, and relatives,

original: tasyaurdhvadehikaṃ kṛtvā mantriṇā mantrināyakaḥ /
analyzed: tasya aurdhvadehikam kṛtvā mantriṇā mantri nāyakaḥ
translated: having performed the funeral rites, the chief minister,

original: hastyaśvarathapattībhiḥ saha prāyān mahāmatiḥ // / //
analyzed: hasti aśva ratha pattībhiḥ saha prāyāt mahāmatiḥ
translated: the greatly wise one, departed with elephants, horses, chariots, and foot soldiers.

original: bharato rāmam anveṣṭuṃ rāmamārgeṇa sattamaḥ /
analyzed: bharataḥ rāmam anveṣṭum rāma mārgeṇa sattamaḥ
translated: Bharata, the best of men, went to search for Rama along the path Rama had taken.

original: tam āyāntaṃ mahāsenaṃ rāmasyānuvirodhinam // / //
analyzed: tam āyāntam mahāsenam rāmasya anuvirodhinam
translated: Seeing that great army coming, which was following Rama's path,

original: matvā taṃ bharataṃ śatruṃ rāmabhakto guhas tadā /
analyzed: matvā tam bharatam śatrum rāma bhaktaḥ guhaḥ tadā
translated: Guha, a devotee of Rama, considered Bharata to be an enemy.

original: svaṃ sainyaṃ vartulaṃ kṛtvā saṃnaddhaḥ kavacī rathī // / //
analyzed: svam sainyam vartulam kṛtvā saṃnaddhaḥ kavacī rathī
translated: He surrounded his own army in a circle, armored and mounted on a chariot,

original: mahābalaparīvāro rurodha bharataṃ pathi // / //🔽sabhrātṛkaṃ sabhāryaṃ me rāmaṃ svāminam uttamam /
analyzed: mahā bala parīvāraḥ rurodha bharatam pathi  sa bhrātṛkam sa bhāryam me rāmam svāminam uttamam
translated: and surrounded Bharata on the path, with a great army.

original: prāpayas tvaṃ vanaṃ duṣṭa sāṃprataṃ hantum icchasi // / //
analyzed: prāpayaḥ tvam vanam duṣṭa sāṃpratam hantum icchasi
translated: You wicked one, you now wish to kill my excellent master Rama, along with his brothers and wife, and take him to the forest.

original: gamiṣyasi durātmaṃs tvaṃ senayā saha durmate /
analyzed: gamiṣyasi durātman tvam senayā saha durmate
translated: O wicked-minded one, you will go with your army, O evil-minded one.

original: ityukto bharatas tatra guhena nṛpanandanaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ bharataḥ tatra guhena nṛpa nandanaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Guha there, the son of the king,

original: tam uvāca vinītātmā rāmāyātha kṛtāñjaliḥ /
analyzed: tam uvāca vinīta ātmā rāmāya atha kṛtāñjaliḥ
translated: with a humble mind, spoke to him, joining his hands in salutation,

original: yathā tvaṃ rāmabhakto 'si tathāham api bhaktimān // / //
analyzed: yathā tvam rāma bhaktaḥ si tathā aham api bhaktimān
translated: Just as you are devoted to Rama, so am I also devoted to him.

original: proṣite mayi kaikeyyā kṛtam etan mahāmate /
analyzed: proṣite mayi kaikeyyā kṛtam etat mahāmate
translated: When I was away, this was done by Kaikeyi, O greatly wise one.

original: rāmasyānayanārthāya vrajāmy adya mahāmate // / //
analyzed: rāmasya ānayana arthāya vrajāmi adya mahāmate
translated: For the sake of bringing back Rama, I am going today, O greatly wise one.

original: satyapūrvaṃ gamiṣyāmi panthānaṃ dehi me guha /
analyzed: satya pūrvam gamiṣyāmi panthānam dehi me guha
translated: I will go along the path that is true. Give me the path, O Guha.

original: iti viśvāsam ānīya jāhnavīṃ tena tāritaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti viśvāsam ānīya jāhnavīm tena tāritaḥ
translated: Having thus inspired confidence, he was ferried across the Jāhnavī by him.

original: naukāvṛndair anekais tu snātvāsau jāhnavījale /
analyzed: naukā vṛndaiḥ anekaiḥ tu snātvā asau jāhnavī jale
translated: Having bathed in the waters of the Jāhnavī with many groups of boats,

original: bharadvājāśramaṃ prāpto bharatas taṃ mahāmunim // / //
analyzed: bharadvāja āśramam prāptaḥ bharataḥ tam mahā munim
translated: Bharata reached the hermitage of Bharadvaja, and that great sage.

original: praṇamya śirasā tasmai yathāvṛttam uvāca ha /
analyzed: praṇamya śirasā tasmai yathāvṛttam uvāca ha
translated: Bowing his head to him, he told him what had happened.

original: bharadvājo 'pi taṃ prāha kālena kṛtam īdṛśam // / //
analyzed: bharadvājaḥ pi tam prāha kālena kṛtam īdṛśam
translated: Bharadvaja also said to him, Such is the way of time.

original: duḥkhaṃ na tāvat kartavyaṃ rāmārthe 'pi tvayādhunā /
analyzed: duḥkham na tāvat kartavyam rāma arthe tvayā adhunā
translated: You should not grieve now, even for the sake of Rama.

original: vartate citrakūṭe 'sau rāmaḥ satyaparākramaḥ // / //
analyzed: vartate citrakūṭe sau rāmaḥ satya parākramaḥ
translated: Rama, whose prowess is truth, is staying on the Chitrakuta mountain.

original: tvayi tatra gate vāpi prāyo 'sau nāgamiṣyati /
analyzed: tvayi tatra gate vā api prāyo sau nā āgamiṣyati
translated: Even if you go there, he is unlikely to come.

original: tathāpi tatra gaccha tvaṃ yas asau vakti tat kuru // / //
analyzed: tathā api tatra gaccha tvam yaḥ asau vakti tat kuru
translated: Still, go there and do what he says.

original: rāmas tu sītayā sārdhaṃ vanakhaṇḍe sthitaḥ śubhe /
analyzed: rāmaḥ tu sītayā sārdham vanakhaṇḍe sthitaḥ śubhe
translated: Rama was staying with Sita in a beautiful forest grove.

original: lakṣmaṇas tu mahāvīryo duṣṭālokanatatparaḥ // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ tu mahā vīryaḥ duṣṭa ālokana tatparaḥ
translated: Lakshmana, the greatly valorous one, was intent on watching for any evil.

original: ityukto bharatas tatra bhāradvājena dhīmatā /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ bharataḥ tatra bhāradvājena dhīmatā
translated: Thus addressed there by the wise Bharadvaja,

original: uttīrya yamunāṃ yātaś citrakūṭaṃ mahān agam // / //
analyzed: uttīrya yamunām yātaḥ citrakūṭam mahān agam
translated: Bharata crossed the Yamuna and went to the great Chitrakuta mountain.

original: sthito 'sau dṛṣṭavān dūrāt sadhūlīṃ cottarāṃ diśam /
analyzed: sthitaḥ u sau dṛṣṭavān dūrāt sa dhūlīm ca uttarām diśam
translated: He stood there and saw in the distance the northern direction covered with dust.

original: rāmāya kathayitvāsa tadādeśāt tu lakṣmaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: rāmāya kathayitvā āsa tad ādeśāt tu lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Having told Rama this, at his command Lakshmana

original: vṛkṣam āruhya medhāvī vīkṣamāṇaḥ prayatnataḥ /
analyzed: vṛkṣam āruhya medhāvī vīkṣamāṇaḥ prayatnataḥ
translated: climbed a tree and, with great effort, looked around.

original: sa tato dṛṣṭavān hṛṣṭām āyāntīṃ mahatīṃ camūm // / //
analyzed: sa tatas dṛṣṭavān hṛṣṭām āyāntīm mahatīm camūm
translated: He then saw a large army of delighted people coming.

original: hastyaśvarathasaṃyuktāṃ dṛṣṭvā rāmam athābravīt /
analyzed: hasti aśva ratha saṃyuktām dṛṣṭvā rāmam atha abravīt
translated: Seeing it full of elephants, horses and chariots, he said to Rama:

original: he bhrātas tvaṃ mahābāho sītāpārśve sthiro bhava // / //
analyzed: he bhrātar tvam mahā bāho sītā pārśve sthiraḥ bhava
translated: O brother, O mighty-armed one, be steady by Sita's side.

original: bhūpo 'sti balavān kaścid dhastyaśvarathapattibhiḥ /
analyzed: bhūpaḥ u sti balavān kaścid hasti aśva ratha pattibhiḥ
translated: There is a powerful king with elephants, horses, chariots and infantry.

original: ity ākarṇya vacas tasya lakṣmaṇasya mahātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti ākarṇya vacaḥ tasya lakṣmaṇasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Hearing these words of the great-souled Lakshmana,

original: rāmas tam abravīd vīro vīraṃ satyaparākramaḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ tam abravīt vīraḥ vīram satya parākramaḥ
translated: the hero Rama, whose prowess was truth, said to that hero Lakshmana:

original: prāyeṇa bharato 'smākaṃ draṣṭum āyāti lakṣmaṇa // / //
analyzed: prāyeṇa bharataḥ smākam draṣṭum āyāti lakṣmaṇa
translated: Lakshmana, Bharata is probably coming to see us.

original: ity evaṃ vadatas tasya rāmasya viditātmanaḥ /🔽ārāt saṃsthāpya senāṃ tāṃ bharato vinayānvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti evam vadataḥ tasya rāmasya vidita ātmanaḥ  ārāt saṃsthāpya senām tām bharataḥ vinaya anvitaḥ
translated: While Rama, who knew his own self, was speaking thus,🔽Bharata, full of humility, having stationed the army at a distance,

original: brāhmaṇair mantribhiḥ sārdhaṃ rudann āgatya pādayoḥ /
analyzed: brāhmaṇaiḥ mantribhiḥ sārdham rudan āgatya pādayoḥ
translated: weeping, approached and fell at the feet

original: rāmasya nipapātātha vaidehyā lakṣmaṇasya ca // / //
analyzed: rāmasya nipapāta atha vaidehyāḥ lakṣmaṇasya ca
translated: of Rama, Vaidehi and Lakshmana.

original: mantriṇo mātṛvargaś ca snigdhabandhusuhṛjjanāḥ /
analyzed: mantriṇaḥ mātṛ vargaḥ ca snigdha bandhu suhṛd janāḥ
translated: The ministers, the group of mothers, affectionate relatives and well-wishers,

original: parivārya tato rāmaṃ ruruduḥ śokakātarāḥ // / //
analyzed: parivārya tatas rāmam ruruduḥ śoka kātarāḥ
translated: then surrounding Rama, wept, frightened by grief.

original: svaryātaṃ pitaraṃ jñātvā tato rāmo mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: svaryātam pitaram jñātvā tatas rāmaḥ mahāmatiḥ
translated: Then the greatly wise Rama, having learned that his father had gone to heaven,

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā vaidehyātha samanvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā vaidehyā atha samanvitaḥ
translated: together with his brother Lakshmana and the princess of Videha,

original: snātvā malāpahe tīrthe dattvā ca salilāñ jalim /
analyzed: snātvā malāpahe tīrthe dattvā ca salilām jalim
translated: having bathed in the purifying tirtha and offered water libations,

original: mātrādīn abhivādyātha rāmo duḥkhasamanvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: mātrā ādīn abhivādya atha rāmaḥ duḥkha samanvitaḥ
translated: and having greeted his mothers and others, Rama, full of sorrow,

original: uvāca bharataṃ rājan duḥkhena mahatānvitam /
analyzed: uvāca bharatam rājan duḥkhena mahatā anvitam
translated: said to Bharata, O king, who was filled with great sorrow:

original: ayodhyāṃ gaccha bharata itaḥ śīghraṃ mahāmate // / //
analyzed: ayodhyām gaccha bharataḥ itas śīghram mahāmate
translated: O Bharata, go to Ayodhya from here quickly, O greatly wise one.

original: rājñā vihīnāṃ nagarīṃ anāthāṃ paripālaya /
analyzed: rājñā vihīnām nagarīm anāthām paripālaya
translated: Protect the city which is without a king and is helpless.

original: ityukto bharato prāha rāmaṃ rājīvalocanam // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ bharataḥ prāha rāmam rājīva locanam
translated: Thus addressed, Bharata said to Rama, the lotus-eyed one:

original: tvām ṛte puruṣavyāghra na yāsye 'ham ito dhruvam /
analyzed: tvām ṛte puruṣa vyāghra na yāsye ham itas dhruvam
translated: Without you, O tiger among men, I will certainly not go from here.

original: yatra tvaṃ tatra yāsyāmi vaidehī lakṣmaṇo yathā // / //
analyzed: yatra tvam tatra yāsyāmi vaidehī lakṣmaṇaḥ yathā
translated: Where you are, there I will go, as Vaidehi and Lakshmana are.

original: ity ākarṇya punaḥ prāha bharataṃ purataḥ sthitam /
analyzed: iti ākarṇya punar prāha bharatam puratas sthitam
translated: Having heard this, he again said to Bharata who was standing in front of him:

original: nṛṇāṃ pitṛsamo jyeṣṭhaḥ svadharmam anuvartinām // / //
analyzed: nṛṇām pitṛ samaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ svadharmam anuvartinām
translated: The eldest is like a father to men who follow their own dharma.

original: yathā na laṅghyaṃ vacanaṃ mayā pitṛmukheritam /
analyzed: yathā na laṅghyam vacanam mayā pitṛ mukha īritam
translated: Just as the words uttered by my father should not be transgressed by me,

original: tathā tvayā na laṅghyaṃ syād vacanaṃ mama sattama // / //
analyzed: tathā tvayā na laṅghyam syāt vacanam mama sattama
translated: in the same way, O best one, the words of mine should not be transgressed by you.

original: matsamīpād ito gatvā prajās tvaṃ paripālaya /
analyzed: mad samīpāt itas gatvā prajāḥ tvam paripālaya
translated: Having gone from here near me, you should protect the subjects.

original: dvādaśābdikam etan me vrataṃ pitṛmukheritam // / //
analyzed: dvādaśa ābdikam etat me vratam pitṛ mukha īritam
translated: This vow of mine for twelve years has been uttered by my father.

original: tad araṇye caritvā tu āgamisyāmi te 'ntikam /
analyzed: tat araṇye caritvā tu āgamisyāmi te ntikam
translated: Having observed it in the forest, I will come back to you.

original: gaccha tiṣṭha mamādeśe na duḥkhaṃ kartum arhasi // / //
analyzed: gaccha tiṣṭha mama ādeśe na duḥkham kartum arhasi
translated: Go, stay by my command. You should not cause grief.

original: ityukto bharataḥ prāha bāṣpaparyākulekṣaṇaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ bharataḥ prāha bāṣpa paryākula īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Bharata said with eyes filled with tears:

original: yathā pitā tathā tvaṃ me nātra karyā vicāraṇā // / //
analyzed: yathā pitā tathā tvam me na atra karyā vicāraṇā
translated: As you are, so am I. There is no doubt about this.

original: tavādeśān mayā kāryaṃ dehi tvaṃ mama /
analyzed: tava ādeśāt mayā kāryam dehi tvam pāduke mama
translated: By your command, I must act. Give me (your) order.

original: nandigrāme vasiṣye 'haṃ dvādaśābdikam // / //
analyzed: nandigrāme vasiṣye haṃ pāduke dvādaśa ābdikam
translated: I will dwell in Nandigrama for twelve years.

original: tvadveṣam eva madveṣaṃ tvadvrataṃ me mahāvratam /
analyzed: tvad veṣam eva mad veṣam tvad vratam me mahāvratam
translated: Your enemy is my enemy, your vow is my great vow.

original: tvaṃ dvādaśābdikād ūrdhvaṃ yadi nāyāsi sattama // / //
analyzed: tvam dvādaśa ābdikāt ūrdhvam yadi na āyāsi sattama
translated: If you, O best one, do not return after twelve years,

original: tato havir yathā cāgnau pradhakṣyāmi kalevaram /
analyzed: tatas haviḥ yathā ca agnau pradhakṣyāmi kalevaram
translated: then like an oblation in the fire, I will burn my body.

original: ity evaṃ śapathaṃ kṛtvā bharato hi suduḥkhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti evam śapatham kṛtvā bharataḥ hi su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: Having thus taken an oath, Bharata was greatly afflicted.

original: bahu pradakṣiṇaṃ kṛtvā namaskṛtya ca rāghavam /🔽śirasā sthāpya bharataḥ prasthitaḥ śanaiḥ // / //
analyzed: bahu pradakṣiṇam kṛtvā namaskṛtya ca rāghavam  pāduke śirasā sthāpya bharataḥ prasthitaḥ śanais
translated: Having circumambulated many times and bowed to Raghava,🔽placing his head (at his feet), Bharata slowly departed.

original: sa kurvan bhrātur ādeśaṃ nandigrāme sthito vaśī /🔽tapasvī niyatāhāraḥ śākamūlaphalāśanaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa kurvan bhrātuḥ ādeśam nandigrāme sthitaḥ vaśī  tapasvī niyata āhāraḥ śāka mūla phala aśanaḥ
translated: He, the self-controlled one, abiding by his brother's command, dwelt in Nandigrama,🔽an ascetic, with restricted diet, subsisting on vegetables, roots and fruits.

original: jaṭākalāpaṃ śirasā ca bibhrat tvacaś ca vārkṣīḥ kila vanyabhojī /
analyzed: jaṭā kalāpam śirasā ca bibhrat tvacaḥ ca vārkṣīḥ kila vanya bhojī
translated: Wearing matted locks on his head, and wearing bark garments, subsisting on wild food,

original: rāmasya vākyādarato hṛdi sthitaṃ babhāra bhūbhāram aninditātmā // / //
analyzed: rāmasya vākya ādarataḥ hṛdi sthitam babhāra bhū bhāram anindita ātmā
translated: devoted to Rama's words, bearing in his heart what was to be done, he bore the burden of the earth, his self being irreproachable.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe śrīrāmaprādurbhāve aṣṭacatvāriṃśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe śrī rāmaprādurbhāve aṣṭacatvāriṃśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-eighth chapter in the Rakshasa-Vadha Parva of the Adi Parva in the holy Mahabharata.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: gate 'tha bharate tasmin rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: gate tha bharate tasmin rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: When Bharata had departed, the lotus-eyed Rama,

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā bhāryayā sītayā saha // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā bhāryayā sītayā saha
translated: along with his brother Lakshmana, and his wife Sita,

original: śākamūlaphalāhāro vicacāra mahāvane /
analyzed: śāka mūla phala āhāraḥ vicacāra mahā vane
translated: lived on a diet of vegetables, roots and fruits in the great forest.

original: kadācil lakṣmaṇam ṛte rāmadevaḥ pratāpavān // / //
analyzed: kadācid lakṣmaṇam ṛte rāmadevaḥ pratāpavān
translated: Once, when Ramadeva, the powerful one, was without Lakshmana,

original: citrakūṭavanoddeśe vaidehyutsaṅgam āśritaḥ /
analyzed: citrakūṭa vana uddeśe vaidehī utsaṅgam āśritaḥ
translated: he lay in the lap of Vaidehi in the forest of Chitrakuta.

original: suṣvāpa sa muhūrtaṃ tu tataḥ kāko durātmavān // / //
analyzed: suṣvāpa sa muhūrtam tu tatas kākaḥ durātmavān
translated: He slept for a moment, but then an evil crow

original: sītābhimukham abhyetya vidadāra stanāntaram /
analyzed: sītā abhimukham abhyetya vidadāra stanāntaram
translated: came before Sita and tore at her breasts.

original: vidārya vṛkṣam āruhya sthito 'sau vāyasādhamaḥ // / //
analyzed: vidārya vṛkṣam āruhya sthitaḥ sau vāyasa adhamaḥ
translated: Having torn her, the wretched crow climbed a tree and stayed there.

original: tataḥ prabuddho rāmo 'sau dṛṣṭvā raktaṃ stanāntare /
analyzed: tatas prabuddhaḥ dṛṣṭvā raktam stanāntare
translated: Then Rama woke up and saw blood on her breasts.

original: śokāviṣṭāṃ tu sītāṃ tām uvāca kamalekṣaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: śoka āviṣṭām tu sītām tām uvāca kamala īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: The lotus-eyed one, overcome with grief, said to Sita:

original: vada stanāntare bhadre tava raktasya kāraṇam /
analyzed: vada stanāntare bhadre tava raktasya kāraṇam
translated: Tell me, O good one, the cause of the blood on your breasts.

original: ityuktā sā ca taṃ prāha bhartāraṃ vinayānvitā // / //
analyzed: iti uktā sā ca tam prāha bhartāram vinaya anvitā
translated: Thus addressed, she, full of humility, said to her husband:

original: paśya rājendra vṛkṣāgre vāyasaṃ duṣṭaceṣṭitam /
analyzed: paśya rāja indra vṛkṣa agre vāyasam duṣṭa ceṣṭitam
translated: O lord of kings, see the crow on the tree, of wicked deeds.

original: anenaiva kṛtaṃ karma supte tvayi mahāmate // / //
analyzed: anena eva kṛtam karma supte tvayi mahāmate
translated: This very one has done the deed, while you were asleep, O greatly wise one.

original: rāmo 'pi dṛṣṭavān kākaṃ tasmin krodham athākarot /
analyzed: rāmaḥ pi dṛṣṭavān kākam tasmin krodham atha akarot
translated: Rama also saw the crow and became angry.

original: iṣīkāstraṃ samādhaya brahmāstreṇābhimantritam // / //
analyzed: iṣīkā astram brahmāstreṇa abhimantritam
translated: He aimed the arrow of reeds, consecrated with the Brahma weapon,

original: kākam uddiśya cikṣepa so 'py adhāvad bhayānvitaḥ /
analyzed: kākam uddiśya cikṣepa saḥ pi adhāvat bhaya anvitaḥ
translated: and shot it at the crow, who ran away in fear.

original: sa tv indrasya suto rājann indralokaṃ viveśa ha // / //
analyzed: sa tu indrasya sutaḥ rājan indra lokam viveśa ha
translated: O king, he, Indra's son, entered Indra's world.

original: rāmāstraṃ prajvalad dīptaṃ tasyānu praviveśa vai /
analyzed: rāma astram prajvalat dīptam tasya anu praviveśa vai
translated: And the blazing and burning Rama weapon entered after him.

original: viditārthaś ca devendro devaiḥ saha samanvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: vidita arthaḥ ca deva indraḥ devaiḥ saha samanvitaḥ
translated: And Indra, the lord of the gods, having understood the matter, together with the gods,

original: niṣkrāmayac ca taṃ duṣṭaṃ rāghavasyāpakāriṇam /
analyzed: niṣkrāmayat ca tam duṣṭam rāghavasya apakāriṇam
translated: expelled that wicked one who had done harm to Raghava.

original: tato 'sau sarvadevais tu devalokād bahiḥ kṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas sau sarva devaiḥ tu deva lokāt bahis kṛtaḥ
translated: Then he, by all the gods, was expelled from the world of the gods,

original: punaḥ so 'py apatad rāmaṃ rājānaṃ śaraṇaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: punar saḥ api apatat rāmam rājānam śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: and again he fell, having gone for refuge to Rama, the king.

original: pāhi rāma mahābāho ajñānād apakāriṇam // / //
analyzed: pāhi rāma mahā bāho ajñānāt apakāriṇam
translated: Protect me, O Rama, O mighty-armed one, who has done harm out of ignorance.

original: iti bruvantaṃ taṃ prāha rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: iti bruvantam tam prāha rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: Thus speaking, him Rama, having eyes like lotus petals, said:

original: amoghaṃ ca mamaivāstram aṅgam ekaṃ prayaccha vai // / //
analyzed: amogham ca mama eva astram aṅgam ekam prayaccha vai
translated: My weapon is infallible. Give me just one limb.

original: tato jīvasi duṣṭa tvam apakāro mahān kṛtaḥ /🔽ityukto 'sau svakaṃ netram ekam astrāya dattavān // / //
analyzed: tatas jīvasi duṣṭa tvam apakāraḥ mahān kṛtaḥ  iti uktaḥ sau svakam netram ekam astrāya dattavān
translated: Then you will live, O wicked one, a great injury has been done.🔽Thus addressed, he gave one of his eyes to the weapon.

original: astraṃ tannetram ekaṃ tu bhasmīkṛtya samāyayau /
analyzed: astram tat netram ekam tu bhasmīkṛtya samāyayau
translated: That weapon reduced his one eye to ashes and returned.

original: tataḥ prabhṛti kākānāṃ sarveṣām ekanetratā // / //
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti kākānām sarveṣām eka netra tā
translated: From that time onwards, all crows have one eye.

original: cakṣuṣaikena paśyanti hetunā tena pārthiva /
analyzed: cakṣuṣā ekena paśyanti hetunā tena pārthiva
translated: They see with one eye, for that reason, O king.

original: uṣitvā tatra suciraṃ citrakūṭe sa rāghavaḥ // / //
analyzed: uṣitvā tatra su ciram citrakūṭe sa rāghavaḥ
translated: Having lived there for a long time on Chitrakuta, that Raghava

original: jagāma daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ nānāmuniniṣevitam /
analyzed: jagāma daṇḍaka araṇyam nānā muni niṣevitam
translated: went to the Dandaka forest, frequented by many sages.

original: sabhrātṛkaḥ sabhāryaś ca tāpasaṃ veṣam āsthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa bhrātṛkaḥ sa bhāryaḥ ca tāpasam veṣam āsthitaḥ
translated: With his brothers and wife, assuming the attire of an ascetic,

original: dhanuḥparvasupāṇiśca seṣudhiś ca mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: dhanuḥ parva su pāṇiḥ ca sa iṣudhiḥ ca mahā balaḥ
translated: with bow and arrow in hand, the greatly powerful one,

original: tato dadarśa tatrasthān ambubhakṣān mahāmunīn // / //
analyzed: tatas dadarśa tatrasthān ambu bhakṣān mahā munīn
translated: then saw the great sages who were residing there, subsisting on water,

original: aśmakuṭṭān anekāṃś ca dantolūkhalinas tathā /
analyzed: aśmakuṭṭān anekān ca dantolūkhalinaḥ tathā
translated: many who were eating stones, and those who were using their teeth as mortars,

original: pañcāgnimadhyagān anyān anyān ugratapaś carān // / //
analyzed: pañca agni madhya gān anyān anyān ugra tapaḥ carān
translated: others who were in the midst of five fires, and others who were practicing severe austerities.

original: tān dṛṣṭvā praṇipatyoccai rāmas taiś cābhinanditaḥ /
analyzed: tān dṛṣṭvā praṇipatya uccais rāmaḥ taiḥ ca abhinanditaḥ
translated: Seeing them, Rama bowed down, and they welcomed him.

original: tato 'khilaṃ vanaṃ dṛṣṭvā rāmaḥ sākṣāj janārdanaḥ // / //
analyzed: khilam vanam dṛṣṭvā rāmaḥ sākṣāt janārdanaḥ
translated: Then Rama, who was actually Janardana, saw the entire forest,

original: bhrātṛbhāryāsahāyaś ca saṃpratasthe mahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: bhrātṛ bhāryā sahāyaḥ ca saṃpratasthe mahāmatiḥ
translated: And with his brother's wife as his companion, the greatly wise one set out.

original: darśayitvā tu sītāyai vanaṃ kusumitaṃ śubham // / //
analyzed: darśayitvā tu sītāyai vanam kusumitam śubham
translated: Having shown Sita the beautiful and blossoming forest,

original: nānāścaryasamāyuktaṃ śanair gacchan sa dṛṣṭavān /🔽kṛṣṇāṅgaṃ raktanetraṃ tu sthūlaśailasamānakam // / //
analyzed: nānā āścarya samāyuktam śanais gacchan sa dṛṣṭavān  kṛṣṇa aṅgam rakta netram tu sthūla śaila samānakam
translated: he proceeded slowly, beholding a forest full of various wonders.🔽He saw a demon with a dark body, red eyes, and a form like a huge mountain,

original: śubhradaṃṣṭraṃ mahābāhuṃ saṃdhyāghanaśiroruham /🔽meghasvanaṃ sāparādhaṃ śaraṃ saṃdhāya rāghavaḥ // / //
analyzed: śubhra daṃṣṭram mahā bāhum saṃdhyā ghana śiroruham  megha svanam sa aparādham śaram saṃdhāya rāghavaḥ
translated: with white teeth, long arms, and hair like evening clouds.

original: vivyādha rākṣasaṃ krodhāl lakṣmaṇena saha prabhuḥ /
analyzed: vivyādha rākṣasam krodhāt lakṣmaṇena saha prabhuḥ
translated: The lord Rama, along with Lakshmana, angrily pierced the guilty demon with an arrow,

original: anyair avadhyaṃ hatvā taṃ girigarte mahātanum // / //
analyzed: anyaiḥ avadhyam hatvā tam giri garte mahā tanum
translated: whose body was huge in a mountain cave, which could not be killed by others.

original: śilābhiś chādya gatavāñ śarabhaṅgāśramaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: śilābhiḥ chādya gatavām śarabhaṅga āśramam tatas
translated: Having killed him, he covered him with rocks and then went to Sharabhanga's hermitage.

original: taṃ natvā tatra viśramya tatkathātuṣṭamānasaḥ // / //
analyzed: tam natvā tatra viśramya tad kathā tuṣṭa mānasaḥ
translated: Having bowed to him there and rested, with a mind pleased by his stories,

original: tīkṣṇāśramam upāgamya dṛṣṭavāṃs taṃ mahāmunim /
analyzed: tīkṣṇa āśramam upāgamya dṛṣṭavān tam mahā munim
translated: he went to Teekhshna's hermitage and saw that great sage.

original: tenādiṣṭena mārgeṇa gatvāgastyaṃ dadarśa ha // / //
analyzed: tena ādiṣṭena mārgeṇa gatvā agastyam dadarśa ha
translated: Instructed by him, he went and saw Agastya.

original: khaḍgaṃ tu vimalaṃ tasmād avāpa raghunandanaḥ /
analyzed: khaḍgam tu vimalam tasmāt avāpa raghunandanaḥ
translated: From him, the descendant of Raghu obtained a clear sword,

original: iṣudhi cākṣayaśaraṃ cāpaṃ caiva tu vaiṣṇavam // / //
analyzed: iṣudhi ca akṣaya śaram cāpam ca eva tu vaiṣṇavam
translated: an inexhaustible quiver, and a bow belonging to Vishnu.

original: tato 'gastyāśramād rāmo bhrātṛbhāryāsamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas gastya āśramāt rāmaḥ bhrātṛ bhāryā samanvitaḥ
translated: Then, Rama, along with his brothers and wife, left Agastya's hermitage.

original: godāvaryāḥ samīpe tu pañcavaṭyām uvāsa saḥ // / //
analyzed: godāvaryāḥ samīpe tu pañcavaṭyām uvāsa saḥ
translated: He stayed near Godavari, in Panchavati.

original: tato jaṭāyur abhyetya rāmaṃ kamalalocanam /
analyzed: tatas jaṭāyuḥ abhyetya rāmam kamala locanam
translated: Then Jatayu, the leader of the vultures, approached the lotus-eyed Rama.

original: natvā svakulam ākhyāya sthitavān gṛdhranāyakaḥ // / //
analyzed: natvā sva kulam ākhyāya sthitavān gṛdhra nāyakaḥ
translated: After paying homage and narrating his lineage, he remained there.

original: rāmo 'pi tatra taṃ dṛṣṭvā ātmavṛttaṃ viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ pi tatra tam dṛṣṭvā ātma vṛttam viśeṣataḥ
translated: Rama, seeing him there, told him his story in detail.

original: kathayitvā tu taṃ prāha sītāṃ rakṣa mahāmate // / //
analyzed: kathayitvā tu tam prāha sītām rakṣa mahāmate
translated: And having told him, he said, O greatly wise one, protect Sita.

original: ityukto 'sau jaṭāyus tu rāmam āliṅgya sādaram /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sau jaṭāyuḥ tu rāmam āliṅgya sa ādaram
translated: Thus addressed, Jatayu, embracing Rama with affection,

original: kāryārthaṃ tu gate rāme bhrātrā saha vanāntaram // / //
analyzed: kārya artham tu gate rāme bhrātrā saha vana antaram
translated: when Rama had gone to the forest with his brother for the sake of his duty,

original: ahaṃ rakṣyāmi te bhāryāṃ sthīyatām atra śobhana /
analyzed: aham rakṣyāmi te bhāryām sthīyatām atra śobhana
translated: he said, I will protect your wife. Stay here, O handsome one.

original: ity uktvā gatavān rāmaṃ gṛdhrarājaḥ svam āśramam // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā gatavān rāmam gṛdhra rājaḥ svam āśramam
translated: Having said this, the king of vultures went to Rama's hermitage.

original: samīpe dakṣiṇe bhāge nānāpakṣiniṣevite /
analyzed: samīpe dakṣiṇe bhāge nānā pakṣi niṣevite
translated: On the southern side, frequented by various birds,

original: vasantaṃ rāghavaṃ tatra sītayā saha sundaram // / //
analyzed: vasantam rāghavam tatra sītayā saha sundaram
translated: there Rama, the handsome one, dwelt with Sita.

original: manmathākārasadṛśaṃ kathayantaṃ mahākathāḥ /
analyzed: manmatha ākāra sadṛśam kathayantam mahā kathāḥ
translated: He, resembling the form of Kama, told great stories.

original: kṛtvā māyāmayaṃ rūpaṃ lāvaṇyaguṇasaṃyutam // / //
analyzed: kṛtvā māyā mayam rūpam lāvaṇya guṇa saṃyutam
translated: Having assumed a magical form endowed with the qualities of loveliness,🔽he said to Rama, O Rama, I will protect your wife.

original: madanākrāntahṛdayā kadācid rāvaṇānujā /
analyzed: madana ākrānta hṛdayā kadācid rāvaṇa anujā
translated: Once, with her heart overwhelmed by passion, Ravana's younger sister,

original: gāyantī susvaraṃ gītaṃ śanair āgatya rākṣasī // / //
analyzed: gāyantī su svaram gītam śanais āgatya rākṣasī
translated: the rakshasi, slowly approached, singing a beautiful song,

original: dadarśa rāmam āsīnaṃ kānane sītayā saha /
analyzed: dadarśa rāmam āsīnam kānane sītayā saha
translated: and saw Rama seated in the forest with Sita.

original: atha śūrpaṇakhā ghorā māyārūpadharā śubhā // / //
analyzed: atha śūrpaṇakhā ghorā māyā rūpa dharā śubhā
translated: Then the terrible and beautiful Shurpanakha, assuming a magical form,

original: niḥśaṅkā duṣṭacittā sā rāghavaṃ pratyabhāṣata /
analyzed: niḥśaṅkā duṣṭa cittā sā rāghavam pratyabhāṣata
translated: fearlessly and with evil intent, spoke to Raghava:

original: bhaja māṃ kānta kalyāṇīṃ bhajantīṃ kāminīm iha // / //
analyzed: bhaja mām kānta kalyāṇīm bhajantīm kāminīm iha
translated: Worship me, O lover, a beautiful and desirable woman here, who is worshipping you.

original: bhajamānāṃ tyajed yas tu tasya doṣo mahān bhavet /
analyzed: bhajamānām tyajet yaḥ tu tasya doṣaḥ mahān bhavet
translated: If one abandons a woman who is worshipping him, that would be a great fault.

original: ityuktaḥ śūrpaṇakhayā rāmas tām āha pārthivaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ śūrpaṇakhayā rāmaḥ tām āha pārthivaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Shurpanakha, Rama, the king, said to her:

original: kalatravān ahaṃ bāle kanīyāṃsaṃ bhajasva me /
analyzed: kalatravān aham bāle kanīyāṃsam bhajasva me
translated: I have a wife, O maiden. Worship my younger brother.

original: iti śrutvā tataḥ prāha rākṣasī kāmarūpiṇī // / //
analyzed: iti śrutvā tatas prāha rākṣasī kāmarūpiṇī
translated: Hearing this, the rakshasi, who could assume any form at will, said:

original: atīva nipuṇā cāhaṃ ratikarmaṇi rāghava /
analyzed: atīva nipuṇā ca aham rati karmaṇi rāghava
translated: O Raghava, I am extremely skilled in the art of love-making.

original: tyaktvainām anabhijñāṃ tvaṃ sītāṃ māṃ bhaja śobhanam // / //
analyzed: tyaktvā enām anabhijñām tvam sītām mām bhaja śobhanam
translated: Abandoning this ignorant Sita, worship me, it will be splendid.

original: ity ākarṇya vacaḥ prāha rāmas tāṃ dharmatatparaḥ /
analyzed: iti ākarṇya vacaḥ prāha rāmaḥ tām dharma tatparaḥ
translated: Hearing this, Rama, devoted to dharma, said to her:

original: parastriyaṃ na gacche 'haṃ tvam ito gaccha lakṣmaṇam // / //
analyzed: para striyam na gacche ham tvam itas gaccha lakṣmaṇam
translated: I do not go to another's wife. Go from here to Lakshmana.

original: tasya nātra vane bhāryā tvām asau saṃgrahīṣyati /
analyzed: tasya na atra vane bhāryā tvām asau saṃgrahīṣyati
translated: He will not keep you as his wife in this forest.

original: ityuktā sā punaḥ prāha rāmaṃ rājīvalocanam // / //
analyzed: iti uktā sā punar prāha rāmam rājīva locanam
translated: Thus addressed, she again spoke to Rama, the lotus-eyed one:

original: yathā syāl lakṣmaṇo bhartā tathā tvaṃ dehi patrakam /
analyzed: yathā syāt lakṣmaṇaḥ bhartā tathā tvam dehi patrakam
translated: Give me the letter in such a way that Lakshmana becomes my husband.

original: tathaivam uktvā matimān rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ // / //
analyzed: tathā evam uktvā matimān rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: Having said this, the wise Rama, the lotus-eyed one,

original: chindhy asyā nāsikām iti moktavyā nātra saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: chindhi asyāḥ nāsikām iti moktavyā na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Cut off her nose. She should be released, there is no doubt about it.

original: iti rāmo mahārājo likhya patraṃ pradattavān // / //
analyzed: iti rāmaḥ mahā rājaḥ likhya patram pradattavān
translated: Thus spoke the great king Rama, and gave the letter.

original: sā gṛhītvā tu tatpatraṃ gatvā tasmān mudānvitā /
analyzed: sā gṛhītvā tu tat patram gatvā tasmāt mudā anvitā
translated: She took that letter and went from there, filled with joy.

original: gatvā dattavatī tadval lakṣmaṇāya mahātmane // / //
analyzed: gatvā dattavatī tadvat lakṣmaṇāya mahātmane
translated: Having gone, she gave it in the same way to the great-souled Lakshmana.

original: tāṃ dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇaḥ prāha rākṣasīṃ kāmarūpiṇīm /
analyzed: tām dṛṣṭvā lakṣmaṇaḥ prāha rākṣasīm kāmarūpiṇīm
translated: Seeing her, Lakshmana said to the demoness who could assume any form at will:

original: na laṅghyaṃ raghavavaco mayā tiṣṭhātmakaśmale // / //
analyzed: na laṅghyam raghava vacaḥ mayā tiṣṭha ātma kaśmale
translated: The words of the Raghus should not be transgressed by me. Stay, O you of sinful mind.

original: tāṃ pragṛhya tataḥ khaḍgam udyamya vimalaṃ sudhīḥ /
analyzed: tām pragṛhya tatas khaḍgam udyamya vimalam sudhīḥ
translated: Having seized her, the wise one raised his sharp and clear sword.

original: tena tatkarṇanāsāṃ tu viccheda tilakāṇḍavat // / //
analyzed: tena tad karṇa nāsām tu viccheda tila kāṇḍa vat
translated: With that, he cut off her ears and nose like sesamum seeds.

original: chinnanāsā tataḥ sā tu ruroda bhṛśaduḥkhitā /
analyzed: chinna nāsā tatas sā tu ruroda bhṛśa duḥkhitā
translated: Then she, with her nose cut off, wept in great sorrow.

original: hā daśāsya mama bhrātaḥ sarvadevavimardaka // / //
analyzed: hā daśa asya mama bhrātar sarva deva vimardaka
translated: Alas, O ten-headed brother, the oppressor of all the gods!

original: hā kaṣṭaṃ kumbhakarṇādyāyātā me cāpadā parā /
analyzed: hā kaṣṭam kumbhakarṇa adya āyātā me ca āpadā parā
translated: Alas, misfortune! The greatest calamity has befallen me, with Kumbhakarna and others coming.

original: hā hā kaṣṭaṃ guṇanidhe vibhīṣaṇa mahāmate // / //
analyzed: hā hā kaṣṭam guṇa nidhe vibhīṣaṇa mahāmate
translated: Alas, alas, misfortune! O Vibhishana, a treasure of virtues, O greatly wise one!

original: ity evam ārtā rudatī sā gatvā kharadūṣaṇau /
analyzed: iti evam ārtā rudatī sā gatvā khara dūṣaṇau
translated: Thus lamenting and weeping, she went to Khara and Dushana.

original: triśirasaṃ ca sā dṛṣṭvā nivedyātmaparābhavam // / //
analyzed: triśirasam ca sā dṛṣṭvā nivedya ātma parābhavam
translated: Having seen Trishira and reported her own defeat, she...

original: rāmam āha janasthāne bhrātrā saha mahābalam /
analyzed: rāmam āha janasthāne bhrātrā saha mahā balam
translated: Spoke to Rama in Janasthana, along with his greatly powerful brother.

original: jñātvā te rāghavaṃ kruddhāḥ ūrjitān // / //
analyzed: jñātvā te rāghavam kruddhāḥ preṣayāmasuḥ ūrjitān
translated: Having known that Raghava was angry, they...

original: caturdaśasahasrāṇi rākṣasānāṃ balīyasām /
analyzed: caturdaśa sahasrāṇi rākṣasānām balīyasām
translated: Fourteen thousand powerful rakshasas,

original: agre nijagmus tenaiva rakṣasāṃ nāyakās trayaḥ // / //
analyzed: agre nijagmuḥ tena eva rakṣasām nāyakāḥ trayaḥ
translated: The three leaders of the rakshasas went ahead with him...

original: rāvaṇena niyuktās te puraiva tu mahābalāḥ /
analyzed: rāvaṇena niyuktāḥ te purā eva tu mahā balāḥ
translated: Appointed by Ravana earlier, those greatly powerful ones,

original: mahābalaparīvārā janasthānam upāgatāḥ // / //🔽krodhena mahatāviṣṭā dṛṣṭvā tāṃ chinnanāsikām /
analyzed: mahā bala parīvārāḥ janasthānam upāgatāḥ  krodhena mahatā āviṣṭāḥ dṛṣṭvā tām chinna nāsikām
translated: Surrounded by a great army, arrived at Janasthana...🔽Possessed by great anger, seeing his sister,

original: rudatīm aśrudigdhāṅgīṃ bhaginīṃ rāvaṇasya tu // / //
analyzed: rudatīm aśru digdha aṅgīm bhaginīm rāvaṇasya tu
translated: Ravana's sister, weeping with tears streaming down her face and her nose cut off...

original: rāmo 'pi tadbalaṃ dṛṣṭvā rākṣasānāṃ balīyasām /
analyzed: rāmaḥ u pi tat balam dṛṣṭvā rākṣasānām balīyasām
translated: Rama too, seeing that army of powerful rakshasas,

original: saṃsthāpya lakṣmaṇaṃ tatra sītāyā rakṣaṇaṃ prati // / //
analyzed: saṃsthāpya lakṣmaṇam tatra sītāyāḥ rakṣaṇam prati
translated: Having stationed Lakshmana there for the protection of Sita...

original: gatvā tu prahitais tatra rākṣasair baladarpitaiḥ /
analyzed: gatvā tu prahitaiḥ tatra rākṣasaiḥ bala darpitaiḥ
translated: Having gone there, the rakshasas sent by him, proud of their strength,

original: caturdaśasahasraṃ tu rākṣasānāṃ mahābalam // / //
analyzed: caturdaśa sahasram tu rākṣasānām mahā balam
translated: And fourteen thousand extremely powerful demons.

original: kṣaṇena nihataṃ tena śarair agniśikhopamaiḥ /
analyzed: kṣaṇena nihatam tena śaraiḥ agni śikhā upamaiḥ
translated: In an instant, they were killed by him with arrows resembling the flames of fire.

original: kharaś ca nihatas tena dūṣaṇaś ca mahābalaḥ // / //
analyzed: kharaḥ ca nihataḥ tena dūṣaṇaḥ ca mahā balaḥ
translated: Khara was killed by him, and the greatly powerful Dushana...

original: triśirāś ca mahāroṣād raṇe rāmeṇa pātitaḥ /
analyzed: triśirāḥ ca mahā roṣāt raṇe rāmeṇa pātitaḥ
translated: And Trishira was brought down in battle by Rama out of great rage.

original: hatvā tān rākṣasān duṣṭān rāmaś cāśramam āviśat // / //
analyzed: hatvā tān rākṣasān duṣṭān rāmaḥ ca āśramam āviśat
translated: Having killed those wicked demons, Rama entered the hermitage...

original: śūrpaṇakhā ca rudatī rāvaṇāntikam āgatā /
analyzed: śūrpaṇakhā ca rudatī rāvaṇa antikam āgatā
translated: And Shurpanakha, weeping, came to Ravana.

original: chinnanāsāṃ ca tāṃ dṛṣṭvā rāvaṇo bhaginīṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: chinna nāsām ca tām dṛṣṭvā rāvaṇaḥ bhaginīm tadā
translated: And seeing his sister with her nose cut off, Ravana...

original: mārīcaṃ prāha durbuddhiḥ sītāharaṇakarmaṇi /
analyzed: mārīcam prāha durbuddhiḥ sītā haraṇa karmaṇi
translated: The evil-minded one spoke to Maricha about the task of abducting Sita.

original: puṣpakeṇa vimānena gatvāhaṃ tvaṃ ca mātula // / //
analyzed: puṣpakeṇa vimānena gatvā aham tvam ca mātula
translated: O uncle, having gone there by the Pushpaka chariot, you and I...

original: janasthānasamīpe tu sthitvā tatra mamājñayā /
analyzed: janasthāna samīpe tu sthitvā tatra mama ājñayā
translated: Having stayed near Janasthana, there, at my command,

original: sauvarṇamṛgarūpaṃ tvam āsthāya tu śanaiḥ śanaiḥ // / //
analyzed: sauvarṇa mṛga rūpam tvam āsthāya tu śanais śanais
translated: you should slowly assume the form of a golden deer...

original: gaccha tvaṃ tatra kāryārthaṃ yatra sītā vyavasthitā /
analyzed: gaccha tvam tatra kārya artham yatra sītā vyavasthitā
translated: You go there for the purpose, where Sita is situated.

original: dṛṣṭvā sā mṛgapotaṃ tvāṃ sauvarṇaṃ tvayi mātula // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā sā mṛga potam tvām sauvarṇam tvayi mātula
translated: Seeing you, the golden fawn, O uncle, Sita...

original: spṛhāṃ kariṣyate rāmaṃ preṣayiṣyati bandhane /
analyzed: spṛhām kariṣyate rāmam preṣayiṣyati bandhane
translated: will arouse desire for you and will send Rama to capture you.🔽Having killed Rama, the best of men, and Lakshmana, the son of the king of Vidarbha, I will enjoy the kingdom of the demons.

original: tadvākyāt tatra gachantaṃ dhāvasva gahane vane // / //
analyzed: tad vākyāt tatra gacchantam dhāvasva gahane vane
translated: At his words, run in the dense forest as he goes there.

original: lakṣmaṇasyāpakarṣārthaṃ vaktavyaṃ vāgudīraṇam /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇasya apakarṣa artham vaktavyam vāc udīraṇam
translated: To remove Lakshmana, the words to be spoken should be uttered.

original: tataḥ puṣpakam āruhya māyārūpeṇa cāpy aham // / //
analyzed: tatas puṣpakam āruhya māyā rūpeṇa ca api aham
translated: Then, having mounted Pushpaka, and also with a magical form, I...

original: tāṃ sītām aham āneṣye tasyām āsaktamānasaḥ /
analyzed: tām sītām aham āneṣye tasyām āsakta mānasaḥ
translated: With my mind attached to her, I will bring back that Sita.

original: tvam api svecchayā paścād āgamiṣyasi śobhana // / //
analyzed: tvam api sva icchayā paścāt āgamiṣyasi śobhana
translated: You too, O beautiful one, will come later at your own will...

original: ityukte rāvaṇenātha mārīco vākyam abravīt /
analyzed: iti ukte rāvaṇena atha mārīcaḥ vākyam abravīt
translated: When this was said by Ravana, Maricha spoke these words:

original: tvam eva gaccha pāpiṣṭha nāhaṃ gacchāmi tatra vai // / //
analyzed: tvam eva gaccha pāpiṣṭha na aham gacchāmi tatra vai
translated: You yourself go, O most sinful one, I will not go there...

original: puraivānena rāmeṇa vyathito 'haṃ muner makhe /
analyzed: purā eva anena rāmeṇa vyathitaḥ ham muneḥ makhe
translated: I have already been afflicted by this Rama in the sage's sacrifice.

original: ityuktavati mārīce rāvaṇaḥ krodhamūrcchitaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktavati mārīce rāvaṇaḥ krodha mūrcchitaḥ
translated: When Maricha said this, Ravana, overwhelmed with anger...

original: mārīcaṃ hantum ārebhe mārīco 'py āha rāvaṇam /
analyzed: mārīcam hantum ārebhe mārīcaḥ u pi āha rāvaṇam
translated: began to kill Maricha. Maricha also said to Ravana:

original: tava hastavadhād vīra rāmeṇa maraṇaṃ varam // / //
analyzed: tava hasta vadhāt vīra rāmeṇa maraṇam varam
translated: O hero, death at the hands of Rama is better than being killed by you...

original: ahaṃ gamiṣyāmi tatra yatra tvaṃ netum icchasi /
analyzed: aham gamiṣyāmi tatra yatra tvam netum icchasi
translated: I will go there where you wish to take me.

original: atha puṣpakam āruhya janasthānam upāgataḥ // / //
analyzed: atha puṣpakam āruhya janasthānam upāgataḥ
translated: Then, having mounted Pushpaka, he went to Janasthana...

original: mārīcas tatra sauvarṇaṃ mṛgam āsthāya cāgrataḥ /
analyzed: mārīcaḥ tatra sauvarṇam mṛgam āsthāya ca agratas
translated: Maricha, having taken up a golden deer in front,

original: jagāma yatra sā sītā vartate janakātmajā // / //
analyzed: jagāma yatra sā sītā vartate janakātmajā
translated: went to the place where Sita, the daughter of Janaka, was staying.

original: sauvarṇaṃ mṛgapotaṃ tu dṛṣṭvā sītā yaśasvinī /
analyzed: sauvarṇam mṛga potam tu dṛṣṭvā sītā yaśasvinī
translated: The illustrious Sita, seeing a golden fawn,
