original: bhāvikarmavaśād rāmam uvāca patim ātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhāvi karma vaśāt rāmam uvāca patim ātmanaḥ
translated: due to the power of her future karma, spoke to her husband Rama:

original: gṛhītvā dehi sauvarṇaṃ mṛgapotaṃ nṛpātmaja /
analyzed: gṛhītvā dehi sauvarṇam mṛga potam nṛpa ātmaja
translated: O prince, take and give me this golden fawn.

original: ayodhāyāṃ tu madgehe krīḍanārtham idaṃ mama // / //
analyzed: ayodhāyām tu mad gehe krīḍana artham idam mama
translated: This is for my play in my house, which is without warriors.

original: tayaivam ukto rāmas tu lakṣmaṇaṃ sthāpya tatra vai /
analyzed: tayā evam uktaḥ rāmaḥ tu lakṣmaṇam sthāpya tatra vai
translated: Thus addressed by her, Rama, leaving Lakshmana there,

original: rakṣaṇārthaṃ tu sītāyā gato 'sau mṛgapṛṣṭhatah // / //🔽rāmeṇa cānuyāto 'sau abhyadhāvad vane mṛgaḥ /
analyzed: rakṣaṇa artham tu sītāyāḥ gataḥ sau mṛga pṛṣṭhatas  rāmeṇa ca anuyātaḥ sau abhyadhāvat vane mṛgaḥ
translated: went after the deer, for the sake of protecting Sita.🔽The deer ran in the forest, followed by Rama.

original: tataḥ sareṇa vivyādha rāmas taṃ mṛgapotakam // / //
analyzed: tatas sareṇa vivyādha rāmaḥ tam mṛga potakam
translated: Then Rama pierced that young deer with an arrow.

original: hā lakṣmaṇeti coktvāsau nipapāta mahītale /
analyzed: hā lakṣmaṇa iti ca uktvā asau nipapāta mahī tale
translated: Having cried out Alas, Lakshmana! he fell down on the ground.

original: mārīcaḥ parvatākāras tena naṣṭo babhūva saḥ // / //
analyzed: mārīcaḥ parvata ākāraḥ tena naṣṭaḥ babhūva saḥ
translated: Maricha, who had the form of a mountain, disappeared then.

original: ākarṇya rudataḥ śabdaṃ sītā lakṣmaṇam abravīt /
analyzed: ākarṇya rudataḥ śabdam sītā lakṣmaṇam abravīt
translated: Hearing the sound of weeping, Sita said to Lakshmana:

original: gaccha lakṣmaṇa putra tvaṃ yatrāyaṃ śabda utthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: gaccha lakṣmaṇa putra tvam yatra ayam śabdaḥ utthitaḥ
translated: Go, Lakshmana, my son, to where this sound has arisen.

original: bhrātur jyeṣṭhasya tat tvaṃ vai rudataḥ śrūyate dhvaniḥ /
analyzed: bhrātuḥ jyeṣṭhasya tat tvam vai rudataḥ śrūyate dhvaniḥ
translated: The sound of your elder brother weeping is heard.

original: prāyo rāmasya saṃdehaṃ lakṣaye 'ham mahātmanaḥ // / //
analyzed: prāyas rāmasya saṃdeham lakṣaye ham mahātmanaḥ
translated: I think that the great Rama has mostly doubts.

original: ityuktaḥ sa tathā prāha lakṣmaṇas tām aninditām /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sa tathā prāha lakṣmaṇaḥ tām aninditām
translated: Thus addressed, Lakshmana said to that blameless one:

original: na hi rāmasya saṃdeho na bhayaṃ vidyate kvacit // / //
analyzed: na hi rāmasya saṃdehaḥ na bhayam vidyate kvacid
translated: Rama has no doubts and no fear anywhere.

original: iti bruvānaṃ taṃ sītā bhāvikarmabalād bhṛtam /
analyzed: iti bruvānam tam sītā bhāvi karma balāt bhṛtam
translated: Thus speaking, Sita, out of the power of her destined karma,

original: lakṣmaṇaṃ prāha vaidehī viruddhavacanaṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇam prāha vaidehī viruddha vacanam tadā
translated: spoke to Lakshmana, Vaidehi, with contradictory words then.

original: mṛte rāme tu mām icchann atas tvaṃ na gamiṣyasi /
analyzed: mṛte rāme tu mām icchan atas tvam na gamiṣyasi
translated: Desiring me only after Rama's death, you will not go from here.

original: ityuktaḥ sa vinītātmā asahann apriyaṃ vacaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ sa vinīta ātmā asahan apriyam vacaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the one with a humble soul, unable to bear the unpleasant words,

original: jagāma rāmam anveṣṭuṃ tadā pārthivanandanaḥ /
analyzed: jagāma rāmam anveṣṭum tadā pārthiva nandanaḥ
translated: the delight of the king, then went to search for Rama.

original: saṃnyāsaveṣam āsthāya rāvaṇo 'pi durātmavān // / //
analyzed: saṃnyāsa veṣam āsthāya rāvaṇaḥ durātmavān
translated: The evil-minded Ravana, having taken on the guise of an ascetic,

original: sa sītāpārśvam āsādya vacanaṃ cedam uktavān /
analyzed: sa sītā pārśvam āsādya vacanam ca idam uktavān
translated: approached Sita and spoke these words:

original: āgato bharataḥ śrīmān ayodhyāyā mahāmatiḥ // / //
analyzed: āgataḥ bharataḥ śrīmān ayodhyāyāḥ mahāmatiḥ
translated: The glorious and greatly wise Bharata has come from Ayodhya.

original: rāmeṇa saha saṃbhāṣya sthitavāṃs tatra kānane /
analyzed: rāmeṇa saha saṃbhāṣya sthitavān tatra kānane
translated: Having conversed with Rama, he has stayed there in the forest.

original: māṃ ca preṣitavān rāmo vimānam idam āruha // / //
analyzed: mām ca preṣitavān rāmaḥ vimānam idam āruha
translated: And Rama has sent me, saying 'Ascend this chariot.'

original: ayodhyāṃ yāti rāmas tu bharatena prasāditaḥ /
analyzed: ayodhyām yāti rāmaḥ tu bharatena prasāditaḥ
translated: Rama is going to Ayodhya, having been appeased by Bharata.

original: mṛgabālaṃ tu vaidehi krīḍārthaṃ te gṛhītavān // / //
analyzed: mṛga bālam tu vaidehi krīḍā artham te gṛhītavān
translated: O Vaidehi! I have taken this deer cub for your sport.

original: kleśitāsi mahāraṇye bahukālaṃ tvam īdṛśam /
analyzed: kleśitā asi mahā araṇye bahu kālam tvam īdṛśam
translated: You have been afflicted in this great forest for such a long time.

original: saṃprāptarājyas te bhartā rāmaḥ sa rucirānanaḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃprāpta rājyaḥ te bhartā rāmaḥ sa rucira ānanaḥ
translated: Your husband Rama, with a beautiful face, has attained the kingdom.

original: lakṣmaṇaś ca vinītātmā vimānam idam āruha /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ ca vinīta ātmā vimānam idam āruha
translated: O Lakshmana! With a humble mind, board this chariot.

original: ityuktā sā tathā gatvā nītā tena mahātmanā // / //
analyzed: iti uktā sā tathā gatvā nītā tena mahātmanā
translated: Thus addressed, she went there and was taken by that great soul.

original: āruroha vimānaṃ tu chadmanā preritā satī /
analyzed: āruroha vimānam tu chadmanā preritā satī
translated: She boarded the chariot, urged by the deception.

original: taj jagāma tataḥ śīghraṃ vimānaṃ dakṣiṇāṃ diśam // / //
analyzed: tat jagāma tatas śīghram vimānam dakṣiṇām diśam
translated: Then the chariot quickly went to the southern direction.

original: tataḥ sītā suduḥkhārtā vilalāpa suduḥkhitā /
analyzed: tatas sītā su duḥkha ārtā vilalāpa su duḥkhitā
translated: Then Sita, extremely afflicted with grief, lamented in great sorrow.

original: vimāne khe 'pi rodantyāś cakre sparśaṃ na rākṣasaḥ // / //
analyzed: vimāne khe rodantyāḥ cakre sparśam na rākṣasaḥ
translated: Even as she was crying in the sky in the chariot, the demon did not touch her.

original: rāvaṇaḥ svena rūpeṇa babhūvātha mahātanuḥ /
analyzed: rāvaṇaḥ svena rūpeṇa babhūva atha mahā tanuḥ
translated: Ravana then assumed his own form with a huge body.

original: daśagrīvaṃ mahākāyaṃ dṛṣṭvā sītā suduḥkhitā // / //
analyzed: daśagrīvam mahā kāyam dṛṣṭvā sītā su duḥkhitā
translated: Seeing the ten-headed one with a huge body, Sita was extremely afflicted with grief.

original: hā rāma vañcitādyāhaṃ kenāpi cchadmarūpiṇā /🔽rakṣasā ghorarūpeṇa trāyasveti bhayārditā // / //
analyzed: hā rāma vañcitā adya aham kena api chadma rūpiṇā  rakṣasā ghora rūpeṇa trāyasva iti bhaya arditā
translated: O Rama! I have been deceived today by someone in a deceptive form,🔽By a demon of a terrible form. Please save me. She was terrified.

original: he lakṣmaṇa mahābāho māṃ hi duṣṭena rakṣasā /
analyzed: he lakṣmaṇa mahā bāho mām hi duṣṭena rakṣasā
translated: O Lakshmana! O mighty-armed one! This wicked demon

original: drutam āgatya rakṣasva nīyamānām athākulām // / //
analyzed: drutam āgatya rakṣasva nīyamānām atha ākulām
translated: Quickly come and save me, as I am being carried away, distressed.

original: evaṃ pralapamānāyāḥ sītāyās tan mahat svanam /
analyzed: evam pralapamānāyāḥ sītāyāḥ tat mahat svanam
translated: Hearing Sita's loud cries as she lamented thus,

original: ākarṇya gṛdhrarājas tu jaṭāyus tatra cāgataḥ // / //
analyzed: ākarṇya gṛdhra rājaḥ tu jaṭāyuḥ tatra ca āgataḥ
translated: the king of vultures, Jatayu, came there.

original: tiṣṭha rāvaṇa duṣṭātman muñca muñcātra maithilīm /
analyzed: tiṣṭha rāvaṇa duṣṭa ātman muñca muñca atra maithilīm
translated: Stay, O Ravana, O wicked-souled one, release, release this Maithili.

original: ity uktvā yuyudhe tena jaṭāyus tatra vīryavān // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā yuyudhe tena jaṭāyuḥ tatra vīryavān
translated: Saying this, the valiant Jatayu fought with him there.

original: pakṣābhyāṃ jaṭāyus tasya vakṣasi /
analyzed: pakṣābhyām tāḍayāmasa jaṭāyuḥ tasya vakṣasi
translated: Jatayu struck him on the chest with his wings.

original: tāḍayantaṃ tu taṃ matvā balavān iti rāvaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: tāḍayantam tu tam matvā balavān iti rāvaṇaḥ
translated: But considering him to be powerful, Ravana

original: tuṇḍacañcuprahārais tu bhṛśaṃ tena prapīḍitaḥ /
analyzed: tuṇḍa cañcu prahāraiḥ tu bhṛśam tena prapīḍitaḥ
translated: was severely afflicted by him with beak and claw strikes.

original: tata utthāpya vegena candrahāsam asiṃ mahat // / //
analyzed: tatas utthāpya vegena candra hāsam asim mahat
translated: Then, lifting him up with force, he raised his great sword Chandrahasa

original: jaghāna tena duṣṭātmā jaṭāyuṃ dharmacāriṇam /
analyzed: jaghāna tena duṣṭa ātmā jaṭāyum dharma cāriṇam
translated: and with it the wicked-souled one struck Jatayu, who followed dharma.

original: nipapāta mahīpṛṣṭhe jaṭāyuḥ kṣīṇacetanaḥ // / //
analyzed: nipapāta mahī pṛṣṭhe jaṭāyuḥ kṣīṇa cetanaḥ
translated: Jatayu fell to the ground, his consciousness fading.

original: uvāca ca daśagrīvaṃ duṣṭātman na tvayā hataḥ /
analyzed: uvāca ca daśagrīvam duṣṭa ātman na tvayā hataḥ
translated: And he said to Dashagriva, O wicked-souled one, you have not killed me.

original: candrahāsasya vīryeṇa hato 'haṃ rākṣasādhama // / //
analyzed: candrahāsasya vīryeṇa hataḥ ham rākṣasa adhama
translated: O worst of rakshasas, I have been killed by the power of Chandrahasa.

original: nirāyudhaṃ ko hanen mūḍha sāyudhas tvām ṛte janaḥ /
analyzed: nirāyudham kaḥ hanet mūḍha sa āyudhaḥ tvām ṛte janaḥ
translated: O fool, who but you, armed, would strike one unarmed?

original: sītāpaharaṇaṃ viddhi mṛtyus te duṣṭa rākṣasa // / //
analyzed: sītā apaharaṇam viddhi mṛtyuḥ te duṣṭa rākṣasa
translated: Know that the abduction of Sita is your death, O wicked demon.

original: duṣṭa rāvaṇa rāmas tvāṃ vadhiṣyati na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: duṣṭa rāvaṇa rāmaḥ tvām vadhiṣyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O wicked Ravana, Rama will kill you, there is no doubt.

original: rudatī duḥkhaśokārtā jaṭāyuṃ prāha maithilī // / //
analyzed: rudatī duḥkha śoka ārtā jaṭāyum prāha maithilī
translated: Weeping and afflicted with grief and sorrow, Maithili said to Jatayu:

original: matkṛte maraṇam yasmāt tvayā prāptaṃ dvijottama /
analyzed: mad kṛte maraṇam yasmāt tvayā prāptam dvijottama
translated: O best of birds, since you have attained death for my sake,

original: tasmād rāmaprasādena viṣṇulokam avāpsyasi // / //
analyzed: tasmāt rāma prasādena viṣṇu lokam avāpsyasi
translated: therefore, by the grace of Rama, you will attain Vishnu's world.

original: yāvad rāmeṇa saṅgas te bhaviṣyati mahādvija /
analyzed: yāvat rāmeṇa saṅgaḥ te bhaviṣyati mahā dvija
translated: O great bird, as long as you will have contact with Rama,

original: tāvat tiṣṭhantu te prāṇā ity uktvā tu khagottamam // / //
analyzed: tāvat tiṣṭhantu te prāṇāḥ iti uktvā tu khaga uttamam
translated: let your life remain. Having said this to the best of birds,

original: tatas tāny arpitāny aṅgād bhūṣaṇāni vimucya sā /
analyzed: tatas tāni arpitāni aṅgāt bhūṣaṇāni vimucya sā
translated: then she removed the ornaments that were placed on her body,

original: śīghraṃ nibadhya vastreṇa rāmahastaṃ gamiṣyatha // / //
analyzed: śīghram nibadhya vastreṇa rāma hastam gamiṣyatha
translated: and quickly tying them in a cloth, you will go to Rama's hand.

original: ity uktvā bhūmau sītā suduḥkhitā /
analyzed: iti uktvā pātayāmasa bhūmau sītā su duḥkhitā
translated: Having said this, the sorrowful Sita fell down on the ground.

original: evaṃ hṛtvā sa sītāṃ tu jaṭāyuṃ pātya bhūtale // / //🔽puṣpakeṇa gataḥ śīghraṃ laṅkāṃ duṣṭaniśācaraḥ /🔽aśokavanikāmadhye sthāpayitvā sa maithilīm // / //
analyzed: evam hṛtvā sa sītām tu jaṭāyum pātya bhū tale  puṣpakeṇa gataḥ śīghram laṅkām duṣṭa niśācaraḥ  aśoka vanikā madhye sthāpayitvā sa maithilīm
translated: Thus having abducted Sita and throwing Jatayu on the ground,🔽the wicked demon quickly went to Lanka by Pushpaka.🔽Having placed Maithili in the middle of the Asokavana,

original: imām atraiva rakṣadhvaṃ rākṣasyo vikṛtānanāḥ /
analyzed: imām atra eva rakṣadhvam rākṣasyaḥ vikṛta ānanāḥ
translated: Keep her here only, O demonesses with disfigured faces.

original: ity ādiśya gṛhaṃ yāto rāvaṇo rākṣaseśvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: iti ādiśya gṛham yātaḥ rāvaṇaḥ rākṣaseśvaraḥ
translated: Having thus commanded, Ravana, the lord of the rakshasas, went home.

original: laṅkānivāsinaś cocur ekāntaṃ ca parasparam /
analyzed: laṅkā nivāsinaḥ ca ūcuḥ ekāntam ca parasparam
translated: And the residents of Lanka said to each other in private:

original: asyāḥ puryā vināśārthaṃ sthāpiteyaṃ durātmanā // / //
analyzed: asyāḥ puryāḥ vināśa artham sthāpitā iyam durātmanā
translated: This one has been placed by the evil-minded one for the destruction of this city.

original: rākṣasībhir virūpābhī rakṣyamāṇā samantataḥ /
analyzed: rākṣasībhiḥ virūpābhiḥ rakṣyamāṇā samantataḥ
translated: Protected all around by ugly rakshasis.

original: sītā ca duḥkhitā tatra smarantī rāmam eva sā // / //
analyzed: sītā ca duḥkhitā tatra smarantī rāmam eva sā
translated: And Sita, afflicted with grief, remembering Rama alone,

original: uvāsa sā suduḥkhārtā duḥkhitā rudatī bhṛśam /
analyzed: uvāsa sā su duḥkha ārtā duḥkhitā rudatī bhṛśam
translated: Lived there, extremely miserable, sorrowful and weeping bitterly.

original: yathā jñānakhale devī haṃsayānā sarasvatī // / //
analyzed: yathā jñāna khale devī haṃsa yānā sarasvatī
translated: Just as Goddess Saraswati, seated on a swan, was placed by the evil-minded one for the destruction of knowledge.

original: sugrīvabhṛtyā harayaś caturaś ca yadṛcchayā /
analyzed: sugrīva bhṛtyāḥ harayaḥ caturaḥ ca yadṛcchayā
translated: And the four monkeys, servants of Sugriva, by chance,

original: vastrabaddhaṃ tayotsṛṣṭaṃ gṛhītvā bhūṣaṇaṃ drutam // / //
analyzed: vastra baddham tayā utsṛṣṭam gṛhītvā bhūṣaṇam drutam
translated: Seizing the ornament released by her, bound in a cloth,

original: svabhartre vinivedyocuḥ sugrīvāya mahātmane /
analyzed: sva bhartre vinivedya ūcuḥ sugrīvāya mahātmane
translated: And informing their master, they told the great-souled Sugriva:

original: araṇye 'bhūn mahāyuddhaṃ jaṭāyo rāvaṇasya ca // / //
analyzed: araṇye bhūt mahā yuddham jaṭāyoḥ rāvaṇasya ca
translated: There was a great battle in the forest between Jatayu and Ravana.

original: atha rāmaś ca taṃ hatvā mārīcaṃ māyayāgatam /
analyzed: atha rāmaḥ ca tam hatvā mārīcam māyayā āgatam
translated: Then Rama, having killed Maricha who had come through illusion,

original: nivṛtto lakṣaṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā tena gatvā svam āśramam // / //
analyzed: nivṛttaḥ lakṣaṇam dṛṣṭvā tena gatvā svam āśramam
translated: Returned, seeing the sign, and having gone with him to his hermitage,

original: sītām apaśyan duḥkhārtaḥ praruroda sa rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: sītām a paśyan duḥkha ārtaḥ praruroda sa rāghavaḥ
translated: Rama, not seeing Sita, wept in sorrow.

original: lakṣmaṇaś ca mahātejā ruroda bhṛśaduḥkhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ ca mahā tejāḥ ruroda bhṛśa duḥkhitaḥ
translated: And the greatly energetic Lakshmana also wept, being extremely sorrowful.

original: bahuprakāram asvasthaṃ rudantaṃ rāghavaṃ tadā /
analyzed: bahu prakāram asvastham rudantam rāghavam tadā
translated: When Raghava was lying on the ground, weeping in many ways, feeling unwell,

original: bhūtale patitaṃ dhīmān utthāpyāśvāsya lakṣmaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhū tale patitam dhīmān utthāpya āśvāsya lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: the wise Lakshmana raised him up and comforted him.

original: uvāca vacanaṃ prāptaṃ tadā yat tac chṛṇuṣva me /
analyzed: uvāca vacanam prāptam tadā yat tat śṛṇuṣva me
translated: Listen to the words he spoke then, which are appropriate.

original: ativelaṃ mahārāja na śokaṃ kartum arhasi // / //
analyzed: ativelam mahā rāja na śokam kartum arhasi
translated: O great king, you should not grieve excessively. . . .

original: uttiṣṭhottiṣṭha śīghraṃ tvaṃ sītāṃ mṛgayituṃ prabho /
analyzed: uttiṣṭha uttiṣṭha śīghram tvam sītām mṛgayitum prabho
translated: Rise up, rise up quickly, O lord, to search for Sita.

original: ity evaṃ vadatā tena lakṣmaṇena mahātmanā // / //
analyzed: iti evam vadatā tena lakṣmaṇena mahātmanā
translated: Thus spoke the great-souled Lakshmana. . . .

original: utthāpito narapatir duḥkhito duḥkhitena tu /
analyzed: utthāpitaḥ narapatiḥ duḥkhitaḥ duḥkhitena tu
translated: The sorrowful king was raised up by his sorrowful brother.

original: bhrātrā saha jagāmātha sītāṃ mṛgayituṃ vanam // / //
analyzed: bhrātrā saha jagāma atha sītām mṛgayitum vanam
translated: Together with his brother, he went to the forest to search for Sita.

original: vanāni sarvāṇi viśodhya rāghavo girīn samastān girisānugocarān /
analyzed: vanāni sarvāṇi viśodhya rāghavaḥ girīn samastān giri sānu gocarān
translated: Having searched all the forests, the mountains and the mountain slopes,

original: tathā munīnām api cāśramān bahūṃs tṛṇādivallīgahaneṣu bhūmiṣu // / //
analyzed: tathā munīnām api ca āśramān bahūn tṛṇa ādi vallī gahaneṣu bhūmiṣu
translated: and also many hermitages of sages, in places overgrown with grass, creepers and vines,

original: nadītaṭe bhūvivare guhāyāṃ nirīkṣamāṇo 'pi mahānubhāvaḥ /
analyzed: nadī taṭe bhū vivare guhāyām nirīkṣamāṇaḥ pi mahā anubhāvaḥ
translated: the greatly illustrious one, even though searching on river banks, in holes in the ground and caves,🔽. . . .

original: priyām apaśyan bhṛśaduḥkhitas tadā jaṭāyuṣaṃ vīkṣya ca ghātitaṃ nṛpaḥ // / //
analyzed: priyām a paśyan bhṛśa duḥkhitaḥ tadā jaṭāyuṣam vīkṣya ca ghātitam nṛpaḥ
translated: Not seeing his beloved, the king was greatly distressed, and seeing Jatayu killed, he said:

original: aho bhavān kena hatas tvam īdṛśīṃ daśām avāpto 'si mṛto 'si jīvasi /
analyzed: aho bhavān kena hataḥ tvam īdṛśīm daśām avāptaḥ si mṛtaḥ si jīvasi
translated: Alas! By whom have you been struck? You have attained such a state, are you dead or alive?

original: mamādya sarvaṃ samaduḥkhitasya bhoḥ patnīviyogād iha cāgatasya vai // / //
analyzed: mama adya sarvam sama duḥkhitasya bhoḥ patnī viyogāt iha ca āgatasya vai
translated: All this to me today, who am equally sorrowful, who have come here due to separation from my wife.

original: ityuktamātre vihago 'tha kṛcchrād uvāca vācaṃ madhurāṃ tadānīm /
analyzed: iti ukta mātre vihagaḥ tha kṛcchrāt uvāca vācam madhurām tadānīm
translated: As soon as this was said, the bird then with difficulty spoke these sweet words at that time:

original: śṛṇuṣva rājan mama vṛttam atra vadāmi dṛṣṭaṃ ca kṛtaṃ ca sadyaḥ // / //
analyzed: śṛṇuṣva rājan mama vṛttam atra vadāmi dṛṣṭam ca kṛtam ca sadyas
translated: Listen, O king, to my account here, I will tell you what I have seen and done immediately.

original: daśānanas tām apanīya māyayā sītāṃ samāropya vimānam uttamam /
analyzed: daśānanaḥ tām apanīya māyayā sītām samāropya vimānam uttamam
translated: Ravana, having deceitfully abducted Sita, placed her on an excellent celestial chariot,

original: jagāma khe dakṣiṇadiṅmukho 'sau sītā ca mātā vilalāpa duḥkhitā // / //
analyzed: jagāma khe sītā ca mātā vilalāpa duḥkhitā
translated: and went in the southern direction through the sky. Sita, her mother, lamented in sorrow.

original: ākarṇya sītāsvanam āgato 'haṃ sītāṃ vimoktuṃ svabalena rāghava /
analyzed: ākarṇya sītā svanam āgataḥ ham sītām vimoktum sva balena rāghava
translated: Having heard Sita's voice, I came here to free Sita with my own strength, O Raghava.

original: yuddhaṃ ca tenāham atīva kṛtvā hataḥ punaḥ khaḍgabalena rakṣasā // / //
analyzed: yuddham ca tena aham atīva kṛtvā hataḥ punar khaḍga balena rakṣasā
translated: And having fought with him, I was again struck down by the demon with the strength of his sword.

original: vaidehivākyād iha jīvatā mayā dṛṣṭo bhavān svargam ito gamiṣye /
analyzed: vaidehi vākyāt iha jīvatā mayā dṛṣṭaḥ bhavān svargam itas gamiṣye
translated: By the words of Vaidehi, I have seen you alive here. I will go to heaven from here.

original: mā rāma śokaṃ kuru bhūmipāla jahy adya duṣṭaṃ sagaṇaṃ tu nairṛtam // / //
analyzed: mā rāma śokam kuru bhūmipāla jahi adya duṣṭam sa gaṇam tu nairṛtam
translated: O Rama! Do not grieve, O lord of the earth. Slay today the wicked demon with his followers.

original: rāmo jaṭāyuṣetyuktaḥ punas taṃ cāha śokataḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ jaṭāyuṣā iti uktaḥ punar tam ca āha śokataḥ
translated: Rama, addressed by Jatayu, again spoke to him out of sorrow:

original: svasty astu te dvijavara gatis tu paramāstu te // / //
analyzed: svasti astu te dvijavara gatiḥ tu paramā astu te
translated: May there be well-being to you, O best of the twice-born. May your ultimate destination be good.

original: tato jaṭāyuḥ svaṃ dehaṃ vihāya gatavān divam /
analyzed: tatas jaṭāyuḥ svam deham vihāya gatavān divam
translated: Then Jatayu, leaving his body, went to heaven,

original: vimānena tu ramyeṇa sevyamāno 'psarogaṇaiḥ // / //
analyzed: vimānena tu ramyeṇa psaraḥ gaṇaiḥ
translated: being served by groups of celestial nymphs in a beautiful celestial vehicle.

original: rāmo 'pi dagdhvā taddehaṃ snāto dattvā jalāñjalim /
analyzed: dagdhvā tad deham snātaḥ dattvā jala añjalim
translated: Rama too, having cremated his body, having bathed and offered water libations,

original: bhrātrā sa gacchan duḥkhārto rākṣasīṃ pathi dṛṣṭavān // / //
analyzed: bhrātrā sa gacchan duḥkha ārtaḥ rākṣasīm pathi dṛṣṭavān
translated: was going along with his brother, afflicted with grief, when he saw a demoness on the way.

original: udvamantīṃ maholkābhāṃ vivṛtāsyāṃ bhayaṃkarīm /
analyzed: udvamantīm mahā ulkā ābhām vivṛta āsyām bhayaṃkarīm
translated: Vomiting great fireballs, with her mouth wide open, terrifying,

original: kṣayaṃ nayantīṃ jantūn vai pātayitvā gato ruṣā // / //
analyzed: kṣayam nayantīm jantūn vai pātayitvā gataḥ ruṣā
translated: causing the destruction of creatures, he angrily struck her down and went on.

original: gacchan vanāntaraṃ rāmaḥ sa kabandhaṃ dadarśa ha /
analyzed: gacchan vana antaram rāmaḥ sa kabandham dadarśa ha
translated: Rama, going to another forest, saw Kabandha.

original: virūpaṃ jaṭharamukhaṃ dīrghabāhuṃ ghanastanam // / //
analyzed: virūpam jaṭhara mukham dīrgha bāhum ghana stanam
translated: Deformed, with a belly for a mouth, long arms, and thick breasts.

original: rundhānaṃ rāmamārgaṃ tu dṛṣṭvā taṃ dagdhavāñ śanaiḥ /
analyzed: rundhānam rāma mārgam tu dṛṣṭvā tam dagdhavām śanais
translated: Seeing him obstructing Rama's path, he slowly burned him.

original: dagdho 'sau divyarūpī tu khastho rāmam abhāṣata // / //
analyzed: dagdhaḥ sau divya rūpī tu kha sthaḥ rāmam abhāṣata
translated: He, being burned, in a divine form, standing in the sky, spoke to Rama:🔽O Rama! O best of the Raghus! I am a demon named Kabandha.

original: rāma rāma mahābāho tvayā mama mahāmate /🔽virūpaṃ nāśitaṃ vira muniśāpāc cirāgatam // / //
analyzed: rāma rāma mahā bāho tvayā mama mahāmate  virūpam nāśitam vira muni śāpāt cira āgatam
translated: O Rama, O mighty-armed one, O you of great intelligence,🔽by you, my disfigurement, which had come about through the curse of the sages, has been destroyed.

original: tridivaṃ yāmi dhanyo 'smi tvatprasādān na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tridivam yāmi dhanyaḥ smi tvad prasādāt na saṃśayaḥ
translated: I am going to heaven. I am blessed. There is no doubt that it is by your grace.

original: tvaṃ sītāprāptaye sakhyaṃ kuru sūryasutena bhoḥ // / //
analyzed: tvam sītā prāptaye sakhyam kuru sūryasutena bhoḥ
translated: O Rama, make friendship with the Sun's son for the sake of obtaining Sita.

original: vānarendreṇa gatvā tu sugrīve svaṃ nivedya vai /
analyzed: vānara indreṇa gatvā tu sugrīve svam nivedya vai
translated: Having gone to Sugriva, the lord of monkeys, and told him your own (story),

original: bhaviṣyati nṛpaśreṣṭha ṛṣyamūkagiriṃ vraja // / //
analyzed: bhaviṣyati nṛpa śreṣṭhaḥ ṛṣyamūka girim vraja
translated: O best of kings, it will be so. Go to Rishyamuka mountain.

original: ity ukvā tu gate tasmin rāmo lakṣmaṇasaṃyutaḥ /
analyzed: iti ukvā tu gate tasmin rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇa saṃyutaḥ
translated: Having said this, when he had gone, Rama, accompanied by Lakshmana,

original: siddhais tu munibhiḥ śūnyam āśramaṃ praviveśa ha // / //
analyzed: siddhaiḥ tu munibhiḥ śūnyam āśramam praviveśa ha
translated: entered the hermitage which was empty of the accomplished sages.

original: tatrasthāṃ tāpasīṃ dṛṣṭvā tayā saṃlāpya saṃsthitaḥ /
analyzed: tatrasthām tāpasīm dṛṣṭvā tayā saṃlāpya saṃsthitaḥ
translated: Having seen the female ascetic who was there, he stayed after conversing with her,

original: śabarīṃ munimukhyānāṃ sa paryāhatakalmaṣām // / //
analyzed: śabarīm muni mukhyānām sa paryāhata kalmaṣām
translated: with Sabari, whose sins had been destroyed by the chief sages.

original: tayā saṃpūjito rāmo badarādibhir īśvaraḥ /
analyzed: tayā saṃpūjitaḥ rāmaḥ badara ādibhiḥ īśvaraḥ
translated: Rama, the lord, was worshipped by her with jujubes and other fruits.

original: sāpy enaṃ pūjayitvā tu svām avasthāṃ nivedya vai // / //
analyzed: sā api enam pūjayitvā tu svām avasthām nivedya vai
translated: She too, having worshipped him and told him her own state,

original: sītāṃ tvaṃ prāpsyasīty uktvā praviśyāgniṃ divaṃgatā /
analyzed: sītām tvam prāpsyasi iti uktvā praviśya agnim divaṃgatā
translated: said, You will obtain Sita, and having entered the fire, went to heaven.

original: divaṃ prasthāpya tāṃ cāpi jagāmānyatra rāghavaḥ // / //
analyzed: divam prasthāpya tām ca api jagāma anyatra rāghavaḥ
translated: And having sent her to heaven, Raghava went elsewhere.

original: tato vinītena guṇānvitena bhrātrā sameto jagadekanāthaḥ /
analyzed: tatas vinītena guṇa anvitena bhrātrā sametaḥ jagat eka nāthaḥ
translated: Then, the Lord of the world, accompanied by his well-disciplined and virtuous brother,

original: priyāviyogena suduḥkhitātmā jagāma yāmyāṃ sa tu rāmadevaḥ // / //
analyzed: priyā viyogena su duḥkhita ātmā jagāma yāmyām sa tu rāmadevaḥ
translated: Ramadeva, with his mind greatly afflicted by separation from his beloved, went towards the south.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe rāmaprādurbhāve ekonapañcāśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe rāmaprādurbhāve ekonapañcāśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the forty-ninth chapter in the Rakshasa-Vadha Parva of the Adi Parva in the holy Mahabharata, of the great sage Krishna-Dvaipayana Vyasa.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: vālinā kṛtavairo 'tha durgavartī harīśvaraḥ /
analyzed: vālinā kṛta vairaḥ durga vartī hari īśvaraḥ
translated: Then the lord of monkeys, Sugriva, who was in a difficult situation and had enmity with Vali,

original: sugrīvo dṛṣṭavān dūrād dṛṣṭvāha pavanātmajam // / //
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ dṛṣṭavān dūrāt dṛṣṭvā āha pavanātmajam
translated: saw from a distance the son of the wind god, and seeing him, said:

original: kasyemau sudhanuḥpāṇī cīravalkaladhāriṇau /
analyzed: kasya imau su dhanuḥ pāṇī cīra valkala dhāriṇau
translated: Whose are these two, with beautiful arms, wearing bark garments,

original: paśyantau sarasīṃ divyāṃ padmotpalasamāvṛtām // / //🔽nānārūpadharāv etau tāpasaṃ veṣam āsthitau /🔽vālidūtāv iha prāptāv iti niścitya sūryajaḥ // / //
analyzed: paśyantau sarasīm divyām padma utpala samāvṛtām  nānā rūpa dharau etau tāpasam veṣam āsthitau  vāli dūtau iha prāptau iti niścitya sūryajaḥ
translated: looking at the divine lake covered with lotuses and lilies?🔽These two, assuming the guise of ascetics, are surely the messengers of Vali who have come here.

original: utpapāta bhayatrastaḥ ṛṣyamūkād vanāntaram /
analyzed: utpapāta bhaya trastaḥ ṛṣyamūkāt vana antaram
translated: Thinking thus, the son of the sun leaped in fear from the Rishyamuka forest to another forest,

original: vānaraiḥ sahitaḥ sarvair agastyāśramam uttamam // / //
analyzed: vānaraiḥ sahitaḥ sarvaiḥ agastya āśramam uttamam
translated: together with all the monkeys, to the excellent hermitage of Agastya.

original: tatra sthitvā sa sugrīvaḥ prāha vāyusutaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: tatra sthitvā sa sugrīvaḥ prāha vāyusutam punar
translated: Having stayed there, Sugriva again said to the son of the wind god:

original: hanūman pṛccha śīghraṃ tvaṃ gaccha tāpasaveṣadhṛk // / //
analyzed: hanūman pṛccha śīghram tvam gaccha tāpasa veṣa dhṛk
translated: O Hanuman, quickly ask him, go in the guise of an ascetic.

original: kau hi kasya sutau jātau kimarthaṃ tatra saṃsthitau /
analyzed: kau hi kasya sutau jātau kimartham tatra saṃsthitau
translated: Whose sons are they? For what purpose do they stay there?

original: jñātvā satyaṃ mama brūhi vāyuputra mahāmate // / //
analyzed: jñātvā satyam mama brūhi vāyuputra mahāmate
translated: Knowing the truth, tell me, O son of Vayu, O greatly wise one.

original: ityukto hanumān gatvā pampātaṭam anuttamam /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ hanumān gatvā pampā taṭam anuttamam
translated: Thus addressed, Hanuman went to the excellent bank of Pampa,

original: bikṣurūpī sa taṃ prāha rāmaṃ bhrātrā samanvitam // / //
analyzed: bikṣu rūpī sa tam prāha rāmam bhrātrā samanvitam
translated: and in the form of a mendicant, he said to Rama, along with his brother:

original: ko bhavān iha saṃprāptas tathyaṃ brūhi mahāmate /
analyzed: kaḥ bhavān iha saṃprāptaḥ tathyam brūhi mahāmate
translated: Who are you, O greatly wise one, who have come here? Tell the truth.

original: araṇye nirjane ghore kutas tvaṃ kiṃ prayojanam // / //
analyzed: araṇye nirjane ghore kutas tvam kim prayojanam
translated: In this terrible, deserted forest, where are you from? What is your purpose?

original: evaṃ vadantaṃ taṃ prāha lakṣmaṇo bhrātur ājñayā /
analyzed: evam vadantam tam prāha lakṣmaṇaḥ bhrātuḥ ājñayā
translated: Thus addressed, Lakshmana, by the command of his brother, said to him:

original: pravakṣyāmi nibodha tvaṃ rāmavṛttāntam āditaḥ // / //
analyzed: pravakṣyāmi nibodha tvam rāma vṛttāntam āditas
translated: I will tell you, listen to the story of Rama from the beginning.

original: rājā daśaratho nāma babhūva bhuvi viśrutaḥ /
analyzed: rājā daśarathaḥ nāma babhūva bhuvi viśrutaḥ
translated: There was a king named Dasharatha, who was famous on earth.

original: tasya putro mahābuddhe rāmo jyeṣṭho mamāgrajaḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya putraḥ mahābuddhe rāmaḥ jyeṣṭhaḥ mama agrajaḥ
translated: His son, O greatly wise one, was Rama, the eldest and my elder brother.

original: asyābhiṣeka ārabdhaḥ kaikeyyā tu nivāritaḥ /
analyzed: asya abhiṣekaḥ ārabdhaḥ kaikeyyā tu nivāritaḥ
translated: His consecration was begun, but was stopped by Kaikeyi.

original: pitur ājñām ayaṃ kurvan rāmo bhrātā mamāgrajaḥ // / //
analyzed: pituḥ ājñām ayam kurvan rāmaḥ bhrātā mama agrajaḥ
translated: This brother of mine, Rama, was carrying out the command of his father.

original: mayā saha viniṣkramya sītayā saha bhāryayā /
analyzed: mayā saha viniṣkramya sītayā saha bhāryayā
translated: He left with me and his wife Sita.

original: praviṣṭo daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ nānāmunisamākulam // / //
analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ daṇḍaka araṇyam nānā muni samākulam
translated: He entered the Dandaka forest, filled with various sages.

original: janasthāne nivasato rāmasyāsya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: janasthāne nivasataḥ rāmasya asya mahātmanaḥ
translated: While the great Rama was residing in Janasthana,

original: bhāryā sītā tatra vane kenāpi pāpmanā hṛtā // / //
analyzed: bhāryā sītā tatra vane kena api pāpmanā hṛtā
translated: his wife Sita was abducted by a sinful person in the forest.

original: sītām anveṣayan vīro rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: sītām anveṣayan vīraḥ rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: The heroic Rama, with eyes like lotus petals, searching for Sita,

original: ihāyātas tvayā dṛṣṭa iti vṛttāntam īritam // / //
analyzed: iha āyātaḥ tvayā dṛṣṭaḥ iti vṛttāntam īritam
translated: came here and was seen by you - this is the story told.

original: śrutvā tato vacas tasya lakṣmaṇasya mahātmanaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā tatas vacaḥ tasya lakṣmaṇasya mahātmanaḥ
translated: Hearing those words of the great-souled Lakshmana,

original: avyañjitātmā viśvāsād dhanūmān mārutātmajaḥ // / //
analyzed: a vyañjita ātmā viśvāsāt dhanūmān mārutātmajaḥ
translated: Hanuman, the son of the wind god, with his true self concealed, out of trust,

original: tvaṃ me svāmī iti vadan rāmaṃ raghupatiṃ tadā /
analyzed: tvam me svāmī iti vadan rāmam raghu patim tadā
translated: saying You are my master, to Rama, the lord of the Raghus,

original: āśvāsyānīya sugrīvaṃ tayoḥ sakhyam akārayat // / //
analyzed: āśvāsya ānīya sugrīvam tayoḥ sakhyam akārayat
translated: having comforted him and brought Sugriva, he made friendship between them.

original: śirasy āropya pādābjaṃ rāmasya viditātmanaḥ /
analyzed: śirasi āropya pāda abjam rāmasya vidita ātmanaḥ
translated: Placing the lotus feet of Rama, who knows the self, on his head,

original: sugrīvo vānarendras tu uvāca madhurākṣaram // / //
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ vānara indraḥ tu uvāca madhura akṣaram
translated: Sugriva, the lord of the monkeys, spoke in sweet words:

original: adyaprabhṛti rājendra tvaṃ me svāmī na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: adya prabhṛti rāja indra tvam me svāmī na saṃśayaḥ
translated: From today onwards, O lord of kings, you are undoubtedly my master.

original: ahaṃ tu tava bhṛtyaś ca vānaraiḥ sahitaḥ prabho // / //
analyzed: aham tu tava bhṛtyaḥ ca vānaraiḥ sahitaḥ prabho
translated: And I am your servant, O lord, along with the monkeys.

original: tvacchatrur mama śatruḥ syād adyaprabhṛti rāghava /
analyzed: tvad śatruḥ mama śatruḥ syāt adya prabhṛti rāghava
translated: From today onwards, O Raghava, whoever is your enemy will be my enemy.

original: mitraṃ te mama sanmitraṃ tvadduḥkhaṃ tan mamāpi ca // / //
analyzed: mitram te mama sat mitram tvad duḥkham tat mama api ca
translated: Your friend will be my true friend, and your sorrow will be mine too.

original: tvatprītir eva matprītir ity uktvā punar āha tam /
analyzed: tvad prītiḥ eva mad prītiḥ iti uktvā punar āha tam
translated: Your pleasure is my pleasure. Having said this, he again spoke to him:

original: vālī nāma mama jyeṣṭho mahābalaparākramaḥ // / //
analyzed: vālī nāma mama jyeṣṭhaḥ mahā bala parākramaḥ
translated: My eldest brother named Vali, of great strength and valor,

original: bhāryāpahārī duṣṭātmā madanāsaktamānasaḥ /
analyzed: bhāryā apahārī duṣṭa ātmā madana āsakta mānasaḥ
translated: is a wicked-minded abductor of other's wives, his mind attached to lust.

original: tvām ṛte puruṣavyāghra nāsti hantādya vālinam // / //🔽yugapat saptatālāṃs tu tarūn yo vai vadhiṣyati /
analyzed: tvām ṛte puruṣa vyāghra na asti hantā adya vālinam  yugapad sapta tālān tu tarūn yaḥ vai vadhiṣyati
translated: O tiger among men, except for you, there is no one to kill Vali today.🔽The knowers of the Puranas have said, O prince, that he who can simultaneously strike seven palm trees,

original: sa taṃ vadhiṣyatīty uktaṃ purāṇajñair nṛpātmaja // / //
analyzed: sa tam vadhiṣyati iti uktam purāṇa jñaiḥ nṛpa ātmaja
translated: will be the one to kill him.

original: tatpriyārthaṃ hi rāmo 'pi śrīmāṃś chittvā mahātarūn /
analyzed: tad priya artham hi śrīmān chittvā mahā tarūn
translated: For his sake, the glorious Rama also, having cut down the great trees,

original: ardhākṛṣṭena bāṇena yugapad raghunandanaḥ // / //
analyzed: ardha ākṛṣṭena bāṇena yugapad raghunandanaḥ
translated: the descendant of Raghu, with an arrow half-drawn, simultaneously

original: viddhvā mahātarūn rāmaḥ sugrīvaṃ prāha pārthivam /
analyzed: viddhvā mahā tarūn rāmaḥ sugrīvam prāha pārthivam
translated: pierced the great trees. Rama, having pierced the great trees, spoke to King Sugriva:

original: vālinā gaccha yudhyasva kṛtacihno raveḥ suta // / //
analyzed: vālinā gaccha yudhyasva kṛta cihnaḥ raveḥ suta
translated: Go and fight with Vali. O son of the sun, the mark has been made.

original: ityuktaḥ kṛtacihno 'yaṃ yuddhaṃ cakre 'tha vālinā /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ kṛta cihnaḥ yam yuddham cakre vālinā
translated: Thus addressed, he, having made the mark, then fought with Vali.

original: rāmo 'pi tatra gatvātha śareṇaikena vālinam // / //🔽vivyādha vīryavān vālī papāta ca mamāra ca /
analyzed: rāmaḥ tatra gatvā atha śareṇa ekena vālinam  vivyādha vīryavān vālī papāta ca mamāra ca
translated: Rama also went there and with a single arrow🔽pierced Vali, the powerful one, who fell down and died.

original: vitrastaṃ vāliputraṃ tu aṅgadaṃ vinayānvitam // / //
analyzed: vitrastam vāli putram tu aṅgadam vinaya anvitam
translated: The frightened son of Vali, Angada, endowed with humility,

original: raṇaśauṇḍaṃ yauvarājye niyuktvā rāghavas tadā /🔽tāṃ ca tārāṃ tathā dattvā rāmaś ca ravisūnave // / //
analyzed: raṇa śauṇḍam yauvarājye niyuktvā rāghavaḥ tadā  tām ca tārām tathā dattvā rāmaḥ ca ravi sūnave
translated: Having appointed the one who delights in battle as the heir apparent, Rama,🔽and having given that Tara to the son of the sun, Rama,

original: sugrīvaṃ prāha dharmātmā rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: sugrīvam prāha dharma ātmā rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: the righteous-souled Rama, having eyes like lotus petals, said to Sugriva:

original: rājyam anveṣaya svaṃ tvaṃ kapīnāṃ punar āvraja // / //
analyzed: rājyam anveṣaya svam tvam kapīnām punar āvraja
translated: Seek out your own kingdom again, O monkey.

original: tvaṃ sītānveṣaṇe yatnaṃ kuru śīghraṃ harīśvara /
analyzed: tvam sītā anveṣaṇe yatnam kuru śīghram hari īśvara
translated: O lord of monkeys, make efforts to find Sita quickly.

original: ityuktaḥ prāha sugrīvo rāmaṃ lakṣmaṇasaṃyutam // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ prāha sugrīvaḥ rāmam lakṣmaṇa saṃyutam
translated: Thus addressed, Sugriva said to Rama, together with Lakshmana:

original: prāvṛṭkālo mahān prāptaḥ sāṃprataṃ raghunandana /
analyzed: prāvṛṣ kālaḥ mahān prāptaḥ sāṃpratam raghunandana
translated: O descendant of Raghu, the great rainy season has arrived now.

original: vānarāṇāṃ gatir nāsti vane varṣati vāsave // / //
analyzed: vānarāṇām gatiḥ nā asti vane varṣati vāsave
translated: When Indra rains in the forest, the monkeys have no way to move.

original: gate tasmiṃs tu rājendra prāpte śaradi nirmale /
analyzed: gate tasmin tu rāja indra prāpte śaradi nirmale
translated: When he had gone, O lord of kings, and the clear autumn had arrived,

original: cārān saṃpreṣayiṣyāmi vānarān dikṣu rāghava // / //
analyzed: cārān saṃpreṣayiṣyāmi vānarān dikṣu rāghava
translated: O Raghava, I will send out spies, monkeys, in all directions.

original: ity uktvā rāmacandraṃ sa taṃ praṇamya kapīśvaraḥ /
analyzed: iti uktvā rāmacandram sa tam praṇamya kapi īśvaraḥ
translated: Having said this to Rama Chandra, the lord of monkeys,

original: pampāpuraṃ praviśyātha reme tārāsamanvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: pampā puram praviśya atha reme tārā samanvitaḥ
translated: having bowed to him, entered Pampapura and delighted with Tara.

original: rāmo 'pi vidhivad bhrātrā śailasānau mahāvane /
analyzed: rāmaḥ u pi vidhivat bhrātrā śaila sānau mahā vane
translated: Rama also, together with his brother, the greatly wise one,

original: nivāsaṃ kṛtavān śaile nīlakaṇṭhe mahāmatiḥ // / //
analyzed: nivāsam kṛtavān śaile nīlakaṇṭhe mahāmatiḥ
translated: made his abode on the peak of a great mountain in a great forest, on the Nilakantha mountain.

original: prāvṛṭkāle gate kṛcchrāt prāpte śaradi rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: prāvṛṣ kāle gate kṛcchrāt prāpte śaradi rāghavaḥ
translated: When the rainy season had passed with difficulty and autumn had arrived, Raghava,

original: sītāviyogād vyathitaḥ saumitriṃ prāha lakṣmaṇam // / //
analyzed: sītā viyogāt vyathitaḥ saumitrim prāha lakṣmaṇam
translated: afflicted by separation from Sita, spoke to Lakshmana, the son of Sumitra.

original: ullaṅghitas tu samayaḥ sugrīveṇa tato ruṣā /
analyzed: ullaṅghitaḥ tu samayaḥ sugrīveṇa tatas ruṣā
translated: The time has been transgressed by Sugriva. Therefore, in anger,

original: lakṣmaṇaṃ prāha kākutstho bhrātaraṃ bhrātṛvatsalaḥ // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇam prāha kākutsthaḥ bhrātaram bhrātṛ vatsalaḥ
translated: Kakutstha, who loved his brother, spoke to Lakshmana, his brother.

original: gaccha lakṣmaṇa duṣṭo 'sau nāgataḥ kapināyakaḥ /
analyzed: gaccha lakṣmaṇa duṣṭaḥ asau na āgataḥ kapi nāyakaḥ
translated: Go, Lakshmana. That wicked one, the leader of the monkeys, has not come.

original: gate tu varṣākāle 'haṃ āgamiṣyāmi te 'ntikam // / //
analyzed: gate tu varṣā kāle haṃ āgamiṣyāmi te ntikam
translated: When the rainy season has passed, I will come to you.

original: anekair vānaraiḥ sārdham ity uktvāsau tadā gataḥ /
analyzed: anekaiḥ vānaraiḥ sārdham iti uktvā asau tadā gataḥ
translated: Having said this, he went away.

original: tatra gaccha tvarāyukto yatrāste kapināyakaḥ // / //🔽taṃ duṣṭaṃ agrataḥ kṛtvā harisenāsamanvitam /
analyzed: tatra gaccha tvarā yuktaḥ yatra āste kapināyakaḥ  tam duṣṭam agratas kṛtvā hari senā samanvitam
translated: Go there quickly to where the leader of the monkeys is.🔽Taking that wicked one in front, accompanied by the monkey army,

original: ramantaṃ tārayā sārdhaṃ śīghram ānaya māṃ prati // / //
analyzed: ramantam tārayā sārdham śīghram ānaya mām prati
translated: who is enjoying with Tara, bring him quickly to me.

original: nātrāgacchati sugrīvo yady asau prāptabhūtikaḥ /
analyzed: na atra āgacchati sugrīvaḥ yadi asau prāpta bhūtikaḥ
translated: If Sugriva does not come here, having attained his goal,

original: tadā tvayaivaṃ vaktavyaḥ sugrīvo 'nṛtabhāṣakaḥ // / //
analyzed: tadā tvayā evam vaktavyaḥ sugrīvaḥ
translated: then you should speak to him thus: 'Sugriva speaks untruth.'

original: vālihantā śaro duṣṭa kare me 'dyāpi tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: vāli hantā śaraḥ duṣṭa kare me tiṣṭhati
translated: The arrow that kills Vali, O wicked one, still remains in my hand.

original: smṛtvaitad ācara kape rāmavākyaṃ hitaṃ tava // / //
analyzed: smṛtvā etat ācara kape rāma vākyam hitam tava
translated: Remembering this, O monkey, do what is beneficial for you, as Rama has said.

original: ityuktas tu tathety uktvā rāmaṃ natvā ca lakṣmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ tu tathā iti uktvā rāmam natvā ca lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Lakshmana said So be it and saluted Rama.

original: pampāpuraṃ jagāmātha sugrīvo yatra tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: pampā puram jagāma atha sugrīvaḥ yatra tiṣṭhati
translated: He then went to Pampapura where Sugriva was staying.

original: dṛṣṭvā sa tatra sugrīvaṃ kapirājaṃ babhāṣa vai // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā sa tatra sugrīvam kapi rājam babhāṣa vai
translated: Having seen Sugriva there, the king of the monkeys, he spoke to him:

original: tārābhogaviṣaktas tvaṃ rāmakāryaparāṅmukhaḥ /
analyzed: tārā bhoga viṣaktaḥ tvam rāma kārya parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: You are attached to Tara and averse to Rama's task.

original: kiṃ tvayā vismṛtaṃ sarvaṃ rāmāgre samayaṃ kṛtam // / //
analyzed: kim tvayā vismṛtam sarvam rāma agre samayam kṛtam
translated: Have you forgotten everything, the promise made in front of Rama?

original: sītām anviṣya dāsyāmi yatra kvāpīti durmate /
analyzed: sītām anviṣya dāsyāmi yatra kvāpi iti durmate
translated: O evil-minded one, I promised to give Sita back to him wherever I found her.

original: hatvā tu vālinaṃ rājyaṃ yena dattaṃ purā tava // / //
analyzed: hatvā tu vālinam rājyam yena dattam purā tava
translated: Having killed Vali, by whom your kingdom was given to you earlier...

original: tvām ṛte ko 'vamanyeta kapīndra pāpacetasa /
analyzed: tvām ṛte kaḥ vamanyeta kapi indra pāpa cetasa
translated: O lord of monkeys, who else but you, of wicked mind, would slight such a promise?

original: pratiśrutya ca rāmasya bhāryāhīnasya bhūpate // / //
analyzed: pratiśrutya ca rāmasya bhāryā hīnasya bhūpate
translated: Having promised to help Rama, the king who is without his wife,

original: sāhāyyaṃ te karomīti devāgnijalasaṃnidhau /
analyzed: sāhāyyam te karomi iti deva agni jala saṃnidhau
translated: in the presence of gods, fire and water...

original: ye ye ca śatravo rājaṃs te te ca mama śatravaḥ // / //
analyzed: ye ye ca śatravaḥ rājan te te ca mama śatravaḥ
translated: Whatever enemies you have, O king, they are also my enemies.

original: mitrāṇi yāni te deva tāni mitrāṇi me sadā /
analyzed: mitrāṇi yāni te deva tāni mitrāṇi me sadā
translated: Whatever friends you have, O god, they are always my friends.

original: sītām anveṣituṃ rājan vānarair bahubhir vṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: sītām anveṣitum rājan vānaraiḥ bahubhiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: O king, surrounded by many monkeys, I am going to search for Sita.

original: satyaṃ yāsyāmi te pārśvam ity uktvā ko 'nyathākarot /
analyzed: satyam yāsyāmi te pārśvam iti uktvā kaḥ nyathā akarot
translated: Having said I will keep my promise and go to you, who else would act otherwise?

original: tvām ṛte pāpinaṃ duṣṭaṃ rāmadevasya saṃnidhau // / //
analyzed: tvām ṛte pāpinam duṣṭam rāmadevasya saṃnidhau
translated: you, the sinful and wicked one, in the presence of Lord Rama.

original: kārayitvā tu tenaivaṃ svakāryaṃ duṣṭavānara /
analyzed: kārayitvā tu tena evam sva kāryam duṣṭa vānara
translated: Having thus accomplished your own task, O wicked monkey,

original: ṛṣīṇāṃ satyavad vākyaṃ tvayi dṛṣṭaṃ mayādhunā // / //
analyzed: ṛṣīṇām satya vat vākyam tvayi dṛṣṭam mayā adhunā
translated: I have now seen the truth of the words of the sages in you.

original: sarvasya hi kṛtārthasya matir anyā pravartate /
analyzed: sarvasya hi kṛtārthasya matiḥ anyā pravartate
translated: The mind of one who has accomplished everything turns to something else.

original: vatsaḥ kṣīrakṣayaṃ dṛṣṭvā parityajati mātaram // / //
analyzed: vatsaḥ kṣīra kṣayam dṛṣṭvā parityajati mātaram
translated: A calf, seeing the milk exhausted, abandons its mother.

original: janavṛttavidāṃ loke sarvajñānāṃ mahātmanām /
analyzed: jana vṛtta vidām loke sarva jñānām mahātmanām
translated: In the world of those who know the conduct of people, of all-knowing great souls,

original: na taṃ paśyāmi loke 'smin kṛtaṃ pratikaroti yaḥ // / //
analyzed: na tam paśyāmi loke smin kṛtam pratikaroti yaḥ
translated: I do not see anyone in this world who repays a favor.

original: śāstreṣu niṣkṛtir dṛṣṭā mahāpātakinām api /
analyzed: śāstreṣu niṣkṛtiḥ dṛṣṭā mahāpātakinām api
translated: In the scriptures, atonement is seen even for great sinners,

original: kṛtaghnasya kape duṣṭa na dṛṣṭā niṣkṛtiḥ purā // / //
analyzed: kṛtaghnasya kape duṣṭa na dṛṣṭā niṣkṛtiḥ purā
translated: But, O wicked monkey, the atonement for an ungrateful person has not been seen before.

original: kṛtaghnatā na kāryā te tvatkṛtaṃ samayaṃ smara /
analyzed: kṛtaghna tā na kāryā te tvad kṛtam samayam smara
translated: You should not be ungrateful. Remember your promise.

original: ehy ehy āgaccha śaraṇaṃ kakutsthaṃ hitapālakam // / //
analyzed: ehi ehi āgaccha śaraṇam kakutstham hita pālakam
translated: Come, come, go for refuge to Kakutstha, the protector of the righteous.

original: yadi nāyāsi ca kape rāmavākyam idaṃ śṛṇu /
analyzed: yadi na āyāsi ca kape rāma vākyam idam śṛṇu
translated: If you do not come, O monkey, listen to this word of Rama:

original: nayiṣe mṛtyusadanaṃ sugrīvaṃ vālinaṃ yathā // / //
analyzed: nayiṣe mṛtyu sadanam sugrīvam vālinam yathā
translated: You will lead Sugriva to the abode of death, just as you did Vali.

original: sa śaro vidyate 'smākaṃ yena vālī hataḥ kapiḥ /
analyzed: sa śaraḥ vidyate smākam yena vālī hataḥ kapiḥ
translated: That arrow of ours remains by which the monkey Vali was killed.

original: lakṣmaṇenaivam ukto 'sau sugrīvaḥ kapināyakaḥ // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena evam uktaḥ sau sugrīvaḥ kapi nāyakaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Lakshmana, Sugriva, the lord of the monkeys,

original: nirgatya tu namaś cakre lakṣmaṇaṃ mantriṇoditaḥ /
analyzed: nirgatya tu namaḥ cakre lakṣmaṇam mantriṇā uditaḥ
translated: having come out, bowed to Lakshmana, as instructed by the ministers.

original: uvāca ca mahātmānaṃ lakṣmaṇaṃ vānarādhipaḥ // / //
analyzed: uvāca ca mahātmānam lakṣmaṇam vānara adhipaḥ
translated: And the lord of the monkeys spoke to the great-souled Lakshmana:

original: ajñānakṛtapāpānām asmākaṃ kṣantum arhasi /
analyzed: ajñāna kṛta pāpānām asmākam kṣantum arhasi
translated: You should forgive us for the sin committed out of ignorance.

original: samayaḥ kṛto mayā rājñā rāmeṇāmitatejasā // / //
analyzed: samayaḥ kṛtaḥ mayā rājñā rāmeṇa amita tejasā
translated: An agreement was made by me with King Rama of immeasurable splendor:

original: yas tadānīṃ mahābhāga tam adyāpi na laṅghaye /🔽yāsyāmi nikhilair adya kapibhir nṛpanandana // / //
analyzed: yaḥ tadānīm mahābhāga tam adyā api na laṅghaye  yāsyāmi nikhilaiḥ adya kapibhiḥ nṛpa nandana
translated: O greatly fortunate one, I have not transgressed it even to this day.

original: tvayā saha mahāvīra rāmapārśvaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā saha mahā vīra rāma pārśvam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: O son of a king, I will go with all the monkeys to Rama's side without a doubt.

original: māṃ dṛṣṭvā tatra kākutstho yad vakṣyati ca māṃ prati // / //
analyzed: mām dṛṣṭvā tatra kākutsthaḥ yat vakṣyati ca mām prati
translated: Whatever Kakutstha will tell me when he sees me there,

original: tat sarvaṃ śirasā gṛhya kariṣyāmi na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: tat sarvam śirasā gṛhya kariṣyāmi na saṃśayaḥ
translated: I will undoubtedly accept it all on my head and carry it out.

original: santi me harayaḥ śūrāḥ sītānveṣaṇakarmaṇi // / //
analyzed: santi me harayaḥ śūrāḥ sītā anveṣaṇa karmaṇi
translated: I have brave monkeys for the task of searching for Sita:

original: tāny ahaṃ preṣayiṣyāmi dikṣu sarvāsu pārthiva /
analyzed: tāni aham preṣayiṣyāmi dikṣu sarvāsu pārthiva
translated: O king, I will send them out in all directions.

original: ityuktaḥ kapirājena sugrīveṇa sa lakṣmaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ kapi rājena sugrīveṇa sa lakṣmaṇaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by Sugriva, the king of the monkeys, Lakshmana,

original: ehi śīghraṃ gamiṣyāmo rāmapārśvam ito 'dhunā /
analyzed: ehi śīghram gamiṣyāmaḥ rāma pārśvam itas dhunā
translated: Come, let us quickly go to Rama's side from here now.

original: senā cāhūyatāṃ vīra ṛkṣāṇāṃ hariṇām api // / //
analyzed: senā ca āhūyatām vīraḥ ṛkṣāṇām hariṇām api
translated: And let the army of bears and monkeys be called, O hero.

original: yāṃ dṛṣṭvā prītim abahyeti rāghavas te mahāmate /
analyzed: yām dṛṣṭvā prītim abahyeti rāghavaḥ te mahāmate
translated: Seeing which, O you of great intelligence, Raghava will be filled with joy.

original: ityukto lakṣmaṇenātha sugrīvaḥ sa tu vīryavān // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ lakṣmaṇena atha sugrīvaḥ sa tu vīryavān
translated: Thus addressed by Lakshmana, Sugriva, the valiant one,

original: pārśvasthaṃ yuvarājānam aṅgadaṃ saṃjñayābravīt /
analyzed: pārśva stham yuvarājānam aṅgadam saṃjñayā abravīt
translated: spoke to Prince Angada, who was at his side, with a sign.

original: so 'pi nirgatya senānīm āha senāpatiṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: saḥ pi nirgatya senānīm āha senāpatim tadā
translated: He too, having gone out, spoke to the general, the commander of the army, then

original: tenāhūtāḥ samāgatya ṛkṣavānarakoṭayaḥ /🔽guhāsthāś ca giristhāś ca vṛkṣasthāś caiva vānarāḥ // / //
analyzed: tena āhūtāḥ samāgatya ṛkṣa vānara koṭayaḥ  guhā sthāḥ ca giri sthāḥ ca vṛkṣa sthāḥ ca eva vānarāḥ
translated: The crores of bears and monkeys, having been called by him, assembled.🔽The monkeys who lived in caves, on mountains, and in trees,

original: taiḥ sārdhaṃ parvatākārair vānarair bhīmavikramaiḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ sārdham parvata ākāraiḥ vānaraiḥ bhīma vikramaiḥ
translated: With those monkeys, who were like mountains and had terrible prowess,

original: sugrīvaḥ śīghram āgatya vavande rāghavaṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ śīghram āgatya vavande rāghavam tadā
translated: Sugriva quickly came and paid homage to Raghava then.

original: lakṣmaṇo 'pi namaskṛtya rāmaṃ bhrātaram abravīt /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ pi namaskṛtya rāmam bhrātaram abravīt
translated: Lakshmana too, having bowed down, spoke to his brother Rama,

original: prasādaṃ kuru sugrīve vinīte cādhunā nṛpa // / //
analyzed: prasādam kuru sugrīve vinīte ca adhunā nṛpa
translated: Be gracious to Sugriva, who is now humble, O king.

original: ityukto rāghavas tena bhrātā sugrīvam abravīt /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ rāghavaḥ tena bhrātā sugrīvam abravīt
translated: Thus addressed by his brother, Raghava spoke to Sugriva,

original: āgacchātra mahāvīra sugrīva kuśalaṃ tava // / //
analyzed: āgaccha atra mahā vīra sugrīva kuśalam tava
translated: Come here, O great hero, O Sugriva, all is well with you.

original: śrutvetthaṃ rāmavacanaṃ prasannaṃ ca narādhipam /
analyzed: śrutvā ittham rāma vacanam prasannam ca narādhipam
translated: Having heard these words of Rama and the delighted king,

original: śirasy añjalim ādhāya sugrīvo rāmam abravīt // / //
analyzed: śirasi añjalim ādhāya sugrīvaḥ rāmam abravīt
translated: Placing his folded hands on his head, Sugriva spoke to Rama:

original: tadā me kuśalaṃ rājan sītādevī tava prabho /
analyzed: tadā me kuśalam rājan sītā devī tava prabho
translated: O king, O lord, I am well, and so is Queen Sita.

original: anviṣya tu yadā dattā mayā bhavati nānyathā // / //
analyzed: anviṣya tu yadā dattā mayā bhavati nā anyathā
translated: But when she is found, she will be given to you, and not otherwise.

original: ityukte vacane tena hanūmān mārutātmajaḥ /
analyzed: iti ukte vacane tena hanūmān mārutātmajaḥ
translated: When these words were spoken by him, Hanuman, the son of the Wind-god,

original: natvā rāmaṃ babhāṣainaṃ sugrīvaṃ kapināyakam // / //
analyzed: natvā rāmam babhāṣa enam sugrīvam kapi nāyakam
translated: bowed to Rama and spoke to Sugriva, the leader of the monkeys:

original: śṛṇu sugrīva me vākyaṃ rājāyaṃ duḥkhito bhṛśam /
analyzed: śṛṇu sugrīva me vākyam rājā ayam duḥkhitaḥ bhṛśam
translated: Listen, Sugriva, this king is extremely unhappy.

original: sītāviyogena ca sadā nāśnāti ca phalādikam // / //
analyzed: sītā viyogena ca sadā nā aśnāti ca phala ādikam
translated: Due to separation from Sita, he never eats fruits and such.

original: asya duḥkhena satataṃ lakṣmaṇo 'yaṃ suduḥkhitaḥ /
analyzed: asya duḥkhena satatam lakṣmaṇaḥ yam su duḥkhitaḥ
translated: Lakshmana here is always very unhappy due to their sorrow.

original: etayor atra yāvasthā tāṃ śrutvā bharato 'nujaḥ // / //
analyzed: etayoḥ atra yā avasthā tām śrutvā bharataḥ nujaḥ
translated: Hearing about their present condition, Bharata, the younger brother,

original: duḥkhī bhavati tadduḥkhād duḥkhaṃ prāpnoti tajjanaḥ /
analyzed: duḥkhī bhavati tad duḥkhāt duḥkham prāpnoti tad janaḥ
translated: becomes sorrowful, and the people suffer from that sorrow.

original: yata evam ato rājan sītānveṣanam ācara // / //
analyzed: yatas evam atas rājan sītā anveṣanam ācara
translated: Therefore, O king, search for Sita.

original: ityukte vacane tatra vāyuputreṇa dhīmatā /
analyzed: iti ukte vacane tatra vāyuputreṇa dhīmatā
translated: When these words were spoken there by the wise son of the Wind-god,

original: jāmbavān atitejasvī natvā rāmaṃ puraḥsthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: jāmbavān ati tejasvī natvā rāmam puras sthitaḥ
translated: the extremely energetic Jambavan, having bowed to Rama, stood in front.

original: sa prāha kapirājaṃ taṃ nītimān nītimad vacaḥ /
analyzed: sa prāha kapi rājam tam nītimān nītimat vacaḥ
translated: He, the wise one, spoke these words of policy to the king of monkeys:

original: yad uktaṃ vāyuputreṇa tat tathety avagaccha bhoḥ // / //
analyzed: yat uktam vāyuputreṇa tat tathā iti avagaccha bhoḥ
translated: Understand that what the son of the wind god has said is true, O lord.

original: yatra kvāpi sthitā sītā rāmabhāryā yaśasvinī /
analyzed: yatra kvāpi sthitā sītā rāma bhāryā yaśasvinī
translated: Wherever the illustrious wife of Rama, Sita, may be staying,

original: pativratā mahābhāgā vaidehī janakātmajā // / //
analyzed: pativratā mahābhāgā vaidehī janakātmajā
translated: the chaste and greatly fortunate Vaidehi, the daughter of Janaka,

original: adyāpi vṛttasaṃpannā iti me manasi sthitam /
analyzed: adya api vṛtta saṃpannāḥ iti me manasi sthitam
translated: I still have it in my mind that she is endowed with good conduct.

original: na hi kalyāṇacittāyāḥ sītāyāḥ kenacid bhuvi // / //
analyzed: na hi kalyāṇa cittāyāḥ sītāyāḥ kenacid bhuvi
translated: For Sita, who is of a virtuous mind, there is no defeat by anyone on earth.

original: parābhavo 'sti sugrīva preṣayādyaiva vānarān /
analyzed: parābhavaḥ u sti sugrīva preṣaya adya eva vānarān
translated: O Sugriva, send the monkeys today itself.

original: ityuktas tena sugrīvaḥ prītātmā kapināyakaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ tena sugrīvaḥ prīta ātmā kapi nāyakaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by him, Sugriva, the delighted lord of the monkeys,

original: paścimāyāṃ diśi tadā preṣayām asa tān kapīn /
analyzed: paścimāyām diśi tadā tān kapīn
translated: then sent those monkeys to the western direction.

original: anveṣṭuṃ rāmabhāryāṃ tāṃ mahābalaparākramaḥ // / //
analyzed: anveṣṭum rāma bhāryām tām mahā bala parākramaḥ
translated: The one of great strength and valor, to search for Rama's wife.

original: uttarasyāṃ diśi tadā niyutān vānarān asau /
analyzed: uttarasyām diśi tadā niyutān vānarān asau
translated: Then he appointed monkeys in the northern direction,

original: dharmātmā sītānveṣaṇakarmaṇi // / //
analyzed: preṣayāmasa dharma ātmā sītā anveṣaṇa karmaṇi
translated: the righteous one, in the task of searching for Sita.

original: pūrvāsyāṃ diśi kapīṃś ca kapirājaḥ pratāpavān /
analyzed: pūrvāsyām diśi kapīn ca kapi rājaḥ pratāpavān
translated: And the powerful king of the monkeys, in the eastern direction,

original: rāmasya subhārānveṣaṇāya vai // / //
analyzed: preṣayāmasa rāmasya su bhāra anveṣaṇāya vai
translated: the monkeys, for the sake of searching for Rama's beloved wife.

original: iti tān vānarān vānarādhipaḥ /
analyzed: iti tān preṣayāmasa vānarān vānara adhipaḥ
translated: Thus the lord of the monkeys,

original: sugrīvo vāliputraṃ tam aṅgadaṃ prāha buddhimān // / //
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ vāli putram tam aṅgadam prāha buddhimān
translated: Sugriva, spoke to that son of Vali, Angada, the intelligent one.

original: tvaṃ gaccha dakṣiṇaṃ deśaṃ sītānveṣaṇakarmaṇi /
analyzed: tvam gaccha dakṣiṇam deśam sītā anveṣaṇa karmaṇi
translated: You go to the southern region to search for Sita.

original: jāmbavāṃś ca hanūmāṃś ca maindo dvivida eva ca // / //
analyzed: jāmbavān ca hanūmān ca maindaḥ dvividaḥ eva ca
translated: And Jambavan, Hanuman, Mainda, Dvivida,

original: nīlādyāś caiva harayo mahābalaparākramāḥ /
analyzed: nīla ādyāḥ ca eva harayaḥ mahā bala parākramāḥ
translated: And the monkeys led by Nila, of great strength and valor,

original: anuyāsyanti gacchantaṃ tvām adya mama śāsanāt // / //
analyzed: anuyāsyanti gacchantam tvām adya mama śāsanāt
translated: Will follow you today as you go, at my command.

original: acirād eva yūyaṃ tāṃ dṛṣṭvā sītāṃ yaśasvinīm /
analyzed: acirāt eva yūyam tām dṛṣṭvā sītām yaśasvinīm
translated: Before long, having seen that illustrious Sita,

original: sthānato rūpataś caiva śīlataś ca viśeṣataḥ // / //
analyzed: sthānataḥ rūpataḥ ca eva śīlataḥ ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: In terms of her position, beauty, and especially her character,

original: kena nītā ca kutrāste jñātvātrāgaccha putraka /
analyzed: kena nītā ca kutra āste jñātvā atra āgaccha putraka
translated: And having found out who has taken her and where she is, come back here, my son.

original: ityuktaḥ kapirājena pitṛvyeṇa mahātmanā // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ kapi rājena pitṛvyeṇa mahātmanā
translated: Thus addressed by the great-souled king of the monkeys, his paternal uncle,

original: aṅgadas tūrṇam utthāya tasyājñāṃ śirasā dadhe /
analyzed: aṅgadaḥ tūrṇam utthāya tasya ājñām śirasā dadhe
translated: Angada quickly rose up and accepted his command with his head bowed down.

original: ityukte dūrataḥ sthāpya vānarān atha jāmbavān // / //
analyzed: iti ukte dūratas sthāpya vānarān atha jāmbavān
translated: Having said this, Jambavan, the wise one, having placed the monkeys at a distance,

original: rāmaṃ ca lakṣmaṇaṃ caiva sugrīvaṃ mārutātmajam /
analyzed: rāmam ca lakṣmaṇam ca eva sugrīvam mārutātmajam
translated: Rama, Lakshmana, Sugriva, and the son of the Wind God,

original: ekataḥ sthāpya tān āha nītimān nītimad vacaḥ // / //
analyzed: ekatas sthāpya tān āha nītimān nītimat vacaḥ
translated: Having placed them to one side, spoke to them with words of wisdom:

original: śrūyatāṃ vacanaṃ me 'dya sītānveṣaṇakarmaṇi /
analyzed: śrūyatām vacanam me sītā anveṣaṇa karmaṇi
translated: Listen to my words now regarding the search for Sita.

original: śrutvā ca tad gṛhāṇa tvaṃ rocate yan nṛpātmaja // / //
analyzed: śrutvā ca tat gṛhāṇa tvam rocate yat nṛpa ātmaja
translated: Having heard them, accept whatever appeals to you, prince.

original: rāvaṇena janasthānān nīyamānā tapasvinī /
analyzed: rāvaṇena janasthānāt nīyamānā tapasvinī
translated: The poor lady was being taken away from Janasthana by Ravana.

original: jaṭāyuṣā tu sā dṛṣṭvā śaktyā yuddhaṃ prakurvatā // / //🔽bhūṣaṇāni ca dṛṣṭāni tayā kṣiptāni tena vai /
analyzed: jaṭāyuṣā tu sā dṛṣṭvā śaktyā yuddham prakurvatā  bhūṣaṇāni ca dṛṣṭāni tayā kṣiptāni tena vai
translated: She was seen by Jatayu, who fought with him to the best of his ability.🔽The ornaments that she was wearing were seen by him and thrown away by her.

original: tāny asmābhiḥ pradṛṣṭāni sugrīvāyārpitāni ca // / //
analyzed: tāni asmābhiḥ pradṛṣṭāni sugrīvāya arpitāni ca
translated: Those were seen by us and handed over to Sugriva.

original: jaṭāyuvākyād rājendra satyam ity avadhāraya /
analyzed: jaṭāyu vākyāt rāja indra satyam iti avadhāraya
translated: O lord of kings, consider it to be true on the words of Jatayu.

original: etasmāt kāraṇāt sītā nītā tenaiva rakṣasā // / //
analyzed: etasmāt kāraṇāt sītā nītā tena eva rakṣasā
translated: For this reason, Sita was taken away by that very Rakshasa.

original: rāvaṇena mahābāho laṅkāyāṃ vartate tu sā /
analyzed: rāvaṇena mahā bāho laṅkāyām vartate tu sā
translated: O mighty-armed one, she is staying in Lanka.

original: tvāṃ smarantī tu tatrasthā tvadduḥkhena suduḥkhitā // / //
analyzed: tvām smarantī tu tatrasthā tvad duḥkhena su duḥkhitā
translated: Remembering you, she is staying there, extremely miserable due to your sorrow.

original: rakṣantī yatnato vṛttaṃ tatrāpi janakātmajā /
analyzed: rakṣantī yatnataḥ vṛttam tatra api janakātmajā
translated: Even there, the daughter of Janaka is carefully preserving her conduct.

original: tvaddhyānenaiva svān prāṇān dhārayantī śubhānanā // / //
analyzed: tvad dhyānena eva svān prāṇān dhārayantī śubha ānanā
translated: The beautiful-faced one is sustaining her own life only by meditating on you.

original: sthitā prāyeṇa te devī sītā duḥkhaparāyaṇā /🔽hitam eva ca te rājann udadher laṅghane kṣamam // / //🔽vāyuputraṃ hanūmantaṃ tvam atrādeṣṭum arhasi /
analyzed: sthitā prāyeṇa te devī sītā duḥkha parāyaṇā  hitam eva ca te rājan udadheḥ laṅghane kṣamam  vāyuputram hanūmantam tvam atrā ādeṣṭum arhasi
translated: The goddess Sita is mostly staying there, devoted to sorrow.🔽O king, it is beneficial for you and capable of crossing the ocean.🔽You should order Hanumat, the son of the Wind-god, in this matter.

original: tvaṃ cāpy arhasi sugrīva preṣituṃ mārutātmajam // / //
analyzed: tvam ca api arhasi sugrīva preṣitum mārutātmajam
translated: And you should also send the son of the Wind-god, O Sugriva.

original: tam ṛte sāgaraṃ gantuṃ vānarāṇāṃ na vidyate /
analyzed: tam ṛte sāgaram gantum vānarāṇām na vidyate
translated: In his absence, no monkey has the strength to go to the ocean,

original: balaṃ kasyāpi vā vīra iti me manasi sthitam // / //
analyzed: balam kasya api vā vīraḥ iti me manasi sthitam
translated: or any hero, so I think.

original: kriyatāṃ madvacaḥ kṣipraṃ hitaṃ pathyaṃ ca naḥ sadā /🔽ukte jāmbavataivaṃ tu nītisvalpākṣarānvite // / //
analyzed: kriyatām mad vacaḥ kṣipram hitam pathyam ca naḥ sadā  ukte jāmbavatā evam tu nīti su alpa akṣara anvite
translated: Let my words be quickly done, which are always beneficial and wholesome for us.🔽When Jāmbavān spoke thus, with a few words of policy,

original: vākye vānararājo 'sau śīghram utthāya cāsanāt /
analyzed: vākye vānara rājaḥ sau śīghram utthāya ca āsanāt
translated: the king of the monkeys quickly rose from his seat,

original: vāyuputrasamīpaṃ tu taṃ gatvā vākyam abravīt // / //
analyzed: vāyuputra samīpam tu tam gatvā vākyam abravīt
translated: and having gone near the son of the wind god, he spoke these words:

original: śṛṇu madvacanaṃ vīra hanuman mārutātmaja /
analyzed: śṛṇu mad vacanam vīra hanuman mārutātmaja
translated: Listen to my words, O hero Hanumān, son of the wind god.

original: ayam ikṣvākutilako rājā rāmaḥ pratāpavān // / //
analyzed: ayam ikṣvāku tilakaḥ rājā rāmaḥ pratāpavān
translated: This is the crest-jewel of the Ikṣvākus, the powerful king Rāma,

original: pitur ādeśam ādāya bhrātṛbhāryāsamanvitaḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ ādeśam ādāya bhrātṛ bhāryā samanvitaḥ
translated: having received the command of his father, accompanied by his brother and wife,

original: praviṣṭo daṇḍakāraṇyaṃ sākṣād dharmaparāyaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: praviṣṭaḥ daṇḍaka araṇyam sākṣāt dharma parāyaṇaḥ
translated: entered the Dāndaka forest, actually devoted to dharma.

original: sarvātmā sarvalokeśo viṣṇur mānuṣarūpavān /
translated: The soul of all, the lord of all worlds, Viṣṇu in human form,

original: asya bhāryā hṛtā tena duṣṭenāpi durātmanā // / //
analyzed: asya bhāryā hṛtā tena duṣṭena api durātmanā
translated: his wife was abducted by that wicked and evil-minded one.

original: tadviyogajaduḥkhārto vicinvaṃs tāṃ vane vane /
analyzed: tad viyoga ja duḥkha ārtaḥ vicinvan tām vane vane
translated: Afflicted by the grief arising from separation from her, searching for her in every forest,

original: tvayā dṛṣṭo nṛpaḥ pūrvam ayaṃ vīraḥ pratāpavān // / //
analyzed: tvayā dṛṣṭaḥ nṛpaḥ pūrvam ayam vīraḥ pratāpavān
translated: the king was seen by you first, this hero of great prowess.

original: etena saha saṃgamya samayaṃ cāpi kāritam /
analyzed: etena saha saṃgamya samayam ca api kāritam
translated: Having made an alliance with him, an agreement was made.

original: anena nihataḥ śatrur mama vālir mahābalaḥ // / //
analyzed: anena nihataḥ śatruḥ mama vāliḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: By him, my powerful enemy Vali was killed.

original: asya prasādena kape rājyaṃ prāptaṃ mayādhunā /
analyzed: asya prasādena kape rājyam prāptam mayā adhunā
translated: By his grace, O monkey, I have now obtained the kingdom.

original: mayā ca tat partijñātam asya sāhāyyakarmaṇi // / //
analyzed: mayā ca tat partijñātam asya sāhāyya karmaṇi
translated: And by me, this pledge was made to help him.

original: tat satyaṃ kartum icchāmi tvadbalān mārutātmaja /
analyzed: tat satyam kartum icchāmi tvad balāt mārutātmaja
translated: I wish to fulfill that truth with your help, O son of the Wind.

original: uttīrya sāgaraṃ vīra dṛṣṭvā sītām aninditām // / //
analyzed: uttīrya sāgaram vīra dṛṣṭvā sītām aninditām
translated: O hero, having crossed the ocean and seen the faultless Sita,

original: bhūyas tartuṃ balaṃ nāsti vānarāṇāṃ tvayā vinā /
analyzed: bhūyas tartum balam nā asti vānarāṇām tvayā vinā
translated: there is no strength left for the monkeys to return, except for you.

original: atas tvam eva jānāsi svāmikāryaṃ mahāmate // / //
analyzed: atas tvam eva jānāsi svāmi kāryam mahāmate
translated: Therefore, you alone know the duty of a master, O greatly wise one.

original: balavān nītimāṃś caiva dakṣas tvaṃ dautyakarmaṇi /
analyzed: balavān nītimān ca eva dakṣaḥ tvam dautya karmaṇi
translated: You are powerful, wise, and skilled in the work of a messenger.

original: tenaivam ukto hanumān sugrīveṇa mahātmanā // / //
analyzed: tena evam uktaḥ hanumān sugrīveṇa mahātmanā
translated: Thus addressed by the great-souled Sugriva, Hanuman,

original: svāmino 'rthaṃ na kiṃ kuryām īdṛśaṃ kiṃ nu bhāṣase /🔽ityukto vāyuputreṇa rāmas taṃ purataḥ sthitam // / //🔽prāha vākyaṃ mahābāhur bāṣpasaṃpūrṇalocanaḥ /
analyzed: svāminaḥ rtham na kim kuryām īdṛśam kim nu bhāṣase  iti uktaḥ vāyuputreṇa rāmaḥ tam puratas sthitam  prāha vākyam mahā bāhuḥ bāṣpa saṃpūrṇa locanaḥ
translated: Why should I not do what is to be done for my master? Why do you speak like this?🔽Thus addressed by the son of the Wind, Rama, with tears filling his eyes,

original: sītāṃ smṛtvā suduḥkhārtaḥ kālayuktam amitrajit // / //
analyzed: sītām smṛtvā su duḥkha ārtaḥ kāla yuktam amitra jit
translated: spoke these words to him standing in front, greatly afflicted by the grief of remembering Sita, the conqueror of enemies, at the right time.

original: tvayi bhāraṃ samāropya samudrataraṇādikam /
analyzed: tvayi bhāram samāropya samudra taraṇa ādikam
translated: Having entrusted the task of crossing the ocean and so on to you,

original: sugrīvaḥ sthāpyate hy atra mayā sārdhaṃ mahāmate // / //
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ sthāpyate hi atra mayā sārdham mahāmate
translated: O greatly wise one, Sugriva is being established here along with me.

original: hanūmaṃs tatra gaccha tvaṃ matprītyai kṛtaniścayaḥ /
analyzed: hanūman tatra gaccha tvam mad prītyai kṛta niścayaḥ
translated: O Hanumat, go there with a determined mind for my pleasure,

original: jñātīnāṃ ca tathā prītyai sugrīvasya viśeṣataḥ // / //
analyzed: jñātīnām ca tathā prītyai sugrīvasya viśeṣataḥ
translated: and for the pleasure of the relatives, especially Sugriva.

original: prāyeṇa rakṣasā nītā bhāryā me janakātmajā /
analyzed: prāyeṇa rakṣasā nītā bhāryā me janakātmajā
translated: My wife, the daughter of Janaka, has probably been taken away by a demon.

original: tatra gaccha mahāvīra yatra sītā vyavasthitā // / //
analyzed: tatra gaccha mahā vīra yatra sītā vyavasthitā
translated: O great hero, go there where Sita is situated.

original: yadi pṛcchati sādṛśyaṃ madākāram aśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: yadi pṛcchati sādṛśyam mad ākāram aśeṣatas
translated: If she asks about the resemblance of me in every way,

original: ato nirīkṣya māṃ bhūyo lakṣmaṇaṃ ca mamānujam // / //
analyzed: atas nirīkṣya mām bhūyas lakṣmaṇam ca mama anujam
translated: then, having examined me again and Lakshmana, my younger brother,

original: jñātvā sarvāṅgagaṃ lakṣma sakalaṃ cāvayor iha /
analyzed: jñātvā sarva aṅga gam lakṣma sakalam ca āvayoḥ iha
translated: and having known the complete mark on all our limbs here,

original: nānyathā viśvaset sītā iti me manasi sthitam // / //
analyzed: na anyathā viśvaset sītā iti me manasi sthitam
translated: Sita will not trust otherwise - this is what is in my mind.

original: ityukto rāmadevena prabhañjanasuto balī /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ rāmadevena prabhañjana sutaḥ balī
translated: Thus addressed by Lord Rama, the powerful son of the Wind God,

original: utthāya tatpuraḥ sthitvā kṛtāñjalir uvāca tam // / //
analyzed: utthāya tad puras sthitvā kṛtāñjaliḥ uvāca tam
translated: arose, stood before him with folded hands and said to him:

original: jānāmi lakṣaṇaṃ sarvaṃ yuvayos tu viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: jānāmi lakṣaṇam sarvam yuvayoḥ tu viśeṣataḥ
translated: I know all the characteristics, especially of you two.

original: gacchāmi kapibhiḥ sārdhaṃ tvaṃ śokaṃ mā kuruṣva vai // / //
analyzed: gacchāmi kapibhiḥ sārdham tvam śokam mā kuruṣva vai
translated: I will go with the monkeys. Do not grieve, O king.

original: anyac ca dehy abhijñānaṃ viśvāso yena me bhavet /
analyzed: anyat ca dehi abhijñānam viśvāsaḥ yena me bhavet
translated: And give me another token, by which I may have confidence.

original: sītāyās tava devyās tu rājan rājīvalocana // / //🔽ityukto vāyuputreṇa rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: sītāyāḥ tava devyāḥ tu rājan rājīva locana  iti uktaḥ vāyuputreṇa rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: O king, O lotus-eyed one, of Queen Sita.🔽Thus addressed by the son of the wind god, the lotus-eyed Rama,

original: aṅgulīyakam unmucya dattavān rāmacihnitam // / //
analyzed: aṅgulīyakam unmucya dattavān rāma cihnitam
translated: removing the ring marked with Rama's name, gave it to Hanumat.

original: tad gṛhītvā tadā so 'pi hanūmān mārutātmajaḥ /
analyzed: tat gṛhītvā tadā saḥ u pi hanūmān mārutātmajaḥ
translated: Then that Hanumat, the son of the wind god, taking it,

original: rāmaṃ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya lakṣmaṇaṃ ca kapīśvaram // / //
analyzed: rāmam pradakṣiṇīkṛtya lakṣmaṇam ca kapi īśvaram
translated: circumambulating Rama, Lakshmana, and the lord of monkeys,

original: natvā tato jagāmāśu hanūmān añjanīsutaḥ /
analyzed: natvā tatas jagāma āśu hanūmān añjanīsutaḥ
translated: bowing down, then quickly went, Hanumat, the son of Anjana.

original: sugrīvo 'pi ca tāñ chrutvā vānarān gantum udyatān // / //
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ pi ca tām śrutvā vānarān gantum udyatān
translated: Sugriva too, having heard those monkeys ready to go,

original: ājñeyān ājñāpayati vānarān baladarpitān /
analyzed: ājñeyān ājñāpayati vānarān bala darpitān
translated: commands the monkeys who are to be commanded, proud of their strength.

original: śṛṇvantu vānarāḥ sarve śāsanaṃ mama bhāṣitam // / //
analyzed: śṛṇvantu vānarāḥ sarve śāsanam mama bhāṣitam
translated: Let all the monkeys listen to the order spoken by me.

original: vilambanaṃ na kartavyaṃ yuṣmābhiḥ parvatādiṣu /
analyzed: vilambanam na kartavyam yuṣmābhiḥ parvata ādiṣu
translated: You should not delay on the mountains and so on.

original: drutaṃ gatvā tu tāṃ vīkṣya āgantavyam aninditām // / //
analyzed: drutam gatvā tu tām vīkṣya āgantavyam aninditām
translated: Having quickly gone and seen her, the blameless one, you should return.

original: rāmapatnīṃ mahābhāgāṃ sthāsye 'haṃ rāmasaṃnidhau /
analyzed: rāma patnīm mahābhāgām sthāsye haṃ rāma saṃnidhau
translated: The greatly fortunate wife of Rama, I will stay in the presence of Rama.

original: kartanaṃ vā kariṣyāmi anyathā kaṛnanāsayoḥ // / //
analyzed: kartanam vā kariṣyāmi anyathā
translated: Or I will cut off your ears and nose in another way.

original: evaṃ tān preṣayitvā tu ājñāpūrvaṃ kapīśvaraḥ /🔽atha te vānarā yātāḥ paścimādiṣu dikṣu vai // / //
analyzed: evam tān preṣayitvā tu ājñā pūrvam kapi īśvaraḥ  atha te vānarāḥ yātāḥ paścima ādiṣu dikṣu vai
translated: Having thus sent them with instructions, the lord of monkeys,🔽Then those monkeys went in the western and other directions,

original: te sānuṣu samasteṣu girīṇām api mūrdhasu /
analyzed: te sānuṣu samasteṣu girīṇām api mūrdhasu
translated: On all the peaks and summits of the mountains,

original: nadītīreṣu sarveṣu munīnām āśrameṣu ca // / //
analyzed: nadī tīreṣu sarveṣu munīnām āśrameṣu ca
translated: On the banks of all the rivers, in the hermitages of the sages,

original: kandareṣu ca sarveṣu vaneṣūpavaneṣu ca /🔽vṛkṣeṣu vṛkṣagulmeṣu guhāsu ca śilāsu ca // / //
analyzed: kandareṣu ca sarveṣu vaneṣu upavaneṣu ca  vṛkṣeṣu vṛkṣa gulmeṣu guhāsu ca śilāsu ca
translated: In all the caves, forests, and pleasure gardens,🔽In the trees, bushes, caves, and rocks,

original: sahyaparvatapārśveṣu vindhyasāgarapārśvayoḥ /
analyzed: sahya parvata pārśveṣu vindhya sāgara pārśvayoḥ
translated: On the sides of the Sahya mountain, on the shores of the Vindhya and ocean,

original: himavaty api śaile ca tathā kiṃpuruṣādiṣu // / //
analyzed: himavati api śaile ca tathā kiṃpuruṣa ādiṣu
translated: On the Himalayas and on the mountains of Kimpurusha and others,

original: manudeśeṣu sarveṣu saptapātālakeṣu ca /
analyzed: manu deśeṣu sarveṣu sapta pātālakeṣu ca
translated: In all the countries, in the seven nether worlds,

original: madhyadeśeṣu sarveṣu kaśmīreṣu mahābalāḥ // / //
analyzed: madhyadeśeṣu sarveṣu kaśmīreṣu mahā balāḥ
translated: In all the central regions, in Kashmir, the greatly powerful ones,

original: pūrvadeśeṣu sarveṣu kāmarūpeṣu kośale /
analyzed: pūrva deśeṣu sarveṣu kāmarūpeṣu kośale
translated: In all the eastern countries, in Kamarupa, in Kosala,

original: tīrthasthāneṣu sarveṣu saptakoṅkaṇakeṣu ca // / //
analyzed: tīrtha sthāneṣu sarveṣu sapta koṅkaṇakeṣu ca
translated: In all the holy places, in the seven Konkana regions,

original: yatra tatraiva te sītām adṛṣṭvā punar āgatāḥ /
analyzed: yatra tatra eva te sītām a dṛṣṭvā punar āgatāḥ
translated: Not having seen Sita anywhere, they returned again.

original: āgatya te namaskṛtya rāmalakṣmaṇapādayoḥ // / //
analyzed: āgatya te namaskṛtya rāma lakṣmaṇa pādayoḥ
translated: Having returned and bowed at the feet of Rama and Lakshmana,

original: sugrīvaṃ ca viśeṣeṇa nāsmābhiḥ kamalekṣaṇā /
analyzed: sugrīvam ca viśeṣeṇa na asmābhiḥ kamala īkṣaṇā
translated: In particular to Sugriva, We have not seen the lotus-eyed Sita anywhere.

original: dṛṣṭā sītā mahābhāgety uktvā tāṃs tatra tasthire // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭā sītā mahābhāgā iti uktvā tān tatra tasthire
translated: Having said, The greatly fortunate Sita has been seen, they remained there.

original: tatas taṃ duḥkhitaṃ prāha rāmadevaṃ kapīśvaraḥ /🔽sītā dakṣiṇadigbhāge sthitā draṣṭuṃ vane nṛpa // / //
analyzed: tatas tam duḥkhitam prāha rāmadevam kapi īśvaraḥ  sītā dakṣiṇa digbhāge sthitā draṣṭum vane nṛpa
translated: Then the lord of monkeys said to the afflicted Ramadeva:

original: śakyā vānarasiṃhena vāyuputreṇa dhīmatā /
analyzed: śakyā vānara siṃhena vāyuputreṇa dhīmatā
translated: O king, Sita is in the southern direction of the forest, standing. She can be seen by the wise son of the wind god, the lion among monkeys.

original: dṛṣṭvā sītām ihāyāti hanūmān nātra saṃśayaḥ // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā sītām iha āyāti hanūmān na atra saṃśayaḥ
translated: Having seen Sita, Hanumat will come here. There is no doubt about it.

original: sthiro bhava mahābāho rāma satyam idaṃ vacaḥ /
analyzed: sthiraḥ bhava mahā bāho rāma satyam idam vacaḥ
translated: O mighty-armed Rama, be steadfast. This is the truth.

original: lakṣmaṇo 'py āha śakunaṃ tatra vākyam idaṃ tadā // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ pi āha śakunam tatra vākyam idam tadā
translated: Lakshmana also spoke these words there, an auspicious sign:

original: sarvathā dṛṣṭasītas tu hanumān āgamiṣyati /
analyzed: sarvathā dṛṣṭa sītaḥ tu hanumān āgamiṣyati
translated: In every way, having seen Sita, Hanumat will come.

original: ity āśvāsya sthitau tatra rāmaṃ sugrīvalakṣmaṇau // / //
analyzed: iti āśvāsya sthitau tatra rāmam sugrīva lakṣmaṇau
translated: Having thus reassured Rama, Sugriva and Lakshmana remained there.

original: athāṅgadaṃ puraskṛtya ye gatā vānarottamāḥ /
analyzed: atha aṅgadam puraskṛtya ye gatāḥ vānara uttamāḥ
translated: Then, with Angada at the forefront, the best of monkeys who had gone

original: yatnād anveṣanārthāya rāmapatnīṃ yaśasvinīm // / //
analyzed: yatnāt anveṣana arthāya rāma patnīm yaśasvinīm
translated: in search of Rama's illustrious wife with great effort,

original: adṛṣṭvā śramam āpannāḥ kṛcchrabhūtās tadā vane /
analyzed: a dṛṣṭvā śramam āpannāḥ kṛcchra bhūtāḥ tadā vane
translated: not having seen her, became exhausted and distressed in the forest.

original: bhakṣaṇena vihīnās te kṣudhayā ca prapīḍitāḥ // / //
analyzed: bhakṣaṇena vihīnāḥ te kṣudhayā ca prapīḍitāḥ
translated: Deprived of food, they were afflicted by hunger.

original: bhramadbhir gahane 'raṇye kvāpi dṛṣṭā ca suprabhā /
analyzed: bhramadbhiḥ gahane raṇye kvāpi dṛṣṭā ca su prabhā
translated: Wandering in the dense forest, they saw a bright light somewhere.

original: guhānivāsinī siddhā ṛsipatnī hy aninditā // / //
analyzed: guhā nivāsinī siddhā ṛsi patnī hi aninditā
translated: The Siddha lady, the wife of the Rishi, who lived in the cave, was irreproachable.

original: sā ca tān āgatān dṛṣṭvā svāśramaṃ prati vānarān /
analyzed: sā ca tān āgatān dṛṣṭvā sva āśramam prati vānarān
