translated: And she, seeing those monkeys come to her hermitage,

original: āgatāḥ kasya yūyaṃ tu kutaḥ kiṃ nu prayojanam // / //
analyzed: āgatāḥ kasya yūyam tu kutas kim nu prayojanam
translated: said, Whom do you belong to? Where have you come from? What is your purpose?

original: ityukte jāmbavān āha tāṃ siddhāṃ sumahāmatiḥ /
analyzed: iti ukte jāmbavān āha tām siddhām su mahāmatiḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the very wise Jambavan said to that Siddha lady,

original: sugrīvasya vayaṃ bhṛtyā āgatā hy atra śobhane // / //
analyzed: sugrīvasya vayam bhṛtyāḥ āgatāḥ hi atra śobhane
translated: We are the servants of Sugriva, O beautiful one, and have come here.

original: rāmabhāryārtham anaghe sītānveṣaṇakarmaṇi /
analyzed: rāma bhāryā artham anaghe sītā anveṣaṇa karmaṇi
translated: O sinless one, in the search for Sita, the wife of Rama,

original: kāṃdigbhūtā nirāhārā adṛṣṭvā janakātmajām // / //
analyzed: kāṃdiś bhūtāḥ nirāhārāḥ a dṛṣṭvā janakātmajām
translated: we are wandering in all directions, without food, not having seen Janaka's daughter.

original: ityukte jāmbavaty atra punas tān āha sā śubhā /
analyzed: iti ukte jāmbavatī atra punar tān āha sā śubhā
translated: Thus addressed, the auspicious one again said to them there,

original: jānāmi rāmaṃ sītāṃ ca lakṣmaṇaṃ ca kapīśvaram // / //
analyzed: jānāmi rāmam sītām ca lakṣmaṇam ca kapi īśvaram
translated: I know Rama, Sita, Lakshmana, and the lord of monkeys.

original: bhuñjīdhvam atra me dattam āhāraṃ ca kapīśvarāḥ /
analyzed: bhuñjīdhvam atra me dattam āhāram ca kapi īśvarāḥ
translated: O lords of monkeys, eat the food given by me here.

original: rāmakāryāgatās tv atra yūyaṃ rāmasamā mama // / //🔽ity uktvā cāmṛtaṃ teṣāṃ yogād dattvā tapasvinī /
analyzed: rāma kārya āgatāḥ tu atra yūyam rāma samāḥ mama  iti uktvā ca amṛtam teṣām yogāt dattvā tapasvinī
translated: You who have come here for Rama's sake, are to me like Rama himself.🔽Having said this, the ascetic lady, by her power, gave them nectar to eat,

original: bhojayitvā yathākāmaṃ bhūyas tān āha tāpasī // / //
analyzed: bhojayitvā yathākāmam bhūyas tān āha tāpasī
translated: and having fed them as they desired, the ascetic lady again said to them,

original: sītāsthānaṃ tu jānāti saṃpātir nāma pakṣirāṭ /
analyzed: sītā sthānam tu jānāti saṃpātiḥ nāma pakṣirāj
translated: The king of birds named Sampati knows the abode of Sita.

original: āsthito vai vane so 'pi mahendre parvate dvijaḥ // / //
analyzed: āsthitaḥ vai vane saḥ pi mahendre parvate dvijaḥ
translated: That bird is now residing on the Mahendra mountain.

original: mārgeṇānena harayas tatra yūyaṃ gamiṣyatha /
analyzed: mārgeṇa anena harayaḥ tatra yūyam gamiṣyatha
translated: By this path you will go there, O monkeys.

original: sa vakti sītāṃ saṃpātir dūradarśī tu yaḥ khagaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa vakti sītām saṃpātiḥ dūradarśī tu yaḥ khagaḥ
translated: That Sampati, the bird with far-seeing eyes, will tell you about Sita.

original: tenādiṣṭaṃ tu panthānaṃ punar āsādya gacchatha /
analyzed: tena ādiṣṭam tu panthānam punar āsādya gacchatha
translated: Having reached the path indicated by him, you go again.

original: avaśyaṃ jānakīṃ sītāṃ drakṣyate pavanātmajaḥ // / //
analyzed: avaśyam jānakīm sītām drakṣyate pavanātmajaḥ
translated: The son of the wind god will certainly see Sita, the daughter of Janaka.

original: tayaivamuktāḥ kapayaḥ parāṃ prītim upāgatāḥ /
analyzed: tayā evam uktāḥ kapayaḥ parām prītim upāgatāḥ
translated: Thus addressed by her, the monkeys attained supreme joy.

original: hṛṣṭās tejanam āpannās tāṃ praṇamya pratasthire // / //
analyzed: hṛṣṭāḥ tejanam āpannāḥ tām praṇamya pratasthire
translated: Delighted and inspired, they departed after bowing to her.

original: mahendrādriṃ gatā vīrā vānarās taddidṛkṣayā /
analyzed: mahendra adrim gatāḥ vīrāḥ vānarāḥ tad didṛkṣayā
translated: The heroic monkeys went to the Mahendra mountain with the desire to see him.

original: tatra sampātim āsīnaṃ dṛṣṭavantaḥ kapīśvarāḥ // / //
analyzed: tatra sampātim āsīnam dṛṣṭavantaḥ kapi īśvarāḥ
translated: The lords of monkeys saw Sampati sitting there.

original: tān uvācātha sampātir vānarān āgatān dvijaḥ /
analyzed: tān uvāca atha sampātiḥ vānarān āgatān dvijaḥ
translated: Then the bird Sampati said to the arrived monkeys:

original: ke yūyam iti saṃprāptāḥ kasya vā brūta mā ciram // / //
analyzed: ke yūyam iti saṃprāptāḥ kasya vā brūta mā ciram
translated: Who are you? Whose? Tell me without delay.

original: ityukte vānarā ūcur yathāvṛttam anukramāt /🔽rāmadūtā vayaṃ sarve sītānveṣaṇakarmaṇi // / //
analyzed: iti ukte vānarāḥ ūcuḥ yathāvṛttam anukramāt  rāma dūtāḥ vayam sarve sītā anveṣaṇa karmaṇi
translated: Thus addressed, the monkeys told the story in order.🔽We are all messengers of Rama, sent by the great king Sugriva,

original: preṣitāḥ kapirājena sugrīveṇa mahātmanā /
analyzed: preṣitāḥ kapi rājena sugrīveṇa mahātmanā
translated: on the mission of searching for Sita.

original: tvāṃ draṣṭum iha saṃprāptāḥ siddhāyā vacanād dvija // / //
analyzed: tvām draṣṭum iha saṃprāptāḥ siddhāyāḥ vacanāt dvija
translated: have come here to see you, O bird, at the command of the accomplished one.

original: sītāsthānaṃ mahābhāga tvaṃ no vada mahāmate /
analyzed: sītā sthānam mahābhāga tvam naḥ vada mahāmate
translated: O greatly fortunate one, O greatly wise one, please tell us the abode of Sita.

original: ityukto vānaraiḥ śyeno vīkṣāṃ cakre sudakṣiṇām // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ vānaraiḥ śyenaḥ vīkṣām cakre su dakṣiṇām
translated: Thus addressed by the monkeys, the hawk looked to the right in a most auspicious manner.

original: sītāṃ dṛṣṭvā sa laṅkāyām aśokākhye mahāvane /
analyzed: sītām dṛṣṭvā sa laṅkāyām aśoka ākhye mahā vane
translated: Having seen Sita in Lanka, in the great forest called Asoka,

original: sthiteti kathitaṃ tena jaṭāyus tu mṛtas tava // / //
analyzed: sthitā iti kathitam tena jaṭāyuḥ tu mṛtaḥ tava
translated: he said that she was staying there, but that Jatayu was dead.

original: bhrāteti cocuḥ sa snātvā dattvā tasyodakāñjalim /
analyzed: bhrātā iti ca ūcuḥ sa snātvā dattvā tasya udaka añjalim
translated: Having bathed and offered water libations to him, they said that he was their brother.

original: yogam āsthāya svaṃ dehaṃ visasarja mahāmatiḥ // / //
analyzed: yogam āsthāya svam deham visasarja mahāmatiḥ
translated: The greatly wise one then resorted to yoga and cast off his body.

original: tatas taṃ vānarā dagdhvā dattvā tasyodakāñjalim /
analyzed: tatas tam vānarāḥ dagdhvā dattvā tasya udaka añjalim
translated: Then the monkeys cremated him and offered water libations.

original: gatvā mahendraśṛṅgaṃ te tam āruhya kṣaṇaṃ sthitāḥ // / //
analyzed: gatvā mahā indra śṛṅgam te tam āruhya kṣaṇam sthitāḥ
translated: Having gone to the peak of Mahendra, they climbed it and stayed there for a moment.

original: sāgaraṃ vīkṣya te sarve parasparam athābruvan /
analyzed: sāgaram vīkṣya te sarve parasparam atha abruvan
translated: Having seen the ocean, they all spoke to each other:

original: rāvaṇenaiva bhāryā sā nītā rāmasya niścitam // / //
analyzed: rāvaṇena eva bhāryā sā nītā rāmasya niścitam
translated: It is certain that Ravana has abducted Rama's wife.

original: sampātivacanād adya saṃjñātaṃ sakalaṃ hi tat /
analyzed: sampāti vacanāt adya saṃjñātam sakalam hi tat
translated: Today we have learned all this from Sampati's words.

original: vānarāṇāṃ tu kaś cātra uttīrya lavaṇodadhim // / //
analyzed: vānarāṇām tu kaḥ ca atra uttīrya lavaṇa udadhim
translated: But which of the monkeys can cross the salt ocean here?

original: laṅkāṃ praviṣya dṛṣṭvā tāṃ rāmapatnīṃ yaśasvinīm /
analyzed: laṅkām praviṣya dṛṣṭvā tām rāma patnīm yaśasvinīm
translated: Having entered Lanka and seen Rama's illustrious wife,

original: punas codadhitaraṇe śaktiṃ brūta hi śobhanāḥ // / //
analyzed: punar ca udadhi taraṇe śaktim brūta hi śobhanāḥ
translated: And again, tell me, you who are glorious, about the means of crossing the ocean.

original: ityukto jāmbavvan prāha sarve śaktās tu vānarāḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ jāmbavvan prāha sarve śaktāḥ tu vānarāḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Jāmbavān said, All the monkeys are indeed capable.

original: sāgarottaraṇe kiṃtu kāryam anyasya saṃbhavet // / //
analyzed: sāgara uttaraṇe kiṃtu kāryam anyasya saṃbhavet
translated: But what should be done in the event of another's ability to cross the ocean?

original: tatra dakṣo 'yam evātra hanūmān iti me matiḥ /
analyzed: tatra dakṣaḥ yam eva atra hanūmān iti me matiḥ
translated: In this matter, it is my opinion that this very dexterous Hanūmat is the one.

original: kālakṣepo na kartavyo māsārdham adhikaṃ gatam // / //
analyzed: kālakṣepaḥ na kartavyaḥ māsa ardham adhikam gatam
translated: No delay should be made, more than half a month has passed.

original: yady adṛṣṭvā tu gacchāmo vaidehīṃ vānararṣabhāḥ /
analyzed: yadi a dṛṣṭvā tu gacchāmaḥ vaidehīm vānara ṛṣabhāḥ
translated: If we go back without seeing Vaidehī, O best of monkeys,

original: karṇanāsādi naḥ svāṅgaṃ nikṛntati kapīśvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: karṇa nāsā ādi naḥ sva aṅgam nikṛntati kapi īśvaraḥ
translated: the lord of monkeys will cut off our limbs, such as ears and nose.

original: tasmāt prārthyaḥ sa cāsmābhir vāyuputras tu me matiḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt prārthyaḥ sa ca asmābhiḥ vāyuputraḥ tu me matiḥ
translated: Therefore, it is my opinion that we should request that son of the wind god.

original: ityuktās te tathety ūcur vānarā vṛddhavānaram // / //
analyzed: iti uktāḥ te tathā iti ūcuḥ vānarāḥ vṛddha vānaram
translated: Thus addressed, the monkeys said, So be it, to the old monkey.

original: tatas te vānarāḥ pavanātmajam /
analyzed: tatas te prārthayāmasuḥ vānarāḥ pavanātmajam
translated: Then those monkeys,

original: hanūmantaṃ mahāprājñaṃ dakṣaṃ kāryeṣu cādhikam // / //
analyzed: hanūmantam mahā prājñam dakṣam kāryeṣu ca adhikam
translated: to the greatly wise and most skilled Hanumān, the son of the wind god,

original: gaccha tvaṃ rāmabhṛtyas tvaṃ rāvaṇasya bhayāya ca /
analyzed: gaccha tvam rāma bhṛtyaḥ tvam rāvaṇasya bhayāya ca
translated: Go, you are Rāma's servant, and for Rāvaṇa's fear,

original: rakṣasva vānarakulam asmākam añjanīsuta /
analyzed: rakṣasva vānara kulam asmākam añjanī suta
translated: protect our monkey clan, O son of Añjanā.

original: ityuktas tāṃs tathety āha vānarān pavanātmajaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ tān tathā iti āha vānarān pavanātmajaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, the son of the wind god said to the monkeys, So be it.

original: rāmaprayuktaś ca punaḥ svabhartṛṇā punar mahendraṃ kapibhiś ca noditaḥ /
analyzed: rāma prayuktaḥ ca punar sva bhartṛṇā punar mahā indram kapibhiḥ ca noditaḥ
translated: And again urged by his own master, Rama, and by the great Indra, and by the monkeys,

original: gantuṃ pracakre matim añjanīsutaḥ samudram uttīrya niśācarālayam // / //
analyzed: gantum pracakre matim añjanī sutaḥ samudram uttīrya niśācara ālayam
translated: The son of Anjana made up his mind to cross the ocean and go to the abode of the night-walkers.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe rāmaprādurbhāve pañcāśo 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe rāmaprādurbhāve pañcāśaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fiftieth chapter in the Rakshasa-Vadha Parva of the Adi Parva in the holy Mahabharata, of the great sage Krishna-Dvaipayana Vyasa.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: sa tu rāvaṇanītāyāḥ sītāyāḥ parimārgaṇam /
analyzed: sa tu rāvaṇa nītāyāḥ sītāyāḥ parimārgaṇam
translated: He set out to find Sita, who had been taken away by Ravana,

original: iyeṣa padam anveṣṭuṃ cāraṇācarite pathi // / //
analyzed: iyeṣa padam anveṣṭum cāraṇa ācarite pathi
translated: Seeking her footsteps on the path frequented by the Charanas.

original: añjaliṃ prāṅmukhaṃ kṛtvā sagaṇāyātmayonaye /
analyzed: añjalim prāc mukham kṛtvā sa gaṇāya ātmayonaye
translated: With folded hands facing east, he mentally paid homage to the Lord of his own lineage, along with his retinue,

original: manasāvandya rāmaṃ ca lakṣmaṇaṃ ca mahāratham // / //
analyzed: manasā āvandya rāmam ca lakṣmaṇam ca mahā ratham
translated: And to Rama and the great warrior Lakshmana.

original: sāgaraṃ saritaś caiva praṇamya śirasā kapiḥ /
analyzed: sāgaram saritaḥ ca eva praṇamya śirasā kapiḥ
translated: The monkey bowed his head to the ocean and the rivers,

original: jñātīṃś caiva pariṣvajya kṛtvā caiva pradakṣiṇām // / //🔽ariṣṭaṃ gaccha panthānaṃ puṇyavāyuniṣevitam /
analyzed: jñātīn ca eva pariṣvajya kṛtvā ca eva pradakṣiṇām  ariṣṭam gaccha panthānam puṇya vāyu niṣevitam
translated: Embraced his relatives and circumambulated them.🔽Go without mishap on your path, frequented by auspicious winds,

original: punarāgamanāyeti vānarair abhipūjitaḥ // / //
analyzed: punarāgamanāya iti vānaraiḥ abhipūjitaḥ
translated: And was honored by the monkeys, For the sake of your return.

original: añjasā svaṃ tathā vīryam āviveśātha vīryavān /
analyzed: añjasā svam tathā vīryam āviveśa atha vīryavān
translated: The powerful one then swiftly entered his own strength,

original: mārgam ālokayan dūrād ūrdhvaṃ praṇihitekṣaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: mārgam ālokayan dūrāt ūrdhvam praṇihita īkṣaṇaḥ
translated: Looking at the path from afar, his eyes fixed upwards.

original: saṃpūrṇam iva cātmānaṃ bhāvayitvā mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: saṃpūrṇam iva ca ātmānam bhāvayitvā mahā balaḥ
translated: The mighty one, considering himself complete,

original: utpapāta gireḥ śṛṅgān niṣpīḍya girim ambaram // / //
analyzed: utpapāta gireḥ śṛṅgāt niṣpīḍya girim ambaram
translated: rose up from the mountain peak, pressing the mountain into the sky.

original: pitur mārgeṇa yātasya vāyuputrasya dhīmataḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ mārgeṇa yātasya vāyuputrasya dhīmataḥ
translated: The intelligent son of the wind god, who had gone by the path of his father,

original: rāmakāryaparasyāsya sāgareṇa pracoditah // / //
analyzed: rāma kārya parasya asya sāgareṇa pracoditah
translated: was urged by the ocean, as he was intent on Rama's task.

original: viśrāmārthaṃ samuttasthau maināko lavaṇodadheḥ /
analyzed: viśrāma artham samuttasthau mainākaḥ lavaṇa udadheḥ
translated: For the sake of rest, Mount Mainaka rose up from the salt ocean.

original: taṃ nirīkṣya nipīḍyātha rayāt saṃbhāṣya sādaram // / //
analyzed: tam nirīkṣya nipīḍya atha rayāt saṃbhāṣya sa ādaram
translated: Having seen him, he pressed him and spoke respectfully with a roar.

original: utpataṃś ca vane vīraḥ siṃhikāsyaṃ mahākapiḥ /🔽āsyaprāntaṃ praviśyātha vegenāntarviniḥsṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: utpatan ca vane vīraḥ siṃhikā āsyam mahā kapiḥ  āsya prāntam praviśya atha vegena antar viniḥsṛtaḥ
translated: And the great monkey, the hero, leaping in the forest, with a lion's face,🔽having entered the edge of the mouth, quickly came out from within.

original: niḥsṛtya gatavāñ śīghraṃ vāyuputraḥ pratāpavān /
analyzed: niḥsṛtya gatavām śīghram vāyuputraḥ pratāpavān
translated: Having come out and gone quickly, the powerful son of the wind god,

original: laṅghayitvā tu taṃ deśaṃ sāgaraṃ pavanātmajaḥ // / //
analyzed: laṅghayitvā tu tam deśam sāgaram pavanātmajaḥ
translated: having crossed that place, the son of the wind god, the ocean,

original: trikūṭaśikhare ramye vṛkṣāgre nipapāta ha /
analyzed: trikūṭa śikhare ramye vṛkṣa agre nipapāta ha
translated: landed on the top of a tree on the peak of the beautiful Trikuta.

original: tasmin sa parvataśreṣṭhe dinaṃ nītvā dinakṣaye // / //🔽saṃdhyām upāsya hanumān rātrau laṅkām śanair niśi /
analyzed: tasmin sa parvata śreṣṭhe dinam nītvā dinakṣaye  saṃdhyām upāsya hanumān rātrau laṅkām śanais niśi
translated: Having spent the day on that best of mountains, at the end of the day,🔽having worshipped the evening, Hanuman slowly entered Lanka at night.

original: laṅkābhidhāṃ vinirjitya devatāṃ praviveśa ha // / //
analyzed: laṅkā abhidhām vinirjitya devatām praviveśa ha
translated: Having conquered the deity named Lanka, he entered.

original: laṅkām anekaratnāḍhyāṃ bahvāścaryasamanvitām /🔽rākṣaseṣu prasupteṣu nītimān pavanātmajaḥ // / //
analyzed: laṅkām aneka ratna āḍhyām bahu āścarya samanvitām  rākṣaseṣu prasupteṣu nītimān pavanātmajaḥ
translated: Lanka, which was full of many jewels and many wonders,🔽while the demons were asleep, the wise son of the wind god (Hanuman) entered Lanka.

original: rāvaṇasya tato veśma praviveśātha ṛddhimat /
analyzed: rāvaṇasya tatas veśma praviveśa atha ṛddhimat
translated: Then he entered Ravana's prosperous palace.

original: śayānaṃ rāvaṇaṃ dṛṣṭvā talpe mahati vānaraḥ // / //
analyzed: śayānam rāvaṇam dṛṣṭvā talpe mahati vānaraḥ
translated: Seeing Ravana lying on a large bed, the monkey (Hanuman) saw him.

original: nāsāpuṭair ghorakārair viśidbhir vāyumocakaiḥ /
analyzed: nāsāpuṭaiḥ ghorakāraiḥ viśidbhiḥ vāyumocakaiḥ
translated: With his nostrils, which were terrible and could release wind, and

original: tathaiva daśabhir vaktrair daṃṣṭropetais tu saṃyutam // / //
analyzed: tathā eva daśabhiḥ vaktraiḥ daṃṣṭra upetaiḥ tu saṃyutam
translated: with his ten mouths, which were full of fangs, he saw Ravana.

original: strīsahasrais tu dṛṣṭvā taṃ nānābharaṇabhūṣitam /
analyzed: strī sahasraiḥ tu dṛṣṭvā tam nānā ābharaṇa bhūṣitam
translated: Seeing him adorned with various ornaments, and surrounded by thousands of women,

original: tasmin sītām adṛṣṭvā tu rāvaṇasya gṛhe śubhe // / //
analyzed: tasmin sītām a dṛṣṭvā tu rāvaṇasya gṛhe śubhe
translated: not seeing Sita in Ravana's auspicious house, the monkey (Hanuman) was distressed.

original: tathā śayānāṃ svagṛhe rākṣasānāṃ ca nāyakam /
analyzed: tathā śayānām sva gṛhe rākṣasānām ca nāyakam
translated: Seeing the leader of the demons lying in his own house,

original: duḥkhito vāyuputras tu saṃpāter vacanaṃ smaran // / //
analyzed: duḥkhitaḥ vāyuputraḥ tu saṃpāteḥ vacanam smaran
translated: the son of the wind god, remembering Sampati's words, was distressed.

original: aśokavanikāṃ prāpto nānāpuṣpasamanvitām /
analyzed: aśoka vanikām prāptaḥ nānā puṣpa samanvitām
translated: He reached the Aśoka grove, which was full of various flowers,

original: juṣṭāṃ malayajātena candanena sugandhinā // / //
analyzed: juṣṭām malaya jātena candanena sugandhinā
translated: and which was fragrant with the Malaya sandalwood.

original: praviśya śiṃśapāvṛkṣam āśritāṃ janakātmajām /
analyzed: praviśya śiṃśapā vṛkṣam āśritām janakātmajām
translated: Entering the Aśoka grove, he saw Janaka's daughter, who was protected by the demonesses,🔽and who was clinging to a Śiṃśapā tree.

original: rāmapatnīṃ samadrākṣīd rākṣasībhir surakṣitām // / //
analyzed: rāma patnīm samadrākṣīt rākṣasībhiḥ su rakṣitām
translated: Seeing Rāma's wife, who was protected by the demonesses,

original: aśokavṛkṣam āruhya puṣpitaṃ madhupallavam /
analyzed: aśoka vṛkṣam āruhya puṣpitam madhu pallavam
translated: Having climbed the flowering and tender-leaved Aśoka tree,

original: āsāṃ cakre haris tatra seyaṃ sīteti saṃsmaran // / //
analyzed: āsām cakre hariḥ tatra sā iyam sītā iti saṃsmaran
translated: Hari sat there, remembering her as 'Sita'.

original: sītāṃ nirīkṣya vṛkṣāgre yāvad āste 'nilātmajaḥ /
analyzed: sītām nirīkṣya vṛkṣa agre yāvat āste nilātmajaḥ
translated: While the son of the Wind-god was looking at Sita on the tree,

original: strībhiḥ parivṛtas tatra rāvaṇas tāvad āgataḥ // / //
analyzed: strībhiḥ parivṛtaḥ tatra rāvaṇaḥ tāvat āgataḥ
translated: Ravana, surrounded by women, came there.

original: āgatya sītāṃ prāhātha priye māṃ bhaja kāmukam /
analyzed: āgatya sītām prāha atha priye mām bhaja kāmukam
translated: Having come, he said to Sita, O beloved, love me, the passionate one.

original: bhuṣitā bhava vaidehi tyaja rāmāgataṃ manaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhuṣitā bhava vaidehi tyaja rāma āgatam manaḥ
translated: O Vaidehi, adorn yourself, abandon the thought of Rama.

original: ity evaṃ bhāṣamāṇaṃ tam antardhāya tṛṇaṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: iti evam bhāṣamāṇam tam antardhāya tṛṇam tatas
translated: Having spoken thus, he covered himself with grass.

original: prāha vākyaṃ śanaiḥ sītā kampamānātha rāvaṇam // / //
analyzed: prāha vākyam śanais sītā kampamānā atha rāvaṇam
translated: Sita, trembling, slowly spoke to Ravana,

original: gaccha rāvaṇa duṣṭa tvaṃ paradāraparāyaṇa /
analyzed: gaccha rāvaṇa duṣṭa tvam para dāra parāyaṇa
translated: O Ravana, O wicked one, devoted to others' wives, go.

original: acirād rāmabāṇās te pibantu rudhiraṃ raṇe // / //
analyzed: acirāt rāma bāṇāḥ te pibantu rudhiram raṇe
translated: Soon Rama's arrows will drink your blood in battle.

original: tathetyukto bhartsitaś ca rākṣasīr āha rākṣasaḥ /
analyzed: tathā iti uktaḥ bhartsitaḥ ca rākṣasīḥ āha rākṣasaḥ
translated: Thus addressed and rebuked, the demon said to the demonesses,

original: dvimāsābhyantare cainaṃ vaśīkuruta mānuṣīm // / //
analyzed: dvi māsa abhyantare ca enam vaśīkuruta mānuṣīm
translated: Within two months, subdue this human woman.

original: yadi necchati māṃ sītā tataḥ khādata mānuṣīm /
analyzed: yadi nā icchati mām sītā tatas khādata mānuṣīm
translated: If Sita does not love me, then eat this human woman.

original: ity uktvā gatavān duṣṭo rāvaṇaḥ svaṃ niketanam // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā gatavān duṣṭaḥ rāvaṇaḥ svam niketanam
translated: Having said this, the wicked Ravana went to his own abode.

original: tato bhayena tāṃ prāhū rākṣasyo janakātmajām /
analyzed: tatas bhayena tām prāhuḥ rākṣasyaḥ janakātmajām
translated: Then, out of fear, the demonesses spoke to Sita, the daughter of Janaka:

original: rāvaṇaṃ bhaja kalyāṇi sadhanaṃ sukhinī bhava // / //
analyzed: rāvaṇam bhaja kalyāṇi sa dhanam sukhinī bhava
translated: O fortunate one, serve Ravana, be happy with wealth.

original: ityuktā prāha tāḥ sītā rāghavo 'laghuvikramaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktā prāha tāḥ sītāḥ rāghavaḥ laghu vikramaḥ
translated: Thus addressed, Sita said to them: Raghava, of unfathomable prowess,

original: nihatya rāvaṇaṃ yuddhe sagaṇaṃ māṃ nayiṣyati // / //
analyzed: nihatya rāvaṇam yuddhe sa gaṇam mām nayiṣyati
translated: having killed Ravana in battle, will take me away with his army.

original: nāham anyasya bhāryā syām ṛte rāmaṃ raghūttamam /
analyzed: na aham anyasya bhāryā syām ṛte rāmam raghūttamam
translated: I will not be the wife of anyone else except Rama, the best of the Raghus.

original: sa hy āgatya daśagrīvaṃ hatvā māṃ pālayiṣyati // / //
analyzed: sa hi āgatya daśagrīvam hatvā mām pālayiṣyati
translated: He will come and kill the ten-headed one and protect me.

original: ity ākarṇya vacas tasyā rākṣasyo dadṛśur bhayam /
analyzed: iti ākarṇya vacaḥ tasyāḥ rākṣasyaḥ dadṛśuḥ bhayam
translated: Hearing these words of hers, the demonesses saw fear.

original: hanyatāṃ hanyatām eṣā bhakṣyatāṃ bhakṣyatām iyam // / //
analyzed: hanyatām hanyatām eṣā bhakṣyatām bhakṣyatām iyam
translated: Let her be killed, let her be killed! Let her be eaten, let her be eaten!

original: tatas tās trijatā prāha svapne dṛṣṭam aninditā /
analyzed: tatas tāḥ trijatā prāha svapne dṛṣṭam aninditā
translated: Then, the unblemished Trijata said: In a dream, I saw

original: śṛṇudhvaṃ duṣṭarākṣasyo rāvaṇasya vināśanaḥ // / //
analyzed: śṛṇudhvam duṣṭa rākṣasyaḥ rāvaṇasya vināśanaḥ
translated: Listen, O wicked demonesses, the destroyer of Ravana,

original: rakṣobhiḥ saha sarvais tu rāvaṇasya mṛtipradaḥ /
analyzed: rakṣobhiḥ saha sarvaiḥ tu rāvaṇasya mṛti pradaḥ
translated: the giver of death to Ravana along with all the demons,

original: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā rāmasya vijayapradaḥ // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇena saha bhrātrā rāmasya vijaya pradaḥ
translated: the giver of victory to Rama along with his brother Lakshmana.

original: svapnaḥ śubho mayā dṛṣṭaḥ sītāyās ca patipradaḥ /
analyzed: svapnaḥ śubhaḥ mayā dṛṣṭaḥ sītāyāḥ ca pati pradaḥ
translated: I have seen an auspicious dream, the giver of a husband to Sita.

original: trijatāvākyam ākarṇya sītāpārśvaṃ visṛjya tāḥ // / //
analyzed: trijatā vākyam ākarṇya sītā pārśvam visṛjya tāḥ
translated: Having heard Trijata's words, they left her by Sita's side.

original: rākṣasyas tā yayuḥ sarvāḥ sītām āhāñjanīsutaḥ /
analyzed: rākṣasyaḥ tāḥ yayuḥ sarvāḥ sītām āha añjanīsutaḥ
translated: All those demonesses went away. The son of Añjanā said to Sītā:

original: kīrtayan rāmavṛttāntaṃ sakalaṃ pavanātmajaḥ // / //
analyzed: kīrtayan rāma vṛttāntam sakalam pavanātmajaḥ
translated: The son of the Wind, recounting the entire story of Rāma,

original: tasyāṃ viśvāsam ānīya dattvā rāmāṅgulīyakam /
analyzed: tasyām viśvāsam ānīya dattvā rāma aṅgulīyakam
translated: having inspired confidence in her and given her Rāma's ring,

original: saṃbhāṣya lakṣaṇaṃ sarvaṃ rāmalakṣmaṇayos tataḥ // / //
analyzed: saṃbhāṣya lakṣaṇam sarvam rāma lakṣmaṇayoḥ tatas
translated: having told her all the characteristics of Rāma and Lakṣmaṇa,

original: mahatyā senayā yuktaḥ sugrīvaḥ kapināyakaḥ /
analyzed: mahatyā senayā yuktaḥ sugrīvaḥ kapi nāyakaḥ
translated: Sugrīva, the leader of the monkeys, accompanied by a great army,

original: tena sārdham ihāgatya rāmas tava patiḥ prabhuḥ // / //
analyzed: tena sārdham iha āgatya rāmaḥ tava patiḥ prabhuḥ
translated: your husband, the lord Rāma, has come here with him.

original: lakṣmaṇaś ca mahāvīro devaras te śubhānane /
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ ca mahā vīraḥ devaraḥ te śubha ānane
translated: And Lakṣmaṇa, the great hero, your brother-in-law, O you of beautiful face,

original: rāvaṇaṃ sagaṇaṃ hatvā tvām ito 'dāya gacchati // / //
analyzed: rāvaṇam sa gaṇam hatvā tvām itas dāya gacchati
translated: having killed Rāvaṇa and his followers, is taking you from here.

original: ityukte sā tu viśvastā vāyuputram athābravīt /
analyzed: iti ukte sā tu viśvastā vāyuputram atha abravīt
translated: When this was said, she, full of trust, then spoke to the son of the Wind:

original: katham atrāgato vīra tvam uttīrya mahodadhim // / //
analyzed: katham atrā āgataḥ vīra tvam uttīrya mahā udadhim
translated: O hero, how did you come here, having crossed the great ocean?

original: ity ākarṇya vacas tasyāḥ punas tām āha vānaraḥ /
analyzed: iti ākarṇya vacaḥ tasyāḥ punar tām āha vānaraḥ
translated: Having heard these words of hers, the monkey again said to her:

original: goṣpadavan mayottīrṇaḥ samudro 'yaṃ varānane // / //
analyzed: goṣpada vat mayā uttīrṇaḥ samudraḥ yam varānane
translated: O beautiful-faced one, by me this ocean has been crossed like a cow's footprint.

original: japato rāma rāmeti sāgaro goṣpadāyate /
analyzed: japataḥ rāma rāma iti sāgaraḥ goṣpadāyate
translated: While I was repeating 'Rāma, Rāma,' the ocean became like a cow's footprint.

original: duḥkhamagnāsi vaidehi sthirā bhava śubhānane // / //
analyzed: duḥkha magnā asi vaidehi sthirā bhava śubha ānane
translated: O Vaidehī, you are immersed in sorrow. Be firm, O you of beautiful face.

original: kṣipraṃ paśya hi rāmaṃ tvaṃ satyam etad bravīmi te /
analyzed: kṣipram paśya hi rāmam tvam satyam etat bravīmi te
translated: You will soon see Rama. I tell you this truthfully.

original: ity āśvāsya satīṃ sītāṃ duḥkhitāṃ janakātmajām // / //
analyzed: iti āśvāsya satīm sītām duḥkhitām janakātmajām
translated: Having thus comforted the faithful Sita, the sorrowful daughter of Janaka,

original: tataś cūḍāmaṇi prāpya śrutvā kākaparābhavam /
analyzed: tatas cūḍāmaṇi prāpya śrutvā kāka parābhavam
translated: and having obtained the crest jewel, and hearing about the defeat of the crow,

original: natvā tāṃ prasthito vīro gantuṃ kṛtamatiḥ kapiḥ // / //
analyzed: natvā tām prasthitaḥ vīraḥ gantum kṛtamatiḥ kapiḥ
translated: the hero, the monkey, having bowed to her and made up his mind to go, set out.

original: tato vimṛśya tad bhuṅktvā kṛīḍāvanam aśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: tatas vimṛśya tat bhuṅktvā kṛīḍāvanam aśeṣatas
translated: Then, having reflected and enjoyed the pleasure garden completely,

original: toraṇastho nanādoccai rāmo jayati vīryavān // / //
analyzed: toraṇa sthaḥ nanāda uccais rāmaḥ jayati vīryavān
translated: standing at the gate, he loudly proclaimed, Rama, the valiant one, is victorious!

original: anekān rākṣasān hatvā senāḥ senāpatīṃś ca saḥ /
analyzed: anekān rākṣasān hatvā senāḥ senāpatīn ca saḥ
translated: Having killed many demons, his armies and generals,

original: tadā tvakṣakumāraṃ tu hatvā rāvaṇasainikam // / //
analyzed: tadā tu akṣa kumāram tu hatvā rāvaṇa sainikam
translated: then having killed Aksha, the son of Ravana's general,

original: sāśvaṃ sasārathiṃ hatvā indrajit taṃ gṛhītavān /
analyzed: sa aśvam sa sārathim hatvā indrajit tam gṛhītavān
translated: Indrajit killed him along with his horse and charioteer and captured him.

original: rāvaṇasya puraḥ sthitvā rāmaṃ saṃkīrtya lakṣmaṇam // / //
analyzed: rāvaṇasya puras sthitvā rāmam saṃkīrtya lakṣmaṇam
translated: Standing in front of Ravana, he mentioned Rama and Lakshmana,

original: sugrīvaṃ ca mahāvīryaṃ dagdhvā laṅkām aśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: sugrīvam ca mahā vīryam dagdhvā laṅkām aśeṣatas
translated: and having completely burnt down Lanka, the greatly valiant Sugriva,

original: nirbhartsya rāvaṇaṃ duṣṭaṃ punaḥ saṃbhāṣya jānakīm // / //
analyzed: nirbhartsya rāvaṇam duṣṭam punar saṃbhāṣya jānakīm
translated: having rebuked the wicked Ravana and again spoken to Janakee,

original: bhūyaḥ sāgaram uttīrya jñātīn āsādya vīryavān /
analyzed: bhūyas sāgaram uttīrya jñātīn āsādya vīryavān
translated: having again crossed the ocean and met his relatives, the valiant one,

original: sītādarśanam āvedya hanūmāṃś caiva pūjitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sītā darśanam āvedya hanūmān ca eva pūjitaḥ
translated: having reported seeing Sita, was honored by Hanuman.

original: vānaraiḥ sārdham āgatya hanumān madhuvanaṃ mahat /
analyzed: vānaraiḥ sārdham āgatya hanumān madhuvanam mahat
translated: Having come with the monkeys, Hanuman destroyed the great Madhuvana,

original: nihatya rakṣapālāṃs tu pāyayitvā ca tanmadhu // / //
analyzed: nihatya rakṣa pālān tu pāyayitvā ca tat madhu
translated: slaughtered the Rakshasa guards, and made the monkeys drink the honey.

original: sarve dadhimukhaṃ pātya harṣito haribhiḥ saha /
analyzed: sarve dadhimukham pātya harṣitaḥ haribhiḥ saha
translated: All the monkeys, delighted, drank Dadhimukha together.

original: kham utpatya ca saṃprāpya rāmalakṣmaṇapādayoḥ // / //
analyzed: kham utpatya ca saṃprāpya rāma lakṣmaṇa pādayoḥ
translated: Having leapt into the sky and reached the feet of Rama and Lakshmana,

original: natvā tu hanumāṃs tatra sugrīvaṃ ca viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: natvā tu hanumān tatra sugrīvam ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: Hanuman bowed there, especially to Sugriva.

original: āditaḥ sarvam āvedya samudrataraṇādikam // / //
analyzed: āditas sarvam āvedya samudra taraṇa ādikam
translated: Having reported everything from the beginning, including the crossing of the ocean,

original: rāmāya sītā dṛṣṭā mayeti vai /
analyzed: kathayāmasa rāmāya sītā dṛṣṭā mayā iti vai
translated: he said to Rama, Sita has been seen by me.

original: aśokavanikāmadhye sītā devī suduḥkhitā // / //
analyzed: aśoka vanikā madhye sītā devī su duḥkhitā
translated: The queen Sita is extremely miserable, in the middle of the Asokavana grove,

original: rākṣasībhiḥ parivṛtā tvāṃ smarantī ca sarvadā /
analyzed: rākṣasībhiḥ parivṛtā tvām smarantī ca sarvadā
translated: surrounded by Rakshasi women, always remembering you.

original: aśrupūrṇamukhī dīnā tava patnī varānanā // / //
analyzed: aśru pūrṇa mukhī dīnā tava patnī varānanā
translated: Your wife, the beautiful-faced one, is wretched, with tears in her eyes.

original: śīlavṛttasamāyuktā tatrāpi janakātmajā /
analyzed: śīla vṛtta samāyuktā tatra api janakātmajā
translated: Even there, Janaka's daughter, endowed with good character and conduct,

original: sarvatrānveṣamāṇena mayā dṛṣṭā pativratā // / //
analyzed: sarvatra anveṣamāṇena mayā dṛṣṭā pativratā
translated: the chaste woman, was seen by me searching everywhere.

original: mayā saṃbhāṣitā sītā viśvastā raghunandana /🔽alaṃkāraś ca sumaṇis tayā te preṣitaḥ prabho // / //
analyzed: mayā saṃbhāṣitā sītā viśvastā raghunandana  alaṃkāraḥ ca su maṇiḥ tayā te preṣitaḥ prabho
translated: Sita, the daughter of Janaka, was spoken to by me, O descendant of Raghu, full of trust.🔽And a beautiful jewel ornament has been sent by her to you, O lord.

original: ity uktvā dattavāṃs tasmai cūḍāmaṇim anuttamam /
analyzed: iti uktvā dattavān tasmai cūḍāmaṇim anuttamam
translated: Having said this, he gave him the excellent crest jewel.

original: idaṃ ca vacanaṃ tubhyaṃ patnyā saṃpreṣitaṃ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: idam ca vacanam tubhyam patnyā saṃpreṣitam śṛṇu
translated: Listen to these words sent by your wife.

original: citrakūṭe madaṅke tu supte tvayi mahāvrata /
analyzed: citrakūṭe mad aṅke tu supte tvayi mahā vrata
translated: O great vow-observing one, when you were sleeping on my lap in Chitrakuta,

original: vāyasābhibhavaṃ rājaṃs tat kila smartum arhasi // / //🔽alpāparādhe rājendra tvayā balibhuji prabho /
analyzed: vāyasa abhibhavam rājan tat kila smartum arhasi  alpa aparādhe rāja indra tvayā   prabho
translated: O king, you should remember the attack by the crow.

original: yat kṛtaṃ tan na kartuṃ ca śakyaṃ devāsurair api // / //
analyzed: yat kṛtam tat na kartum ca śakyam deva asuraiḥ api
translated: O lord of kings, even by the gods and demons, it is not possible to undo what you have done to the crow for such a small offense.

original: brahmāstraṃ tu tadotsṛṣṭaṃ rāvaṇaṃ kiṃ na jeṣyasi /
analyzed: brahmāstram tu tadā utsṛṣṭam rāvaṇam kim na jeṣyasi
translated: Why will you not conquer Ravana by releasing the Brahma weapon?

original: ity evamādi bahuśaḥ proktvā sītā ruroda ha /
analyzed: iti evamādi bahuśas proktvā sītā ruroda ha
translated: Having spoken in this way and many other things, Sita wept.

original: evaṃ tu duḥkhitā sītā tāṃ moktuṃ yatnam ācara // / //🔽ity evam ukte pavanaātmajena sītāvacas tac chubhabhūṣaṇaṃ ca /
analyzed: evam tu duḥkhitā sītā tām moktum yatnam ācara  iti evam ukte pavana ātmajena sītā vacaḥ tat śubha bhūṣaṇam ca
translated: Thus afflicted, Sita tried to free her.🔽Thus addressed by the son of the wind god, hearing Sita's words and seeing the auspicious ornaments,

original: śrutvā ca dṛṣṭvā ca ruroda rāmaḥ kapiṃ samāliṅgya śanaiḥ pratasthe // / //
analyzed: śrutvā ca dṛṣṭvā ca ruroda rāmaḥ kapim samāliṅgya śanais pratasthe
translated: Rama wept. Embracing the monkey, he slowly departed.

original: iti śrīnarasiṃhapurāṇe rāmaprādurbhāve ekapañcāso 'dhyāyaḥ // NarP //
analyzed: iti śrī narasiṃhapurāṇe rāmaprādurbhāve ekapañcāsaḥ dhyāyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifty-first chapter in the Rakshasa-Vadha Parva of the Adi Parva in the holy Mahabharata.

original: mārkaṇḍeya uvāca /
analyzed: mārkaṇḍeyaḥ uvāca
translated: Markandeya said:

original: iti śrutvā priyāvārtāṃ vāyuputreṇa kīrtitām /
analyzed: iti śrutvā priyā vārtām vāyuputreṇa kīrtitām
translated: Having heard these news of his beloved, spoken by the son of the wind god,

original: rāmo gatvā samudrāntaṃ vānaraiḥ saha vistṛtaiḥ // / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ gatvā samudra antam vānaraiḥ saha vistṛtaiḥ
translated: Rama, having gone to the shore of the ocean with the vast army of monkeys,

original: sāgarasya taṭe ramye tālīvanavirājite /
analyzed: sāgarasya taṭe ramye tālī vana virājite
translated: on the beautiful shore of the ocean, adorned with palm groves,

original: sugrīvo jāmbavāṃś cātha vānarair atiharṣitaiḥ // / //
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ jāmbavān ca atha vānaraiḥ ati harṣitaiḥ
translated: Sugriva, Jambavan, and the greatly delighted monkeys,

original: saṃkhyātītair vṛtaḥ śrīmān nakṣatrair iva candramāḥ /
analyzed: saṃkhyā atītaiḥ vṛtaḥ śrīmān nakṣatraiḥ iva candramāḥ
translated: surrounded by countless ones, the glorious one like the moon by the stars,

original: anujena ca dhīreṇa vīkṣya tasthau saritpatim // / //
analyzed: anujena ca dhīreṇa vīkṣya tasthau saritpatim
translated: and by his wise younger brother, looked at the lord of the rivers and stood there.

original: rāvaṇenātha laṅkāyāṃ sa sūktau bhartsito 'nujaḥ /
analyzed: rāvaṇena atha laṅkāyām sa su uktau bhartsitaḥ nujaḥ
translated: Then Ravana, in Lanka, rebuked his younger brother,

original: vibhīṣaṇo mahābuddhiḥ śāstrajñair mantribhiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: vibhīṣaṇaḥ mahā buddhiḥ śāstra jñaiḥ mantribhiḥ saha
translated: Vibhishana, the greatly wise one, along with his ministers who knew the scriptures.

original: narasiṃhe mahādeve śrīdhare bhaktavatsale /
analyzed: narasiṃhe mahādeve śrīdhare bhakta vatsale
translated: To Narasimha, the great god, Shri-Hari, who is affectionate towards devotees,

original: evaṃ rāme 'calāṃ bhaktim āgatya vinayāt tadā // / //
analyzed: evam rāme calām bhaktim āgatya vinayāt tadā
translated: Having thus come to unwavering devotion in Rama with humility,

original: kṛtāñjalir uvācedaṃ rāmam akliṣṭakāriṇam /
analyzed: kṛtāñjaliḥ uvāca idam rāmam akliṣṭa kāriṇam
translated: with folded hands, he spoke this to Rama, the performer of unwearied deeds:

original: rāma rāma mahābāho devadeva janārdana // / //
analyzed: rāma rāma mahā bāho devadeva janārdana
translated: Rama, Rama, O mighty-armed one, god of gods, Janardana,

original: vibhīṣaṇo 'smi māṃ rakṣa ahaṃ te śaraṇaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: vibhīṣaṇaḥ smi mām rakṣa aham te śaraṇam gataḥ
translated: protect me, Vibhishana, I have come to you for refuge.

original: ity uktvā nipapātātha prāñjalī rāmapādayoḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktvā nipapāta atha prāñjaliḥ rāma pādayoḥ
translated: Having said this, he fell at Rama's feet with folded hands.

original: viditārtho 'tha rāmas tu tam utthāpya mahāmatim /
analyzed: rāmaḥ tu tam utthāpya mahāmatim
translated: Then Rama, the greatly wise one, having understood the matter, raised him up,🔽and said to Vibhishana, who was standing with folded hands:

original: samudratoyais taṃ vīram abhiṣicya vibhīṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: samudra toyaiḥ tam vīram abhiṣicya vibhīṣaṇam
translated: And consecrated the hero Vibhishana with the waters of the ocean,

original: laṅkārājyaṃ tavaiveti proktaḥ saṃbhāṣya tasthivān /
analyzed: laṅkā rājyam tava evā iti proktaḥ saṃbhāṣya tasthivān
translated: And having said, The kingdom of Lanka is yours alone, he remained speaking.

original: tato vibhīṣaṇenoktaṃ tvaṃ viṣṇur bhuvaneśvaraḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas vibhīṣaṇena uktam tvam viṣṇuḥ bhuvana īśvaraḥ
translated: Then Vibhishana said, You are Vishnu, the lord of the world.

original: abdhir dadātu mārgaṃ te deva taṃ yācayāmahe /
analyzed: abdhiḥ dadātu mārgam te deva tam yācayāmahe
translated: O god, may the ocean grant you a path, we request him.

original: ityukto vānaraiḥ sārdhaṃ śiśye tatra sa rāghavaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti uktaḥ vānaraiḥ sārdham śiśye tatra sa rāghavaḥ
translated: Thus spoken to, Raghava slept there with the monkeys.

original: supte rāme gataṃ tatra trirātram amitadyutau /
analyzed: supte rāme gatam tatra tri rātram amita dyutau
translated: When Rama, of immeasurable splendor, had slept there for three nights,

original: tataḥ kruddho jagannātho rāmo rājīvalocanaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas kruddhaḥ jagannāthaḥ rāmaḥ rājīva locanaḥ
translated: Then the lotus-eyed lord of the world, Rama, became angry.

original: saṃśoṣaṇam apāṃ kartum astram āgneyam ādade /
analyzed: saṃśoṣaṇam apām kartum astram āgneyam ādade
translated: He took up the fire weapon to dry up the waters.

original: tadotthāya vacaḥ prāhaḥ lakṣmaṇaś ca ruṣānvitam // / //
analyzed: tadā utthāya vacaḥ prāhaḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ ca ruṣā anvitam
translated: Then Lakshmana, who had arisen, spoke these words, filled with anger:

original: krodhas te layakartā hi enaṃ jahi mahamate /
analyzed: krodhaḥ te laya kartā hi enam jahi mahamate
translated: Anger destroys your composure; kill him, O greatly wise one.

original: bhūtānāṃ rakṣaṇārthāya avatāras tvayā kṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhūtānām rakṣaṇa arthāya avatāraḥ tvayā kṛtaḥ
translated: You have taken an incarnation for the protection of beings.

original: kṣantavyaṃ devadeveśa ity uktvā dhṛtavān śaram /
analyzed: kṣantavyam devadeveśaḥ iti uktvā dhṛtavān śaram
translated: Having said this, he took up an arrow, saying, The lord of the gods should be forgiven.

original: tato rātritraye yāte kruddhaṃ rāmam avekṣya saḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas rātri traye yāte kruddham rāmam avekṣya saḥ
translated: Then, when three nights had passed, seeing Rama angry,

original: āgneyāstrāc ca saṃtrastaḥ sāgaro 'bhyetya mūrtimān /
analyzed: āgneya astrāt ca saṃtrastaḥ sāgaraḥ bhyetya mūrtimān
translated: The ocean, frightened by the fire weapon, approached in person.

original: āha rāmaṃ mahādevaṃ rakṣa mām apakāriṇam // / //
analyzed: āha rāmam mahādevam rakṣa mām apakāriṇam
translated: And said to the great god Rama, Protect me, the offender.

original: mārgo datto mayā te 'dya kuśalaḥ setukarmaṇi /
analyzed: mārgaḥ dattaḥ mayā te dya kuśalaḥ setu karmaṇi
translated: Today I have shown you the path, which is good for building a bridge.

original: nalas ca kathito vīras tena kāraya rāghava // / //
analyzed: nalaḥ ca kathitaḥ vīraḥ tena kāraya rāghava
translated: And the hero Nala has been told, O Raghava, by him have it done.

original: yāvadiṣṭaṃ tu vistīrṇaṃ setubandhanam uttamam /
analyzed: yāvat iṣṭam tu vistīrṇam setubandhanam uttamam
translated: As much as desired, the excellent bridge-building was done.

original: tato nalamukhair anyair vānarair amitaujasaiḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas nala mukhaiḥ anyaiḥ vānaraiḥ amita ojasaiḥ
translated: Then, by Nala and other monkeys of immeasurable prowess,

original: bandhayitvā mahāsetuṃ tena gatvā sa rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: bandhayitvā mahā setum tena gatvā sa rāghavaḥ
translated: Having built a great bridge, Raghava went by it.

original: suvelākhyaṃ giriṃ prāptaḥ sthito 'sau vānarair vṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: suvela ākhyam girim prāptaḥ sthitaḥ sau vānaraiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: Having reached the mountain called Suvela, he remained surrounded by the monkeys.

original: harmyasthalasthitaṃ duṣṭaṃ rāvaṇaṃ vīkṣya cāṅgadaḥ /
analyzed: harmya sthala sthitam duṣṭam rāvaṇam vīkṣya ca aṅgadaḥ
translated: Seeing the wicked Ravana standing on the palace terrace, Angada,

original: rāmādeśād athotplutya dūtakarmasu tatparaḥ // / //
analyzed: rāma ādeśāt athā utplutya dūta karmasu tatparaḥ
translated: Then, by Rama's order, he jumped up, intent on the task of a messenger.

original: prādāt pādapraharaṃ tu roṣād rāvaṇamūrdhani /
analyzed: prādāt pāda praharam tu roṣāt rāvaṇa mūrdhani
translated: Out of anger, he gave a kick on Ravana's head.

original: vismitaṃ taiḥ suragaṇair vīkṣitaḥ so 'tivīryavān // / //
analyzed: vismitam taiḥ sura gaṇaiḥ vīkṣitaḥ saḥ tivīryavān
translated: The exceedingly valorous one was seen by the amazed hosts of gods.

original: sādhayitvā pratijñāṃ tāṃ suvelaṃ punar āgataḥ /
analyzed: sādhayitvā pratijñām tām suvelam punar āgataḥ
translated: Having fulfilled that vow, he returned to Suvela.

original: tato vānarasenābhiḥ saṃkhyātītābhir acyutaḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas vānara senābhiḥ saṃkhyā atītābhiḥ acyutaḥ
translated: Then, by the innumerable armies of monkeys, the imperishable one,

original: rurodha rāvaṇapurīṃ laṅkāṃ tatra pratāpavān /
analyzed: rurodha rāvaṇa purīm laṅkām tatra pratāpavān
translated: The valorous one besieged the city of Ravana, Lanka, there.

original: rāmaḥ samantād ālokya prāha lakṣmaṇam antike // / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ samantāt ālokya prāha lakṣmaṇam antike
translated: Rama, looking all around, said to Lakshmana nearby:

original: tīrṇo 'rṇavaḥ kavaliteva kapīśvarasya senābhaṭair jhaṭiti rākṣasarājadhānī /
analyzed: tīrṇaḥ rṇavaḥ kavalitā iva kapi īśvarasya senā bhaṭaiḥ jhaṭiti rākṣasa rājadhānī
translated: The ocean has been crossed as if swallowed by the monkey king's army in an instant, the capital of the demon king.

original: yat pauruṣocitam ihāṅkuritaṃ mayā tad daivasya vaśyam aparaṃ dhanuṣo 'tha vāsya // / //
analyzed: yat pauruṣa ucitam iha aṅkuritam mayā tat daivasya vaśyam aparam vā asya
translated: What is appropriate for a man to do here, that I have done. Beyond that, I am subject to fate, or to the bow and arrow.

original: ḥlakṣmaṇaḥ prāha /
analyzed: ḥlakṣmaṇaḥ prāha
translated: Lakshmana said:

original: kātarajanamanovalambinā kiṃ daivena /
analyzed: kātara jana manaḥ uvalambinā kim daivena
translated: What is the use of fate, which is the support of the minds of timid people?

original: yāval lalāṭaśikharaṃ bhrukuṭir na yāti yāvan na kārmukaśikhām adhirohati jyā /
analyzed: yāvat lalāṭa śikharam bhrukuṭiḥ na yāti yāvat na kārmuka śikhām adhirohati jyā
translated: As long as the frown does not reach the peak of the forehead, as long as the string does not ascend to the tip of the bow,

original: tāvan niśācarapateḥ paṭim ānametu trailokyamūlavibhujeṣu bhujeṣu darpaḥ // / //
analyzed: tāvat niśācara pateḥ paṭim ānametu trailokya mūla vibhujeṣu bhujeṣu darpaḥ
translated: let the pride of the lord of demons in his arms, which are the roots of the three worlds, be humbled.

original: ḥtadā lakṣmaṇaḥ rāmasya karṇe lagitvā pitṛvadhavairasmaraṇe atha tadbaktivīryaparīkṣaṇāya lakṣaṇavijñānāyādiśyatām aṅgadāya dūtyam /
analyzed: ḥtadā lakṣmaṇaḥ rāmasya karṇe lagitvā pitṛ vadha vaira smaraṇe atha tad bakti vīrya parīkṣaṇāya lakṣaṇa vijñānāya ādiśyatām aṅgadāya dūtyam
translated: Then Lakshmana whispered in Rama's ear to remind him of the enmity of his father's murder, and to test his words and valor, to send a message to Angada to know the signs.

original: ḥrāmaḥ sādhu iti bhaṇitvā aṅgadaṃ sabahumānam avalokya ādiśati // / //
analyzed: sādhu iti bhaṇitvā aṅgadam sa bahu mānam avalokya ādiśati
translated: Rama said Good and looking at Angada with great respect, he ordered:

original: ḥaṅgada /
analyzed: ḥaṅgada
translated: Angada.

original: pitā te yad vālī balini daśakaṇṭhe kalitavān na śaktās tad vaktuṃ vayam api mudā tena pulakaḥ /
analyzed: pitā te yat vālī balini daśakaṇṭhe kalitavān na śaktāḥ tat vaktum vayam api mudā tena pulakaḥ
translated: Your father, when he killed the powerful ten-headed one, was not able to express it, and we too are thrilled with joy.

original: sa eva tvaṃ vyāvartayasi tanujatvena pitṛtāṃ tataḥ kiṃ vaktavyaṃ tilakayati sṛṣṭārthapadavīm // / //
analyzed: saḥ eva tvam vyāvartayasi tanuja tvena pitṛ tām tatas kim vaktavyam tilakayati sṛṣṭa artha padavīm
translated: You are the very same one, turning away from being a son, to fatherhood. Then what is to be said? It adorns the path of accomplished meaning.

original: ḥaṅgado maulimaṇḍalamilatkarayugalena praṇamya yad ājñāpayati devaḥ /
analyzed: aṅgadaḥ mauli maṇḍala milat kara yugalena praṇamya yat ājñāpayati devaḥ
translated: When Angada, with his two hands joined on his head, bows down, he says, Whatever the Lord commands.

original: ḥavadhāryatām // / //
analyzed: ḥavadhāryatām
translated: Let it be understood.

original: kiṃ prākāravihāratoraṇavatīṃ laṅkām ihaivānaye kiṃ vā sainyam ahaṃ drutaṃ raghupate tatraiva saṃpādaye /
analyzed: kim prākāra vihāra toraṇavatīm laṅkām iha eva ānaye kim vā sainyam aham drutam raghu pate tatra eva saṃpādaye
translated: Should I bring Lanka, with its ramparts, gardens, and archways, here itself? Or should I quickly accomplish the army there itself, O Lord of Raghus?

original: atyalpaṃ kulaparvatair aviralair badhnāmi vā sāgaraṃ devādeśaya kiṃ karomi sakalaṃ dordaṇḍasādhyaṃ mama // / //
analyzed: ati alpam kula parvataiḥ aviralaiḥ badhnāmi vā sāgaram deva ādeśaya kim karomi sakalam dos daṇḍa sādhyam mama
translated: Or should I bind the ocean with many firm mountain chains? O God, command me. Everything is accomplishable by my mighty arms.

original: ḥśrīrāmas tadvacanamātreṇaiva tadbhaktiṃ sāmarthyaṃ cāvekṣya vadati // / //
analyzed: ca avekṣya vadati
translated: Sri Rama, just by hearing those words, considering his devotion and ability, speaks.

original: ajñānād athavādhipatyarabhasā vāsmatparokṣe hṛtā sīteyaṃ pravimucyatām iti vaco gatvā daśāsyaṃ vada /
analyzed: ajñānāt athavā ādhipatya rabhasā vā asmad parokṣe hṛtā sītā iyam pravimucyatām iti vacaḥ gatvā daśāsyam vada
translated: Either out of ignorance or due to the haste of sovereignty, this Sita has been abducted in our absence. Go and tell the ten-headed one these words: 'Release this Sita.'

original: no cel lakṣmaṇamuktamārgaṇagaṇacchedocchalacchoṇitac chatracchannadigantam antakapurīṃ putrair vṛto yāsyasi // / //
analyzed: no ced lakṣmaṇa mukta mārgaṇa gaṇa cheda ucchalat śoṇitat chatra channa digantam antaka purīm putraiḥ vṛtaḥ yāsyasi
translated: If not, then surrounded by your sons, you will go to the city of the god of death, with the ends of the directions covered with the blood gushing forth from the wounds inflicted by the multitudes of arrows released by Lakshmana.

original: ḥaṅgadaḥ // / //
analyzed: ḥ aṅga daḥ
translated: Hanuman

original: ḥdeva /
analyzed: ḥdeva
translated: O Lord.

original: saṃdhau vā vigrahe vāpi mayi dūte daśānanī /
analyzed: saṃdhau vā vigrahe vā api mayi dūte daśānanī
translated: Whether in peace or war, with me as the messenger, O Ten-faced One,

original: akṣatā vā kṣatā vāpi kṣitipīṭhe luṭhiṣyati // / //
analyzed: akṣatā vā kṣatā vā api kṣiti pīṭhe luṭhiṣyati
translated: Either unhurt or wounded, you will roll on the ground of the earth.

original: tadā śrīrāmacandreṇa praśasya prahito 'ṅgadaḥ /
analyzed: tadā śrī rāmacandreṇa praśasya prahitaḥ ṅgadaḥ
translated: Then, praised by Sri Ramachandra, Angada was sent.

original: uktipratyukticāturyaiḥ parājityāgato ripum // / //🔽rāghavasya balaṃ jñātvā cārais tadanujasya ca /
analyzed: ukti pratyukti cāturyaiḥ parājitya āgataḥ ripum  rāghavasya balam jñātvā cāraiḥ tad anujasya ca
translated: Having defeated the enemy with the skill of speaking and replying, he returned.

original: vānarāṇāṃ ca bhīto 'pi nirbhīr iva daśānanaḥ // / //
analyzed: vānarāṇām ca nirbhīḥ iva daśānanaḥ
translated: Knowing the strength of Raghava and his younger brother, and also of the monkeys, Dasha-nanan, though afraid, acted as if fearless.

original: laṅkāpurasya rakṣārtham ādideśa sa rākṣasān /
analyzed: laṅkā purasya rakṣā artham ādideśa sa rākṣasān
translated: He ordered the demons for the protection of the city of Lanka.

original: ādiśya sarvato dikṣu putrān āha daśānanaḥ // / //
analyzed: ādiśya sarvatas dikṣu putrān āha daśānanaḥ
translated: Having ordered in all directions, Dasha-nanan said to his sons.

original: dhūmrākṣaṃ dhūmrapānaṃ ca rākṣasā yāta me purīm /
analyzed: dhūmrākṣam dhūmrapānam ca rākṣasāḥ yāta me purīm
translated: O demons, Dhumraksha and Dhumrapan, go to my city.

original: pāśair badhnīta tau martyau amitrāntakavīryavān /
analyzed: pāśaiḥ badhnīta tau martyau amitra antaka vīryavān
translated: Bind those two mortals with ropes, who are valorous in killing enemies.

original: kumbhakarṇo 'pi madbhrātā turyanādaiḥ prabodhitaḥ // / //
analyzed: kumbhakarṇaḥ pi mad bhrātā turya nādaiḥ prabodhitaḥ
translated: Kumbhakarna, my brother, was also awakened by the sounds of trumpets.

original: rākṣasāś caiva saṃdiṣṭā rāvaṇena mahābalāḥ /
analyzed: rākṣasāḥ ca eva saṃdiṣṭāḥ rāvaṇena mahā balāḥ
translated: And the extremely powerful demons were commanded by Ravana.

original: tasyājñāṃ śirasādāya yuyudhur vānaraiḥ saha // / //
analyzed: tasya ājñām śirasā ādāya yuyudhuḥ vānaraiḥ saha
translated: Accepting his command on their heads, they fought with the monkeys.

original: yudhyamānā yathāśaktyā koṭisaṃkhyās tu rākṣasāḥ /
analyzed: yudhyamānāḥ yathāśaktyā koṭi saṃkhyāḥ tu rākṣasāḥ
translated: The demons, numbering in crores, fought to the best of their ability.

original: vānarair nidhanaṃ prāptāḥ punar anyān yathādiśat // / //
analyzed: vānaraiḥ nidhanam prāptāḥ punar anyān yathā ādiśat
translated: They were killed by the monkeys, and he again ordered others.

original: pūrvadvāre daśagrīvo rākṣasān amitaujasaḥ /
analyzed: pūrva dvāre daśagrīvaḥ rākṣasān amita ojasaḥ
translated: In the eastern gate, the ten-headed one (Ravana) sent out demons of immeasurable prowess.

original: te cāpi yudhya haribhir nīlādyair nidhanaṃ gatāḥ // / //
analyzed: te ca api yudhya haribhiḥ nīla ādyaiḥ nidhanam gatāḥ
translated: And they too, fighting with the monkeys led by Nila, were killed.

original: atha dakṣiṇadigbhāge rāvaṇena niyojitāḥ /
analyzed: atha dakṣiṇa digbhāge rāvaṇena niyojitāḥ
translated: Then, in the southern direction, those who were employed by Ravana,

original: te sarve vānaravarair dāritās tu yamaṃ gatāḥ // / //
analyzed: te sarve vānara varaiḥ dāritāḥ tu yamam gatāḥ
translated: all of them, torn apart by the best of monkeys, went to Yama (the god of death).

original: paścime 'ṅgadamukhyaiś ca vānarair atigarvitaiḥ /
analyzed: paścime ṅgada mukhyaiḥ ca vānaraiḥ ati garvitaiḥ
translated: In the west, by the monkeys led by Angada, who were extremely proud,

original: rākṣasāḥ parvatākārāḥ prāpitā yamasādanam // / //🔽taduttare tu digbhāge rāvaṇena niveśitāḥ /
analyzed: rākṣasāḥ parvata ākārāḥ prāpitāḥ yama sādanam  tad uttare tu digbhāge rāvaṇena niveśitāḥ
translated: the demons, huge like mountains, were sent to the abode of Yama (the god of death).🔽In the northern direction, those who were stationed by Ravana,

original: petus te rākṣasāḥ krūrā maindādyair vānarair hatāḥ // / //🔽tato vānarasaṃghās tu laṅkāprākāram ucchritam /
analyzed: petuḥ te rākṣasāḥ krūrāḥ mainda ādyaiḥ vānaraiḥ hatāḥ  tatas vānara saṃghāḥ tu laṅkā prākāram ucchritam
translated: those cruel demons fell, killed by the monkeys led by Mainda.🔽Then the hordes of monkeys, leaping over the lofty ramparts of Lanka,

original: utplutyābhyantarasthāṃś ca rākṣasān baladarpitān // / //
analyzed: utplutya ābhyantara sthān ca rākṣasān bala darpitān
translated: and those inside, the demons proud of their strength,

original: hatvā śīghraṃ punaḥ prāptāḥ svasenām eva vānarāḥ /
analyzed: hatvā śīghram punar prāptāḥ sva senām eva vānarāḥ
translated: Having killed (the demons), the monkeys quickly returned to their own army.

original: evaṃ hateṣu sarveṣu rākṣaseṣu daśānanaḥ // / //
analyzed: evam hateṣu sarveṣu rākṣaseṣu daśānanaḥ
translated: Thus, when all the demons were killed, Dasha-nanan (Ravana)

original: rodamānāsu tatstrīṣu nirgataḥ krodhamūrcchitaḥ /
analyzed: rodamānāsu tad strīṣu nirgataḥ krodha mūrcchitaḥ
translated: was enraged and came out, with his wives weeping.

original: dvāre sa paścime vīro rākṣasair bahubhir vṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: dvāre sa paścime vīraḥ rākṣasaiḥ bahubhiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: In the western gate, the hero, surrounded by many demons,

original: kvāsau rāmeti ca vadan dhanuṣpāṇiḥ pratāpavān /
analyzed: kva asau rāma iti ca vadan dhanuṣpāṇiḥ pratāpavān
translated: with a bow in his hand, saying Where is Rama, the powerful one

original: rathasthaḥ śaravarṣaṃ ca visṛjan vānareṣu saḥ // / //
analyzed: ratha sthaḥ śara varṣam ca visṛjan vānareṣu saḥ
translated: standing on a chariot, releasing a shower of arrows on the monkeys,

original: tatas tadbāṇachinnāṅgā vānarā dudruvus tadā /
analyzed: tatas tad bāṇa chinna aṅgāḥ vānarāḥ dudruvuḥ tadā
translated: then the monkeys, their limbs cut by his arrows, fled.

original: palāyamānāṃs tān dṛṣṭvā vānarān rāghavas tadā // / //
analyzed: palāyamānān tān dṛṣṭvā vānarān rāghavaḥ tadā
translated: Seeing the monkeys fleeing, Raghava (Rama)

original: kasmāt tu vānarā bhagnāḥ kim eṣāṃ bhayam āgatam /
analyzed: kasmāt tu vānarāḥ bhagnāḥ kim eṣām bhayam āgatam
translated: Why are the monkeys routed? What fear has come upon them?

original: iti rāmavacaḥ śrutvā prāha vākyaṃ vibhīṣaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti rāma vacaḥ śrutvā prāha vākyam vibhīṣaṇaḥ
translated: Hearing these words of Rama, Vibhishana said

original: śṛṇu rājan mahābāho rāvaṇo nirgato 'dhunā /
analyzed: śṛṇu rājan mahā bāho rāvaṇaḥ nirgataḥ dhunā
translated: Listen, O king, O mighty-armed one, Ravana has now come out.

original: tadbāṇachinnā harayaḥ palāyante mahāmate // / //
analyzed: tad bāṇa chinnāḥ harayaḥ palāyante mahāmate
translated: O great-minded one, the monkeys are fleeing, their limbs cut by his arrows.

original: ityukto rāghavas tena dhanur udyamya roṣitaḥ /
analyzed: iti uktaḥ rāghavaḥ tena dhanuḥ udyamya roṣitaḥ
translated: Thus addressed by him, Raghava, enraged, raised his bow

original: jyāghoṣatalaghoṣābhyāṃ khaṃ diśaḥ // / //
analyzed: jyā ghoṣa tala ghoṣābhyām pūrayāmasa kham diśaḥ
translated: and with the twang of the bowstring and the sound of his palms, the sky and the directions🔽were filled with a loud sound.

original: yuyudhe rāvaṇenātha rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /
analyzed: yuyudhe rāvaṇena atha rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ
translated: The lotus-eyed Rama then fought with Ravana.

original: sugrīvo jāmbavāṃś caiva hanumān aṅgadas tathā // / //
analyzed: sugrīvaḥ jāmbavān ca eva hanumān aṅgadaḥ tathā
translated: Sugriva, Jambavan, Hanuman, Angada,

original: vibhīṣaṇo vānarāś ca lakṣmaṇaś cāpi vīryavān /
analyzed: vibhīṣaṇaḥ vānarāḥ ca lakṣmaṇaḥ ca api vīryavān
translated: Vibhishana, the monkeys and the valiant Lakshmana,

original: upetya rāvaṇīṃ senāṃ varṣantīṃ sarvasāyakān // / //
analyzed: upetya rāvaṇīm senām varṣantīm sarva sāyakān
translated: having approached the army of Ravana, which was raining all kinds of arrows,

original: hastyaśvarathasaṃyuktāṃ te nijaghnur mahābalāḥ /
analyzed: hasti aśva ratha saṃyuktām te nijaghnuḥ mahā balāḥ
translated: the greatly powerful ones killed it, along with its elephants, horses and chariots.

original: rāmarāvaṇayor yuddham abhūt tatrāpi bhīṣaṇam // / //
analyzed: rāma rāvaṇayoḥ yuddham abhūt tatra api bhīṣaṇam
translated: The battle between Rama and Ravana that took place there was also terrifying.

original: rāvaṇena visṛṣṭāni śastrāstrāṇi ca yāni vai /
analyzed: rāvaṇena visṛṣṭāni śastra astrāṇi ca yāni vai
translated: The weapons and missiles that were released by Ravana,

original: tāni chittvātha śastrais tu rāghavaś ca mahābalaḥ // / //
analyzed: tāni chittvā atha śastraiḥ tu rāghavaḥ ca mahā balaḥ
translated: having cut them off with his own weapons, the greatly powerful Raghava,

original: śareṇa sārathiṃ hatvā daśabhiś ca mahāhayān /
analyzed: śareṇa sārathim hatvā daśabhiḥ ca mahā hayān
translated: having killed Ravana's charioteer with one arrow and his great horses with ten,

original: rāvaṇasya dhanus chittvā bhallenaikena rāghavaḥ // / //
analyzed: rāvaṇasya dhanuḥ chittvā bhallena ekena rāghavaḥ
translated: having cut off Ravana's bow with a broad-headed arrow, Raghava,

original: mukuṭaṃ pañcadaśabhiś chittvā tanmastakaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: mukuṭam pañcadaśabhiḥ chittvā tad mastakam punar
translated: having cut off his crown with fifteen arrows, then struck his head

original: suvarṇapuṅkhair daśabhiḥ śarair vivyādha vīryavān // / //
analyzed: suvarṇa puṅkhaiḥ daśabhiḥ śaraiḥ vivyādha vīryavān
translated: with ten gold-feathered arrows, the valiant one.

original: tadā daśāsyo vyathito rāmabāṇair bhṛśaṃ tadā /
analyzed: tadā daśa āsyaḥ vyathitaḥ rāma bāṇaiḥ bhṛśam tadā
translated: Then the ten-headed Ravana, severely afflicted by Rama's arrows,

original: viveśa mantribhir nītaḥ svapurīṃ devamardakaḥ // / //
analyzed: viveśa mantribhiḥ nītaḥ sva purīm devamardakaḥ
translated: was taken by his ministers to his own city, the oppressor of gods.

original: bodhitas tūryanādais tu gajayūthakramaiḥ śanaiḥ /
analyzed: bodhitaḥ tūrya nādaiḥ tu gaja yūtha kramaiḥ śanais
translated: Awakened by the sounds of trumpets and the slow steps of herds of elephants,

original: punaḥ prākāram ullaṅghya kumbhakarṇo vinirgataḥ // / //
analyzed: punar prākāram ullaṅghya kumbhakarṇaḥ vinirgataḥ
translated: Kumbhakarna again jumped over the rampart and came out.

original: uttuṅgasthūladeho 'sa bhīmadṛṣṭir mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: uttuṅga sthūla dehaḥ sa bhīma dṛṣṭiḥ mahā balaḥ
translated: He had a tall and stout body, a terrible look, and great strength.

original: vānarān bhakṣayan duṣṭo vicacāra kṣudhānvitaḥ // / //
analyzed: vānarān bhakṣayan duṣṭaḥ vicacāra kṣudhā anvitaḥ
translated: The wicked one, hungry, roamed about devouring the monkeys.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvotpatya sugrīvaḥ śūlenorasy atāḍayat /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā utpatya sugrīvaḥ śūlena urasi atāḍayat
translated: Seeing him, Sugriva jumped up and struck him on the chest with a spear.

original: karṇadvayaṃ karābhyāṃ tu cchittvā vakreṇa nāsikām // / //🔽sarvato yudhyamānāṃś ca rakṣonāthān raṇe 'dhikān /
analyzed: karṇa dvayam karābhyām tu chittvā vakreṇa nāsikām  sarvatas yudhyamānān ca rakṣaḥ nāthān raṇe dhikān
translated: Having cut off his two ears with his hands and his nose with his beak,🔽And the Rakshasa lords who were fighting everywhere in the battle,

original: rāghavo ghātayitvā tu vānarendraiḥ samantataḥ // / //
analyzed: rāghavaḥ ghātayitvā tu vānara indraiḥ samantataḥ
translated: Having killed them all with the monkey kings,

original: cakarta viśikhais tīkṣṇaiḥ kumbhakarṇasya kandharām /
analyzed: cakarta viśikhaiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ kumbhakarṇasya kandharām
translated: Rama cut off Kumbhakarna's neck with sharp arrows.

original: vijityendrajitaṃ sākṣād garuḍenāgatena saḥ // / //
analyzed: vijitya indrajitam sākṣāt garuḍena āgatena saḥ
translated: Having defeated Indrajit himself, when Garuda came,

original: rāmo lakṣmaṇasaṃyuktaḥ śuśubhe vānarair vṛtaḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ lakṣmaṇa saṃyuktaḥ śuśubhe vānaraiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: Rama, together with Lakshmana, surrounded by the monkeys, shone.

original: vyarthaṃ gate cendrajiti kumbhakarṇe nipātite // / //
analyzed: vyartham gate ca indrajiti kumbhakarṇe nipātite
translated: When Indrajit had gone in vain and Kumbhakarna had been brought down,

original: laṅkānāthas tataḥ kruddhaḥ putraṃ triśirasaṃ punaḥ /
analyzed: laṅkā nāthaḥ tatas kruddhaḥ putram triśirasam punar
translated: Then the lord of Lanka, enraged, again sent his son Trishira.

original: atikāyamahākāyau devāntakanarāntakau // / //
analyzed: atikāya mahākāyau devāntaka narāntakau
translated: Atikaya, Mahakaya, Devanagari, and Naragari,

original: yūyaṃ hatvā tu putrādyā tau narau yudhi nighnata /
analyzed: yūyam hatvā tu putra adyā tau narau yudhi nighnata
translated: Having killed those two men in battle, you should kill their sons and others.

original: tān niyujya daśagrīvaḥ putrān evaṃ punar bravīt // / //🔽mahodaramahāpāśvau sārdham etair mahābalaiḥ /
analyzed: tān niyujya daśagrīvaḥ putrān evam punar bravīt  mahodara mahāpāśvau sārdham etaiḥ mahā balaiḥ
translated: Having thus employed his sons, the ten-headed one again spoke to them:🔽You two, Mahodara and Mahaparshva, along with these mighty warriors,

original: saṃgrāme 'smin ripūn hantuṃ yuvāṃ vrajatam udyatau // / //
analyzed: saṃgrāme smin ripūn hantum yuvām vrajatam udyatau
translated: should go forth to kill the enemies in this battle, ready to fight.

original: dṛṣṭvā tān āgatāṃś caiva yudhyamānān raṇe ripūn /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tān āgatān ca eva yudhyamānān raṇe ripūn
translated: Having seen those enemies come and fight in the battle,

original: anayal lakṣmaṇaḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ śarais tīkṣṇair yamālayam // / //
analyzed: anayat lakṣmaṇaḥ ṣaḍbhiḥ śaraiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ yama ālayam
translated: Lakshmana sent them to Yama's abode with six sharp arrows.

original: vānarāṇāṃ samūhaś ca śiṣṭāṃś ca rajanīcarān /
analyzed: vānarāṇām samūhaḥ ca śiṣṭān ca rajanīcarān
translated: And the group of monkeys and the remaining demons,

original: sugrīveṇa hataḥ kumbho rākṣaso baladarpitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sugrīveṇa hataḥ kumbhaḥ rākṣasaḥ bala darpitaḥ
translated: Kumbha, the demon proud of his strength, was killed by Sugriva.

original: nikumbho vāyuputreṇa nihato devakaṇṭakaḥ /
analyzed: nikumbhaḥ vāyuputreṇa nihataḥ deva kaṇṭakaḥ
translated: Nikumbha, the thorn of the gods, was killed by the son of the wind god.

original: virūpākṣaṃ yudhyamānāṃ gadayā tu vibhīṣaṇaḥ // / //
analyzed: virūpākṣam yudhyamānām gadayā tu vibhīṣaṇaḥ
translated: Vibhishana killed Virupaksha, who was fighting with a mace.

original: bhīmamaindau ca śvapatiṃ vānarendrau nijaghnatuḥ /
analyzed: bhīmam aindau ca śvapatim vānara indrau nijaghnatuḥ
translated: The two monkey kings, Mainda and Dvivida, killed the terrible Shvapachi.

original: aṅgado jāmbavāṃś cātha harayo 'nyān niśācarān // / //🔽yudhyamanas tu samare mahālakṣaṃ mahācalam /
analyzed: aṅgadaḥ jāmbavān ca atha harayaḥ nyān niśācarān  yudhyamanaḥ tu samare mahā lakṣam mahā acalam
translated: Angada and Jambavan, and other monkeys, killed other demons.

original: jaghāna rāmo 'tha raṇe bāṇavṛṣṭikaraṃ nṛpa // / //
analyzed: jaghāna raṇe bāṇa vṛṣṭi karam nṛpa
translated: In the battle, Rama killed the great demon Mahalaksha, who showered arrows in the battle, O king.

original: indrajin mantralabdhaṃ tu ratham āruhya vai punaḥ /
analyzed: indrajit mantra labdham tu ratham āruhya vai punar
translated: Indrajit, having again mounted the chariot obtained through the power of mantras,

original: vānareṣu ca sareṣu śaravarṣaṃ vavarṣa saḥ // / //🔽rātrau tadbāṇabhinnaṃ tu balaṃ sarvaṃ ca rāghavam /
analyzed: vānareṣu ca sareṣu śara varṣam vavarṣa saḥ  rātrau tad bāṇa bhinnam tu balam sarvam ca rāghavam
translated: showered a rain of arrows on the monkeys and the arrows.🔽At night, seeing the entire army and all of Raghava's army

original: niśceṣṭam akhilaṃ dṛṣṭvā jāmbavat preritas tadā // / //
analyzed: niśceṣṭam akhilam dṛṣṭvā jāmbavat preritaḥ tadā
translated: pierced by his arrows, motionless, then urged by Jambavan,

original: vīryād auṣadham ānīya hanūmān mārutātmajaḥ /🔽bhūmyāṃ śayānam utthāpya rāmaṃ harigaṇāṃs tathā // / //
analyzed: vīryāt auṣadham ānīya hanūmān mārutātmajaḥ  bhūmyām śayānam utthāpya rāmam hari gaṇān tathā
translated: Hanuman, the son of the wind god, having brought the herb through his prowess,🔽having raised up Rama and the monkey troops who were lying on the ground,

original: tair eva vānaraiḥ sārdhaṃ jvalitolkākarair niśi /
analyzed: taiḥ eva vānaraiḥ sārdham jvalita ulkā karaiḥ niśi
translated: together with those very monkeys, with blazing torches at night,

original: laṅkāṃ tāṃ hastyaśvaratharakṣasām // / //
analyzed: dāhayāmasa laṅkām tām hasti aśva ratha rakṣasām
translated: that Lanka, with its elephants, horses, chariots, and demons,

original: varṣantaṃ śarajālāni sarvadikṣu ghano yathā /
analyzed: varṣantam śara jālāni sarva dikṣu ghanaḥ yathā
translated: raining nets of arrows in all directions, like a cloud,

original: sa bhrātrā meghanādaṃ taṃ rāghavaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa bhrātrā megha nādam tam ghātayāmasa rāghavaḥ
translated: that Meghanada, the brother of Raghava,

original: ghātiteṣv atha rakṣassu putramitrādibandhuṣu /
analyzed: ghātiteṣu atha rakṣaḥsu putra mitra ādi bandhuṣu
translated: when the Rakshasas, the sons, friends, and other relatives, were slain,

original: kāriteṣv atha vighneṣu homajapyādikarmaṇām // / //
analyzed: kāriteṣu atha vighneṣu homa japya ādi karmaṇām
translated: and the obstacles were removed through the rites of Homa, Japa, and so on,

original: tataḥ kruddho daśagrīvo laṅkādvāre vinirgataḥ /
analyzed: tatas kruddhaḥ daśagrīvaḥ laṅkā dvāre vinirgataḥ
translated: then the ten-headed one, enraged, came out of the gate of Lanka.

original: kvāsau rāma iti brūte mānuṣas tāpasākṛtiḥ // / //
analyzed: kva asau rāmaḥ iti brūte mānuṣaḥ tāpasa ākṛtiḥ
translated: He says, Where is that Rama, a human in the form of an ascetic?

original: yoddhā kapibalīty uccair vyāharad rākṣasādhipaḥ /
analyzed: yoddhā kapi balī iti uccais vyāharat rākṣasa adhipaḥ
translated: The lord of the demons loudly proclaimed, The warrior is the army of monkeys.

original: vegavadbhir vinītaiś ca aśvaiś citrarathe sthitaḥ // / //🔽athāyāntaṃ tu taṃ dṛṣṭvā rāmaḥ prāha daśānanam /
analyzed: vegavadbhiḥ vinītaiḥ ca aśvaiḥ citrarathe sthitaḥ  atha āyāntam tu tam dṛṣṭvā rāmaḥ prāha daśānanam
translated: He was seated in a colorful chariot, with swift and well-trained horses.

original: rāmo 'ham atra duṣṭātmann ehi rāvaṇa māṃ prati // / //🔽ityukte lakṣmaṇaḥ prāha rāmaṃ rājīvalocanam /
analyzed: rāmaḥ ham atra duṣṭa ātman ehi rāvaṇa mām prati  iti ukte lakṣmaṇaḥ prāha rāmam rājīva locanam
translated: Then, seeing him coming, Rama said to Dasha-nan (Ravana), I am Rama here, O wicked-souled one. Come to me, O Ravana.

original: anena rākṣasā yotsye tvaṃ tiṣṭheti mahābalaḥ // / //
analyzed: anena rākṣasāḥ yotsye tvam tiṣṭha iti mahā balaḥ
translated: When this was said, Lakshmana said to Rama, the lotus-eyed one, I will fight with this demon. You stay here.

original: tatas tu lakṣmaṇo gatvā rurodha śaravṛṣṭibhiḥ /🔽viṃśadbāhuvisṛṣṭais tu śastrāstrair lakṣmaṇaṃ yudhi // / //
analyzed: tatas tu lakṣmaṇaḥ gatvā rurodha śara vṛṣṭibhiḥ  viṃśat bāhu visṛṣṭaiḥ tu śastra astraiḥ lakṣmaṇam yudhi
translated: Then Lakshmana went and obstructed him with showers of arrows.🔽With weapons and missiles released from his twenty arms, the ten-headed one obstructed Lakshmana in the battle.

original: rurodha sa daśagrīvaḥ tayor yuddham abhūn mahat /
analyzed: rurodha sa daśagrīvaḥ tayoḥ yuddham abhūt mahat
translated: There was a great battle between them.

original: devā vyomni vimānasthā vīkṣya tasthur mahāhavam // / //🔽tato rāvaṇaśastrāṇi cchittvā svais tīkṣṇasāyakaiḥ /
analyzed: devāḥ vyomni vimāna sthāḥ vīkṣya tasthuḥ mahā āhavam  tatas rāvaṇa śastrāṇi chittvā svaiḥ tīkṣṇa sāyakaiḥ
translated: The gods, seeing the great battle, stood in the sky in their celestial vehicles.🔽Then Lakshmana, having cut off Ravana's weapons with his own sharp arrows,

original: lakṣmaṇaḥ sārathiṃ hatvā tasyāśvān api bhallakaiḥ // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇaḥ sārathim hatvā tasya aśvān api bhallakaiḥ
translated: killed his charioteer and his horses with broad arrows.

original: rāvaṇasya dhanuś chittvā dhvajaṃ ca niśitaiḥ śaraiḥ /
analyzed: rāvaṇasya dhanuḥ chittvā dhvajam ca niśitaiḥ śaraiḥ
translated: Having cut off Ravana's bow and flag with sharp arrows,

original: vakṣaḥsthalaṃ mahāvīryo vivyādha paravīrahā // / //
analyzed: vakṣaḥ sthalam mahā vīryaḥ vivyādha para vīra hā
translated: The greatly valorous slayer of enemy heroes pierced his chest.

original: tato rathān nipatyādhaḥ kṣipraṃ rākṣasanāyakaḥ /🔽śaktiṃ jagrāha kupito ghaṇṭānādavinādinīm // / //
analyzed: tatas rathāt nipatya adhas kṣipram rākṣasa nāyakaḥ  śaktim jagrāha kupitaḥ ghaṇṭā nāda vinādinīm
translated: Then, quickly jumping down from the chariot, the leader of the demons,🔽angered, seized a spear that resounded like a bell.

original: agnijvālājvalajjihvāṃ maholkāsadṛśadyutim /
analyzed: agni jvālā jvalat jihvām mahā ulkā sadṛśa dyutim
translated: With a tongue blazing like the fire, and the brilliance of a great meteor,

original: dṛḍhamuṣṭyā tu nikṣiptā śaktiḥ sā lakṣmaṇorasi // / //
analyzed: dṛḍha muṣṭyā tu nikṣiptā śaktiḥ sā lakṣmaṇa urasi
translated: that spear, thrown with a firm fist, pierced Lakshmana's chest.

original: vidāryāntaḥpraviṣṭātha devās trastās tato 'mbare /
analyzed: vidāryā antar praviṣṭā atha devāḥ trastāḥ tatas mbare
translated: Having pierced through, it entered inside, and then the gods were frightened in the sky.

original: lakṣmaṇaṃ patitaṃ dṛṣṭvā rudadbhir vānareśvaraiḥ // / //
analyzed: lakṣmaṇam patitam dṛṣṭvā rudadbhiḥ vānara īśvaraiḥ
translated: Seeing Lakshmana fallen, with the monkey kings crying out,

original: duḥkhitaḥ śīghram āgamya tatpārśvaṃ prāha rāghavaḥ /
analyzed: duḥkhitaḥ śīghram āgamya tad pārśvam prāha rāghavaḥ
translated: Rama, afflicted with grief, quickly came to his side and said:

original: kva gato hanumān vīro mitro me pavanātmajaḥ // / //
analyzed: kva gataḥ hanumān vīraḥ mitraḥ me pavanātmajaḥ
translated: Where has the heroic Hanumat, my friend, the son of the wind god, gone?

original: yadi jīvati me bhrātā kathaṃcit patito bhuvi /
analyzed: yadi jīvati me bhrātā kathaṃcid patitaḥ bhuvi
translated: If my brother is somehow alive and fallen on the ground,

original: ityukte hanumān rājan vīro vikhyātapauruṣaḥ // / //
analyzed: iti ukte hanumān rājan vīraḥ vikhyāta pauruṣaḥ
translated: When this was said, O king, the heroic Hanumat, renowned for his manliness,

original: baddhvāñjaliṃ babhāṣedaṃ dehy anujñāṃ sthito 'smi bhoḥ /
analyzed: baddhvā añjalim babhāṣa idam dehi anujñām sthitaḥ smi bhoḥ
translated: joining his palms, said this: Grant permission, I am standing here.

original: rāmaḥ prāha mahāvīra viśalyakaraṇī mama // / //
analyzed: rāmaḥ prāha mahā vīra viśalya karaṇī mama
translated: Rama said to the great hero: Perform the Vishalyaghani for me.

original: anujaṃ virujaṃ śīghraṃ kuru mitra mahābala /
analyzed: anujam virujam śīghram kuru mitra mahā bala
translated: Quickly make my younger brother free from injury, O greatly powerful friend.

original: tato vegāt samutpatya gatvā droṇagiriṃ kapiḥ // / //
analyzed: tatas vegāt samutpatya gatvā droṇa girim kapiḥ
translated: Then the monkey, leaping with speed, went to Mount Drona.

original: baddhvā ca śighram ānīya lakṣmaṇaṃ nīrujaṃ kṣaṇāt /
analyzed: baddhvā ca śighram ānīya lakṣmaṇam nīrujam kṣaṇāt
translated: And quickly binding Lakshmana, he brought him and in a moment made him free from pain,

original: cakāra devadeveśāṃ paśyatāṃ rāghavasya ca // / //
analyzed: cakāra devadeva īśām paśyatām rāghavasya ca
translated: while the gods and the lord of gods were watching, and also of Raghava.

original: tataḥ kruddho jagannātho rāmaḥ kamalalocanaḥ /🔽rāvaṇasya balaṃ śiṣṭaṃ hastyaśvaratharākṣasam // / //🔽hatvā kṣaṇena rāmas tu taccharīraṃ tu sāyakaiḥ /
analyzed: tatas kruddhaḥ jagannāthaḥ rāmaḥ kamala locanaḥ  rāvaṇasya balam śiṣṭam hasti aśva ratha rākṣasam  hatvā kṣaṇena rāmaḥ tu tat śarīram tu sāyakaiḥ
translated: Then the lotus-eyed Rama, the lord of the world, became angry.🔽Having killed in a moment the remaining army of Ravana, consisting of elephants, horses, chariots and rakshasas,

original: tīkṣṇair jarjaritaṃ kṛtvā tasthivān vānarair vṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: tīkṣṇaiḥ jarjaritam kṛtvā tasthivān vānaraiḥ vṛtaḥ
translated: Rama, with sharp arrows, made his body shattered and remained surrounded by the monkeys.

original: astaceṣṭo daśagrīvaḥ saṃjñāṃ prāpya śanaiḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: asta ceṣṭaḥ daśagrīvaḥ saṃjñām prāpya śanais punar
translated: The ten-headed one, with his weapons exhausted, slowly regained consciousness.

original: utthāya rāvaṇaḥ kruddhaḥ siṃhanādaṃ nanāda ca // / //
analyzed: utthāya rāvaṇaḥ kruddhaḥ siṃhanādam nanāda ca
translated: Rising up, Ravana, in anger, roared like a lion.

original: tannādaśravaṇair vyomni vitrasto devatāgaṇaḥ /
analyzed: tad nāda śravaṇaiḥ vyomni vitrastaḥ devatā gaṇaḥ
translated: At the sound of that roar, the hosts of gods in the sky were frightened.

original: etasminn eva kale tu rāmaṃ prāpya mahāmuniḥ // / //
analyzed: etasmin eva kale tu rāmam prāpya mahā muniḥ
translated: In this very quarrel, having reached Rama, the great sage

original: rāvaṇe baddhavairas tu agastyo vai jayapradam /
analyzed: rāvaṇe baddha vairaḥ tu agastyaḥ vai jaya pradam
translated: Agastya, who had enmity with Ravana, gave him the victorious

original: ādityahṛdayaṃ nāma mantraṃ prādāj jayapradam // / //
analyzed: ādityahṛdayam nāma mantram prādāt jaya pradam
translated: Aditya Hridaya, a mantra that bestows victory.

original: rāmo 'pi japtvā tanmantram agastyoktaṃ jayapradam /
analyzed: rāmaḥ japtvā tat mantram agastya uktam jaya pradam
translated: Rama also, having muttered that mantra, which was given by Agastya and bestows victory,

original: taddattaṃ vaiṣṇavaṃ cāpam atulaṃ sadguṇaṃ dṛḍham // / //
analyzed: tat dattam vaiṣṇavam cāpam atulam sat guṇam dṛḍham
translated: The invincible, excellent and firm bow given by him is Vaishnava.

original: pūjayitvā tad ādāya sajyaṃ kṛtvā mahābalaḥ /
analyzed: pūjayitvā tat ādāya sajyam kṛtvā mahā balaḥ
translated: Having worshipped it and taken it, the greatly strong one made it stringed.

original: sauvarṇapuṅkhais tīkṣṇais tu śarair marmavidāraṇaiḥ // / //
analyzed: sauvarṇa puṅkhaiḥ tīkṣṇaiḥ tu śaraiḥ marma vidāraṇaiḥ
translated: With sharp arrows with golden nocks that pierce the vital points,

original: yuyudhe rākṣasendreṇa raghunāthaḥ pratāpavān /🔽tayos tu yudhyatos tatra bhīmaśaktyor mahāmate // / //
analyzed: yuyudhe rākṣasa indreṇa raghunāthaḥ pratāpavān  tayoḥ tu yudhyatoḥ tatra bhīma śaktyoḥ mahāmate
translated: The powerful lord of the Raghus fought with the lord of the rakshasas.🔽O greatly wise one, while they were fighting there, with terrible weapons,

original: parasparavisṛṣṭas tu vyomni saṃvarddhito 'nalaḥ /
analyzed: paraspara visṛṣṭaḥ tu vyomni saṃvarddhitaḥ nalaḥ
translated: The fire emitted by each other increased in the sky.

original: samutthito nṛpaśreṣṭha rāmarāvaṇayor yudhi // / //
analyzed: samutthitaḥ nṛpa śreṣṭha rāma rāvaṇayoḥ yudhi
translated: It arose, O best of kings, in the battle between Rama and Ravana.

original: saṃgare vartamāne tu rāmo dāśarathis tadā /
analyzed: saṃgare vartamāne tu rāmaḥ dāśarathiḥ tadā
translated: When the battle was going on, then Dasharatha's son Rama,

original: padātir yuyudhe vīro rāmo 'nuktaparākramaḥ // / //
analyzed: padātiḥ yuyudhe vīraḥ rāmaḥ nukta parākramaḥ
translated: The hero Rama, whose prowess is unsurpassed, fought on foot.

original: sahasrāśvayutaṃ divyaṃ rathaṃ mātalim eva ca /
analyzed: sahasra aśva yutam divyam ratham mātalim eva ca
translated: The lord of the gods gave him a chariot with a thousand divine horses and Matali,

original: devendro mahāntaṃ lokaviśrutam // / //
analyzed: preṣayāmasa deva indraḥ mahāntam loka viśrutam
translated: The great one famous in the world.

original: rāmas tam ratham āruhya pūjyamānaḥ surottamaiḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ tam ratham āruhya pūjyamānaḥ sura uttamaiḥ
translated: Rama, worshipped by the best of the gods, mounted that chariot.

original: mātulyuktopadeśas tu rāmacandraḥ pratāpavān // / //
analyzed: mātulī ukta upadeśaḥ tu rāmacandraḥ pratāpavān
translated: The powerful Ramachandra, instructed by his uncle,

original: brahmadattavaraṃ duṣṭaṃ brahmāstreṇa daśānanam /
analyzed: brahma datta varam duṣṭam brahmāstreṇa daśānanam
translated: With the Brahma weapon, killed the wicked Ravana, who had received a boon from Brahma.

original: jaghāna vairiṇaṃ krūraṃ rāmadevaḥ pratāpavān // / //
analyzed: jaghāna vairiṇam krūram rāmadevaḥ pratāpavān
translated: The powerful Lord Rama killed the cruel enemy.

original: rāmeṇa nihate tatra rāvaṇe sagaṇe ripau /
analyzed: rāmeṇa nihate tatra rāvaṇe sa gaṇe ripau
translated: When Rama had killed the enemy Ravana along with his followers,

original: indrādyā devatāḥ sarvāḥ parasparam athābruvan // / //
analyzed: indra ādyāḥ devatāḥ sarvāḥ parasparam atha abruvan
translated: all the gods including Indra spoke to each other:

original: rāmo bhūtvā harir yasmād asmākaṃ vairiṇaṃ raṇe /
analyzed: rāmaḥ bhūtvā hariḥ yasmāt asmākam vairiṇam raṇe
translated: Since Hari, becoming Rama, killed in battle

original: anyair avadhyam apy enaṃ jaghāna yudhi rāvaṇam // / //
analyzed: anyaiḥ avadhyam api enam jaghāna yudhi rāvaṇam
translated: our enemy Ravana, who could not be killed by others, in the battle,

original: tasmāt taṃ rāmanāmānam anantam aparājitam /
analyzed: tasmāt tam rāma nāmānam anantam aparājitam
translated: therefore we shall worship that infinite and invincible one, named Rama,

original: pūjayāmo 'vatīryainam ity uktvā te divaukasaḥ // / //
analyzed: pūjayāmaḥ vatīrya enam iti uktvā te divaukasaḥ
translated: having descended to this world. Having said this, those dwellers of heaven,

original: nānāvimānaiḥ śrīmadbhir avatīrya mahītale /
analyzed: nānā vimānaiḥ śrīmadbhiḥ avatīrya mahī tale
translated: having descended to the earth in various glorious aerial cars,

original: rudrendravasucandrādyā vidhātāraṃ sanātanam // / //🔽viṣṇuṃ jiṣṇuṃ jaganmūrtiṃ sānujaṃ rāmam avyayam /
analyzed: rudra indra vasu candra ādyāḥ vidhātāram sanātanam  viṣṇum jiṣṇum jagat mūrtim sa anujam rāmam avyayam
translated: Rudra, Indra, the Vasus, Chandra and others,

original: taṃ pūjayitvā vidhivat parivāryopatasthire // / //
analyzed: tam pūjayitvā vidhivat parivārya upatasthire
translated: worshipped the eternal creator, Vishnu, the conqueror, the form of the world, the undecaying Rama with his younger brother, in accordance with the rules, and stood surrounding him.

original: rāmo 'yaṃ dṛśyatāṃ devā lakṣmaṇo 'yaṃ vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: rāmaḥ yam dṛśyatām devāḥ lakṣmaṇaḥ yam vyavasthitaḥ
translated: This is Rama, O gods, this is Lakshmana standing,
